item.title: Python Developer (100% remote within European timezones) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently onlyseeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious Python developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 320,000 users from 190 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


What skills are we looking for?



As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides Python, you will also be given training on front-end languages and frameworks (such as AngularJS) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.  You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.


Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.


Skills & Requirements



  • Minimum of 3 years experience working with Python

  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high levels of traffic

  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript

  • Experience with any of the following is a plus - jQuery, AngularJS, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services

  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium

  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or Git

  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party

item.title: Creative and Initiative Python Developer at Sportech LLC (Kyiv, Ukraine) (allows remote)
item.description:
SENIOR PYTHON DEVELOPER (Kiev-Office-Fulltime)


We are looking for a Senior Python Developer, who will act as the high performed and self - motivated specialist to join a team of developers and analysts working on sport platform start up project, in order to ensure that leading edge technology keeps the business at the forefront of its field.



SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:



  • You have good understanding of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns.

  • You have a minimum of 5 years experience as a Python developer.

  • You have strong knowledge of HTTP protocol.

  • You have strong knowledge of the common web standards and data formats


(HTML, CSS, JSON, etc.).



  • You are familiar with the concepts behind the modern web apps (REST, AJAX).

  • You are familiar with Javascript and modernd JS frameworks.

  • Hands-on experience with web automation framework (preferably Selenium).

  • Experience working in Linux environment.

  • Experience working with relational and non-relational databases

  • Experience with working on low latency real-time application is a big plus.

  • Practical experience of the troubleshooting and performance optimization.

  • Excellent written and spoken English skills.



PERSONAL SKILLS:



  • As a team, we value creativity and a strong work ethic. You must have the ability to work well in a team, as well as autonomously.

  • Pro-active, can do attitude and willingly getting involved to do things that need to be done in time.

  • Also, if you are comfortable handling a fluid and demanding work environment, which often coincides with a startup environment, than this will be a great position for you.



WHAT WE OFFER:



  • Money.

  • Development in a team of professional developers in exciting project.

  • Private Health insurance.

  • An awesome office location.

  • Gym compensation.

  • Tasty lunches.

  • The ability to customize your own career path.

item.title: Python Developer - Web Scraping at Scrapinghub () (allows remote)
item.description:
Scrapinghub is looking for experienced and senior software engineers to join our Professional Services team to work on web crawler development with Scrapy, our flagship open source project.

Are you interested in building web crawlers harnessing the Scrapinghub platform, which powers crawls of over 3 billion pages a month? Do you like working in a company with a strong open source foundation? Scrapinghub helps companies, ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to up and coming early stage startups, turn web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

Join us in making the world a better place for web crawler developers with our team of top talented engineers working remotely from more than 30 countries.

Role Responsibilities: 


  • Design, develop and maintain Scrapy web crawlers

  • Leverage the Scrapinghub platform and our open source projects to perform distributed information extraction, retrieval and data processing

  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues with distributed crawling at scale

  • Help identify, debug and fix problems with open source projects, including Scrapy


Scrapinghub’s platform and Professional Services offerings have been growing tremendously over the past couple of years but there are a lot of big projects waiting in the pipeline, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Here’s what we’re looking for:

About You: 


  • 2+ years of software development experience.

  • Solid Python knowledge.

  • Scrapy experience a plus.

  • Familiarity with Linux/UNIX, HTTP, HTML, Javascript and Networking.

  • Good communication in written and spoken English.

  • Availability to work full time.

item.title: Senior/Mid-Level Full Stack Python Developer at Tassomai (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a senior engineer to help us embark on a green field project which we hope will have a significant impact on the equality of access to education across the UK. If you’re passionate about building scalable cloud applications, open-minded to adopting the correct technologies for the task at hand, and write clean, exemplary code, we’re interested in hearing from you!


Depending on your interests and experience, you could work solely on this new project, or get involved with our other more established and commercially successful products.  We’re in the process of migrating Tassomai to a Django-based REST API consumed by an Angular 2+ frontend to efficiently support the company’s rapid recent growth - Tassomai is currently in 10% of secondary schools in the UK, and (not too optimistically) that number could double or triple within the next year.


Skills & Requirements


While the technical skills listed below are important, equally important are the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with other developers and non-technical stakeholders, and to give and take constructive feedback. 


Essential skills:



  • Python

  • Django

  • Typescript and expert knowledge of at least one front end JS framework

  • Expert in at least one RDBMS

  • Experience scaling high traffic websites


Nice, but not essential:



  • Angular 2

  • Django Rest Framework

  • SASS/LESS

  • PostgreSQL

  • AWS

item.title: Senior Back End Python (Django) Developer at Festicket (London, UK)
item.description:
YOUR ROLE


We are looking for mid-senior level developers who specialise in Python and have some exposure to the Django framework (Flask applicants will also be considered).


We've had a big funding round in the middle of last year and our technical team is growing rapidly (from 4 to 20 people so far). We need to bring up-to-date our technology to meet the business's ambitions for the next few years.


We are a team of 20 looking to grow to over 25 immediately. To do this we need your dedication to get work done on time, to train new staff and integrate many new team members into this rapidly growing team while working with the other mid-senior developers to ensure that standards stay high and keep getting higher.


THE STACK


http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket


METHODOLOGY


We work incrementally but do occasionally take on bigger projects to update our stack and offering. Our current methodology is agile kanban.


Skills & Requirements


YOUR ATTITUDE


You’re someone who’s smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. You want to work in a startup environment, because you like the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what you work on. You have ideas about everything, and you’re not afraid to argue your point (while respecting everyone else’s of course). You’re constantly thinking “how can we do this better?”. You have the experience and aptitude to provide direction for other staff, to help build the team as a whole and within its eventual sub-units.


You understand the hard work required to update and stabilise a large technical product and you are prepared to put this work into the project.


YOUR SKILL SET


You must have gone into a company or role with a maturing or mature technical product before. Having done such you are aware of the pros and cons caused by the startup coding mentality of "we'll fix that later". You also understand that you need to grasp the product's technical debt before planning or making significant changes to the product.



  • The applicant would normally have a maths, computing or software engineering degree.

  • Ideally you have setup and/or worked with a system of Continuous Integration.


You must have significant experience of working and delivering projects with the following technologies:



  • 3+ years of working with Python (with some experience of Django or Flask framework)

  • Very good mathematical abilities

  • SQL, preferably PostgreSQL

  • You have integrated systems with 3rd party APIs before

  • You’re also fluent with the command line, you use git

  • It would be great if you’d had experience with one or more of Redis, Gunicorn, Nginx, Ansible, or Ubuntu; or if you’ve worked as a developer in the travel, music, or e-commerce industries before. But it’s not a requirement

item.title: Software Developer (Ruby, React, Python, AWS, Agile) at ZappiStore (London, UK)
item.description:
At Zappi, we:



  • Believe hiring intrinsically motivated people and giving them autonomy

  • Being bold and learning from failure

  • Being honest, even if it’s uncomfortable

  • Working in cross-functional teams to minimise getting blocked

  • Getting the right people in the room early

  • Using travel to break down regional barriers

  • Empowering self-improvement, sponsoring conferences, tickets, etc

  • Have teams that are proud of what they have built


Who we’re looking for


We are looking for people who want to grow in fast paced and dynamic start up enterprise. The individual will be a team player with good communication skills who is self-motivated and driven to excellence.  They will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and eager to both learn and share knowledge with team mates and other teams.


The ideal candidate will have strong experience in programming (Ruby and Javascript, ideally using frameworks like Ruby on Rails and ReactJS) having shown herself or himself to be highly competent. They should be passionate about developing and delivering high quality products for our clients and take pride in their work.


The Job


As a Zappi developer the role is what you make of it.  While you will have experts to ask advice from where necessary, and with your team you will have a high degree of influence on design and implementation decisions. You will almost certainly work across different programming languages and technologies, building and sharing knowledge with your colleagues as you progress.


Your prospective team will be able to share the details around the content of what they work on.


If you believe in quality, maintainability, testing, design/architecture, you might be the right developer for us.


We are an agile organisation, so you’ll be likely be working with SCRUM (pretty much by the book: Product Backlog Refinement [PBRs], Planning, Daily stand ups, Review, Retrospective) or KANBAN. We believe passionately in self-management, and accountability within teams. This means we expect that people to work in a very open spirit, sharing successes and failures, being transparent about blockers and bottlenecks, and making decisions with their colleagues and the wider organisation in mind.


You must also care strongly about quality AND be a good communicator and team player. Your success and your team’s success go hand in hand.


Essential skills and experience



  • Architecture, application design

  • TDD, BDD, Bringing new efficient testing ideas

  • Ruby, Javascript

  • Strong communication skills

  • Looking for a role that is challenging, but also has great opportunities

  • Tools : Git, circle CI, AWS, Sentry, Slack.


Desirable skills and experience



  • Has a real passion for Architecture and Design

  • Writes blogs, attends conferences on the subject of software development, or is involved in the wider software community


Perks


At ZappiStore we manage our own time; your contracted hours of work will be Monday to Friday 9am to 6pm, but you decide when you get in and leave day-to-day based on your commitments.  We offer a relaxed and friendly atmosphere, ground-breaking projects to work on, free lunches, unlimited holidays, a pension scheme, a Playstation 4 and foosball table in the office, and the flexibility to work from home when you need to (although with all those perks in our Camden office, who would want to?)


Zappi Store is an equal opportunities employer, although you must be legally able to work in UK.

item.title: Python Full Stack Engineer (m/f) at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To support our team in Berlin we are currently looking for a Python Full Stack Engineer. 

You will work in a data science team that uses machine learning for dynamic pricing of bus tickets. 

Our backend runs in Python. We use SQLAlchemy to query our data sets from PostgreSQL and Redshift, we train our models and make predictions using scikit-learn. The frontend is written in Vue.js and used by our Stake Holders to interact with our backend. Both frontend and backend are dockerized and run on our kubernetes cluster.


Your tasks


As a Full Stack Developer you will cover the whole range: 
Support our data scientists to make their prototypes production ready 
Improve our frontend 
Maintain the CI/CD pipelines and the infrastructure our software is running on.


Your Profile


3+ years of experience in the field 
Professional experience with Python and SQLAlchemy, the scientific Python stack is optional 
Professional experience with JavaScript and at least one of the following frameworks: React.js, Node.js, Vue.js 
Solid experience with SQL (Posgres, Redshift) and managing data bases 
Git (optional: gitlab, gitlab-ci) 
PHP knowledge is a plus 
You are passionate about testing, CI/CD and automating 
Experienced with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes 
Experienced with Amazon Web Services 
Basic understanding of machine learning 
Optional: Kafka, Spark, Presto 
Fluent in English

item.title: Data Engineer / Python Developer at Kayrros (Paris, France)
item.description:
Kayrros is a fast-growing company founded in March 2016, successfully raised €9 million in Series A funding in January 2017 and it has just started rolling out its first products with major client organizations.


As a data engineer, you will:



  • Convert prototype into production level code

  • Architect, build and test industry-grade data pipelines

  • Provide technical support to Data Scientists during exploratory analysis

  • Evaluate performance and optimize all parts of the stack

  • Continuously provide ideas to improve products


Profile



  • All levels of seniority considered

  • Strong Python 3 Engineer able to write reusable, testable and efficient code and coach others in doing so

  • Passion and proven record building data pipelines with an emphasis on software engineering, software architecture, code quality, best practices

  • Optionally: experience with some components of our current stack: Linux/MacOS, Git, Spark, Docker, Elasticsearch, Pandas, Scikit-learn

  • You are dynamic, curious and eager to learn about the energy industry

  • You can work in a fast-paced environment

  • You can communicate clearly in English, including with non-technical people

  • You are willing to contribute actively and have a real impact to the company success

item.title: Python Developer at Gaming Innovation Group (Saint Julian's, Malta)
item.description:
Something about us


Gaming Innovation Group is a rapidly growing technology business. The Group offers cutting-edge Cloud based services and B2B Performance Marketing, and owns B2C gambling operators offering games from the best-of-breed suppliers across the online sports betting and casino industry.
Our vision is to make the iGaming industry an open and connected eco-system, for the benefit of all.


Our brands


iGaming Cloud (iGC): our client management platform seeking to interconnect the entire iGaming industry. iGC offers the full spectrum of services for iGaming operators.
Rizk, Thrills, Guts, SuperLenny, Kaboo and Betspin: our multiple award winning online casino and sports betting brands.
Innovation Labs: offering online marketing and true lead generation to iGaming businesses on an international level.


The Role


We are looking for a Python Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application; therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.



What you'll be doing



  • Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code

  • Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant applications

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic

  • Implementation of security and data protection

  • Integration of data storage solutions


Requirements



  • Solid experience with Python, at least 3 years

  • Experience developing with Python web frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask)

  • Experience with relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL. 

  • Comfortable with HTML, JS, CSS, etc. 

  • Comfortable working in Linux environments

  • Experience with GIT or similar tools for source control management


Optional requirements



  • Experience with unit testing

  • Experience with Selenium and asyncio

  • Basic knowledge of system administration, and automation tools (Ansible, Puppet, Chef)

  • Experience with cloud providers (AWS, GCP), and specifically the serverless platforms (Lambda, Cloud Functions)


What we offer


We are team workers and cross functional collaborators - we don't have boundaries when it comes to getting work done. There will be lots of opportunities for you to be stretched and challenged in your role, and outside of it. We invest in our people, not just with a great pay and benefits package and the usual free fruit and coffee (and Friday beers), but in focusing on your growth and development - we encourage innovation and 'getting involved' - we celebrate success. We are an inclusive, multi-cultural and diverse company with over 15 different nationalities represented.


Details


Start date: As soon as possible really. Let’s talk about it.
Last application date: We’ll hire as soon as we find a match, apply now.
Location: Malta


As a diverse and inclusive employer, GiG encourages applications from all sections of the community

item.title: Full Stack Engineer (JavaScript & Python) at TrustYou (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Imagine a workplace which encourages you to take on responsibility and where your ideas will be heard and implemented. Imagine a fast paced environment where your performance makes the difference. This is TrustYou!


We are looking for adventurers to join our smart and inspiring team!


You will be responsible for a suite of features or a new project. If you enjoy thinking up useful and fun to use features, and driving the implementation from specification to QA you will be the perfect addition to our team!


What challenges await you?



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects.

  • Team play together with other smart data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.



What do we expect from you?



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree.

  • 4 years+ experience implementing beautiful and scalable web applications.

  • Mastery of JavaScript or Python. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use Python and JavaScript.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases.

  • Good algorithms knowledge.

  • Fluent in English.

item.title: Python Software Engineer at Coosto (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Heb jij passie voor softwareontwikkeling en wil jij robuuste en schaalbare applicaties ontwikkelen die dagelijks miljoenen social media berichten indexeren? Kom dan werken bij Coosto in de rol van Python Software Engineer.


Wat ga je doen? 


Coosto levert software oplossingen voor social media monitoring en webcare en is marktleider in Nederland. Wij verwerken dagelijks miljoenen social media berichten (o.a. Twitter, Facebook, blogs, fora) en ontsluiten deze in een zoekmachine die door honderden klanten tegelijkertijd gebruikt wordt.


De teams binnen onze Data-afdeling zijn verantwoordelijk voor het ophalen en verwerken van deze social data en dat doen we door middel van verschillende software en scripts. Je komt te werken in een DevOps team met een focus op data intake, waarin je werkt aan nieuwe applicaties en bestaande applicaties verder zal ontwikkelen. Nieuwe applicaties worden gebouwd als (micro)services met gebruik van o.a. Docker en Kubernetes. Je komt in aanraking met de verschillende lagen van onze architectuur, bestaande uit diverse gedistribueerde applicaties en databases. Wij werken onder andere met MySQL, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Redis en RabbitMQ. Samen met je team denk je pro-actief mee en help je om onze way-of-working te verbeteren in termen van test automatisering en Continuous Delivery.



Wat heb je daarvoor nodig?



Allereerst heb jij passie voor je werk, net als iedereen bij Coosto. Jij bent dan ook altijd bezig met nieuwe technologieën, programmeren, innoveren en jezelf blijven uitdagen en ontwikkelen. Schaalbaarheid en daarmee performance vind je belangrijk en je vindt het leuk om in de processen te zitten en samen met je team jullie manier van softwareontwikkeling te verbeteren.





Daarnaast heb je het volgende in huis:




  • Een relevante bachelor of master;

  • Ruime ervaring met Python en/of vergelijkbare talen en goede kennis van MySQL;

  • Uitgebreide ervaring met de Linux command line, Bash, Shell Scripting en Crontabs;

  • Het is een voordeel als je kan programmeren in C of C++;

  • Tevens is het een pré als je kennis hebt van NoSQL databases zoals Cassandra en Elasticsearch;

  • Je hebt uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in Engels als Nederlands.


Wat hebben wij je te bieden?



Je komt te werken in een stimulerende omgeving, vol technische uitdagingen, in een team van leuke en slimme collega’s. We hebben een sterke focus op de Agile manier van werken, waarbij we in korte sprints werken, en met zaken als Test Automation en Continuous Delivery steeds sneller live gaan.


We hebben veel aandacht voor de verdere ontwikkeling van jouw talent: er is een opleidingsbudget waarmee je trainingen en cursussen kan volgen. Daarnaast bieden we je de mogelijkheid om samen met je collega’s naar tech events te gaan, zoals Software Circus, JAX DevOps en Code Motion. Je kunt kiezen op wat voor een machine je wilt werken, met een OS naar jouw keuze. Je werkt vanuit een prachtig kantoor in Eindhoven, pal naast het centraal station, met een weids uitzicht over de dynamiek van de stad. Vanzelfsprekend zijn de arbeidsvoorwaarden aantrekkelijk en krijg je een goed salaris.


Interesse?


Dat is goed nieuws! We kijken uit naar jouw cv en begeleidende brief. Wie weet tot snel!

item.title: Django Backend Dev (Python) (Fulltime in Munich) at Motius GmbH (Garching bei München, Deutschland)
item.description:
In the last years, we successfully built up an R&D company that develops great products using latest technologies. We do this with an unique approach: combining a fixed core team and a huge and strong community of developers, engineers, makers, hackers, and designers. Building up and managing this community and these fast-paced R&D projects is a crucial part of our business.


Just from the beginning we therefore decided to setup an own solution for that and created the backbone for our operations: the Motius Platform. We currently look for you, the Platform Lead Developer, to make the next big step with this service. Since the last three years our platform grew to a complex enterprise management system based on Django (Python). Being able to manage our talents and our network, to generate contracts for employees and clients, to forecast our financial goals, and to automatically match potential candidates with suitable project roles, enables us to expand our operations quickly and to scale our business. 


This year, we also started a state-funded research project in cooperation with fortiss, an institute from Technische Universität München (TUM), in order to improve our talent matching solution and to make our platform smarter. Our roadmap involves machine learning based on existing project and talent data. Besides that, we take the first steps in transforming our platform into a Software-as-a-Service product and in finding first beta customers for it.


Your Profile:



  • Strong software engineering / web applications engineering background

  • Focus on backend, but also interested in frontend

  • At least one year of professional Django dev experience

  • Good Python developer

  • Having worked in agile environments, being able to follow and soon lead the SCRUM process of the Platform dev team

  • Good communication skills in English in writing and speaking

  • Being able to understand and partly take the role of the Product Owner

  • Having worked with Docker, GitLab CI, or comparable tools


Your Role and our offer: https://www.motius.de/en/job/platform-lead-developer-mf



Some of the values we share here are



  • open communication and a constant feedback culture (flat hierarchies help here)

  • diverse teams (not really a value, but diverse teams lead to great results in our opinion)

  • comitted to personal growth (as a young company, we all grow day by day)

  • eagerness, curiosity, and desire to build new products, learn new things, try things out, fail fast, etc.


What you can expect here



  • a young team that wants to grow with you

  • a steep learning curve (pair programming with our CTO) and definitely a place to take over ownership and responsibility for something

  • a diverse team with over 10 nationalities and tech backgrounds as software engineers, designers, electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, etc.

  • a self-funded healthy startup that grows constantly and is profitable from year one

  • ..therefore a proper payment + bonus for you

  • of course coffee and teambuilding events and budget for personal development and all this hippie startup things


The Hiring Process will look like this:



  • Please apply here or via hr@motius.de with your CV, GitHub link (or other practical references) and a cover letter, why you want to join Motius

  • We'll review the applications and select a few applicants

  • First interview will be via Skype. Here we look for a cultural fit and answer all relevant questions. Also, we do a first rough technical evaluation.

  • We'll send out a coding test in order know more about your skills and to ensure a fair selection

  • Second interview will be with a technical focus with the Project Owner


What are you waiting for?

item.title: Python / Django Developer (f/m) at Gotthardt Healthgroup AG (Heidelberg, Germany)

https://jobdb.softgarden.de/jobdb/public/jobdb/JobOutput.html?jp=1297706

item.title: Full Stack Developer (Python / Django) at Sherpany () (allows remote)
item.description:
Excellence in Web Application Development...


As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will be working 100% on mission critical projects from the first day on. You will be working in all aspects of architecting and developing our Boardroom application (B2B SaaS). You will have the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and new product development in a startup that is rapidly growing. You will be creating the business logic and server backend for our excellent user interface including message queues, server-side JavaScript, Django Rest Framework and concurrent tasks handling. 


Your work will contribute to the excellence of our software based on Django, PostgreSQL, jQuery, Less, Sass, etc. Our goal is to create a product, which can compete with any globally renowned application. Finally, we will tightly work together to grow our development skills. 


Our mission: Challenge the enterprise world...


Sherpany is a young, highly acclaimed startup headquartered in Zurich. We build innovative, mobile solutions for executive committees, and want to use our technology to make companies and management teams more effective.


Our team is made up of ambitious, highly motivated specialists.


 Required…



  • Solid web developer with at least 4+ years of Python/ Django experience

  • 4+ years professional experience with enterprise architecture and developing highly scalable websites/services

  • Proficiency with large databases, it's  design and maintenance 

  • Proficiency with back and front end

  • Exposure to front end MVVM frameworks such as Backbone/Ember/Angular (we use Backbone)

  • Hands-on experience developing, releasing, and maintaining large-scale software applications (web/mobile)

  • Must be a self-starter and enjoy working in a team with other passionate professionals

  • Experience with automated unit/regression testing.

  • Strong IT fundamentals with a bachelors or masters in computer science, engineering or equivalent industry experience

item.title: Python Developer at Usertech (Prague, Czechia)
item.description:
We’re looking for a skilled Python developer to help our teams build complex web applications with interesting technologies. 


To our current team, we are looking for a great web and app enthusiast. If you are knowledgeable in web development and you think you meet our requirements, we would be happy if you applied!


Our requirements:



  • Python :-D (ideally Python 2/3)

  • basic DB (SQL) and web apps developement knowledge

  • Django framework is a plus

  • independence, reliability and willingness to learn 


If you are good - we want to build a startup with you, check out what we already have in store: http://usertechnologies.com/work


The journey with us:


We have developed more than30 digital products/startups with big corporationsin the past three years, and worked with some of the world’s biggest brands.


We have also made5 of our ownand spread the shares to people working on these startups, we want to do more of these with you if you are good.


We are all about learning new stuff,we want you to fail fast and fail often as long as you are learning.


We also want you to be a straight up guy/gal we have a no bullshit policy.


We are very informal, agile and have a really twisted sense of humor(don’t worry you will come to like it…one of us, one of us….).


Here’s what you get:


New appreciation for 90’s music, house and all sorts of other weird stuff on our #vibes Slack channel.


You will learn how to build digital products and understand the development end to end.


In-depth conversations with our Slackbot which has knowledge of the current memes and Red Dwarf trivia.


Unlimited vacation, as long as you are learning and doing everything agreed, everybody’s happy. Relax is necessary ;)


Working with people who will become more than your coworkers with frequent happy hour drinks and beers (also if you are good in Fifa, you will get schooled on our office Xbox).


You will have the opportunity to spend time in our NYC office if you become our top talent.


We are pushing the boundaries of web and mobile applications. We like to work on demanding projects which require us to use the experience of hundreds of projects and look for new solutions and use new technologies. The ability to think without limits, agile development and rapid prototyping give us the possibility to develop startups with ease. We've created more than 30 startups in the past 3 years (zonky.cz, kupnajisto.cz, secteno.cz...). Come build with us!

item.title: Software Developer: Python, Erlang, High-Frequency, Low Latency Trading at Gambit Research (London, UK)
item.description:
Gambit Research is a unique organisation. We are a tight-knit team of research mathematicians, computer scientists and trading analysts at the top of their chosen fields. Established in 2005, we have developed a highly advanced research and trading platform that facilitates high-frequency trading on sports betting markets. 


Role


Developers typically implement new features for our system, diagnose issues, and fix bugs. We have a number of components that are mostly written in Erlang or Python. These components interface with external APIs and websites, normalise offers from different sources, process large quantities of bet placements, and manage strategies. We also maintain graphical tools and websites that allow the trading operations team to monitor the system and we provide interfaces for clients to place bets directly. It is common for developers to move between projects according to both the changing requirements of the company and their own interests.


Gambit developers start writing production code in their first week with the company and take on responsibilities fast. There are opportunities to be involved with the recruitment process and other business operations for developers who have an interest in those activities.


Essential Skills



  • Experience programming in an object-oriented, functional, or dynamic language.

  • Knowledge of algorithms and data structures.

  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL.

  • An interest in new technologies, theoretical computer science, and/or mathematics.

  • Intelligence, usually evidenced by:

    • Predominantly A grades at A-level or equivalent, preferably including maths.

    • A 2:1 or higher in a relevant degree.

item.title: Python Developer at ZAGENO GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
TL;DR; WANTED:


Python coders. Willing to code, grow and have a great time in Berlin, with a great, positive and collaborative team you can only dream of.


TL;DR; OFFERED:


Your choice of tech & OS, kaffeebox coffee (with barista level coffee & tea machine), great compensation (with salary plan!), awesome training plans. DAS Keyboard. And stickers. Lots of them.


The longer story:

Our online biotech marketplace, zageno.com, is doing very well and growing incredibly fast as well as our company.


We are now looking to expand the team by hiring 2 python developers (intermediate to senior level) that will help us work on two specific projects:


- Development, setup, and growth of a new data warehouse (with support from our DBA and DevOp)
- Development of order-handling focused functionalities (automate tasks, integrate with vendors)

By joining our tech team of 13, you will help us deliver new functionalities, improve our architecture, and help us scale our platform and our team, without compromising on quality.


You will be a great fit for us if:




  • You are a true python developer. You understand pythonic way of writing things and different coding paradigms




  • You understand the ins and outs of what you are talking about. You don't settle for "well it works now", but try to understand why it works or why it doesn't.



  • You understand that *trust* (goes both ways) is key for a healthy professional relationship with both your team and lead


  • You are honest and a selfless player in a fair and selfless team. We will help you whenever you need, and we would expect you to do the same with us. It's not about you. It's about all of us (one for all, and all for one)




  • You bring your ideas to the table, and you stand your ground when you believe in them. But also, you give others the chance to discuss their ideas




  • You are excited about pushing forward for code optimisation, scalability, performance




Last, but not least, you are passionate and motivated about what you do and *why* you do it.



Some of the things you will experience and work with:




  • Large scale python development, deployment, and testing




  • Automation (python + shell scripts) as key to qualitatively scaling our team




  • A continuous delivery infrastructure on the cloud (Jenkins is our friend)




  • How to store, perform queries & reports and manage big data on/to different data sources (ElasticSearch, Postgres, our data warehouse, ...)




  • All of the technologies we use. While each of us focuses on specific areas, we help each other and learn from each other





Technologies & programming languages we use

Python 3.6, Postgres 9.6, ElasticSearch 5.3, Django 1.11, Redis 3.2, Less CSS and a super minimal JS library (a usable and fast backend trumps a shiny frontend).

Compensation & Benefits




  • "Competitive salary". To clarify what competitive is: we will offer you a salary based on your market rate + an extra 10 - 15%.




  • Your choice of hardware. Workstation or laptop? Debian or OSX? DAS Keyboard? We got you covered with whatever helps you get your work done.




  • Flexitime, the real deal: after the first 3 months you can work from home 20% of the time (1 day a week) and, after the first 6 months, we can decide on a work routine that better fits with you and our office communication needs.after the first 6 months, we can decide a work routine that better fits with your likes (and our office communication needs).





What you'll find at ZAGENO:




  • Welcoming English speaking international team of 45 people from more than 17 countries




  • The possibility to work together with some of the most talented minds in IT, Science, Business and Marketing




  • The opportunity to grow into your role and to develop a career with the company




  • An amazing new and spacious office in Zeughofstrasse, in the center of Kreuzberg




  • The usual cool stuff: Monday team breakfast, amazing coffee,

item.title: Software Developer: Java, C++, Python at Goldman Sachs (London, UK)
item.description:
At Goldman Sachs Engineering, we build.


As a Goldman Sachs engineer, you’ll build solutions to some of the most complex problems, creating transformational technologies and developing systems that drive business and financial markets worldwide.


From automated trading systems to risk management techniques, data architectures and distributed computing platforms, our developers and quantitative professionals build and provide robust, scalable best-in-class solutions to some of the most complex problems in the industry.


At Goldman Sachs, we offer our professionals the opportunity to work with interesting challenges and influential leaders, while our team-driven culture leverages and rewards individual talent. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.


We have a wide range of opportunities in many different technical areas in our London offices.


Come see what you can build at Goldman Sachs. More information can be found on our Engineering homepage.


Skills & requirements



  • A software engineer programming in a complied language such as Java, C++, or C# or interpreted such as Python.

  • Comfortable with core programming concepts and techniques (e.g. concurrency, memory management).

  • Enjoys working with algorithms and data structures (e.g. trees, hash maps, queues).

  • A keen interest and experience with machine learning libraries and techniques.

  • Order Management, Electronic Trading and Client Connectivity Systems

  • Adaptable Algorithmic Trading Platforms

  • Performance-Sensitive User Interfaces

  • Real-Time In-Memory Distributed Systems

  • Complex Event Processors

  • Pricing, Risk and Booking Systems

item.title: Python Course Developer and Instructor (80-100%) at EPFL Extension School (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
The EPFL Extension School is looking for an experienced Python course developer and instructor, working 80-100%. The course developer will be responsible for creation of course content, production of video and online learning materials (including lessons, quizzes, exams), management of relationships with course presenters and industry partners, student / learner support (forum/chat as well as project feedback), and general contributions to the overall development and success of the EPFL Extension School. This is not a software development job but a content development role, with a focus on Python.


The knowledge level of our learners will range from novice (no prior experience) to intermediate (strong familiarity), and the course developer should be able to adapt his/her teaching (topics, learning objectives, exercises, learner support) accordingly.


Your background should include:



  • Previous teaching experience

  • Solid, demonstrable professional software development experience in Python 3

  • Demonstrable experience with developer tools: git, the command line, code editors, caching, error management, security etc.

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complicated topics to an audience with a wide variety of skills / skill levels

  • Excellent communications and relationship management / people skills

  • Excellent verbal presentation skills

  • Strong organisational and interpersonal skills

  • Ability to complete tasks on time without supervision

  • Good team player

  • Self-starter, capable of autonomous work

  • Fluent English, both written and spoken


Desirable other qualifications include:



  • Startup experience

  • Experience with writing educational content in a digital format

  • Experience with modern web development, including front-end frameworks and back-end technologies

  • Professional knowledge of REST APIs / Databases (SQL and NoSQL) / server management / HTML/CSS

item.title: Cloud Platform Developer (f/m) Python/Open Stack at STRATO AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a new team member (f/m) in Berlin:


In our new division Cloud Operations (CORE), we are building a forward-looking highly available platform with OpenStack components. The internationally staffed team, currently made up of seven developers, three administrators and two quality engineers, evaluates, adapts, installs and operates the highly automated solution in a STRATO data centre. We cooperate closely with our first internal client and face the challenges of the OpenStack tool landscape daily. 


Your responsibilities:



  • Development of deployment automation and config-management of the CORE stacks

  • Development of OpenStack projects, relating to patches, fixes, new features and blueprints

  • Development of tools all around the CORE stack, for example in CI, diagnosis and support tools or in the server lifecycle management

  • Last level support for all CORE environments, incl. debugging, tracing and root cause analysis

  • Selection, testing and analysis of new stack components

  • Reviewing the work of your team colleagues, comprehensible and correct documentation


Your profile:



  • Very good programming skills in Python, as well as experience with OpenStack architecture and its use

  • Experience in config-management (Puppet, Ansible, Chef or SaltStack), and collaboration with the OpenStack community

  • Knowledge of Linux and OpenStack’s underlying technologies (RabbitMQ, MySQL, kvm, Open vSwitch, etc.)

  • Proactive, independent way of working and a readiness for a continuous exchange with your team colleagues

  • Very good communication skills when dealing with internal clients and external partners

  • Fluent English skills

item.title: Python/Go/JS/C++/<put language here> Developer for System Integration at Swarm64 AS Zweigstelle Hive (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Your Mission


You challenge Swarm64DB to its limits until it breaks by writing use cases and specialized product tests. Your discoveries help to make our product better, more stable and reliable.


Your Tasks



  • Work with Swarm64DB on various hardware configurations and different software applications using it.

  • Unleash and show the potential of our product by writing use cases.

  • Write acceptance tests going straight to the build pipeline showcasing the stability and reliability of every new Swarm64DB build.

  • Listen to customers telling their pain points, solve them by using Swarm64's product.


The How



  • You work together with team 51. We live scrum, are multidisciplinary with direct customer contact and have a broad interest in different programming languages, frameworks and technologies.

  • You experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time whilst being focused on one thing.

  • You want something to happen or finally implement that super cool use case? Write a story and bring it to the next PBR. Together with the team it will be estimated and then it is time to convince the PO to give it prio #1.


Skills we are looking for



  • You are a team player and eager to learn new things by taking challenges.

  • You know several programming languages not necessarily in-and-out but you are aware of their strengths and weaknesses. By the way, we like: Python, Go, JavaScript and C++.

  • You know frameworks for getting things done in a lean way. We say no to not-invented-here.


Our offers - apart from the money



  • We encourage you to continuously learn and to grow your skills.

  • Honesty and openness are very valuable to us.

item.title: Python Software Developer at UBIMET GmbH (Wien, Österreich)

The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. Python Software Developer (f/m)

item.title: Python Developer at Hays plc (City of London, UK)

Your new company

Bank of America Merrill Lynch is a leading investment bank with a technology driven, flexible working and relaxed culture.

Your new role

Sitting within the global markets technology team you will get exposure to numerous business areas whilst being part of a purely technical team. The vision is to "build the best agile team in the world". The team is also passionate about TDD and pair programming. item.title: Python Software Engineer at Osirium (Theale, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced software engineer who can own and nurture a component of our platform.


We're scaling up our company, engineering department and product platform. For the software this means creating clear and distinct boundaries that allow components/services to be worked on in isolation by different people/teams whilst servicing the needs of the business.


We have identified a few potential components within our existing codebase and we're looking to match the right one to your skills. For example, recently we created a secure, AP-tolerant, distributed key-eventlog store into which we will migrate our existing password store---combining refactoring of existing code with the creation a of new component and functionality.


Responsibilities


Our Python backend relies on Twisted, SQLAlchemy and Celery. After you get the lie of the land, you'll be hands on putting in place a clear boundary, specifying an API and refactoring the areas affected by the new boundary.


We use a branch-protected, pull-request workflow with tests and code review required. We expect that you'll review others' pull requests and give constructive feedback.


Our platform deployments are often not internet-connected and this presents its own challenges—you'll need to ensure your component operates autonomously in a well-behaved manner under load.


Team


We run agile, multidisciplinary teams on a two-week sprint cycle. As a component owner, you'll work closely with the product manager; you'll be aware of the business requirements; and you'll have the autonomy to deliver the requirements as effectively as possible.


Your passions will help shape the department as well as the software. Your observations will help drive our continuous improvement.


Nice to have


Experience of technologies in our stack would be a bonus (see our company page). For example, C# would enable you to bridge the components that span the Python backend and our Windows-based MAP server; or Objective-C would allow you to work on our OSX client.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - ReactJS, Python, MongoDB at Conversocial (London, UK)
item.description:
Description


Conversocial is a leading SAAS platform that helps companies deliver great customer service over social media platforms.


Gone are the days of the occasional Tweet ! , Today, social and messenger channels make up a significant proportion of many companies customer service traffic and our engineers strive to ensure we deliver the best platform to meet our customers ever growing needs.  


As a Core Engineer you'll be heavily involved in developing the core platform which our clients customer service agents use. This will involve work on both the front and back end so we need people with full stack experience.


What experience are we looking for?


Our core technologies are Python, Django , Mongodb and ReactJS.


Whilst experts in Python, Django, ReactJS would be ideal don’t let that put you off. We like people to play to their strengths so if you are much stronger on a particular area but have had exposure to the others we would still love to hear from you.


We would also love you to have experience in:



  • Writing code with Test Driven Development

  • Experience as part of product lifecycles

  • Mentoring colleagues, providing them with guidance rather than solutions

  • Agile practices like Scrum and/or Kanban

  • React ecosystem including a TDD approach

  • CI/CD tools like Jenkins, Chef

  • Strong delivery skills: a huge drive to get something shipped

  • Good communication and Teamwork


What's it like at Conversocial ?


At Conversocial we focus on delivering real value to our clients: they use our software every day to delight their customers. We work closely with the product team to understand what users need and design and implement pragmatic solutions.


We care about fostering a positive work environment. We are respectful and trusting, and take our work seriously but ourselves less so.


You will get plenty of opportunities to discuss progress with managers and senior management via 1:1, company updates or just over the water cooler!.


Benefits


We do treat our team well @ Conversocial , here are a few of the perks :


Remote Working


Whilst our Product Engineering teams are based in our Central London Offices, many of the team work remotely on a regular basis. This is something we encourage and we ensure tools enable this.


Learning


We want our people to learn and grow so provide everyone conference allowances and unlimited books


Generous Holiday


Staying on your "A" game is important so taking the time to recharge the batteries is catered for.


Team Lunch


We get together every monday for a team lunch.


Tech


Whether it's Mac, Linux or Windows, the choice is yours.


Get in touch


If you’re interested in chatting more about this position, please do apply.

item.title: Python Developer at Cambridge Medical Robotics (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a highly capable and enthusiastic python developer to join our growing software team in Cambridge to develop and maintain our rich spectrum of engineering support software.


You’d be taking a pivotal role in the development of new Python-based support software for control and testing of our minimally invasive surgical robotic system, and maintenance support for our existing code base.



Responsibilities


You’ll be designing and implementing Python software to support the development and test of our robotic hardware and software, with your responsibilities including:



  • Following best practices for Python software development, and helping promote these to non-software colleagues

  • Maintaining, improving, and adding to the existing Python codebase

  • Developing and implementing creative solutions based on key engineering requirements

  • Delivering project tasks within agreed time-scales and budget

  • Writing technical documentation to support both manufacturing and integration tests

  • Collaborating with electronics & mechanical engineers to understand software requirements


About you


First and foremost, you’ll have a passion for software craftsmanship and the drive to continually learn new skills. You’ll most likely have a degree, although not necessarily in Computer Science – many of our developers studied other STEM subjects. If you haven’t been to university, then you’ll have equivalent career experience.


You should be able to demonstrate strong Python development skills, the determination to develop software to the highest standards within agreed time-scales, adaptability and great communications skills.


Key Skills:



  • On-the-job experience of using Python to develop software applications

  • Familiarity with both Python 2.7 and Python 3.x

  • Working with a large existing codebase

  • Automated testing and continuous integration

  • Reporting, diagnosing and fixing software issues

  • Using version control

  • Adhering to coding standards


Desirable Skills:



  • Knowledge of some/all of the following Python modules:

    • PyQt, numpy, pandas, ctypes, socket, struct, threading





  • Ability to read and understand C/C++

  • Experience with Agile development methodologies

  • Working with Python in Blender

  • Code refactoring for testability


The package


We offer a competitive salary and a great benefits package (including pension scheme, cycle-to-work scheme, life assurance, and childcare vouchers, and our now famous monthly company BBQs).


On top of that, you’ll be joining a company with a fabulous culture of ambition, creativity and teamwork, and where fun is just as valued as our commitment to make surgery better for millions of people.  Whilst we’re highly professional in our approach to engineering, we believe in creating a relaxed environment. As a company CMR trusts its employees to do the right thing, so there’s the right mix of freedom and flexibility. CMR also supports open source software. On a side note, we also both take our coffee and our board games very seriously.


Why join us?


Cambridge Medical Robotics is developing a next-generation robotic system for universal keyhole surgery. The Versius system comprises a surgeon console, modular light-weight robotic arms and a range of wristed 5 mm instruments. The system uses state-of-the-art 3D high-definition imagery, significantly enhanced flexibility, and incorporates haptic feedback to provide surgeons with life-like sensitivity. In short, we’re creating something truly amazing designed to improve the lives of people around the globe; it’s a vision that excites us and hopefully will excite you.


Versius overcomes obstacles to widespread adoption of robotic minimal access surgery, namely robot size, instrument size, versatility, port placement, cost and ease of use, allowing the system to be highly utilised and ultimately cost-comparable to manual laparoscopic surgery.


The Company was formed in 2014 and has its headquarters in Cambridge, United Kingdom. We’re privately owned and enjoy strong financial backing.

  • You will write clean, dynamic code using best software development practices


What we offer:


We offer an interesting job with a true startup feeling in a dynamic environment. You can expect an attractive remuneration, and the freedom to make technical decisions. You will join a motivated international team, which supports a good work-life-balance. You will have the opportunity to implement own ideas and to contribute to the corporate decision making process. Our office is located in the vibrant heart of Hamburg’s Ottensen.

item.title: Senior Python Backend Engineer - Turn trips into amazing experiences! at GetYourGuide AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a motivated Senior Python Backend Engineer to help develop the next generation of our in-house systems in the realm of Search Engine Marketing (SEM).  You will work as part of a cross-functional mission team with top-notch developers, analysts, data scientists and product owners as co-workers.  Deep dive data, develop innovative solutions, lead architecture decisions and take our marketing systems to new heights!


About GetYourGuide:


With 400+ employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.


Marketing Technology Team Mission:


This team is part of the Performance Marketing department and responsible for our core systems related to account structure, audience management/remarketing and targeting dimensions (geo, location, device, language) for search and display channels.  We aim to be at the cutting edge of ad technology developing, testing and automating systems across our channels.  We have touch points with various departments and aim to solve problems at scale with systems that manage 10s of millions of ads.


Responsibilities:



  • Immerse yourself in our Marketing and Technology Stack

  • Lead architecture discussions and develop next-generation systems

  • Partner with our business and technical teams to deliver innovative solutions

  • Review ongoing SEM efforts, identify opportunities and explore new areas

  • Design and develop efficient solutions that can continue to scale

  • Continuously improve our code base, systems and processes

  • Mentor other team members and be involved with hiring


Requirements:



  • Minimum of 5+ years of software development experience

  • Highly proficient in backend Python coding, best practices and libraries

  • Experience with the architecture and deployment of complex systems

  • Ability to turn ideas into fast, reliable and maintainable code

  • Solid understanding of SQL including complex queries and optimization

  • Positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft

  • Customer-centric prioritization and data drive decision making

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have:



  • Experience with large scale data processing using Apache Spark

  • Developed against advertising APIs (Google Adwords, Facebook, etc.)

  • Prior experience with advertising technology or remarketing

  • Prior experience in start-up environments


We Offer:



  • Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences

  • Smart, engaged co-workers

  • Speak English in the office with people from over 50 nationalities

  • Virtual stock options - be part of our success story

  • Quarterly Hackathons and weekly tech talks

  • Annual external training budget - be constantly learning

  • Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s

  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons

  • Relocation Assistance


Curious?


Do you have the skills for the job, enthusiasm about our vision and fit our culture? We are already looking forward to hearing from you! If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.


In the meantime, you can check our blog to see what happens behind the scenes at GetYourGuide and check out Tech Radar for an insight into the stack we use to turn trips into amazing experiences!

item.title: PYTHON SOFTWARE ENGINEER at Croud (Shrewsbury, UK)
item.description:
OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:


Enthusiastic Python developer required for a fast growing and technically driven digital marketing agency. The role, which is based in the Shrewsbury office, entails development of our flagship platform; Croud Control and related technologies. With partnerships with key players in paid and natural search, display and paid social, the successful candidate will be a key part of an evolving development team that is producing and managing suite of tools to manage, support and enhance high profile internet marketing campaigns.

This is primarily a Python development role, involving extensive interaction with third party services and partners, so knowledge of consuming and creating RESTful APIs is also advantageous.

There will also be opportunities for developing junior team members in the future as the team grows as well as project management through liaising with external resource to ensure tasks are completed on time.


MAIN ACTIVITIES / TASKS:



  • Working directly with the Head of Development and Product Director to build components for the Croud Control Platform in Python – Follows coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts

  • Providing essential maintenance to the platform and providing support for the users of it.

  • Contribute to the improvement of the platform - suggest improvements to code, technology, architecture & workflow

  • Work with other members of the company to help improve workflow and processes.

  • Project manage external resource.

  • Assists in defining software architectures

  • Explains progress on the development effort

  • Successful delivery of the solutions to agreed timelines

  • Collaboration with leads to explore existing systems, determine areas of complexity, potential risks to successful implementation, and learn the applications capabilities

  • Contributes to continual improvement by suggesting improvements to software architecture or new technologies

  • Ensure operations requirements are met prior to production deployment

  • Assist triage and resolution for production issues as they arise


ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Responsible for following coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts across the team

  • Responsible for building and implementing designs from wider team to a high standard

  • Responsible for communicating continually with the client and project teams

  • Responsible for translating specification documentation provided by the product team into clearly defined functionality

  • Responsible for developing, compiling and unit test building for delivery to QA

  • Responsible for timely planning and execution of amendments due to relevant third party API updates


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:



  • Degree level education or relevant equivalent experience

  • 2-3 years’ experience in Python Development



  • Strong experience with Python frameworks (Django)



  • Familiarity of Python, common design patterns and modern frameworks.

  • Excellent levels of communication

  • Proactive approach to work with a high level of enthusiasm for web development - we’re always keen to learn new things and discover better ways of solving problems.


DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:



  • Python Expert

  • Basic front End Technology skills (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript & jQuery)

  • Unit testing experience.

  • Knowledge and experience of the following products/languages: MySQL, Memcached, Apache, Nginx

  • Experience with consuming and implementing third party web services and tools - in particular:  Amazon Web Services, Google Analytics, Bing Ads & Google Adwords APIs.

  • Experience in developing REST APIs

  • Experience working with persistence technologies (relational, NoSQL)


The successful candidate will be keen to learn, want to strive for success and have a desire to question everything. An analytical mind-set coupled with the ability to think laterally is a must for this role.


KEY STAKEHOLDERS:



  • Direct Line Manager: Head of Development

  • Key stakeholders: DevOps team, Product Director, Product Manager, CTO

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Backend/Full Stack Python Engineer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a motivated backend engineer to join our product team in Madrid, Spain.


Your Job


We are looking for a motivated Python/Full Stack engineer to join our Backend team in Madrid, Spain. Some interesting things about our architecture:



  • Our backend extracts and analyses more than 250 million products in E-Commerce websites around the world every day. And adding 1-2M more every week.

  • We have developed automatic tools to detect changes in all of these websites in real time. This is why the quality of our data is one of the best in the industry.

  • In addition to that, we have a lot of internal tools to monitor the backend and we are improving them constantly. Always using the right technology for every challenge (and sometimes this means to learn how to use it from scratch)

  • We are adding new data sources constantly, based on our clients feedback and the business team crazy ideas. For example, we are analysing Newsletters, Coupons codes, Social Networks, Google Trends and screenshots from the E-Commerce websites that we collect every day.


If you are interested in one part of our architecture (or in all of them), want to learn new things, work with a small but highly talented team and you can communicate using only Gifs, please, contact us. We will be happy to know more about you.


Your Skills



  • High level in Python.

  • High level in Django or Flask.

  • Basic level in one of the modern JS Frameworks like AngularJS.


Bonus Points



  • Strong experience with SQL databases like PostgreSQL.

  • Experience with No SQL databases like MongoDB and Redis.

  • Experience with Celery.

  • Experience with Selenium.

  • Experience with Scrapy or any other web crawling framework.

item.title: Polyglot Developer - Java & Python at Zopa (London, UK)
item.description:
Polyglot Developer (Java & Python)


Job description


At Zopa, we’re shaping the future of finance.

We offer simple loans and smart investments that help people take control of their finances and do more with their money. In the 12 years we’ve been in business, we’ve helped more than 60,000 people lend over £2.3 billion to 246,000 UK consumers.

And our journey’s only just beginning. In November 2016 we announced our plans to build a next generation bank so that we can bring a greater range of smart, ethical finance products to even more people.

We are looking for Software Engineers that would relish the opportunity to work with Java & Python and collaborate on projects which will continue to enhance our stack and take us to the next level. Our new backend has a stream processing architecture, implemented via Kafka Streams. It is composed of Java and Python processing nodes.


This is a perfect opportunity to pick-up other languages, that you have always wanted to work with. We are looking for candidates with a very good understanding of either Java or Python (C# is a plus), and a willingness to learn the other(s). You’ll be working in a team of experience developers that can program in several languages with a focus on Python who will help shape your development skills and the exposure to Data Science teams.


The projects you may be involved in include:



  • Enhancing our existing suite of credit, pricing, fraud and risk services (Java & Python).

  • Working with our data scientists to implement and enhance machine learning components.

  • Integrating python services into the new Kafka-Streams based architecture.

  • Creating and adapting analytic and monitoring services that drive business decisions.


You will build solutions that solve real-world problems, in a true cross-functional team, collaborating closely with business analysts and talented data scientists who come from institutions such as CERN and NASA. Daily interaction with stakeholders and key business users is a way of life here. Developers have a regular dialogue with product owners, analysts and data scientists within and outside the team, and interact with them on a daily basis. We are big believers in a lean philosophy and flexibility in implementation, while we’re also aiming to achieve stack consistency and alignment across the board.


Requirements


How We Work:


At Zopa we are pragmatic programmers - both the cutting edge and the tried and tested get a voice. Our platform is a mix of Python, Java and C# with a growing importance of Java. We are strongly committed to Python as a key language in our technology stack and have big plans for the future.

What we are looking for:



  • Experience in one of the two (Java/Python), and basic understanding or keen-ness to learn the others. We're looking for experienced engineers that have solved big challenges through ingenious ideas and execution.

  • You must be happy to talk to key stakeholders on a daily basis and be able to understand and be interested in the business objectives of the company.

  • Product-focused engineers are a must - you will be part of a team that is on the front line of our business and you will see the direct impact of your work.

  • You must place strong emphasis on testing (unit, integration, acceptance, end-to-end). We are a financial institution and a strong commitment to quality is essential.

  • Be comfortable with reading legacy code

  • Any experience in microservices and message-based architectures in the past (and understand both the pros and cons) is a massive plus

  • Experience in C# is a plus


  
“We are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships."

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Gen25 (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior Python Developer you will develop applications and work on existing systems. We will give you a great challenge and you will take care of a functional solution taking into account that the code that you write is of high quality, expandable and above all maintainable. 


Your background

  • Conversion of clients' requirements into concrete Python solutions

item.title: Senior Python Web Developer who enjoys creating new digital health services at Fosanis GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Driven by the vision to improve well-being and therapy outcomes of cancer patients, we are creating a digital companion for cancer patients. As Senior Python Web Developer you will become a key player in our dynamic team. We are a young and spirited telemedicine company with our headquarter in Europe's startup capital and the passion to making a difference for cancer patients.


We care! – Do you?


Some of the stuff you would do:



  • Contribute to the backend development of our platform using state of the art technologies

  • Design and implement core features

  • Joint responsibility for architecture, development and operation of the platform

  • Learn something new every day


Your ideal profile - you've got most of this covered:



  • You have experience in developing web applications using Python, preferably with Django and technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB and RabbitMQ

  • You are familiar with modern infrastructure and tooling, e.g. Docker, Swarm, Consul, Jenkins and git

  • You have sound knowledge in test-driven development, security and resilience for high-quality, highly available applications

  • You enjoy working in a small, effective cross-functional team

  • You have contributed to Open Source projects or realized private development projects

  • You are a team player with excellent communication skills but can also work on your own

  • You communicate fluently in English - German is a plus


What we offer:



  • An entrepreneurial and dynamic environment in which you can make an important contribution to improving cancer care

  • Flat hierarchies, a great team and transparent communication

  • An attractive compensation

  • Workplace in the heart of Berlin


Does this sound exciting to you? Do you want to join a young and fast-growing company with the vision to improve patients’ lives? Send your application to jobs@fosanis.de - even if this is not the job for you – we are hiring for other positions (e.g. Frontend Developer, DevOps Engineer) as well!


We are looking forward to getting to know you!

item.title: Python Engineer at Dubizzle - an OLX company (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
What responsibilities will you get when working with us? 


Liaises with the other back end and front end engineers within your product stream, the QA team, the design team and your Tech Team Leads. As a Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for advancing our development stack and ensuring scale as we grow to millions of monthly active users across many countries.


What will you need to be successful in this role?



  • Backend Engineers build and maintain robust APIs - from the service that powers them right down to the line of code that perfects them.

  • They ensure all our services are healthy, monitored, automated, and designed to scale.

  • You'll work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues.

  • You will support a wide range of products focusing on automation, availability and performance, and above all reliability as well as supporting mobile engineers and business intelligence leading up to, during and after each sprint.

  • You will live true to our ambitions of building an industry leading platform which is relentlessly focussed on innovation.

  • Inside-out knowledge of free and open-source web application frameworks, e.g. Django, Flask and Bottle;

  • In-depth understanding of Python; Meta-classes, decorators, descriptors, list comprehensions and multiple inheritance/mixins should be commonly used paradigms;

  • In-depth knowledge of database management technologies, preferably MySQL, PostgreSQL and understanding of NoSQL databases

  • Understanding of Agile Methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum and XP;

  • Driven to gain insight into different new and old technologies;

  • Experience working on high-traffic and large-scale web products;

  • Experience with web infrastructure, distributed systems, performance analysis, search infrastructure;

  • Must have experienced the whole development cycle from start to finish;

  • Experience with various queuing system/message bus technologies such as RabbitMQ, kafka, etc;

  • Should have good working experience with AWS technologies such as Elastic beanstalk, Elastic cache, RDS, Kinesis, etc;

  • Exposure to deploying and managing Docker containers


Qualifications & specialist skills



  • 3+ years of experience with Python;

  • 3+ years of experience in analysis, design, coding and implementation of next generation web applications in Python and Django;

  • 2+ years of experience in API based architectures (eg SOA, micro-services);

  • 1+ years of experience in AWS technologies;

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Holvi (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Holvi is banking for Makers and Doers – a business account built by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs. We are building financial technology with a purpose that makes a difference in the day-to-day life of European business owners. 


We are looking for a Senior Python Developer with an interest in financial and payment systems. Your role would be to work as part of a team building our core payment system. We're currently connected to the core European payment schemes (SEPA), Mastercard, Visa, and other international card schemes.


You have



  • Experience in web development and API integrations

  • Solid understanding of relational databases and data modelling

  • Understand patterns and know when to use one

  • Love building software and are always looking for ways to improve your work
