item.title: Software Engineer - Java, Python, C++, JavaScript at Goldman Sachs (London, UK)
item.description:
Our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. 


Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas.  Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients.  Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action.  Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.


We are looking for passionate technologists to join our Platforms team, who have some exciting and challenging problems such as uplifting 100m lines of code to use modern C++ this means; new compilers, static/dynamic analysers, performance analytics and automatic refactoring tools as porting 100m lines of code to C++ is only feasible with automated tools.


We will be looking to uplift our Slang/SecDB platform which is used for almost all the risk and pricing in the firm and is incredibly critical to our business. We are constantly looking at ways to improve the platform for example by creating language bindings between Slang/SecDB and other languages such as Python and Java.


To be successful in the challenges above, we need to have the space to be able to innovate which largely means we have the license to do some R&D into how these languages work and how to create the interop. This is a unique opportunity to be a part of defining the path forward for Slang and SecDB and helping to create a platform on which the entire firm’s financial analytics run.


Skills & requirements



  • Programming expertise in one or more of the following languages: Java, Scala, C++, Python, JavaScript and Web.

  • Analytical mind-set, creativity and commercial focus.

  • Enjoys working with algorithms and data structures (e.g. trees, hash maps, queues).

  • A keen interest and experience with machine learning libraries and techniques.

  • Real-Time In-Memory Distributed Systems

  • Agile & CI/CD.


Want to push the limit of digital possibilities?  Start here.  http://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/divisions/engineering/index.html

item.title: Senior (Python) Developer/ Agile Architect (f/m) for international data company at CARFAX Europe GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
As Senior Developer and Agile Architect at CARFAX Europe, you will be part of an agile, cross-functional team, working closely together with software developers, data engineers, data scientists and the teams' Product Owner; all our teams are responsible for the full lifecycle and operation of their products. You will write software and help to plan, coordinate and implement an architectural vision within an agile team. Being a senior and having gained valuable experience in the past, you enable the team to establish best practices (code reviews, unittesting, TDD, refactoring, etc.) and support and mentor your team members in their daily development tasks.


Currently we need support for several teams:


Our "Vehicle History" team's main focus is to consolidate data from various sources and compile a feature rich, good looking Vehicle History Report. Its challenges include data processing, in-depth analysis of interactions of various sources and logic to properly handle them, data storage strategies, the rendering of the report and the delivery to the consumer through various channels.


Our "Internal Applications" team constantly develops and enhances existing applications, supporting various business units (like Customer Support, Marketing, Sales & Business Development) in their daily work life.


While developing in Python on Linux (CentOS), our teams use GitLab to collaborate and do regular, automated deployments to virtualized (VMWare) servers in our data-center and AWS based infrastructure. In their daily development and operations work, our teams are using tools like VirtualBox, Vagrant, Docker, Ansible and Zabbix. 


Our product data is stored in an AWS based, high-availability MongoDB cluster, our business data in Salesforce. Our applications currently use (amongst others) MariaDB, MongoDB, MemCache, Amazon Redshift, Apache, HAProxy, Redis and RabbitMQ.


Currently we have 12 IT professionals working in our headquarter in Munich and one IT colleague working remotely from Barcelona. In total, we are a 50-person team made up of 19 different nationalities - so our company language is English! Most of the team is situated in Munich, with several colleagues located in Sweden, Spain and the Netherlands.


We have many great opportunities ahead of us, which is why we are looking to grow our team of dedicated specialists!

item.title: Instrumentation Software Engineers (Python) at TeraView Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to become a key developer in the undisputed world leader in commercial applications of terahertz light? We are recruiting both contract and permanent Python developers to join our team of industry-leading scientist and engineers, serving semiconductor, automotive and applied research customers worldwide from our base in Cambridge, UK. Check us out at www.teraview.com.


We offer a friendly, informal environment where people are passionate about the ground-breaking work we do.


You will have 3 years or more industry experience of software development, preferably with experience of industrial automation or scientific instrumentation. You will have worked within a formalised Quality System framework. You will be a self-starter with a positive attitude and a proven ability to work in small multi-disciplinary teams.


Remote working will be considered for exceptional candidates.

item.title: Data Scientist (e-Commerce/ Machine Learning/ Python/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curated shopping experience, part of Zalando SE. Being part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent data and software engineering.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Zalon, you will be at the heart of business, data and technology; your work having an immediate impact on customer satisfaction and company profitability.

As part of our empowering technology culture - Radically Agile - you will have the autonomy to develop innovative and complex algorithms for novel use-cases from scratch, while leveraging our rich data, spread across a large range of topics. From data exploration and model building, to algorithm implementation or data engineering, you will have our trust to choose the optimal approach to solve problems. Our wide range of topics to touch upon include several different areas of machine learning and statistics, such as ranking algorithms, supervised and unsupervised learning, Bayesian inference, and any approach that will help you shine in your role.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.).

  • +4 years experience in the analysis of real data with the tools of Machine Learning.

  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analysing and modelling data sets and an interest in statistics.

  • Ideally, at least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object-oriented language, Python or Scala.

  • Willingness to work with microservices architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs.

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

  • Effective communication skills, ability to understand business requirements and an interest in being a touch point for product, software development and commercial.

  • Deep scepticism, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzwords, false assumptions and analysis.

  • English language fluency.


YOUR ROLE



  • Research, design, and implement algorithms to improve our various machine learning driven systems.

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability.

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis, to testing and deployment.

  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative input, working on key results. Your role will span over a number of various topics; therefore, a curious nature would be advantageous.

  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders.

  • Think in an abstract manner and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.

  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints.

  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5 year old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.
Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.

item.title: Senior Fullstack Python Developer for Fintech Startup at Bento (Singapore)

item.title: Scientific Python Developer at INAIT (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
Major duties and responsibilities:



  • Participate in the development of Python modules supporting the automated and configurable execution of INAIT’s machine learning workflow, in collaboration with the the project’ technical lead

  • Use state of the art Scientific Python packages to minimize end-to-end execution time for individual modules and the overall INAIT workflow

  • Define and implement QA and best Python software development practices throughout the organization

  • Perform technical survey of relevant Python standards


Essential skills and experience required:



  • Deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms

  • Strong proficiency in Python and Scientific Python

  • Professional experience in software engineering, software design patterns, and software testing

  • Professional experience using UNIX/Linux operating systems

  • Good team player

  • Fluent spoken and written English

  • Strong work ethic


Preferred:



  • Professional experience in different phases of the software development life-cycle, including unit testing, continuous integration, version control, debugging and documentation

  • Several years of experience in industry developing Python software, preferably using TDD and agile methods


Profile:



  • Master’s degree in computer science and/or computer engineering with at least two years of experience in industry or track record in developing open source packages

  • Quality-driven work ethic

  • Successful track record in designing, developing and maintaining software projects

item.title: Back-End Developer Python - Probably the best job in the world at Octopus Labs (London, UK)
item.description:
Great opportunity to be a key part of a small team that will build high volume FinTech platforms. We have recently hired 7 brilliant individuals and we would like more of you to come and join the team, so if in doubt please send us your CV and tell us about YOU.


YOU:
 - Python developer with several years of experience.
 - You code because you love to "build stuff".
 - You want the "stuff you build" to be used by loads of people.
 - You spend your evenings and weekends working on your own side-project(s).
 - You have a "can do" attitude and love to experiment, tinker and play.
 - You've failed often enough to know you're not perfect.
 - (But secretly you know you're pretty darn good).
 - One of your side projects (almost) received seed funding.


WHAT?
 - You will be a key part of a small team that will build very high volume FinTech platforms from the ground up.


WHY?
 - Flexible working hours.
 - Stunning office.
 - Salary (tell us what you are worth) + benefits.
 - Very diverse/multinational team.


WHERE?
We're ideally looking for a candidate who can work from our offices in London, but are willing to consider:
 - Someone in the commuter belt who would come in to the office 2-3 days per week, and work from home the remainder of the time.
.


WHAT NEXT?
 - Send a brief cover letter and a CV.

item.title: Backend Developer (Python) - Satellite imagery platform at Spaceknow Inc. (Praha 8, Czechia)
item.description:
If you want to join a team of passionate Pythonistas and build systems like no one has ever done before, then SpaceKnow is the right place to start. We are looking for talented people rather than having specific requirements - know Java, C#, C++ or similar and want to jump into something cooler? Keep reading...


Our development process is test driven. We do code review on all changes or pair programming. We are building a continuous deployment ecosystem and have very agile/lean attitude. Every good idea is considered because we believe that meritocracy is the best way to lead skilled people.


Our future challenges lien design and development of microservices, which together bring a possibility to analyze large volumes of satellite imagery data for our customers. Our daily bread is designing APIs, and improving scalability, security and stability of the platform.


Joining Spaceknow, you will join a young team of talented and highly motivated people who strive to make an impact on the world but also have fun along the way.


Do not hesitate to send links of your contributions to FOSS projects or of any other relevant work.

item.title: Software Developer (C++/Python) for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering you an exciting opportunity as a software developer (f/m) in our autonomous driving department. Join one of our agile features teams to develop sophisticated algorithms with a focus on state-of-art disciplines, such as signal processing, robotics and machine learning. Contribute to the autonomous vehicle being able to orient itself, assess situations and select the most appropriate and comfortable driving strategy  even in urban environments.

Being a passionate C++ and Python developer, you care about writing clean and reusable code and testing is an integral part of your every-day routine. When developing algorithms, you adhere to design patterns and keep the overall software architecture in focus. You validate your software solutions continuously in a simulation environment as well as in real test vehicles.

In your daily work, you will find yourself in an international and interdisciplinary environment and collaborate intensively with our high-tech industry partners. Our brand-new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the infrastructure you need to work productively and focus on the software for the automobile of the future.



Qualifications:


- A University degree in Computer Science or a related field of study.
- Expert knowledge in object-oriented design, algorithms and data structures.
- Extensive experience in software development using C++ and Python.
- Experience with software testing and test-driven development.
- Expertise in dealing with complex build environments and continuous integration.
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior Python Developer, you make fresh collected data available to support company decisions.

What you tell people at parties

"I'm a snake charmer: I can make Python do whatever I want."

What you really do

  • You provide technical support to our Business Analysts, who transform your data to Actionable Insights.
  • Your technical expertise will make Coolblue smarter by assisting a data-driven decision making process.

How you do it

  • You help develop scalable Data Pipelines in Python.
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You'll have your own specialization, but you can also perform all other tasks within the team.
  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner.
  • You'll work close to our Business Analysts and you will receive immediate feedback from them.
  • You coach your team members and provide feedback.
  • You employ the right tools for whatever job is thrown at you. You'll have a lot of opportunities to experiment new things. Airflow, Redshift, and BigQuery are technologies we're experimenting with at the moment.

Team

You'll work in a Scrum team of 4 to 6 members, mostly consisting Python developers with a passion for data. The team is managed by a Team Lead. The Team’s backlog is curated  by the Product Owner and Scrum Master. Your team works closely together with our Business Analysts and a team of Data Scientists, providing them with data they can readily use to support company decisions.

A day at the office

After your morning Scrum standup, Rafael sends you a Pull Request. He introduced a new messaging system to speed up the transfer of data from the ERP system. Together, you review the Pull Request and then merge the code. After that, you join David, the Product Owner. He wants to discuss and design a new architecture to provide the Finance department with insights about Customer Service costs. Just before lunch, you pass by Andres, a data scientist who's working on new Machine Learning algorithm that  can forecast warehouse stock. You help him move some data to BigQuery. You invite him to have lunch together with your team. On the way back, you share your concerns about the Google Adwords ingest process with David. It's losing records, so you want to refactor some of the Python code. You add a few automated tests and send the Pull Request to your team mate, Dirk, for review. At 16:30, the improvements are automatically deployed via our continuous integration pipeline. By 17:30, you're done for the day and, together with your team members, head to the bar for a drink.

What we're asking

  • You have a minimum of 5 years experience as a developer.
  • You have a minimum of 2 years experience with Python.
  • You have experience writing SQL queries.
  • You write extendable easy-to-read clean Python code.
  • Agile and flexibility come naturally to you.
  • You're a team player.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues' craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're willing to investigate what users want and why.
  • You're familiar with continuous integration systems that automate your code deployments.
  • Experience as a Business Intelligence developer is a plus.
  • Experience with Kimball methodology is a big plus.
  • Experience with Python concurrency frameworks (e.g. asyncio, gevent) and improving Python performance (e.g. using Cython, PyPy, Numba, etc.) is a plus.
  • Experience with Redshift or BigQuery is a plus.
  • You're willing to relocate to Rotterdam, or nearby.

What we're offering

  • Money.
  • Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.
  • A 10% discount on all of our products.
  • An awesome workplace. With freshly prepared meals, monthly TGIF drinks, epic Coolblue parties, and an informal, playful office space.
  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back.
  • Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a short stumble away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk.
  • Relocation assistance, from a to z (if you live abroad).
  • Dutch language courses. To help you become a Rotterdammert.
  • An international work environment. With colleagues from places like Belgium, Spain, Australia, Mexico, and Italy.
  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.
  • A job at one of the fastest-growing companies in the Benelux region.
  • Plenty of space for initiatives and original ideas. We welcome them. Whether you've been with us for a week, month, or year.

item.title: Python / API Full Stack Engineer! Help us to deliver Python-based REST solutions at FanDuel (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
What you’ll do


Working on a full stack team mainly focussed on native application development this role provides the API and backend capabilities necessary for those applications to hook into a number of sources. This will be a mix of in-depth, complex engineering tasks as well as quick-fire UI/UX improvements to our product suite.


The tech stack in this area will require experience and a desire to deliver Python-based REST solutions although you may touch on other technologies including Java & GraphQL. Our full-stack philosophy also provides the opportunity to take on other tasks, where necessary to assist the team in delivering their goals.


Our engineering teams work in an agile environment, but it’s the autonomy and empowerment given to our full-stack teams that’s the big difference. We utilise methods for delivery, quality and collective improvement that work for them, not a one size fits all approach. That’s what allows our teams to deliver on a constant cycle without external dependencies.

item.title: Senior Python Web Developer at Bromium UK Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced full stack developer to join our engineering team in Cambridge. You will be working on the Bromium Controller - a web-based management platform for our product. Working within a small and focused team, the job covers:



  • The API and UI backend (Django, SQL)

  • The background worker service / task queues (Celery)

  • Front-end UI and data visualisation - HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Vue.js, Sass, D3)

  • Deployment to AWS

  • Installation and upgrade on customers' self-hosted, on-prem servers

  • Unit tests, Selenium tests, automated installation tests, anything else we can have the CI system do for us


The Controller provides security policy and software updates for the Bromium endpoint security product installed on the clients. It also receives status, events and threat data from these clients, including malware traces which are used to produce interactive visualisations in the Controller UI and summarised in reports. The Controller is deployed at scale, both on-premises at individual corporate enterprises with tens of thousands of clients, and in the cloud across multiple Amazon AWS instances. We're looking to scale further, while also adding support for new products and enhancing existing features.


Required



  • Proven experience working with Python

  • Understanding of Django, JavaScript and SQL

  • Successful experience of designing scalable web services

  • Ability to debug and optimize complex queries

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent


 Desirable



  • Experience designing and deploying Cloud services at scale (we use Amazon AWS)

  • Experience using task queue systems, such as Celery

  • Experience guiding customer deployments of server products with a database backend

item.title: Python Developer at ON Semiconductor (Mechelen, Belgium)
item.description:
Working in a dynamic environment you will be part of a team that is responsible for evaluating CMOS image sensors for industrial and specialty applications.


In your role as python developer you will focus on further developing our Python based production test software which interfaces with our custom developed image sensor tester. You will create custom test algorithms to detect image sensor defects and help improve both our test times and test coverage.


Your performance and growth is monitored, assessed and rewarded, you will have an individual development plan based on your competences and interests.


Profile: Msc in Electronics-ICT or Software engineering. 5 to 8 years experience.


Tools: C / C ++ / Visual Basic knowledge is a plus. In-depth Python coding knowledge.


Soft Skills: You are highly motivated, efficient and passionate about technology and hold high standards where it comes to quality. Fluent in English.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist (Python/Scala) at Contiamo (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the role


The challenge: Bringing data science to production



  • We have created a platform that gives data scientists a flexible, consistent, and simple environment based on Docker containers, where their code can be written in a large variety of languages (Python, R, Scala).

  • Your job would be to work with our customers, select the right approach and tools for the problem while also providing feedback from your usage of our platform to help shape its roadmap.

  • You would support a wide range of use cases ranging from customer service analytics to IoT projects.


The stack


Python, scikit-learn, R, Scala, Spark, MLLib, XGBoost, TensorFlow


Additional technologies you might get in contact with: Go, Docker, Kubernetes (see our Go Engineer position).


Your profile


You have a strong background in mathematics or another scientific discipline. You are curious and have an affinity for statistical thinking. You are comfortable with programming (e.g. with Python or Scala). You like to understand things and don't fall for buzzwords.


Interested?


Let's schedule a brief 20min session to get to know each other.


About us


Who we are



  • Contiamo is a Berlin-based, fast-growing tech company.

  • We are tech-driven and keep a close watch on recent scientific developments and emerging technologies. We love open-source. We are a very international team with interesting people from all over the world (95% of us have relocated to Berlin).


How we work



  • We strongly believe in the importance of uninterrupted time to get stuff done and quality over quantity when it comes to working hours. We prefer to keep our schedule meeting-light and work in a library-like atmosphere during the core hours.

  • We believe the ability to give and get constructive feedback and express divergent ideas is crucial to make innovation come to life. We live a very open discussion culture and prefer the evaluation of ideas based on merit over top-down decision making.

  • We strongly believe in ownership of one's features, from spec to implementation to operation. We also understand that ownership comes with a sense of responsibility towards others that depend on the results of our work.

  • We believe that that everybody should be able to find meaning in their work. We match assignments based on both ability and individual interests and discuss your progress and individual needs every 3 months.

  • We don't see people as "resources" and genuinely care about each other. We also understand that there's more than fancy perks and cool events to people's satisfaction and engagement. We continuously work towards an environment providing a lot of autonomy, transparency and development opportunities and rely on everybody's feedback to hold us accountable for maintaining our high standards.


About the interview process


How we get to know each other



  1. We like to start out with a brief 20-30min session for a mutual introduction. We tell you about our company, product and culture and are happy to answer any questions you might have. From your side, we're mostly interested in understanding what kind of challenges you're looking for, what technologies you'd like to work with and what role you'd like to be in.

  2. If both sides agree that this could be a good fit, we move on to a more technical session. We ask you to walk us through one of your past projects as if we were new colleagues joining you on the job. The ability to communicate effectively and concisely about complex systems and trade-offs between different approaches is key.

  3. In a second technical session, we discuss some of the technologies and concepts you have used. We also give you a walk-through of our product and solutions, discuss our architecture and components. Finally we try to scope your initial role and focus — should you be joining us.

  4. In the last session, we discuss the remaining details, logistics and plan your relocation.


We see the interview process as a mutual opportunity to get to know each other — at eye level. That's why we won't ask you to work for free on any coding assignments and always strive for responding within hours, not weeks.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f) - Mid Level (python, pyspark, hadoop, docker) at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 5 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. Now we're the fastest growing company in Europe, active and growing in 9 different countries across 3 continents.


Our story started in Berlin. As Europe’s tech hub, and the home of our global headquarters, it’s a dynamic, progressive environment where innovation is nurtured and promoted. Since we started, we’ve worked exceptionally hard and we’ve received almost US$ 300 million in investment which together have allowed us to create an award winning product.



As a member of HelloTech you’ll be exposed to a modern technology stack and a slick cross functional agile team setup. We have developed a refined product and provide scalability on a global level. Join our HelloTech team and help us to build a fresh food global champion!


About the job


HelloFresh Data Science is an interdisciplinary team that designs, implements and maintains state of the art machine learning models to automate and optimize marketing, operations, logistics and customer experience.  We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who is excited about turning innovative ideas into powerful data driven products.  Working closely with the data scientist and engineers on the team you will help bringing these ideas into reality and improve the e-commerce experience of millions of customers around the globe.


To succeed in this role, you’ll need a hunger for discovering information in massive amounts of data, an attitude towards experimentation and fluency in machine learning techniques and software engineering best practices.


As machine learning engineer you will be responsible for 



  • Solving challenging business problems by deploying state-of- the-art machine learning pipelines in production

  • Ensuring availability, performance and scalability of our machine learning and data processing platform

  • Collaborating with data scientists and business stakeholders to discover innovative ways of using vast repositories of user generated data


Who we’re looking for



  • A proven track record implementing data driven products and a broad understanding of the state of the art in machine learning

  • A passion for using and developing open source software and a solid programming background ideally in Python and Pyspark

  • Experience with storage models coming from the SQL (PostgresSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (Elasticsearch, Redis) space as well as data streaming (Kinesis, Kafka) and columnar databases (BigQuery)

  • Experience in using Docker containers and configuration management systems such as Ansible/ Fabric / Puppet.

  • Experience in Hadoop technologies such as Hive / Impala and distributed data pipelines such as Airflow / Luigi

  • Sense of ownership: you take responsibility for your projects and pride in your work:


What we offer



  • The opportunity to get into one of the most intellectually demanding roles at one of the largest technology companies in Europe

  • Cutting edge technology, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutions

  • Competitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growth

  • Great international exposure and team atmosphere

  • Work in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Berlin with excellent transport links and employee perks


Are you up for a challenge?


Please submit your complete application by using this link including your earliest starting date.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer (Backend / Data Driven/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curating and delivering complete outfits for our customers. Part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent software engineering.

As part of our recruitment ramp-up for a designated Data Science & Research Engineering team, you, as a Python Backend Engineer will bring the engineering perspective into our products. Expect a role where you will have immediate impact as we iterate fast and experiment a lot, welcoming your innovative engineering ideas to the table. The teams work with full end-to-end responsibility on solving the challenges at hand - starting with ideating over prototyping and user testing to bringing features live and checking their performance.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Python skills (deep understanding of language internals, profiling, best practices, eg. Pandas, Scikit-learn). Java or Scala experience (or an interest) would also be appreciated.



  • Solid understanding of data structures, coding standards, best practices, software design, architecture.

  • Interest in setting up monitoring, tracking and reporting, designing and implementing pipelines for training and deploying new models and a real curiosity around "how algorithms work".

  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS. Knowledge of microservice architecture and distributed systems is also advantageous.

  • At least 3 years of professional programming experience in a commercial environment, backed-up by a Masters or Bachelor Degree in a relevant subject or additional working experience.

  • English language fluency


YOUR ROLE



  • You will communicate with the data scientists (or machine learning experts or research engineers) and exchange ideas about solutions to the existent and potential problems. You will do this by identifying the right components and putting them together in the correct manner.

  • You will work closely with product owners and the business counterparts, acting as a sparring partner on technical solutions to our immediate challenges.

  • You will be part of a team where Code Quality, Code Reviews, Test Coverage, etc. are kept at very high standards, therefore you should also be positive and firm in your attitude towards them.

  • You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability.

  • You will be accountable for all aspects of your work as you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

  • You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from ideation over design to implementation and maintenance.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

  • Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at related Conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.

  • Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5-year-old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.

item.title: Big Data QA Engineers (Hadoop Spark Python Scala Automation) at Vodafone Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We've reached 420 million customers, all with unique behaviours and experiences and have a tremendous amount of data that is generated every single second in our network. This means that we have a vast body of rich information, which if unlocked, can lead to something very special. With your help.


Role purpose:



  • Making sure that Data Engineering produce highly performing and stable applications to perform complex processing of massive volumes of data in a multi-tenancy Hadoop environment

  • Guaranteeing the quality of end-to-end applications (through Review AND testing) that make use of large volumes of source data from the operational systems and output insights back to business systems

  • Proactively Working with the Data engineering (and data extraction) team, as one squad, to ensure the right quality

  • checks are in place at the various stages of the Data Integration

  • Support and contribute, with the central team, to define best practice for the agile development of applications to run on the Big Data Platform, from a QA perspective


 Key Accountabilities:



  • Review the code produced by Data Engineering to load the necessary data from local and group sources onto the shared platform that are necessary for analysis and for commercial actions;

  • Review the code produced by Data Engineering to Building applications that make use of large volumes of data and generate outputs that allow commercial actions that generate incremental value

  • Define, Build, Automate, execute the “in sprint” testing for code mentioned at point 1 and 2.

  • Comply with the framework and Dev/Ops approach defined in the centre in terms of QA strategy, tools, ways of working.

  • Validate, were requested, the models produced by the data science team


Your Profile:



  • Expert level experience in designing, building and managing applications to process large amounts of data in a Hadoop ecosystem;

  • Extensive experience with performance tuning applications on Hadoop and configuring Hadoop systems to maximise performance;

  • Experience building systems to perform real-time data processing using Spark Streaming or Storm;

  • Experience with managing the development life-cycle for agile software development projects;

  • Experience working in a multi tenancy Hadoop environment;


Essential:



  • Significant level of Quality Assurance or Test automation

  • Expert level experience with using Spark, Yarn, Hive or Oozie

  • Strong Python and Scala programming ability


Desirable: 



  • Working knowledge of HBase, Solr, Kafka and Flume

  • Dev/Ops experience

  • Some experience with other distributed technologies such as Cassandra, ElasticSeatch and Flink

item.title: Entwicklungsingenieur (m/w) C und Python für Softwaretests at Rohde & Schwarz (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Spezifikation und Entwicklung von System-/Gerätelevel-Tests sowie Durchführung existierender Tests wie Regressions-, Integrations- und Smoke-Tests

  • Reproduktion und Verfolgung bis zur Lösung von im Test gefundenen Fehlern

  • Fehler-Reporting an die zuständigen Softwareentwickler

  • Durchführung von Funktionstests am Gerät

  • Automatisierung wiederkehrender Tests durch die Erstellung von Skripten

  • Regelmäßige Teststatusberichte an das Projektmanagement

  • Integration von Software-Zulieferungen


Ihre Qualifikationen:



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, der Elektro- oder Nachrichtentechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung

  • Erste Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung sowie in der Erstellung und Durchführung von Tests einschl. Testautomatisierung

  • Fundierte Programmierkenntnisse in C und Python

  • Erfahrung mit IP-basierten Protokollen und Netzwerken

  • Kenntnisse über Vorgehensmodelle in Entwicklung, Konfigurationsmanagement und Qualitätssicherung

  • Fähigkeit Entwicklungsteilprozesse selbstständig und kreativ umzusetzen

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Python, C#, AZURE at ARANZ Geo (Christchurch, New Zealand)
item.description:
ARANZ Geo specialises in the interpretation and 3D visualisation of geoscience information using software modelling. It takes a special mix of people to make our cool and innovative software, and we’re immensely proud of how far we have come.


We currently serve the mining, geothermal and hydrogeology markets. With so many talented people with passion for building great software, we are fast expanding into the energy, civil engineering and environmental sectors. Our products are built for the desktop, enterprise, and increasingly the cloud.


Software Engineer Tech Stack


Our technology stack is based on a wide array of open source tech mostly written in Python. Don’t worry if haven’t coded in Python yet, as we as have many developers who started off in C# or C++.


We are an agile development company using state of the art tools like JIRA, GIT and TeamCity to tackle complex problems backed up by code reviews and lots of exploratory and automated testing.

item.title: Scientific Media Designer - Python at EPFL - Blue Brain Project (Genève, Switzerland)
item.description:
The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration.



For our Visualization team, we are currently seeking to fill the following position:



Scientific Media Designer



We are looking for a multi- disciplinary profile, a creative and technically savvy individual interested in understanding and communicating scientific research with high quality visuals. This person will support and collaborate with the lead designer in the visualisation team on a broad range of projects.



Major Duties and responsibilities:



  • Scripting with Python for automation in visualisation tools

  • Designing scientific visualisations for expert or lay audience

  • Researching ways of visualising complex data

  • Designing short movies with 3D visualisations

  • Coordinating visualisation requests with scientists and engineers

  • Storing, archiving and publishing visualisations



Profile:



  • 1+ year of work experience in a related field field

  • Graduate degree in a related field or 4+ years of work experience

  • Ability to develop with scripting languages using version control

  • A good sense of composition, colours & aesthetics

  • Good notions of video making, 2d/3d animation and compositing

  • Experience with Adobe or open source design tools

  • Good command of written and spoken English, French is a plus

  • Experience with Blender or another 3D professional tool is a plus

  • Experience with a scientific or similar public domain is a plus



The Blue Brain Project is:



  • A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience.

  • A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community

  • A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron



Start date: as soon as possible; Activity rate: 100%; Deadline for application : until position is filled Duration of contract: 1 year, renewable. Ref : BBP – Scientific Media Designer



Applicants should submit a cover letter, detailed CV and a small portfolio in PDF format only, with file name “Surname_position _Cover Letter” and “Surname_positon _CV” electronically to jobs.bbp@epfl.ch Please use the reference of the position title in the “object” field.

item.title: Software Engineer - Product Research, Python at Tenable, Inc. (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Tenable is more than ‘just’ the creator of Nessus. Our security solutions - including the first cyber exposure platform for modern assets, Tenable.io - are transforming global vulnerability management. We’re a global team, powered by creative thinkers who are wired for action, focused on delivering results and collaborating to enable decisive actions to protect what matters most. We’re in this together - colleagues, customers and partner communities working as One Tenable.

Can you join Team Tenable? Yes you can - if you’re excited by the thought of working with over 800 colleagues, 23,000 customers and a range of revolutionary products that are shaping cybersecurity in 150 countries. Being valued for who you are as well as what you do, you can embrace the pace (we’re recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte and E&Y) as well as enjoy a superb rewards package (we’re seen as a Best Places to Work by Glassdoor, The Washington Post, The Baltimore Sun, The Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace). The key question is: Is This You?



Your Role:

Tenable is looking for a developer to join our research team. This position will involve developing Nessus plugins (scripts) for configuration auditing and vulnerability detection. The development will be in Nessus Attack Scripting Language (NASL). Although experience in NASL programming is not required, however experience in Python is a must have.


Your Opportunity:



  • Develop and enhance Tenable’s Nessus plugins

  • Promote great software design and quality

  • Manage, participate in, or directly work on any additional projects, assignments, or initiatives as assigned

  • Drive innovation by coming up with new ideas for our products and processes

  • Work with Tenable’s Support group to identify and troubleshoot issues related to existing plugins and audit files


What you'll need:



  • Demonstrated experience with regular expressions, shell scripting, and expert-level Python

  • Experience with git revision control system a must

  • Unit and end to end testing experience required

  • In depth knowledge of a variety of operating systems (e.g., Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Cisco IOS) as well as enterprise applications

  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills


And ideally:



  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or a related field

  • Familiarity with Tenable’s product line 

  • 3-4 years of programming experience

  • Experience in Enterprise Compliance/Configuration & Vulnerability Management products 

  • Experience with our proprietary language, Nessus Attack Scripting Language (NASL)



We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels. 


Openings

item.title: Senior Software Engineer in Test (C++, Java, Python Essential) at Arm (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer in Test to join our engineering team based in Cambridge to help us deliver best-in-class tools. Our team within the Development Solutions Group (DSG) is responsible for developing DS-5 Development Studio, a comprehensive tools suite for embedded C/C++ software development on ARM-based systems.



The DSG vision is to help our customers create innovative and energy efficient ARM Powered products, using powerful and easy to use development tools. Our mission is to create or enable tools that improve ARM system performance, productivity or time to market.

Your main responsibilities will be:



  • Work within the development team to ensure highest quality levels throughout; contribute to requirements capture, monitor tests coverage, identify and implement necessary changes in the code base so that testability is built into our products

  • Own continuous integration and test automation infrastructures; aim for the tightest build/test feedback loop, by selecting and deploying the best tools and frameworks

  • Contribute directly to unit and end-to-end testing

  • Develop product expertise, organise exploratory and usability testing, leveraging internal users and customer support teams

  • Depending on experience, develop people in the team, developers and testers alike



Job Requirements:



  • To be successful in this role, you will need the following attributes: 

  • Solid knowledge of Java and Python

  • Recent experience in product validation, tests automation and continuous integration frameworks

  • Be able to work effectively as part of an engineering team, collaborating with developers and other infrastructure teams around the company

  • Desirable skills: 

  • Experience with embedded software development

  • Sound computer architecture knowledge


At ARM, we are guided by our core beliefs that reflect our unique culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy ordinary and shape extraordinary:


We not I



  • Take daily responsibility to make the Global ARM community thrive

  • No individual owns the right answer. Brilliance is collective

  • Information is crucial, share it

  • Realise that we win when we collaborate — and that everyone misses out when we don’t


Passion for Progress



  • Our differences are our strength. Widen and mix up the pool of people you connect with

  • Difficult things can take unexpected directions. Stick with it

  • Make feedback positive and expansive, not negative and narrow

  • The essence of progress is that it can’t stop. Grow with it and own your own progress



Be your brilliant self



  • Be quirky not egocentric

  • Recognise the power in saying ‘I don’t know’

  • Make trust our default position

  • Hold strong opinions lightly


With offices around the world, ARM is a diverse organisation of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling a vibrant, inclusive, meritocratic, and open workplace, where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to ARM's success in the global marketplace.


We are also committed to global talent acquisition and offer an attractive relocation package. Please note we are hiring for multiple Software Engineers at this location

item.title: QA Automation (hiptest, nightwatchjs, selenium, gherkin, python) at FineTune Learning (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
FineTune is seeking a senior QA for our AP and Pre-AP software product.   We are a fully distributed and international team though 1/3 of us are in Boston Metro area.  S/he will have the opportunity to work on mission critical software that will impact 3-5 million students in 2019.  If you are well versed in various selenium based testing, load testing, smoke testing, test driven development and have worked in QA'ing at least 3 production released software, you are welcome to apply. S/he will be working with our development team, product owners, designers and increase the quality of the software so that we may serve 3 million+ users in 2019.


Requirements:



  • Proven experience in understanding complex user needs with multiple stakeholders

  • 5+ years of QA experience

  • 3+ years experience with API testing, UI testing, end to end testing.

  • 3+ years experience QA’ing high-availability enterprise software a plus

  • 3+ years experience with Databases (SQL or noSQL)

  • Experience with Selenium

  • Strong Agile Experience

  • Experience with continuous integration and test driven development

  • Ability to dive deep into technical issues.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Experience in debugging performance issues with javascript and reactjs or other SPA architecture a plus

  • Experience with collaborating in github a plus

  • Desire to continuously, learn, improve and apply new technologies that will increase operational efficiency and effectiveness

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent a plus


As we prepare for rapid business growth from here, FineTune Learning is seeking to hire a Senior QA Engineer who have worked in at least 2-3 production released software/web/mobile products.  We are looking for people who have strong motivation to grow startup companies, who is agile and continuously improving themselves while having an opinion for great software components and services with great attention to detail in delivering reliable software that is well tested according to user expectations.

item.title: Senior Python Backend Engineer - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Develop cutting edge Machine Learning applications


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Forecasting tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfil customer demand. We use cutting edge Machine Learning technology to forecast demand and pricing with a focus on business and customer experience.


THE JOB


As a Backend Engineer, you’ll bring the engineering perspective into our cross-functional Data Science teams:



  • You drive system design and Implementation. You apply your Python development skills to build production systems, RESTful APIs, micro services (AWS), and the infrastructure for big data processing. You will use latest tech stack (Presto, Kubernetes, airflow, NoSql) in day-to-day work. You’re responsible for the system design and architecture, considering dependencies, scalability, and performance. Experiences with ML related libraries (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn)  and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Spark) would be beneficial.



  • You are comfortable with uncertainty in research. You know how to bring structure into explorative tasks and make appropriate technical trade-offs.



  • You bring machine learning systems to production. You collaborate with Data Scientists to translate forecasting prototypes into production systems. You either already have a good understanding of machine learning or a curiosity and strong mathematical background to quickly become familiar with them.



  • You set standards of engineering excellence. You will challenge our status quo, drive innovation and apply agile best practices. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability. You push topics around code quality, reviews, test coverage. 


WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY



  • You have impact. Your contribution to our business critical forecasting products will have a broad visibility across the company and management levels.

  • You can influence. Zalando’s dynamic structures and processes give you a huge opportunity to drive ideas and influence your working environment.

  • We create career opportunities. Our tech departments are ever growing, offering various career opportunities for your future, whether you want to become an Expert Developer, or step into a new role.

  • We support your networking. You have the opportunity to attend and speak at related conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish your work (open source commitment), we host game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • The Benefits. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


Please make sure your application is written in English. If you have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, or if you are not sure whether your qualifications and work experience is suffice, please contact your recruiter: Almog Greenberg

item.title: Senior Python / Django Developer (w/m) at moneymeets GmbH (Köln, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die Finanzbranche befindet sich mitten im größten Wandel ihrer Geschichte. moneymeets.com ist bereits 2011 - als eines der ersten Unternehmen in Deutschland - gestartet, um die klassische Finanz- und Versicherungsberatung durch online-Lösungen signifikant zu verändern. Heute gehört moneymeets zu den erfolgreichsten FinTech-Unternehmen im deutschsprachigen Raum – mit starken Investoren und zahlreichen Auszeichnungen.


Du bist in der Lage, basierend auf deinen Erfahrungen Entwicklerteams zum Erfolg zu bringen und arbeitest gerne in einem dynamischen Umfeld für moderne Webanwendungen in einem FinTech?


Dann bieten wir Dir hierfür eine der spannendsten Möglichkeiten:


Deine Aufgaben



  • Du schreibst Performance optimierten Clean Code auf der Höhe der technischen Entwicklung

  • Soweit erforderlich definierst und integrierst du Testmethoden

  • Unterstützung des Entwicklerteams im Backend in einem agilen Entwicklungsumfeld (Scrum)

  • Fachliches Coaching der Teammitglieder Backend

  • Abstimmung der Entwicklung gemeinsam mit dem Head of Development Operations

  • Abstimmung der Entwicklungsplanung mit dem Head of Development Operations und dem Backend-Team


Das bringst Du mit



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik / Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung / Erfahrungen

  • Mehrjährige erfolgreiche Tätigkeit im IT Development

  • Umfangreiche technische Skills im Webumfeld, Professional Skills in Python oder noch besser im Django-Framework

  • Erfahrung im Design sowie Implementierung von REST-APIs

  • Affinität zum FinTech Segment

  • Analytische Fähigkeiten und Lösungsorientierung

  • Aufgeschlossenheit, Teamfähigkeit, ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und die Lust, Teams zum Erfolg zu bringen.

  • Engagement, Leistungsorientierung und hohe Eigenverantwortung


Das darfst Du von uns erwarten



  • Eine abwechslungsreiche sowie anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit in einem expandierenden Unternehmen

  • Vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und flachen Hierarchien

  • Hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortlichkeit sowie persönliche Gestaltungsspielräume

  • Raum für Ideen an verantwortungsvoller Stelle

  • Angenehmes Arbeitsklima mit konstruktiver Feedback-Kultur in einem engagierten und dynamischen Team mit kreativer Atmosphäre und Start-Up-Feeling

item.title: Scala /Python Data Engineer M/F Green and smart mobility to experience the world at FlixBus (München, Germany)
item.description:
We want to grow our successful German business and therefore we are looking for Data Engineers (m/f) to join our team based in Munich, Germany.


Your tasks


You are in charge to build a data platform that manages our companies' data flows
The platform consists of several services (messaging, streaming, persistence, machine learning etc.) that can be used by our product development teams in a self-service way
As a member of one of our product development teams, you build data-intensive applications on top of our data platform, ranging from data ingestion to processing and making use of the data to provide smart services to our customers and internal business users


Your Profile


Several years of experience as Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Solid expertise in at least one programming language (preferably Scala, Java or Python) 
Working experience with structured engineering methods like test first (TDD, BDD)
Experience with big data technologies (Flume, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Redshift and NoSQL Databases) and practical experience with Amazon Web Services 
Previous experience in the design and implementation of complex data pipelines (AWS Data Pipeline) and familiarity with machine learning, real-time data processing, data warehousing and data visualization techniques are a plus
Fluent in English; every other European language is a plus

item.title: Python Developer at Optel (Ville de Québec, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Now a Certified B Corporation, OPTEL is a leading multinational provider of traceability systems, and its mission is to use its innovative technologies to create a better world through responsible capitalism. The company's renowned solutions ensure the quality of consumer health products and help stop counterfeiting of pharmaceuticals and medical devices throughout the world. OPTEL is also adapting its technologies to create efficiencies in various other sectors from health-related industries to smart manufacturing and more, all can benefit from global traceability. OPTEL's expertise will allow diverse industries to measure, inspect, control and track a variety of elements to improve quality and make better use of resources.


We are looking for a Python Developer to join its Software team.


On being a Python Developer at Optel


At the heart of the design and integration of automated vision and serialization systems, you will thrive in a small, agile, and multidisciplinary team. This self-managed environment will provide you all the flexibility required to innovate while complying with the company's software development phases: design, implementation, tests, debug, and support. 


Everyday life of a Python Developer at Optel


As you participate in the team's daily activities (scrums, sprint planning, sprint review, and sprint retrospective), you will suggest innovative solutions to software challenges. You will develop future solutions and improve the current ones, while performing maintenance improvements on existing solutions. You will benefit from working with experienced colleagues and in interruption-free spaces that will enhance your creativity. This independence will be accompanied by the unique responsibility of providing a factual account of your work progress while remaining open to improvement.


Types of Projects and Technologies 


At Optel, we use different platforms and projects in different fields: PC-based applications, middleware, cloud, and mobile. We offer solutions and services such as inspection, serialization, traceability, and engineering for various industries, including the pharmaceutical sector. We strive to resolve widespread and major issues and therefore contribute to creating a better world.


If you are familiar with Visual Studio (2013 and up) and Python programming is your strength, Optel is the right company for you.


You will also be involved in exploratory projects to evaluate the most advanced technologies available on the market.


Working at OPTEL is benefiting from a dynamic work environment, based on collaboration with open spaces and focus on challenges. It is also a flexible schedule, activities organized by the social club each month and many stimulating projects. All of this in a friendly atmosphere with free coffee, of course!

item.title: Python/Django Contractors at Bromium UK Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Day rate: Negotiable


Duration: Estimated 3 months


Location: Cambridge


We are looking for experienced full stack development contractors to temporarily join our engineering team in Cambridge.  You will be working on the Bromium Controller - a web-based management platform for our product. Working within a small and focused team, the job covers:



  • The API and UI backend (Django, SQL)

  • The background worker service / task queues (Celery)

  • Front-end UI and data visualisation - HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Vue.js, Sass, D3)

  • Deployment to AWS

  • Installation and upgrade on customers' self-hosted, on-prem servers

  • Unit tests, Selenium tests, automated installation tests, anything else we can have the CI system do for us


The Controller provides security policy and software updates for the Bromium endpoint security product installed on the clients. It also receives status, events and threat data from these clients, including malware traces which are used to produce interactive visualisations in the Controller UI and summarised in reports. The Controller is deployed at scale, both on-premises at individual corporate enterprises with tens of thousands of clients, and in the cloud across multiple Amazon AWS instances. We're looking to scale further, while also adding support for new products and enhancing existing features.


Job Requirements:



  • Proven experience working with Python and Django

  • Understanding of JavaScript and SQL

  • Successful experience of designing scalable web services

  • Ability to debug and optimize complex queries

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent


The following skills and attributes are a plus:



  • Experience designing and deploying Cloud services at scale (we use Amazon AWS)

  • Experience using task queue systems, such as Celery

  • Experience guiding customer deployments of server products with a database backend


To apply for contract: Email your profile and day rate to jobs@bromium.com

item.title: Big Data Engineer (m/f) - Mid Level (python, pyspark, hadoop, kafka) at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 5 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We’re now active and growing in 9 different countries in 3 continents.


Our story started in Berlin. As Europe’s tech hub, and the home of our global headquarters, it’s a dynamic, progressive environment where innovation is nurtured and promoted. Since we started, we’ve worked exceptionally hard and we’ve received more than US$ 300 million in investment which together have allowed us to create an award winning product and become one of the top 3 largest companies to come out of Europe over the past 4 years.


As a member of HelloTech you’ll be exposed to a modern technology stack and a slick cross functional agile team setup. We have developed a refined product and provide scalability on a global level. Join our HelloTech team and help us to build a fresh food global champion!


About the job


As a Big Data Engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop distributed services that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain distributed, service-oriented and message-oriented data platform components 

  • Design, build, and maintain data ingestion, ETLs and infrastructure for batch and near real time processing.

  • Build and maintain Business Intelligence and reporting solutions.


You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our engineering blog.


Who we’re looking for



  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent

  • Experience in Software Engineering

  • Fluency in Python and OOP

  • Experience with Apache Spark, Hive, Impala, and Kafka

  • Experience with Hadoop, plus distributions like Cloudera, MapR or Hortonworks

  • Experience with RDBMS such as PostgreSQL or MySQL

  • Experience with NoSQL data stores such as MongoDB, Redis or Cassandra

  • Agile team-working experience 

  • Test-Driven Development

  • Preferred: Experienced with data modelling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured solutions

  • Preferred: Experience with Amazon AWS and DevOps and Automation

  • Preferred: Familiarity with performance metric tools

  • Preferred: Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Qlikview)


What we offer



  • The opportunity to get into one of the most intellectually demanding roles at one of the largest technology companies in Europe

  • Cutting edge technology, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutions

  • Competitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growth

  • Great international exposure and team atmosphere

  • Work in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Berlin with excellent transport links and employee perks


Are you up for a challenge?


Please submit your complete application below including your earliest starting date and salary expectations.


We’re committed to making HelloFresh as inclusive as we can be. As part of that commitment we chose to be transparent about our diversity data. To enable us to build an accurate picture of our workforce, we ask some optional questions in our application process.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer to create internal ERP system (Python/Java) at zLabels GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT


At zLabels we create inspiring fashion brands for the online generation, such as mint&berry, Even&Odd, Zign and Kiomi. Our data-driven way of doing business means that our decisions are backed up by consumer behaviors and translate directly into relevant product selections. Developed for the digital market from day one, we’re confident to navigate the changing retail landscape and take pride in being always fast, always fresh.


To extend the reach of our fashion brands and enter new markets, we are building our own technical platform, such as our own system to manage stock and completing business transactions systems separate to the Zalando tech platform. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 30 engineers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of zLabels. As Senior Backend Engineer (Java and/or Python) at zLabels you will create and maintain our  internal ERP system, which will support key business units in enhancing its performance through technology.



YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDS


Variety. Together with your team you will build, scale and continuously improve our ERP platform improving functional areas of the business such as Finance, Procurement, Logistics, Merchandising and Selling. These different areas demand a lot of integrations (with multiple systems) and tooling to improve the daily business.


Autonomy. Due to the size and startup-like set up of the tech team you will have the opportunity to decide together with your team on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.


Ownership. You are taking ownership of, and being responsible for providing strong technical architecture of the distributed systems that you will provide to key business units, such as Procurement, Finance or Logistics.


Excellence. Due to your business mindset you are continually thinking about new ways on how to help zLabels scale through a strong technical platform and synchronize it with distributed systems of the Zalando tech platform.



YOU ARE SKILLED


Experience. You have a strong background in working on and setting up ERPs and integrating them with multiple systems. You have also worked on creating architecture for technical solutions that have direct impact on the business scalability and profitability.


Technologies. Your preferred choice of coding hands-on is in Java and/or Python. You also have an understanding of APIs, REST, SOAP and have previously worked with distributed systems that  included CRM or ERP tools. Previous experience with AWS and Javascript is a plus. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Business mindset. You have a business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve zLabels through effective and strategic development of internal systems.


Knowledge Exchange. You will lead and mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.



YOU ARE OFFERED


Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, municipality services, flexible working times, family service and parent & child rooms, additional holidays & volunteering time off, diverse sports and health offerings


Development. Extensive onboarding, personal branding support focused on leadership, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teams.



WANT TO JOIN US?


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer - (Java/ Scala/ Clojure/ Python/ Go) at Zalando SE (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


The Helsinki Tech Hub is growing fast.. We already outgrew our first offices in Punavuori and recently moved into custom designed premises in Kampii, right in the heart of Helsinki. The new office offers a fantastic work space where you can have a real impact on the world of e-commerce working with a great bunch of talented individuals (if we do say so ourselves!)


You Are Setting Standards 


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


 Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

item.title: Django Developer (Zurich) at Divio (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description:
If working with a sophisticated cloud environment spanning multiple service providers and acting in a cross-functional role is what youre aiming for, then wed be happy to welcome you to our team as full-time Django Developer for Divio's products!

Start date: according to mutual agreement Location: Zurich - Switzerland


Divio has placed Django software in the hands of literally thousands of users across the world, through the Divio Cloud platform and the open-source django CMS. Our company offers world-class services and tools that empower agencies, enterprises and developers to build scalable and lightning fast Django deployments.

At Divio we enjoy technology and love working with Python, Django, Ansible, Docker, JavaScript, React, Bootstrap and more. We believe good products are born out of collaboration, and the passion for our work comes with the challenging goals we set for ourselves and the people we work with.

Is it your dream to work on new ideas and approaches for cloud-based services and products in a fast-paced environment? Wonderful!

Meaningful, satisfying work

You love developing websites and applications in Python/Django, and youll bring that enthusiasm to collaborate with your colleagues on our products. Working closely with our front-end developers, your challenge will be to ensure that our customers enjoy the best possible experience - and to keep making it even better. In this exciting role youll be constantly on the lookout for ways to extend, optimise and modernise the platform. Youll have the opportunity to introduce new ideas while being involved in the conception, development and maintenance of cutting-edge enhancements and new features.

As well as coding, youll also review code, support our team in achieving shared goals and together with your colleagues youll make sure our customers enjoy using our products as much as we do working with them. We follow a philosophy of active interaction with our customers and like every member of our team youll assist them with help and expertise.

If youre looking for exciting development opportunities to work on and a position that offers true responsibilities and a great team to be a part of, than Divio is the perfect place for you.
