item.title: Application Developer for innovative research organization at DataCite e.V. () (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you passionate about data sharing and moving research forward? We are looking for an application developer to join our DataCite team which currently consists of two developers, bringing a mix of skills that complement the existing team capacity. The ideal candidate has experience writing open source software and a basic understanding of scholarly communication infrastructure.


DataCite is based in Hannover, Germany, but the position is suited for remote work from other places in Germany or other countries in Europe. Travel to meet with DataCite members and other partners is expected. The position includes work for projects funded by the European Commission and other funders.


Responsibilities



  • Develop full-stack product features in an open source software environment, including user-facing front-end services

  • Test, deploy and monitor applications, and react to problems.

  • Technical support for DataCite members and third parties, including supporting technical documentation.


Required Qualifications



  • 3+ years of experience with Javascript, Ruby, Java and/or Python.

  • Hands-on experience developing, deploying and maintaining web applications, including system administration, error tracking, and support.

  • Experience with project management and open source software development practices.

  • Excellent communication skills, and the flexibility that is needed for working in a small, distributed team.

  • Strong and demonstrated interest in open science and data sharing.


Desirable Qualifications



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Experience in frontend development. Interest and/or experience with ReactJS and/or EmberJS.

  • Interest and/or experience in DevOps.

  • Interest to learn and use other languages such as Clojure or Go.


Please send a short email, stating your interest in the position, and CV with your GitHub username to Martin Fenner, DataCite Technical Director, mfenner@datacite.org. Applications will be considered beginning October 16, 2017.

item.title: Dév' Swift ou Ruby-on-Rails at Sêmeia (Paris, France)
item.description:
# Qu'est-ce que je ferai chez vous ?
Vous nous aiderez à développer toutes les briques de notre suite de programmes patients. En fonction de ce que vous maîtrisez, de ce que vous voulez apprendre et des nos priorités, vous travaillerez sur la conception logicielle et l'implémentation du code des applis et du code serveur, leurs déploiements, le choix des outils et des méthodes de travail.


Notre catalogue est en pleine phase de création, ce sera donc l'occasion, de travailler de manière globale, sur les fonctionnalités, sur son ergonomie, sur son utilisation…


# Que dois-je savoir faire pour ce poste ?
Il nous paraît important que vous connaissiez bien les architectures serveurs (les choses du genre micro-services, Docker, API client-serveur REST…), un ou des langages modernes (par exemples Swift, Ruby, Python…), les bases de données (sans toutefois être bilingue SQL, ni savoir administrer un serveur Oracle).


Idéalement, nous apprécierions si vous connaissiez le développement mobile (en particulier framework CocoaTouch), les langages Swift (spécifiquement) et JavaScript, l'administration serveur moderne (conteneurs, déploiements PaaS…), la mise en place de système d'intégration continue. L'attrait pour l'ergonomie est un plus.


Nous aimerions un développeur assez expert (au moins deux ou trois années d'expérience), spécialisé côté serveur, ne connaissant pas encore Swift, ou spécialisé côté iOS natif, mais ne connaissant pas encore le côté serveur.


# À quelles conditions travaillerais-je chez Sêmeia ?
Nous sommes prêt à payer le prix juste pour vos compétences. Votre salaire dépendra beaucoup de vos connaissances et de votre évolution. Parlons déjà de ce que vous savez faire, de ce que vous aimez faire, voyons si ça colle entre nous… on parlera salaire ensuite. Un intéressement à notre réussite est également envisageable.


Par ailleurs, nous vous proposons les avantages classiques : mutuelle santé, tickets restaurants, salle de sport. Le télétravail est une bonne chose, nous l'utilisons régulièrement, et vous le permettrons partiellement.


Mais le plus important est peut-être que vous aurez l'opportunité de créer quelque chose de vraiment utile ! Et ça, ça vaut tous les buzzwords du monde. ;-)


# Mots clés, en vrac
Santé, server side Swift, iOS natif, CocoaTouch, Ember, JavaScript, TypeScript, Ruby-on-Rails, PostgreSQL, Git, CI, Unit Tests, UI Tests…

item.title: Freelance Expert Interviewer at Karat () (allows remote)
item.description:
Interviewing is broken.  Karat professionalizes interviewing.

About Karat

Karat has reengineered technical hiring to ensure that great talent gets noticed by great companies.   We augment engineering organizations by conducting the first-rounds of technical interviews on their behalf. Our service saves material engineering time and drives a highly responsive and consistent experience for candidates.  Karat continuously invests in cutting edge interview methodologies with an aim of reducing bias and letting candidates demonstrate their true ability.

We operate as strategic partners for engineering leaders at the world's leading technology companies including Jet, MuleSoft, Roblox, Intuit, Ten-X, Minted and many more.   As the gold standard of technical interviewing, our well-funded company is scaling quickly to meet our growing list of client's needs.  Come join us!

Join our elite community of Expert Interviewers.

Karat’s Expert Interviewers are recognized and rewarded for doing a first-class job as top assessors of technical talent.  Every interviewer in the network is an accomplished engineer.  Our interviewers include development managers from big-tech companies, start-up engineers and freelancers covering the full technology stack.

Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.

As an Expert Interviewer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible---many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some experts do 10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.

item.title: Developer met gevoel voor design at Fabrique (Delft, Netherlands)
item.description:
Vernieuwen. Het verschil maken. Bij Fabrique maken we werk van betekenis. Voor onszelf, voor de klant en als het kan ook voor de maatschappij. Werk met impact noemen we dat. Wat neem jij mee om dat mogelijk te maken?

Jij
bent een developer met academisch niveau en een aantal jaar werkervaring op het gebied van webapplicaties. Jij wordt enthousiast van code die goed doordacht is en netjes in elkaar zit, maar weet de balans te vinden tussen purisme en pragmatiek. Je vindt het tijd om jezelf uit te dagen in spraakmakende en prijswinnende projecten waar je in nauwe samenwerking met onze topontwerpers prachtige resultaten neerzet. En of je nou een kei bent in frontend, of een echte backender die z’n skillset wil uitbreiden met Python en Django: leergierigheid en nieuwsgierigheid staan bij jou voorop.

Wij
geven je een plek in een omgeving vol inspiratie waar je samenwerkt met eersteklas ontwerpers en mede-ontwikkelaars aan uiteenlopende projecten voor nationale en internationale topklanten. Van goed doordachte websites (bijvoorbeeld Heijmans, Viktor&Rolf, Nemo, Fire of London), tot unieke technische oplossingen zoals de Wolfgang app, de Van Gogh multimediatour en interactives in het Nationaal Militair Museum. We bieden je een leuke werkplek, een hecht en gezellig team, en voldoende ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

item.title: PostgreSQL Database Specialist at GitLab () (allows remote)
item.description:
Our database specialist is a hybrid role: part developer, part database expert. You will spend the majority of your time making application changes to improve database performance, availability, and reliability; though you will also spend time working on the database infrastructure that powers GitLab.com. Infrastructure work involves (but is not limited to) tasks such as making configuration changes, adjusting monitoring, and upgrading the database.


Example Projects




    • Rewriting the database queries and related application logic used for retrieving subgroups.

    • Rewriting code used for importing projects from other platforms (e.g. GitHub).

    • Adding trend analysis to monitoring to better detect performance and availability changes on GitLab.com.

    • Analyzing tables and optimizing them by adding indexes, breaking them up into separate tables, or by removing unnecessary columns.

    • Reviewing database related changes submitted by other developers.

    • Documenting database best practices or patterns to avoid.



Requirements




    • At least 5 years of experience running PostgreSQL in large production environments.

    • At least 3 years of experience working with either Ruby (preferred) or Python.

    • At least 3 years of experience with Ruby on Rails, Django, or other Ruby and/or Python web frameworks (Flask, web2py, etc).

    • Solid understanding of SQL and PL/pgSQL.

    • Solid understanding of the internals of PostgreSQL.

    • Significant experience working in a distributed production environment.

    • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

    • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.



Nice-to-have's




    • Experience with running pgbouncer and/or WAL-E in production.

    • Experience with Go, C, and/or Rust.

    • MySQL experience, since GitLab also supports MySQL.

item.title: Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) at social sweethearts® GmbH (München, Germany)

item.title: Senior full stack developer at NoviCap (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
NoviCap helps small businesses make payroll by giving them a cash advance for work already performed and invoiced.


We are a meritocratic organization where ideas flow freely and are judged on merit. You can make a huge impact in any area of the organization as great ideas are adopted and applied as soon as possible.


We care about making our customers happy and build a great company together. In order to make sure we all agree on what is best for the company, we are very transparent with our numbers and regularly present board decks to the entire company. We also share meeting notes of the weekly management meeting. We have dashboards hanging in the office that display our key metrics so everybody knows how we are doing at all times.


If you want to work in an environment with zero politics and where data carries the day, then you will love this.


We apply automation as much as possible and have built a risk underwriting model using machine learning, a sophisticated pricing model, documentation verification and an automatic trading system.


Currently our efforts are focused on automating banking actions (wiring funds, reconciling funds, ...) and building out our fraud detection model.


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for great engineers who find joy in a well-designed system, clean code, lots of tests, clean git commit histories, code review, whiteboarding and shipping often.


You must have deep working knowledge of at least one modern language (ruby, python, scala, elexir,...) and knowing ruby is a big plus. Knowledge of ruby is not required as we strongly believe that great engineers can learn any language in a reasonable timeframe.


Good working knowledge of english is required.

item.title: Web Application Research Engineer at Tenable, Inc. (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Tenable is more than ‘just’ the creator of Nessus. Our security solutions - including the first cyber exposure platform for modern assets, Tenable.io - are transforming global vulnerability management. We’re a global team, powered by creative thinkers who are wired for action, focused on delivering results and collaborating to enable decisive actions to protect what matters most. We’re in this together - colleagues, customers and partner communities working as One Tenable.

Can you join Team Tenable? Yes you can - if you’re excited by the thought of working with over 800 colleagues, 23,000 customers and a range of revolutionary products that are shaping cybersecurity in 150 countries. Being valued for who you are as well as what you do, you can embrace the pace (we’re recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte and E&Y) as well as enjoy a superb rewards package (we’re seen as a Best Places to Work by Glassdoor, The Washington Post, The Baltimore Sun, The Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace). The key question is: Is This You?

Your Role:

We are looking for an engineer to join our research team. This role will be based in our brand new International HQ in Dublin. The role will involve developing scripts to detect vulnerabilities in web applications. The development will be in Nessus Attack Scripting Language (NASL) and Ruby as needed. Although experience in NASL programming is not required, experience in scripting in Ruby or Python is a must have.

Your Opportunity:



  • Develop exploits, proof-of- concepts for web application vulnerabilities

  • Develop new plugins to detect web application vulnerabilities

  • Enhance existing plugins to improve detection of web application vulnerabilities

  • Analyse vulnerabilities in web applications through dynamic and static analysis

  • Installing vulnerable/non-vulnerable versions of web applications

  • Work with customer support to resolve false positive/negative reports

  • Manage, participate in, or directly work on any additional projects, assignments, or initiatives as assigned

  • Drive innovation by coming up with new ideas for our products and processes


What you'll need:


  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or a related field

  • 3-4 years of programming experience in Ruby or Python

  • In depth understanding of web application security vulnerabilities, detection and exploitation techniques

  • Understanding of Web Services technologies such as XML, SOAP, and AJAX

  • Web Server configuration knowledge: Microsoft IIS, Apache HTTP Server, Apache Tomcat

  • Strong programming skills in Ruby or Python

  • Experience with one or more web application security assessment tools such as BurpSuite, Arachni, sqlmap, w3af, sqlninja, and others

  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills

  • Experience with pentesting web applications

  • Research and/or development experience with web application security assessment tools

  • Experience working with OWASP Top 10, CVE, and other vulnerability taxonomy/classification systems



We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineers required to work in Software Defined Networking at Arista Networks Limited (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Arista Networks is looking for great Software Engineers interested in product development in C/C++ and Go to join the team in Dublin advancing the Software Defined Networking (SDN) revolution. Arista is a profitable, publicly quoted company with 2016 revenues expected to­­­­­ exceed $1B. Arista is the number 2 vendor for data centre switches in the world with over 4000 customers including such well known names as Facebook, Netflix and Spotify.


Some recent highlights



  • In May 2016, Gartner positioned Arista in the 'Leaders' quadrant of the Magic Quadrant for Data Center Networking.

  • Arista switches powered video transmission in both the Euro 2016 football championship and the Rio Olympics.

  • Jayshree Ullal (Arista CEO) and Andy Bechtolsheim (Founder) won the 2015 Ernst and Young entrepreneur of the year in the USA.


Dublin R&D


Arista opened the Dublin R&D office in the IFSC in 2015, and has ambitious plans to continue growing the Dublin team across all areas of Software Engineering.


Some interesting projects that we're currently working on in Dublin include:



  • Writing Linux user space and kernel code to allow 32-bit drivers to DMA 64-bit virtual memory spaces using both Intel and AMD IOMMU controller.

  • Accessing ASIC registers over SPI bus, SMbus, PCIe and I2C, to implement high resolution timers (sub-100ns accuracy) and read ASIC hardware specifications to gather near-real-time information on large numbers of packet flows and to generate network congestion statistics.

  • Development of configuration management services using Go and Python to support YANG, OpenConfig, NETCONF and RESTCONF over gRPC, ssh and ssl for standardised switch configuration, combined with tools such as git, gerrit, Jenkins, Slack and Trello.

  • Creating a streaming telemetry service for networking devices that will send real-time state updates from the switch to cloud-based data ingestion infrastructure. We work in Go creating gRPC and REST based services. We use modern development tools such as git, gerrit, Jenkins, Trello and we deploy our backend in a cluster using Kubernetes and docker containers.

  • Development of routing protocol agents (for BGP, OSPF, ISIS) in C/C++ within a Fedora Linux embedded environment. Coding of fault-tolerant, concurrent agents capable of handling the demands of future data centres where high performance and high availability are basic requirements. Fully automated, developer owned, Python based, continuous test harness with 100s of devices under test at any one moment.


Engineering Driven


One of the many attractions of joining Arista is that from the top Arista is an engineering company. The founders and engineering managers are all engineers who understand good software engineering and the importance of doing things right.


Arista hires directly into the broader team, regardless of geography. The languages we program in are primarily C, C++, python and Go, but if you aren’t an expert in any of these don’t let that stop you from speaking with us.


Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers who are in charge of delivering features from concept through to completion. We put a premium on building and using test automation tools.


No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. If you have opinions on emacs vs vi, delve vs gdb, keyboard vs mouse, then you will find many like-minded developers at Arista.


Arista is headquartered in Santa Clara, California and has development offices in the US, Canada, India and Ireland. Arista treats all R&D centres on par with each other.



  • Arista is a software company with a unique culture building data centre switches done right.

  • Arista is hiring software developers to build products that will drive the networks of the future.

  • Arista is looking for developers who primarily enjoy writing code, solving problems and who appreciate a culture of invention, quality, respect and fun.

item.title: Full-Stack Web Developer at Mintel Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a Web Developers with at least 3 years of commercial experience who have strong experience with JavaScript and are comfortable with front end frameworks as well as server-side web frameworks.  Our teams are adding functionality across several products, improving the tools our researchers and analysts use every day and building client delivery sites that showcase our research findings and data via compelling visualisations and intuitive interfaces.  If your skills and experience will help us to deliver these improvements effectively, we want to talk to you!


In this role:



  • Work with your development team to implement technical solutions to solve key business problems.

  • Use your experience to suggest alternatives or to evaluate options we have to build really effective, flexible and easy to maintain front end solutions.

  • Work with your development team and our Design and UX colleagues to help us deliver improved client experience of our products.

  • Ensure that our front end development practices on your team are progressing, such as improving Javascript testing or helping our teams implement effective front end components.

  • Help to improve coding standards and team knowledge via your expert input.

  • You’ll be expected to contribute to cross team discussions, as our developers help us to evolve our technical direction and best practices.


Primary Technologies Used:



  • Languages: ES6 JavaScript, Python, Java, C++, .NET

  • Web frontend technologies: React.js, Backbone.js, Bootstrap, SCSS, Selenium, webpack

  • Web backend frameworks: Django, Alfresco

  • Databases: MariaDB/MySQL, Postgres

  • Search technologies: Solr, ElasticSearch

  • Servers: Mixture of our own hosted network and cloud services on AWS



During our interview process we’ll want to see that you have extensive experience working with web front end technologies and a good working knowledge with a server-side web framework.  Our scrum teams look after front and back end components of their products - we’re expecting that from time to time you’ll be able to assist with cases that are outside of your specialism.


Requirements:



  • Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics degree or equivalent experience coupled with a proven ability to solve problems with code.

  • 3+ years of experience of software development.

  • Track record of building highly interactive web tools using modern Javascript frameworks such as React, Angular, Ember or Backbone.

  • Working knowledge of server-side web frameworks such as Django, Flask or Ruby on Rails

  • Knowledge of data visualisation approaches and technologies.

  • Some experience in following backend technologies would be beneficial:  MySQL, PostgreSQL, Solr, ElasticSearch

  • Experience working with your colleagues to integrate best practices into front end build or continuous integration pipelines.

  • Excellent communication skills, and a desire to work in a highly collaborative environment and participate fully in agile software development processes.

  • A history of working effectively with design and UX professionals.


Why join Mintel? We are the world's leading market intelligence agency and technology underpins our success. We help our clients understand consumers and consumer markets and aspire to provide the market intelligence behind every great business decision. Our technology supports research, analysis, and operations work of Mintel staff and help us deliver data, insight and opinion in a compelling way to our clients across the globe.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer-Full Stack Web Development. Improve Lives through Learning at Udemy (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
ABOUT UDEMY for BUSINESS Udemy for Business consumerizes the learning experience at work through an engaging and intuitive interface, that is integrated with Udemy's core marketplace. Built for businesses striving to be at the forefront of innovation, Udemy for Business offers fresh, relevant on-demand learning. Employees can access over 2000+ high-quality courses taught by the world’s leading experts on a variety of key topics ranging from development and IT to leadership, design and stress management. In addition to its curated content collection, organizations can also securely host and distribute their own proprietary content. Leading organizations including PayPal, Lyft, Booking.com, Capgemini, ON24, and Century 21 choose Udemy for Business to upskill their workforce and drive learning forward.


JOB DESCRIPTION: The Udemy for Business team is growing and scaling quickly, having doubled in size last year and expecting to do the same this year.  We are looking for a senior engineer to help us build the best workplace learning experience in the industry.

item.title: Software Engineer - Security at Yelp (London, UK)
item.description:
Yelp is looking for security engineers to keep us safe and sane as we build out our desktop, mobile, business owner, and administrative websites. It's an opportunity to have tremendous impact and broad scope protecting Yelp's data, our employees, and our millions of users. Additionally, Yelp’s future growth in the transactions space has many security implications, both in traditional application security as well as in privacy controls and fraud and risk analysis. 

As a Security software engineer, you'll be responsible for partnering with different engineering teams at Yelp to help build features, tools, and libraries to enable security by default. You’ll also work to identify and fix vulnerabilities in the products we build, as well as work with external security researchers through our public bug bounty program.


What You Will Do:



  • Develop and deploy authentication and security-related components of Yelp’s website and mobile apps

  • Develop libraries used across multiple Yelp apps for secure communication and data storage

  • Pair with mobile, frontend, and backend teams to architect and develop features in a secure and scalable manner

  • Validate and remediate vulnerabilities reported in our bug bounty


What We Are Looking For:



  • While previous application security experience is a plus, we're looking for strong software generalists first, with an interest in application security

  • Understanding of HTML5, current, and emerging browser security models

  • Understanding of PKI and key management

  • 3-5 years of software engineering experience

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or Engineering

  • Experience with languages like Python, Java, Javascript, Puppet, Objective-C, or Swift


Pluses:



  • Experience with AWS and SoA

  • Experience with securing iOS and Android applications

  • Security research or pen testing experience


What We Offer:



  • Private health insurance

  • Monthly fitness/gym subsidy

  • Income protection, disability, and life insurance

  • Generous paid maternity and paternity leave

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Fully adjustable sit/standing desks

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Central London location, close to public transport and restaurants

  • Quarterly team offsites

item.title: Software Development Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
From a technology perspective, we have thousands of devices with our own firmware installed in our customers’ stores around the world and an advanced server infrastructure to manage these devices and process the terabytes of data that they are producing with Machine Learning algorithms. You will have a great opportunity for growing personally and professionally – while having lots of fun along the way.


Join our team as a Software Development Intern!


What we do all day


We build most of our applications using Ruby on Rails because we love it. We experiment and try out new things a lot so we are looking for developers who not only like to build new prototypes or minimum viable products and like to be creative, but also have great ideas and enjoy trying them out. We also built our main data processing architecture with Python because we love it. This architecture has been made to scale horizontally and with no single point of failure. We are processing multiple gigabytes of data per hour using different machine learning algorithms.


Any interest in data analysis or competence in data science would definitely be a plus.



How we work:



  • To be innovative and fast we organise our work using scrum and 1-week sprints.

  • To be as efficient as possible, we reduce the time spent in meetings to the minimum.

  • We love to test and we test all our code – we hope you like it too.

  • We like to do pair programming and code review sessions.



Where we work:



  • We have a new office next to Checkpoint Charlie. It is spacious and cozy.

  • There is everything you need to work in a great environment.

  • We have food, fruits, coffee, tea, soda and also a couch with a big TV and a Wii U for the occasional Mario Kart race.


Skills & Requirements


Required skills



  • Some coding experience (in any language)


Appreciated skills



  • Experience with Python

  • Experience with Ruby on Rails

  • Interest or experience with data science and analysis


Why there are just a few required skills


We believe that being a good developer is not so much a question of skills, but more a question of mindset. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a perfect fit. You will learn with us what is missing.

item.title: Software Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Advidi is currently looking for an experienced  medior/senior Software Engineer to work within our Development team in Amsterdam.


The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic. It is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero downtime and minimal response times are critical. The business has a lot of ambition across a wide range of facets, so there will be lots of variety as well as hard work.


As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products and for extending and maintaining our SOA. We are looking for people who love clean code, work in a test-driven manner, like to work on projects that add value to business and enjoy working within an inspirational environment.


Development is done in Ruby using several cutting-edge technologies, open source products, and standards.


Qualifications


Personal




    Excellent problem solving and analytical skills




    A real team player, willing to actively contribute to a good and productive team atmosphere




    Effective communication skills, both verbal and written; fluency in English is essential




    Strong drive to improve his/her own skills, with a love for engineering




Education and experience




    Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering / Computer Science or equivalent




    Minimum of 3 years of relevant industry experience




Specific technical skills




    Excellent programming skills in an OO language (preferably Ruby and/or Python)




    Strong experience with system architecture design and integration (backend)




    Strong experience with Relational and NoSQL databases (Mysql/PostgreSQL, Redis, etc)




    Version control (Git & Github), continuous integration (Travis), Monitoring (DataDog, NewRelic)




    Experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS)




    Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)




    Experience with Unix system administration, shell scripts




Bonus skills




    Big Data experience (BigQuery, DataFlow, DataLab)




    DevOps experience (Ansible, Kubernetes)




    Front-end experience




Benefits




    Promising bonus plan based on company profit and personal development plan




    Education budget per team member to attend conferences and workshops




    Possibility to work out during office hours




    Daily gourmet lunches prepared by our in-house Chef




    Inspiring new office near Amsterdam Westerpark




    Awesome trimester company events and Fancy Friday parties




    Free Dutch language classes and gym subscription discount





Note: While it’s not a requirement, we’d also love to see a link to your Github account, links to your blogs, and details of any Open Source contributions or other projects.

item.title: Django Engineer (m/f) for Germany's leading local marketing platform at RegioHelden GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Heroic deeds, tasks & responsibilities



  • As an engineering hero you will participate in all phases of the software development cycle from product definition and design through implementation, documentation and training

  • Continuously develop our intranet and workflow management system

  • Develop and improve our tools for business process automation and workflow optimization

  • Train employees on internal tools and systems

  • Develop superhero gadgets to supercharge our products

  • Be involved in technical decisions


Skills & Requirements



  • Relevant professional experience in Python and Django

  • Experience with relational databases and the usual web development technologies

  • Experience with Celery, RabbitMQ, Sentry and Jenkins a plus

  • Experience with Google AdWords or other Google APIs a plus

  • Experience building (fully functional) time machines will already have you hired yesterday

  • Heroic properties: integrity, engagement, fun at work and the desire to work together to achieve awesome things!


Heroic Benefits



  • Flat hierarchy and independent work

  • Personal and professional development in a dynamic team

  • Visit conferences (e.g. DjangoCon, PyCon, etc.) to enhance and deepen expert knowledge

  • Major contribution to the successful corporate development

  • Exceptional offices (e.g. free drinks, breakfast, football table, darts, etc.) and regular team events

  • Support moving to Germany and getting you started in your new life (e.g. work permit, bank account, apartment, etc.)


Apply now!


Exactly your kind of thing? Start your cover letter with the sentence “I am your new Django Hero, because…”. Send your cover letter, CV, salary requirements (EUR), as well as your date of entry with our online application form.


HR-Hero: Tanja
Any questions? For further informations please call
+49 711 128 501-888

item.title: Software Engineer (Unix/C++) at PPRO Group (München, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for top-notch Software Engineers to join our team in Munich


Your responsibilities:

We offer:

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (Backend) at Holvi (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Holvi is banking for Makers and Doers - a business account built by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs. We are building financial technology that has a purpose and makes a difference in the day-to-day life of European business owners.


We are looking for an experienced Backend / Data Engineer to join our Data team. You will be working closely with a small team of data and analytics experts. We offer you a positive, dynamic atmosphere full of can-do attitude. We work on a fully in-house built software stack, and are a small team where everyone contributes and has a real impact!





You



  • Are experienced in Python/Django, PostgreSQL, Git, Unit testing, Debian GNU/Linux

  • Are business-minded and geared towards results and know when something is good enough

  • Are a team player who has the ability and experience to work in a multicultural virtual team setting

  • Have excellent collaboration and communication skills, both verbal and written, in English



  • Would be a plus:

    • Background in dimensional modeling, R, AWS Redshift, ETL concepts / tools

    • Experience with BI and data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, ReDash)




Your role and responsibilities



  • Modeling events as database tables based on business requirements

  • Building and improving data warehouse infrastructure

  • Integrate data sources with various BI tools / marketing platforms


Things to love about being a developer at Holvi



  • We are not an old fashioned bank but a modern technology company. Our code runs on Python and our developers get to influence everything we develop. As simple as that, no legacy systems to maintain.

  • We are a product company with solid funding and a clear long term vision

  • Working in a small team means you have both responsibility and ownership of the end result our team produces. At the core of all our product development is solving real problems for our customers and making their lives easier.

  • With great responsibility comes freedom. Expect no pre set rules for doing your job but be prepared to challenge the existing and creating new solutions from scratch.

  • Our developers are known for making the impossible possible. Our culture is built on respect and low hierarchy. We have a holistic view on development where all our developers play a crucial role in decision making.

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend at 21 Buttons (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Although our focus is fashion, 21 Buttons is an engineering company. We are looking for talented people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of the technology's greatest challenges and make an impact.


Our Engineering & Technology team kick-ass in the development of an innovative product that will be used by (hope!) billions of users. 


If you’re a curious and collaborative visionary, someone excited about tackling the hard problems in technology, this is the place to be! 


With your technical expertise, you'll manage individual projects priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You'll design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the software in a microservices architecture.

  • Ensure robustness, performance and failure-proof characteristics of the system.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.


Requirements


Minimum qualifications:



  • BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.

  • Experience as a backend developer, some of it working in Python - at least 3 years.

  • Experience with REST Framework.

  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English


Preferred qualifications:



  • Master’s, further education or experience in engineering, computer science or other technical related fields.

  • Experience with one or more of these technologies: Relational Databases (PostgreSQL in particular), Django, Redis, ElasticSearch, Async Frameworks (aiohttp, tornado…), Amazon Web Services.

item.title: Project Management Engineer - European timezone at Platform.sh () (allows remote)
item.description:
Job description:


Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program). To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our engineering team with an engineer that also enjoys project management. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you


For its groundbreaking PaaS solution https://platform.sh is looking for a Project Manager with a taste for Go, good Linux system understanding, and a real hunger for the challenges of building robust, distributed systems.


Platform.sh is a PaaS shrouded in a lot of black magic (we can consistently clone a whole running cluster, with its state, databases, indexes in a matter of seconds). We want to get this down to the hundreds of milliseconds domain. Interested? There is more...


Our external API is pure Hypermedia REST + oAuth on top of Pyramid. It mechanizes the Git layer and needs more features.


We can consistently generate from the same manifest a Docker container, an LXC one, or VM disk images (AWS, Azure, OpenStack), we want more targets.


We probably have the highest industry container density. We need to get it higher.


We support any Python, Ruby, NodeJS or PHP application, it’s time to roll-out Java and .NET, and Elixir, of course Elixir.


We need to have more auto-healing on the high-availability clusters. We need more performance out of our multi-protocol ssh proxy. We need work on our Ceph Implementation; We need to get the Debian package generation streamlined and faster. We need… great ideas on how to make Platform.sh even better. Interested? Join us!


Mission :


Directly reporting to our VP of Engineering, your roles will include:



  • Engineering teams coordination for the flawless execution of ambitious, time constrained development projects



  • Work with CPO and CTO to ensure alignment between roadmap goals and short-term goals. Communication with all company stakeholders to give an incredibly clear project of both  advancement and roadblocks



  • Backlog grooming. Making it pretty. Actionable. Sublime



  • Sprint planning, estimation, critical path analysis



  • Knowing all the things ; where each skeleton is buried



  • Making projects delivery predictable. Measurable. Finding impediments and helping remove them



  • Managing with brio changes to backlog. Informing stakeholders when an injected task will cause some other story to be rejected from current sprint or be late



  • Project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility



  • Review resource availability and allocation



  • Tooling around project plan and progress tracking



  • Reporting and escalation when necessary



  • Quality management. Managing the “Definition of Done” hand in hand with QA



  • Delivery management (release planning, QA follow-up) coordination with the Partner Delivery Manager


Must have :


The ideal candidate:



  • Is a true software engineer with enough low level chops. They know their system. Uses Linux. Codes. This is not a job for anyone who does not like coding. It is not a coding job. But extreme empathy with developers is absolutely required. So the candidate should be one



  • Is focused. Organized. Mature. Handles pressure. Handles multi-tasking. (Don’t worry we are nice and try to make a really nice stress-free working environment. But when the PM is panicky... well this is when stress-free disappears: PM should be the rock)



  • Has proven successful experience in project management



  • Has comprehensive knowledge of agile development. They know they Kanban from their Scrum. Know thy artifacts PM



  • Has had exposure to cloud services (AWS, Azure etc..)



  • Understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works, and the constraints of a distributed system



  • Is proficient in at least one modern programming language (and proficient in troll deflection about what “modern programming languages” are and are not)


Nice to have :



  • Knowledge of some PHP stuff. Magento, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3. No expertise required



  • Mad Jira skillz



  • Public speaking experience



  • Proficiency in Rust or Ponylang grants you bonus points

item.title: HPC System Specialist at EPFL - Blue Brain Project (Genève, Suisse)
item.description:
The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration.


For our Computing section, we are currently seeking to fill the following position:


System Engineer – HPC


Major duties and responsibilities:



  • Configuration, installation and maintenance of HPC system stacks (operating system, network, software)

  • Ownership and maintenance of HPC scheduling software (eg: Slurm) across heterogeneous clusters/environments

  • Contribution to HPC user support

  • Liaison with 3rd party support vendors

  • Participation in the building and delivery of HPC infrastructure components and IT services


Essential skills and experience required:



  • Experience with operating and supporting large scale HPC clusters

  • Experience with InfiniBand, Omnipath, 40/10GbE fabrics

  • Experience working with core network infrastructure (Cisco Nexus/Catalyst)

  • Experience in administrating, optimizing and troubleshooting parallel file systems (eg: GPFS)

  • Track record of operating production services in a dynamic environment


Preferred:



  • Experience with configuration management tools (eg: puppet, ansible)

  • Exposure to cloud computing infrastructure

  • Proficient in scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby, Perl, shell)


Profile:



  • Bachelor or Master degree in computer science or similar

  • Experience working in a collaborative and multi-cultural environment

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, written and oral

  • Fast learner, eager to expand his/her domains of expertise

  • Proven ability to work both independently and in team-based environments

  • Fluent communication in English (written and spoken)


The Blue Brain Project is:



  • A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience.

  • A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community

  • A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron


Start date: August 2017, or negociable;


Activity rate: 100%;


Deadline for application : until position is filled


Duration of contract: 1 year


Applicants should submit a cover letter and a detailed CV in PDF format only, with file name “Surname_position _Cover Letter” and “Surname_positon _CV” electronically to jobs.bbp @epfl.ch


Please use the reference of the position title in the “object” field.

item.title: Gesamtsystemarchitekt (w/m) at HUK-COBURG Versicherungsgruppe (Coburg, Deutschland) (allows remote)
item.description:
Wo sorge ich auch bei enormer Komplexität für Durchblick?


Gesamtsystemarchitekt (w/m)


Wir suchen die besten Mitarbeiter (w/m) von morgen für unsere Abteilung Informatik Betrieb in Coburg.


Schon die Baumeister der Antike bauten Leuchttürme, um für den richtigen Überblick zu sorgen. Und auch in der modernen IT sind Architecten wie Sie gefragt, die das gesamte System im Blick behalten. System für System und Plattform auf Plattform bauen Sie unseren IT-Leuchtturm, von dem aus jeder Datenstrom verlustfrei in den richtigen Kanal gelenkt wird. Dazu analysieren, koordinieren und gestalten Sie mit Weitblick, verfolgen und bewerten neue Technologietrends und integrieren diese, falls sinnvoll, in die bestehende Architektur. Als zentraler Ansprechpartner (m/w) der Abteilung binden Sie die Systemarchitekten in Ihre Konzepte ein und dank Ihrer umfangreichen Berufs­er­fahrung gelingt es Ihnen, komplexe Anforderungen in Modelle zu übersetzen und Kollegen sowie Dienstleister davon zu überzeugen. In einem Team, das damit erfolgreich ist, Daten stabil und sicher verfügbar zu machen. Und in einer Stadt, die über die passenden Systemkomponenten verfügt, mit denen Sie auch an Ihrer eigenen Zukunft weiterbauen können.


Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie bei der HUK-COBURG:



  • Aufbau einer übergreifenden Gesamt­systemarchitektur, z. B. für: Netzwerk, Hardware, Betriebssystem, Middleware, Storage, User-Verwaltung, SAP-Basis, Kommunikation, IT-Sicherheit

  • Analyse und Bewertung neuer Technologie­themen sowie Koordination der Einführung, inkl. Erstellung der Architekturkonzepte

  • Fachliche Koordination der System­architekten und fachliche Abstimmung sämtlicher Architekturthemen

  • Übergreifende Koordination der Ent­wick­lung, Ausgestaltung und Aktualisierung des technologischen Architektur-Modells (Infrastrukturbereitstellung und IT-Betrieb)

  • Überprüfung und Freigabe der Architektur­konformität bei techno­logie­übergreifenden Anforderungen


Das bringen Sie mit:



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik bzw. eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs verbunden mit mehrjähriger Erfahrung in komplexen IT-Umfeldern

  • Fundiertes Know-how in etablierten Betriebssystemen (IBM z/OS, IBM AIX, Linux, Windows), Netzwerk- und Storage- Konzepten, Datenbanken (DB2, Oracle, MS SQL) sowie in neuen Technologien und Trends im IT-Umfeld (z. B. Big Data, Open Stack)

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Design und Doku­mentation komplexer System­architekturen

  • Umfangreiche Kenntnisse in der Organisation, Prozessgestaltung, Projektarbeit und in der Führung von Mitarbeitern

  • Betriebswirtschaftliches Gespür für Fragen der Wirtschaftlichkeit sowie erste Erfahrung in der Planung, Steuerung und im Controlling

  • Ausgeprägtes Argumentations- und Verhandlungsgeschick verbunden mit hoher kommunikativer Kompetenz und sicherem Auftreten


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?


Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt!


Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen gerne Herr Patrick Paul
unter der Telefonnummer 09561 96-13243 zur Verfügung.

item.title: Internal IT Engineer / Internal IT Administrator (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Develop the future of journalism with us!


We are CeleraOne: A team of highly motivated software developers, architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms and signal processing to compiler technology and theoretical mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve the technology behind CeleraOne’s paywalls, real-time analytics and machine learning models to support newspaper publishers in Europe like Axel Springer or NZZ Mediengruppe.

  • Automation, monitoring and maintenance of internal hardware and services like Jira, LDAP, Jenkins, Gitlab, OpenNebula, etc.

  • Technical support for onboarding of new employees

  • Responsible for incident, problem, and change management for internal systems

  • Maintaining backups of the internal IT


Who we’re looking for



  • At least two years experience with production systems running Linux

  • Experience with common internet protocols

  • Experience with automation and/or configuration management tools like Ansible, Salt, Puppet or Chef

  • Experience with installation and usage of monitoring tools (elastic stack, Icinga/Nagios, Ganglia)

  • Good command of English (fluent in written and spoken)


Why join us?



  • Professional and friendly international team

  • Full transparency of the company's strategy

  • Modern technology stack

  • Central location in Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

  • High-level trainings and language classes

  • Free public transport ticket

  • Free coffee, fruits, soft drinks, beer, etc.

  • Team events and BBQs


We’re growing and looking for support!


Do you want to grow with us? Please send your application in German or English, including your résumé or CV, certificates, salary expectations and availability.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at arago GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
arago


We Give Time Back to People


We believe people should have more time


In everyday life people waste time on tasks that do not contribute to a sustainable, productive future. People focus on working like robots and not making use of their primary strengths. These strengths are creativity, curiosity and passion to improve. We want to give people the means to make more effective use of their time, to be valued not by time spent but by contribution made, and to be free in exploring their potential.


In a world where technology drives exponential growth and disruption the established economy is trying to catch up with high-tech companies. Due to organically grown, heterogeneous environments the operating cost of these companies puts them at an even bigger disadvantage, because they simply can never spend as much on the future as the high-tech folks can. This is where we give time back to companies. We drastically reduce the time required in their technology operations and give them the weapon needed to compete in tomorrow’s markets: the time of the technology experts they have.


Your role



  • Enable developers to package product components

  • Own the technical product pipeline from A to Z

  • Continuously learn new technology

  • Use cutting edge technologies and methods to improve the component delivery pipeline

  • Be part of a team that develops one of the most scalable data platforms in the universe

  • Contribute ideas to implementing an operating system around data

  • Include analytics used e.g. for monetization into the platform’s functionality

  • Ensure robustness, security and enterprise compatibility of the cutting edge Solutions


What we expect



  • Strong hands-on mentality

  • Tendency to finish things

  • Strong Linux and Linux Environment knowledge

  • Robust knowledge about network, newsql and distributed system

  • Passion and engagement in constantly making things better

  • Degree or extensive experience in Computer Science or related area

  • Extended programming experience with languages like Python, Ruby, Shell, …

  • Experience in software testing tools (Frontend, Backend, Integration, Regression, Performance)

  • Ability to document your designs, architectures and code

  • Experience with agile development

  • Excellent team working skills


What we offer you



  • Our company focuses on building revolutionary smart systems

  • A purpose worth getting up for in the morning: We want to give time back to people!

  • A unique company culture built to give unique people an environment where they thrive in autonomy, mastery and find their purpose

  • Educational opportunities - including conferences, training and events

  • Working in a creative team with a start-up mentality where you WILL play a big role in building the company, your ideas will be welcome and we have an open door policy so you can discuss anything on your mind anytime

  • We have a truly international work environment with over 10 different nationalities already on-board

  • We offer many perks. An all-inclusive breakfast and lunch served in our own company lounge is just one example

  • We do believe in people staying with us, this is why we include complimentary retirement insurance

  • We run our own education, communication and fun event series - internally and with high-tech partners

  • And by the way, did we mention… we don’t tolerate assholes;)


Your contact person is:


Silvia Steinmüller


p:+49 (0)69 40568 210

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at Secret Sauce Partners (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
As a Senior Data Engineer you are responsible for developing the jobs we use to integrate and process large datasets for our products. Our products, powered by data science, are integrated into the largest online stores in the US and Europe and provide shopping experiences that revolutionize ecommerce. You will be directly responsible for developing and maintaining the data infrastructure that powers our products.


Hadoop and Spark are at the front and center of our data infrastructure. If you do not have much experience with Hadoop, this is an opportunity for you to receive training and learn about the big data technology ecosystem surrounding Hadoop.


This is an opportunity for you to directly impact our 50+ million users and to ensure their happiness. If you are passionate about working with data, big and small, this is your opportunity.


Responsibilities



  • Analyze and verify that newly acquired datasets follow our specifications

  • Identify and investigate data quality issues

  • Write code that processes large datasets

  • Perform code reviews


Requirements


We are looking for smart people who are hungry to tackle massive challenges. If the responsibilities are attractive to you and you would like to test your capabilities in a dynamic, unstructured, fast paced environment, we would love to talk to you.


Technology Stack


We believe in using the right tool for the right job instead of a particular set of technologies. Experience with our current stack is useful, but not required.



  • Frontend: ES6, AngularJS, React/Flux

  • Backend: Java 8 (Dropwizard, Spark), Go

  • Admin: Ruby/Rails (sidekiq), PostgreSQL

  • Data: Python (Airflow, Spark), Redshift

  • DevOps: AWS, GitHub, Circle CI, HipChat, Sentry, New Relic, Docker, Packer, Terraform, Ansible

  • QA: BrowserStack, JIRA, Java (Selenium)


Benefits


Be part of a successful startup with phenomenal growth opportunities
Casual, fun, international team
Competitive compensation package, flexible vacation days
Stock options
Cool downtown office with games, beer, wine and more

item.title: Full Stack Developer (based in Europe, 100% remote) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently onlyseeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 329,000users from 190 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


 What skills are we looking for?


As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.


Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.


Skills & Requirements



  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high levels of traffic

  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python

  • Experience using jQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services a plus

  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium

  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or Git

  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party

item.title: Softwareentwickler (m/w) at Paessler AG (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Wir verwenden eine Vielzahl von Programmiersprachen, Schwerpunkte sind Delphi, Go, C++ und Python

  • Seit über 20 Jahren entwickeln und pflegen wir unsere Software PRTG Network Monitor, die von 200.000 Kunden weltweit zur Überwachung von Netzen und Servern verwendet wird

  • Unser Technology Stack ist umfangreich: Cloud, Lambda, Windows, Linux, OSX, iOS, Android

  • Weboberfläche sowie Client- und mobile Apps binden wir über Microservices ein

  • Die webbasierte Oberfläche unserer Software verwendet Javascript mit AJAX-Frameworks

  • In crossfunktionalen Teams lassen wir viel Entscheidungsspielraum für den Einzelnen

  • Unseren Entwicklungsprozess verbessern wir in regelmäßigen Retrospektiven

  • Wir leben unsere Leidenschaft für die Softwareentwicklung


Skills & Requirements



  • Du fühlst Dich im Frontend und/oder im Backend wohl

  • Du hast massiv viel Erfahrung, erste Berufspraxis oder bist ein engagierter Einsteiger

  • Du liebst es, anspruchsvolle Aufgaben gemeinsam mit einem erfahrenen und agilen Team zu lösen

  • Du setzt nicht einfach Kundenwünsche um, sondern hast eigene Ideen, um unser Produkt noch besser zu machen

  • Du bist mit einem Code ohne ausreichende Testabdeckung nicht zufrieden

  • Du überzeugst in konstruktiven Code Reviews

  • Du fühlst dich durch moderne Tools und "bleeding edge"-Technologien herausgefordert

item.title: Software Developer - Help us see into the future! at YouGov () (allows remote)
item.description:
You will take ownership and responsibility for IT development projects, while working in a fast paced and agile environment. Working as part of a wider development team, you’ll interact with the remote global teams along with product departments within our offices across the world.


Day to day you will provide new features to YouGov’s survey systems, collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to determine needs and plan projects, optimize features for speed, clarity and robustness, expand test coverage and troubleshoot as and when needed. You will also have an inquisitive and innovative style to ensure that you are constantly thinking of ways to challenge our current ways of working and come up with new developments and ideas.


What we expect?


You’ll already be a highly skilled professional software developer with expert knowledge (and extensive experience) with Python (2 and 3). Your tech skills will be second to none and ideally you will be used to working with MongoDB, PostgreSQL and RESTful APIs. If you’ve got some experience with HTML, javascript and CSS, this would be a great help also, along with being well versed in version control and Linux. Above all, you will be dedicated to robust test driven development and have the ability to take a project through to final completion.


What we offer



  • Exciting technology stack

  • Ability to focus and develop the skills you enjoy best

  • Global reach of your work (quick release cycle)

  • Stable employment at a global company, with a start up atmosphere

  • Fresh fruit, coffee

  • Great equipment, screen, office – we want you to be happy!


Last things?


This is a full time remote working role and can be based in remote location throughout Europe. If you prefer to be office based, this can also be arranged.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Squla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Does the idea of making the world a better place appeal to you?


More specifically, do you find it fascinating and fun to build a web platform for educational games where hundreds of thousands of children, parents and teachers will interact? In different countries, with different content, and in different languages!


Still reading? Good, let’s dive into more details.



Your role:
In this role you will get the opportunity to work within a team of great developers who build the Squla platform. This platform includes educational missions and quizzes for our students, features for teachers and parents who can follow the progress of the students and send motivational messages, and a shop for parents.
 


Your typical day at work will involve:



  • building end-to-end features that contribute to both the growth of the Squla brand internationally, and the engagement of our target groups;

  • testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live;

  • working across the different projects we have, in Python, Html5, WordPress (PHP), Java.

  • planning and estimating your work;

  • trouble-shooting live issues that could be functional bugs or performance bottlenecks.

item.title: Engineering Manager, Shipping 80+ times a day! at Intercom (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
The way businesses talk to people online is broken. Intercom is fixing it.


Intercom is the first to bring sales, marketing & customer service products to one messaging platform, helping businesses avoid the stiff, spammy status quo and have real conversations with the people that matter. Designed to feel like the messaging apps you use every day, Intercom is the only business messenger to let you talk to consumers just about anywhere: inside your app, on your website, across social media and via email.


Intercom invented in-app messaging in 2011, and today more than 20,000 businesses use Intercom to reach a billion people around the world. Intercom has 400+ employees across San Francisco (HQ), Dublin (R&D), London (R&D), Chicago (Support) and has raised $116M in venture funding.


What's the opportunity?


Intercom is growing fast. We’ve created an environment where product teams, with big ambitions, can ship high-quality product to our customers every week. Across a team of more than 60 engineers, we ship changes to production around 100 times each weekday. Our mission is to make web and mobile business personal. Come help us build a world-changing product, a long-lasting company and the most effective R&D team possible.


We’re particularly focused on building an organisation where people thrive, grow in their careers, and enjoy having high impact through their work. We’re looking for experienced engineering managers to help us grow our capabilities and capacity.


The Intercom platform comprises of several different and connected products. Each product is designed and developed — through invention and iteration — by a single team. As an engineering manager, you’ll partner with a product manager to define a product vision, strategy and roadmap.


You’ll be expected to own your space: work with all disciplines on your team to build, launch and iterate. Talk directly with your customers, take part in usability studies, work with data analysts and researchers to ask the right questions and make good use of the answers.


This is an incredibly rare opportunity to join a company that’s still small but on its way to something much bigger, with a meaningful transformative mission. You’ll work directly with a product, design, and engineering team who’ve worked in places such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, Apple and Zendesk. And best of all, be early enough to hold a leadership position where you have a high impact role in our success over the coming years.


This role is based in our city centre office on St. Stephen’s Green, in Dublin, Ireland. Our entire R&D team is based here. You'll report directly to one of our directors of engineering.


What will I be doing?



  • Collaboratively set a product and technical direction with your team.

  • Support an ambitious group of engineers in their career goals. Work with our people ops team to maintain our high performance and high morale.

  • Be actively involved in hiring and growing our engineering team.

  • Care about agility as much you care about scalability and availability. Continuous deployment keeps us focused on incremental releases. Even our biggest technical achievements roll out piece by piece, feature flagged out of sight. Projects are kept short and tightly scoped. Teams build a weekly cadene of releases.

  • Drive, create and improve operational excellence, quality, security and privacy initiatives within your team and the entire engineering organization.

  • Help us evolve our culture.


What skills do I need?


Management experience is a requirement. New managers are grown through our engineering team, so external hires must have hands-on experience of people management.


If you want to take your career in a management direction but haven’t had the opportunity yet, we’d strongly encourage you to apply for our product engineering role. Career progression is important to us and if management is the path you’d like to take we can help you get there.


You also need to have deep knowledge of a high-level programming language (for example, Ruby, Python, Perl etc.) but it doesn’t need to be a language that we use here! Great people are effective and learn what we use quickly (or introduce us to better ways of working). Our ideal is for every team to be comfortable working across the full stack, delivering new features and capabilities from start to finish.



  • The core Intercom product is a Ruby on Rails application with an Ember.js frontend. We use MySQL and MongoDB for most of our storage, though we’re starting to migrate to other services like Amazon’s DynamoDB.

  • We’re actively moving to a service-oriented architecture, with new components built using the most appropriate technology. So far that’s largely been in Java on Dropwizard, and recently using Go.

  • Our infrastructure runs entirely within Amazon Web Services and we make use of many of their services (DynamoDB, SQS, etc.) We like to buy the best tools and services where available but will build our own when we need to -- we use an in-house continuous deployment service and built our own lightweight project management tooling.

  • Our iOS application and SDK are developed in Objective-C, while our Android application and SDK are Java. The web integration our customers use is built on React. We have API and integration clients for Ruby, Java and PHP with Go and Node.js coming soon (Python and Perl are community supported at the moment).


You will need to be hands-on technically, comfortable reviewing and writing code. We don’t need you to be the strongest or most productive engineer on the team but your on-boarding will involve at least a month working as an engineer on one of our products. We believe this is the best way to get context and build trust before directly managing.


Benefits


We are a well treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)



  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity in a fast-growing start-up

  • We serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner every weekday! There are also snacks and drinks on tap to keep you topped up

  • Regular compensation reviews - we reward great work!

  • Peace of mind with life assurance, as well as comprehensive health and dental insurance for you and your dependents

  • Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need to

  • Paid parental leave to let you spend valuable time with your loved ones

  • Commuting is a breeze with our generous public transport allowance

  • Keep active with our roaming FlyeFit gyms in Dublin membership!

  • If you’re cycling, we’ve got you covered on the Cycle-to-Work Scheme. With secure bike storage too!

  • MacBooks are our standard, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done

  • We also offer generous relocation assistance for certain roles for people joining us from overseas.


How to Apply


If you’re interested in joining the team, please send us your resume (you can also contract Caoimhe Cooney on Caoimhe@intercom.io). Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements above. If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access (Twitter, Github), contribute to an open source project, write a blog we’d love to hear about it.



  • Type of contract: Permanent

  • Salary: Competitive

  • Location: St Stephens Green, Dublin, Ireland

item.title: Ruby on Rails Fullstack Engineer at Web Summit (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
About us
Web Summit is a global technology conference company based in Dublin, Ireland. We run a series of international gatherings across the world. Our flagship event is Web Summit, held in Lisbon. In less than 7 years, Web Summit has grown from a small team to a company of over 150 focused on disrupting the conference industry through technology and data science. In 2017, over 100,000 startups, investors, speakers and other attendees gathered at Web Summit events, including Collision in the US and RISE in Hong Kong.

About the team
We’re looking for software engineers of all levels to join our growing engineering team at Web Summit. The engineering team is broken up into smaller cross-functional teams which deliver different business projects; like ad-automation, core data APIs, attendee web applications and internal optimisation tools. 

At Web Summit we believe that the power of data and engineering can be applied to every facet of our events to make the attendee experience excellent, so whatever projects you work on you’ll work closely with our UX engineers, data scientists, event engineers and web developers across all our conferences: Web Summit in Lisbon, RISE in Hong Kong, MoneyConf in Dublin, and Collision in New Orleans.


What you’ll achieve at Web Summit: 



  • You’ll contribute to the architecture and development direction of the team to ensure quality code is written and excellent products are built.

  • You’ll work across the stack (Rails, AngularJS, PostgreSQL, Redis, Linux) to deliver quality, maintainable code in order to power the best conferences in the world.

  • You’ll collaborate and learn with other team members via mentoring, code reviews, and technical talks.

  • You’ll learn about and champion best practices in code, architecture & development process.



Who you are:



  • You have an analytical mind and love solving problems.

  • You care deeply about engineering culture and the quality of products you and your team build.

  • You have experience working in a Kanban or Scrum team driving everyone around you to perform to their utmost.

  • You love the web and new technologies (AWS Lambda looks cool).

  • You’re knowledgeable in a broad spectrum of products and recent developments; making smart choices about technologies to be adopted.



Skills and abilities we’re looking for:



  • Computer related MSc is a plus.

  • Commercial experience in Ruby or other object-orientated language.

  • Solid understanding of *NIX.

  • Solid experience with AWS, GCE or other cloud providers.

  • Experience with Ruby, Node, and/or Python.

  • Experience with AngluarJS, React and/or Ember.

  • Experience with Redis, Postgres or Neo4j.

  • Open source contributions to a project in any language (even English) is a plus.


Be healthy, curious and social:



  • Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover.

  • Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga.

  • Enjoy your own private garden with orchard, sports equipment, and vegetables right outside your office.

  • Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages and cereals.

  • Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks and training initiatives.

  • Become workmates, not just colleagues, with our active social calendar of company celebrations, trips abroad and sports.

  • Have the opportunity to travel to our global events and tap into the best tech network under one roof!

item.title: Storage Specialist HPC at EPFL - Blue Brain Project (Genève, Suisse)
item.description:
The EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), situated on the Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease. The BBP provides the community with regular releases of data, models and tools to accelerate neuroscience discovery and clinical translation through open science and global collaboration.


For our Computing section, we are currently seeking to fill the following position:



Storage Specialist – HPC



Specific responsibilities include:



  • Ownership, operation and support of HPC parallel file systems

  • Configuration and or optimization of parallel file systems for maximum performance

  • Development of policies for data transfer, sharing and lifecycle management

  • Liaison with 3rd party support vendors

  • Participation in the building and delivery of HPC infrastructure components and IT services



Essential skills and experience required:



  • Experience in administrating, optimizing and troubleshooting parallel file systems (eg: GPFS)

  • Experience with archival storage and tape libraries

  • Experience with InfiniBand, Omnipath, 40/10GbE fabrics

  • Track record of operating production services in a dynamic environment



Preferred:



  • Experience with site-to-site file transfer solutions (eg: Globus or similar)

  • Proficient in scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby, Perl, shell)

  • Experience working with core network infrastructure (Cisco Nexus/Catalyst)



Profile:



  • Bachelor or Master degree in computer science or similar

  • Experience working in a collaborative and multi-cultural environment

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, written and oral

  • Fast learner, eager to expand his/her domains of expertise

  • Proven ability to work both independently and in team-based environments

  • Fluent communication in English (written and spoken)



The Blue Brain Project is:



  • A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience.

  • A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community

  • A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron




Start date: August 2017, or negociable;


Activity rate: 100%;


Deadline for application : until position is filled


Duration of contract: 1 year



Applicants should submit a cover letter and a detailed CV in PDF format only, with file name “Surname_position _Cover Letter” and “Surname_positon _CV” electronically to jobs.bbp @epfl.ch


Please use the reference of the position title in the “object” field.

item.title: Senior frontend or fullstack developer? Fancy breaking into the film industry? at We Got POP Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We make it easier for actors to find work and for films to fill their sets with suitable actors. We've helped find aliens for Star Wars and Amazons for Wonder Woman.


But now we need help building our own team. We need an experienced frontend developer to make our web UI as simple to use as possible while responsibly helping us to migrate our existing code to something that is easier to work with and maintain.


We allow our users a lot of freedom to customise their interface and we want to keep that flexibility while not drowning in complex code.


We need your help!


Skills & Requirements


You will need to know the standard frontend skills of HTML5, CSS and Javascript. You will have worked on legacy codebases and understand why people used to love JQuery. However you will used a modern framework like React, Angular or Vue.


The ideal candidate would also be unafraid of diving into Python code and understand how applications get deployed on AWS. The more fullstack you are the more autonomy you'll be able to have in the codebase.


Being willing to learn these skills is just as important as having them today so please don't be put off if you don't know these things yet. The interview process will take into consideration how you've developed your skills to date.
