  • Excellent at taking on technical challenges, and forever curious about learning new things.

item.title: Software Solution Architekt (m/w) at Giesecke+Devrient Currency Technology GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Arbeiten Sie mit an einer Zukunft, die bewegt. Für unsere Division Currency Management Solutions suchen wir Sie als Software Solution Architekt (m/w).


Ihre Aufgaben:


Sie arbeiten in einem innovativen cross-funktionalen Team und ver­ant­worten die Konzeption und Umsetzung von ganzheitlich ausgerichteten, integrativen und skalier­baren Software-Plattformen und -Lösungen (Eco-System). Die Schwer­punkte bilden dabei moderne Machine-Operations / Manage­ment-Lösungen im Enterprise- und IoT- / Remote-Umfeld inklusive zuge­höriger Frontends / Apps wie auch die Nutzung und Integration mit Advanced Analytics für z. B. Predictive-Maintenance oder Process- / Logistic-Optimization. Mit Ihren innovativen und nach­haltigen Lösungen setzen Sie Maßstäbe und beeinflussen unser Industrie­umfeld maßgeblich. Sie arbeiten dabei zielgerichtet, problemorientiert für und mit unseren Kunden und fokussieren die Schaffung von Business Value.


Ihr Profil:



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbar sowie Erfah­rung in der Gestaltung von komplexen Enterprise- und IoT-Software-Plattformen und Lösungsarchitekturen sowie weiterhin praktische Erfahrung

  • mit Java / Java EE, Web-Technologien, JavaScript, Python, C# .NET

  • mit Data-Storage-Technologien, NoSQL, Hadoop, RDBMS

  • mit Enterprise- / Integration-Design-Patterns, Microservices, REST, SOA

  • mit Kommunikationsprotokollen wie HTTPS / REST, MQTT, AMQP, DDS, OPC UA

  • in Technologiefeldern wie Cloud, Big Data Analytics, IoT, Security, Cross Platform Mobile Apps

  • Kenntnisse von Linux, Windows, Virtualisierung, Docker

  • Praktische Erfahrung im Einsatz von Open Source sowie mit Continuous Integration, Delivery und Deployment

  • Arbeiten nach Lean-Startup- und Agile-Principles

  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, hohe Motivation und Team­fähig­keit

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift



Referenzcode: CTCS32-17-384


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung unter www.gi-de.com/karriere.

Giesecke+Devrient Currency Technology GmbH
Prinzregentenstraße 159 · 81677 München

item.title: Script Developers within Cyber Security at OUTPOST24 (Karlskrona, Sweden)
item.description:
Outpost24 is looking for experienced Script Developers to expand our Vulnerability Research and Development team in Sweden. At Outpost24, we envision solutions that identify risk that could disrupt our customer's business before it happens. These solutions are flexible to any process or technology your business uses. Our teams build these solutions in our beautiful office in Karlskrona, Sweden where the passion and expertise within IT Security is shown through our everyday work. Here you can join an international team working with the future development of security scanning and engage as a key player in the success of increasing the functionality in our already awarded application. As a part of the team, you will contribute to defining and implementing our products.


What you will do



  • Develop scripts for new product/service detection

  • Add custom scripts for vulnerabilities

  • Work on existing and new research

  • Working in a team of smart developers

  • Working in a high pace work environment



What we need from you



  • Solid work experience with programming

  • Bachelor's Degree in IT

  • Good knowledge of scripting in Python and Bash.

  • Knowledge of other scripting and programming languages is an advantage.

  • Good attention to detail

  • Team-work mentality

We offer a full-time job with a competitive salary and continued skill development. You will be a part of high performing and international team and working closely with smart developers.


As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.


These positions will remain open for application until the roles are filled. Please do not delay in applying as we will close the positions once the right candidates are found.

item.title: BI Engineer (Java, C++, AWS & Spark) at Zalando SE (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. As a BI Engineer at Zalando Media Solutions within the Reporting and Data Infrastructure team, you will be responsible for creating and improving engaging reporting solutions, together with our Product Managers.


We live Radical Agility, a software development methodology that allows you to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles – Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose – we entrust you to be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


Our team in Hamburg spearheads our data-driven media buying efforts with a focus on fashion-oriented buying strategies for accurate and relevant consumer targeting. Machine learning, high-level database modeling, metrics definition, trend analysis and report generation are crucial to our business. We are Zalandos ad-technology forge and an integral contributor to Zalando Media Solutions.


You Are Setting Standards


Ownership. You and your team will consult and help our teams to develop, implement and maintain sustainable, high-performance, growth-ready data-processing and data integration systems.


Expertise. You will join a team that is focused on analyzing and making sense of diverse set of data, on the bleeding edge of eCommerce and advertisement. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset.


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will collaborate with our 120+ teams across Europe integrating our system.


You Are Skilled


Experience. Solid experience with OLAP analysis and tools (such as Microstrategy, GoodData, Eclipse BIRT, Tableau, Crystal Report, Pentaho). Experience in ETL/DWH and the relational Data Bases RDBMS (e.g. MySQL, PostgresDB, Oracle, SQL Server) or MPP (e.g. Teradata, Redshift, Vertica) are beneficial. Another plus is knowledge and understanding of the online advertising industry / eCommerce.


Big Data. Analyze advertising and eCommerce data. Demonstrate expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets. Design ETL processes, refine DWH architectures, build reportings and visualizations primarily in GoodData.


Ownership. Develop expertise in understanding our business. Own solutions that empower other teams and our clients to perform and enable profound analysis to allow data-driven Management decisions.


Technologies. Experience in the programming languages SQL and Javascript and desirably also in Java, Python or Linux scripting.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and feedback, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos. A dynamic, international team where collaboration is the core mindset.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.de and discounts from external partners.


Development. Opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Technologies. Opportunity to work with a range of different and cutting-edge technologies such as Python, R, SQL, Spark.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Georg Petersen.

item.title: Senior-Level Software Engineer - Web (Biz Growth Team) at Yelp (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Our Hamburg office is located in the heart of the city and brings with it the unique advantages of booming international teams, all of whom share the same floor and are brought together by the same goal: empowering Yelp’s business products.

The Biz Growth team continuously improves the claiming and onboarding experience for new business owners on both the web and mobile platforms. We move fast, and on our team you’ll never have an ordinary day, constantly shifting between experimenting, iterating, and implementing new features. If you're passionate about logging, metrics, and A/B testing, then the Biz Growth team is the perfect home for you!


Skills & Requirements


What You Will Do:



  • Design and document new systems

  • Lead cross-platform projects

  • Run experiments and analyze the resulting data

  • Constantly improve the monitoring and alerting of our services

  • Mentor interns or newly-hired engineers

  • Continue to learn, grow, and help us tackle brand new challenges


Technologies We Use:



  • Python and popular Python libraries/ tools (e.g., SQLAlchemy, Pylint, tox, PyPI)

  • Javascript, jQuery, Google Closure

  • Testing: testify, py.test, Selenium WebDriver

We Are Looking For:

  • Understanding of web security best practices

  • Comfortable working in a Unix environment

  • Bonus: Participation in FOSS and interest in public speaking


What We Offer:



  • Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment

  • Competitive salary, equity in the company, and an optional employee stock purchase program

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Complimentary German lessons for international employees

  • Subsidization of your public transportation card and €50 per month toward any exercise of your choice

  • Central location, a fully stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, foosball, and more!

We have created one of the world's largest, living data-sets and we use it to bring unparalleled relevance to online advertising. By utilizing technology and big data to understand digital audiences, Quantcast solves the biggest challenges in marketing.

You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and will own projects from start to finish. As a technology-driven company, we foster an agile environment where new ideas and software development come together to effectively solve some of our industry's toughest problems.

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

item.title: Data Engineer - Build our Crystal Ball! at YouGov (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description:
Are you our new Data Engineer in the Data Intelligence team? 


We’re looking for a Data Engineer to enable our clients to understand what the world thinks with ever greater detail, speed and accuracy. You'll create high-quality, automated data pipelines and infrastructure to serve YouGov’s syndicated data products. Working inside the Data Intelligence Unit, you will collaborate with data-minded people to convert vast troves of raw consumer data into meaningful insight by developing automated ETL applications, streaming data processors, RESTful microservices and browser-based user interfaces.


What will I be doing?

What do I need to bring with me?

  • JavaScript, HTML, CSS

  • PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ

  • Hadoop, Hive, Spark


A couple more things . . .


This is a full time role (37.5 hours a week), based at our Warsaw Office. 


P.S. If you’ve read this and realised that the role isn’t for you, could you recommend someone you know?

item.title: Quant Developer Internship - Summer 2018 at Quadrature Capital (London, UK)
item.description:
ABOUT US


Founded in 2010, we’re a small tech business run by programmers.


Using cutting edge technologies and complex algorithms, we analyse petabytes of structured and unstructured data to trade in a way that’s impossible for humans. Our trading is entirely automated and we look to bring automation to everything we do. This allows our teams to focus on what matters most - solving the complex and challenging problems that grow our business.


We have a huge amount of new work to do: new markets, new instruments, new data, new execution venues. So along with extending our 3rd generation system, there is a lot of greenfield development work.


OUR TEAM


Founded in 2010 and now 40 people and growing, we’re a close-knit team of computer scientists, engineers, mathematicians and other talented individuals who collaborate to solve hard problems. Our business is well suited to the curious and intellectually-honest, those who are committed to working collaboratively with others to help grow our business.


Our people are kind, diverse, friendly and humble and bring a wealth of experience from the likes of Apple, Facebook, Google, Microsoft, Yandex, tech start ups, hedge funds and banks. They’ve joined to play a personal part in the growth of our business and deliver tangible results to our trading and bottom line.


THE ROLE


Rather than separating the roles of ‘Quant’ and ‘Developer’, we have a unified team of Quant Developers. The work is varied and there are plenty of learning opportunities: our Quant Developers can design and implement trading infrastructure, build data analytics tools or develop real-time execution strategies. Those who are more quant-focused are strong programmers, and those who consider themselves a pure programmer have the opportunity to research.


All of our Quant Developers, regardless of background, program extensively and have the opportunity to tackle interesting problems at the cutting edge of financial technology. Below are examples of what our Quant Development team does day to day. Some of these responsibilities are more suited to those that research, some are more suited to those that work on low-level infrastructure. By no means do we expect all of these skills in our candidates; they have been listed to give you a sense of what our Quant Development team does as a whole. In any case, finance experience is not essential.



  • Design extremely high-­performance, highly-­reliable and finely-­tuned programs, implemented in Python/Cython and C++ with production­-quality code

  • Design and implement the full stack of trading infrastructure from the exchange level to workflow management

  • Develop trading strategies using statistical and ML approaches

  • Extend and optimise the research and analysis process

  • Develop ways to automatically and intelligently trade multiple asset classes globally

  • Process and analyse novel structured and unstructured data with a view to improving risk, forecasting or execution.

  • Read academic papers, industry publications and books to learn new and improved algorithms for use in messaging throughput & latency, data storage, parallelisation and computation

  • Work on complex computational and data-­related problems and implement efficient and innovative solutions

  • Build tools and engines that enhance our ability to analyse data and contribute to optimised workflow

  • Develop visualisations, and other analytics for live and experimental trading

  • Improve system component performance by orders of magnitudes by improving the underlying algorithms/method of processing/identifying systems bottlenecks

  • Support our trading system and fix operational problems


ABOUT YOU



  • Significant programming experience is a must, as is a genuine passion for solving complex problems through programming

  • You enjoy coding, rather than considering it just a tool, but want your code to have real world results and effects

  • You know your data structures and algorithms, and can practically apply the knowledge to real world problems

  • You may have a passion for ML and NLP, with ambitions to use these models to help solve algorithmic challenges and extract information from a wide variety of data sets

  • You have strong communication skills and a simple, down-to-earth style when articulating your ideas

  • You’re self-directed and can effectively and independently manage your time across various projects

  • You’re honest, reliable and take pride in your work

  • You’re enthusiastic, driven to develop your skills and open to new ideas

  • You’re flexible, adaptable and can jump from individual contributor to collaborative team member

  • We deliver in a Linux environment, mainly in C++ and Python/Cython, and embrace grid computing. Skills and knowledge here would be very helpful, but not essential

  • Ideally you will have a strong undergraduate degree in a numerate discipline from a top-tier university


WORKING HERE


We’re fortunate enough to have a fantastic open-plan office, where we provide breakfasts, snacks, a music room, games, a library, the obligatory ping pong table and yoga sessions overlooking the London skyline.


We offer competitive compensation, a generous holiday allowance, various health benefits (medical, dental, and a private GP), travel insurance, life insurance, 10% employer pension, gym membership (plus an on-site gym), subsidised music lessons and regular social events.


We’re also big believers in learning, and work hard to support the professional development of our team through tailored training, coaching and tuition.


THERE'S SO MUCH THAT WE WANT TO BUILD AND WE'VE ONLY JUST BEGUN, SO IT’S AN IDEAL TIME TO JOIN OUR TEAM AND BE PART OF THE JOURNEY! IF YOU’RE INTERESTED, WE’D LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU.

item.title: Full-Stack Engineer - Advertising Solutions (f/m) at Delivery Hero AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Food delivery… sounds fancy, but how does that actually work?


Someone is hungry, she Googles her favourite restaurant, clicks the first link… and she lands on the restaurant page on lieferheld.de.


Now imagine this person lives in Australia, or in Argentina, or in one of the 40+ countries where Delivery Hero is present. Each country has a different culture, a different language (or even several!). Imagine more than 150k restaurants with details that make them unique.


How would you make sure that she finds the food she wants? Can you make sure it happens quickly? Can you make sure it happens at scale and in a sustainable way?


 
Your mission:



  • You will design, implement and maintain web apps for the Ads Solutions Team.

  • You will own the entire development lifecycle from specification to deployment.

  • Our apps deal with lots of data so you will make sure they are reliable, fast and cost efficient.You will design, implement and maintain new tools for the Advertising Solutions Tech Team.

  • You will ensure code quality by coaching junior colleagues.

  • You will make sure that the platforms keep up with high standards of scalability, stability, security and performance.

  • Our Tech Stack: python3, flask, drf, pandas, angular, typescript, circleci, aws/gcp.



Your heroic technical skills:



  • You have 3+ years of software development experience with a key focus on a modern web applications and cloud services.

  • You have hands on experience with HTML, CSS, JS, Angular, python, flask.

  • You have a getting things done attitude.

  • You care about creating an exceptional user experience.

  • You care about reliability and performance.

  • You have passion for clean and beautiful code, with an eye for simplicity and pragmatism.

  • You firmly believe in lean and agile development (Scrum).

  • You get up to speed with new systems and concepts quickly.

  • You understand that quality is not assured solely by the QA engineer, but by the team.

  • You believe in cross-functional teams and know that responsibility does not end with deployment.

  • You have good communication skills and you use them to share knowledge among your peers.

  • Nice to have: knowledge of the Facebook and Adwords APIs, Python data manipulation libraries. Infrastructure knowledge is a plus.



We offer you:



  • International working atmosphere and cross-cultural teams.

  • Goal oriented environment.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Great career opportunities.

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability.

  • Nice work environment and English as working language.

  • For applicants from abroad: relocation package and German lessons.



Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. 
We’re looking forward to your application!

item.title: Full Stack Entwickler/in, Erfahrung mit Angular, 60100% at APG|SGA (Zürich, Schweiz)

Wir entwickeln Lösungen für den mobilen Werbemarkt mit einem Fokus auf Geotargeting. Durch unsere Anbindung an Apps mit mehreren Millionen Nutzern verarbeiten wir täglich grosse Mengen and GPS- und Beacon-Standortdaten und verwenden diese für ein sehr akkurates Werbetargeting. Unser Team besteht aus sechs kreativen Kopfen mit einem Durchschnittsalter von dreissig Jahren. item.title: Software Engineer at Beekeeper AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description:
As a Software Engineer you have the opportunity to work on all of our software stack and learn about state-of-the art web and mobile development. Technologies that you will work on are ElasticSearch, Realm.io, RabbitMQ, Backbone.js, Docker, Amazon Web Services, MySQL and interfacing them with different programming languages like Python, Java, Objective-C and Javascript.


Your responsibilities



  • Software Engineering with focus on API, web or mobile development

  • Being integrated in the whole development cycle; including planning, designing, implementation, testing and deployment processes

item.title: Software Engineer (m/w) bei Valiton in München at Valiton GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Was Dich bei uns erwartet …



  • Du bist zusammen mit einem agilen Entwicklungsteam verantwortlich für die Konzeption, Umsetzung und Inbetriebnahme neuer Applikationen und Produkt-Features

  • Du kümmerst Dich um die kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Anwendung hinsichtlich Aktualität der verwendeten Technologien, Modularität, Stabilität, Skalierbarkeit und Performance

  • Du entwickelst Front- und/oder Backend-Projekte, je nach persönlichem Profil


Was wir bieten …



  • Spannende Projekte, von BigData und Web-Entwicklung bis Micro Services und Serverless Computing

  • Neueste Technologien: Node.js, Symfony, Docker, React.js, Elasticsearch etc.

  • Flache Hierarchien

  • Ein Umfeld, in dem jeder aktiv mitgestalten kann

  • Gesunde Ernährung am Arbeitsplatz, von Kaffee über Mineralwasser bis Obstkorb und Gemüse

  • Wir gehören zu 100% zu Hubert Burda Media – das bringt Dir vielfältige Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen, Vergünstigungen und vieles mehr


Was wir uns von Dir wünschen …



  • Du hast eine Leidenschaft für Web-Projekte und Open Source-Technologien

  • Du bist ein offener und kommunikativer Teamplayer mit Begeisterung für agile Software-Entwicklung (z. B. SCRUM, testgetriebene Entwicklung, Pair Programming, stetiges Refactoring, Clean Code-Praktiken)

  • Du verfügst über gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit einer oder mehreren dieser Technologien: node.js, JavaScript, NoSQL-Datenbanken, HTML5/CSS3

  • Du verfügst über gute Deutschkenntnisse

  • Kenntnisse in der App-Entwicklung für iOS und Android von Vorteil, aber keine Voraussetzung

  • Idealerweise hast Du schon Erfahrung mit Versionsverwaltungen (z. B. GIT), Continuous Integration (z. B. Jenkins) und Deployment-Prozessen (z. B. Webistrano/Capistrano) gesammelt


Jetzt bewerben!


Kontakt
Phillip Borus
Recruiting Center

item.title: Backend (Cloud Orchestration) Entwickler (m/w) at Hetzner Cloud GmbH (Unterföhring, Deutschland)
item.description:
Für unseren Entwicklungsstandort in München Unterföhring suchen wir:


Backend (Cloud Orchestration) Entwickler (m/w)


Als Backend Entwickler (m/w) bringst du deine vorhandene Erfahrung ein und arbeitest mit uns an der nächsten Generation von Cloudangeboten für den weltweiten Markt. Hier kannst du dich selbst verwirklichen und deine Erfahrungen und Ideen gezielt einbringen, denn es handelt sich um ein junges, frisches Projekt. Mit uns entwickelst und konzipierst du eine verteilte Applikation die ein REST API zur Verfügung stellt. Ein Stack aus Python, PostgreSQL, Redis und RabbitMQ wird von dir genutzt und erweitert. Moderne Entwicklungsmethoden mit containerberbasierten Testumgebungen, automatisierten Tests und Continuous Integration sowie Deployment unterstützen dich dabei.


Das bieten wir dir: 



  • Ein lockeres Team mit einer angenehmen Arbeitsatmosphäre und kurzen Entscheidungswegen

  • Freiheit dich zu entfalten, Ideen umzusetzen und Neues zu lernen

  • Attraktive Vergütung

  • Sehr gute Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem schnell wachsenden Unternehmen

  • Du sagst uns was du für deine Arbeit brauchst, wir besorgen es. Ganz egal ob PC, Mac, Linux oder Windows

  • Kostenlose Getränke und Snacks im Büro


Bewerben:


Der Bewerbungsprozess läuft bei uns unkompliziert und schnell: Schick uns deine Bewerbung am besten per E-Mail direkt an jobs@hetzner-cloud.de. Du erhältst von uns zeitnah ein Feedback.


Skills & Requirements



  • Mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der modernen Software-Entwicklung

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python oder einer anderen gängigen hohen Programmiersprache, z.B. Java, C#, PHP, Ruby

  • Erfahrung mit Datenbanksystemen (SQL) sowie idealerweise ORM-Systemen

  • Linux Erfahrung von Vorteil

  • Du legst Wert auf sauberen, verständlichen Code (DRY, KISS)

  • Wir können uns auf dich verlassen, du bist eigenständig und gleichzeitig offen für Neues

  • Bestehende Dokumentationen aktualisierst du und führst sie eigenständig fort

  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

  • Solide Englischkenntnisse

item.title: Développeur at onepoint (Paris, France)
item.description:
Craftsman comme état d’esprit ?


Si pour vous, un code de qualité, bien conçu et évolutif n’est pas réservé au système de lancement et de guidage d’Ariane.


Si pour vous, le développeur n’est pas le dernier maillon de la chaîne mais l’artisan de la qualité.


Si vous êtes passionné(e) par le code et aimez vous tenir au courant de ce qui se fait (lectures, conf, meetup).


Si vous avez envie d’apporter, de partager, d’apprendre, d’expérimenter à nos côtés sur de nouveaux frameworks, patterns, usages.


Alors rencontrons-nous pour construire ensemble le monde de demain avec d’autres passionnés comme vous.



Chez onepoint, nous sommes sensibles au code bien pensé et bien conçu. Nous mettons à disposition de nos collaborateurs les moyens pour qu’ils puissent bien faire leur métier et valoriser leurs idées, par une organisation qui laisse tout le monde s’exprimer, et par des outils, lieux, plateformes (FabLab, hololens, HTC Vive, Robot, banc IoT…).


Nos espaces de travail sont des lieux ouverts qui favorisent le travail collaboratif dans un environnement bienveillant qui privilégie le bien-être des collaborateurs.


Que vous soyez proche d’un pingouin célèbre, préfériez les pommes ou les fenêtres multicolores, que vous soyez Front-end ou back-end, que vous excelliez en python, en ruby , en php, sur Xamarin, sur l’IoT, l’IA…

item.title: Senior Developer at Government Digital Service (GDS) (London, UK)
item.description:
GDS is looking for Senior Developers of all experiences and backgrounds who can work across a range of projects.  



Our developers


Build RESTful web services to serve a variety of citizen and government needs, taking responsibility for the quality of code you produce. They implement toolkits and APIs for purposes such as integration, performance optimisation, security and scalability. We build automated tests to support our continuous deployment environment. We share knowledge of tools and techniques with your wider team, both developers and non-developers. We work across government departments as digital ambassadors identifying good practices for GDS to adopt and sharing experiences, eg through blog posts, tech talks at conferences etc. We also participate in our inhouse support of which you will be paid an allowance, which is done in a rota system.


As a senior developer at GDS you'll be familiar with working practices such as TDD, continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and have the ability to quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques.


You will also lead in helping recruit developers, provide tech leadership within the team advising and working with developers to identify the best solutions, share knowledge among the GDS teams, ensuring that your team is understood by others and understanding the working of the wider organisation and take responsibility for solving complex issues.


The basic skills we would expect a Developer to have:



  • experience in back-end development, with knowledge of at least one of Ruby, Java, Python, Javascript, Scala or Go

  • understanding of software design principles

  • ability to quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques

  • a systematic approach to solving problems 

  •  experience of using testing to validate solutions

  • understanding of agile environments and version control

  • basic understanding about web security

  • an awareness of technologies used for web applications, e.g databases, backups, CDNs and search, and of Unix-like operating systems, eg Linux and/or Mac OS experience of working on, or with web technologies 


Some of the benefits people at GDS love! 



  • great place to learn and grow as a developer; we have a number of projects that you can move around to get experience solving different large scale challenges and encourage learning new programming languages

  • flexible working and a brilliant work life balance

  • working on things that affect the lives of every UK citizen

  • working in modern development environments and with modern agile delivery principles


**For more information about the role, salary and benefits please follow the "Apply" link.**

item.title: Software Engineer Tax (f/m) / Stuttgart or Düsseldorf at EY (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Challenges that will let you grow


The Tax Technology & Analytics Group at EY provides clients with quantitative solutions to their business needs. We cover a whole range of services such as Software Development, ERP System Analysis and Adjustment as well as Advanced Analytics. Examples are: Development of real-time analytics software to monitor business transactions, user-centered and responsive web-applications, as well as data visualization using VR with Oculus Rift + touch.   Team members are drawn from diverse backgrounds and nationalities. The management team has a huge track record of projects at diverse companies in various industries with different challenges of meeting business needs with creative solutions. In this role, you actively develop innovative tools and models to guide clients and tax experts in the process of decision making. Depending on your background, tasks include requirement engineering, software engineering with state-of-the-art technology and work streams, in conjunction with a high degree of freedom in problem solving. Besides the model-view-controller design pattern, you can name numerous pros for your other favorite design pattern. You will be involved in the design and implementation of full-fledged web-/ applications with clear modular structure, code, testing and documentation. You design and implement solutions that take human-computer interaction two steps further due to your good hand for visual design. You work closely with our data scientists to integrate advanced analytics in intuitive dashboards.


You proactively develop and propose your own solutions to the team. You are keen to learn about new technologies and methods. We define the state-of-the-art in tax technology & analytics. You are part of the presentation of the developed solutions to middle and top management from various industries in our digital showroom tax at EY Stuttgart.


Your profile to make a difference together



  • You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in software engineering/ computer science or can demonstrate your skills in another way (e.g. github, applications or websites).

  • You’ve designed and written numerous web-/ applications in Java or Python (ideally Django) across the whole MVC cycle.

  • You are familiar with ORM and flavors of SQL.

  • You are experienced in JavaScript, HTML and CSS.

  • Tax knowledge or ERP-system know-how are a plus but not a must.

  • Intermediate German skills should be provided with the willingness to improve as well as advanced English skills.


More opportunities to help you achieve your potential


Through our corporate culture, which combines variety, life balance, training and an international perspective, we will help you achieve your potential. We are very aware that your views, your energy and your enthusiasm are the drivers that will move us all forward.


Interested in the position? Then send us your application!


If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call our Recruiting Center on +49 6196 996 10005.


We prefer online applications quoting job ID ALL001Y1.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer at 3D Hubs (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to help build THE 3D printing solution that engineers and designers around the world will love to use?


With a network of 3D printers in over 7,000 locations and 160 countries, 3D Hubs provides over 1 billion people with access to a 3D printer within 10 miles of their location.


Why join now? In the coming weeks we'll cross the magical number of 1 million parts printed since the inception of our platform, with close to 100,000 parts being printed every month you could help us scale up our teams to achieve the next growth stage.


We are looking for an experienced Full-Stack developer that wants to help us solve marketplace challenges by using the right technology to significantly grow our printing business.


Projects
Because 3D printing is a rapidly evolving industry, we find ourselves learning and educating at the same time, this means iterations have to be fast-paced. You'll be able to rapidly A/B test different solutions with our customers and suppliers, helping you to find the ones that works best.


You will help craft features that are groundbreaking and accelerating the entire Additive Manufacturing industry. But most of all, you will be building a unique experience for engineers, designers and architects that use 3D printing to prototype their next big idea. Don't be surprised when you get hit by goosebumps when engineers from NASA, Tesla or DARPA give you kudos on your latest features, helping them to be more productive and prototype even faster.


Our challenges are threefold; e-commerce, a market place and 3D printing. These combined allow you to apply your skills in a complex environment and solve meaningful customer problems daily.


Team
You'll join a truly international engineering team with backgrounds ranging from computational geometry to data science. Don’t worry if you don’t have any knowledge of 3D printing yet, because you will join a culture that is centered around learning.
Whether it’s Scrum, Agile or Kanban, we are open to new methodologies of delivering projects, as long as they improve our clock speed.
Together we build scalable solutions and literally change the way manufacturing will work in the future.


Find out more about the company culture and the people behind 3D Hubs here!


You


* Have 4+ years professional track record in software product companies
* Good knowledge of Python
* Have good planning and execution skills and get the projects across the finish line
* Like to choose the right tool to solve diverse business problems
* Have a solid grasp of web solutions and modern browsers that sync well with back-end tech in a cloud infrastructure
* Enjoy working with passionate engineers and share your knowledge on tech
* Have worked with various RDBMS (MySQL or PostgreSQL)
* Work with mature tech that was validated by time and production
* Thrive in a dynamic, creative and innovation focused environment
* Have advanced English skills, both spoken and written


Bonus points:
* Experience with JS
* Knowledge of Flask
* Open source contributions. But we totally understand if you didn't have time because of your full-time    job.


Our tech stack


* ES6 (Angular, Three.js)
* Sass
* Pug
* Docker
* Python (Flask/SQL Alchemy)
* PostgreSQL
* RabbitMQ
* MySQL
* Rust
* AWS: EC2, S3, RDS etc.


Perks


* Budget for training and conferences
* Free 3D printing, anytime, at our office or on our platform
* Real impact on our technical roadmap
* Flat structure and no political games
* Work in a lean, mean, startup environment
* Be productive in an office space designed for developer happiness.Not to mention it is located in the     heart of Amsterdam
* Join a fast growing, international team of 50+ people and 17+ nationalities
* Get time to work on your own projects at our Pizza Nights
* Free lunch, Friday activities and awesome annual trips

item.title: Excellence in Web Application Development (Senior Frontend Engineer) at Sherpany () (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Fulltime JavaScript/HTML/CSS Developer  


As our core UI Developer you will be working 100% on mission critical projects from the first day on. While cooperating in a small and highly efficient Scrum team you will be responsible for developing the User Interface of the Sherpany Boardroom.


Your skills contribute to the success of the software and enable us to create a perfect product. Together we will move the current UI to the next level. Our goal is to create a User Interface which can compete with any globally renowned application. Finally we will tightly work together to raise the potential of our technologies.


Our ambition: Challenge the enterprise world...


Our mission is to give time back. We are building the first mobile and web based platform that allows effective decision making by digitally transforming the meeting process of executives and board members. We reduce waste by cutting administrative, organisational and repetitive work and spare resources like paper, shipping and transportation.


With our platform we want to have given back over 2 Mio. hours of extra time to directors within the next 5 years. Therefore we are extending our teams, also in Zurich (Switzerland) Lisbon (Portugal) or worldwide. We are looking for an ambitious Senior Front End Developer to join our company.


Skills & Requirements


Required…



  • You are obsessed with apps and you stay up-to-date with mobile UI/UX trends

  • You have the aspiration to build one of the best webapp in the world

  • You have a strong opinion but no problem to accept other views. Discarding the 20th design, to dig even deeper? No problem for you!

item.title: Software Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
The Ensembl Production Team is looking to appoint a skilled and highly motivated Software Developer to join the team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), which is located on the Wellcome Trust Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

The Software Developer will focus on developing software used for production of data releases for Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes, as part of the Ensembl Production Team. The team is responsible for:



  • Coordination of the production of new releases of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes data;

  • Developing new automated pipelines for use in the production process;

  • Designing and implementing infrastructure for automated production processing;

  • Ensuring the quality and integrity of data for release.


Specific day-to-day duties will include:



  • Design and implementation of software infrastructure components for automated processing using messaging queues and microservices;

  • Design and implementation of new production pipelines;

  • Participating in the planning and coordination of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes releases, including collaboration with other members of the Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes teams;

  • Execution of production processes and pipelines.


Qualifications and Experience


You must hold a degree in computer science or bioinformatics or a degree in biological sciences and a post-graduate qualification in computer science or bioinformatics. You should have one of the following: a minimum of two years professional programming experience, a bioinformatics based PhD; or research experience with next generation sequencing data. It would be highly desirable if experience had been gained working in other areas of genomic biology or bioinformatics.

Experience of data processing workflows either with traditional compute farms (e.g. LSF, SGE) or with distributed processing systems (e.g. Luigi) is necessary and you must be able to demonstrate understanding of these workflows. Evidence of working in a dynamic, team-based environment or contributing to a large, shared code-base is desirable..

You must have knowledge of Perl, though experience in a related scripting language (e.g. Python, Ruby) or compiled programming language (e.g. Java) would be applicable. Knowledge of MySQL, writing SQL statements and designing database schemas is essential. Experience of handling large data sets, and knowledge of other database technologies (NoSQL and traditional RDBMS) would be desirable. Experience of messaging queues (e.g. ActiveMQ and the STOMP protocol) and modern reporting frameworks (e.g. Kibana) would also be desirable.

item.title: (Senior) Backend Software Engineer to join Rapid Detection Service at F-Secure (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Backend Software Engineer to join Rapid Detection Service (RDS) backend team. Rapid Detection Service is a managed all-in-one service that detects and responds to advanced attacks. The scope also includes the Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) backend functionalities for our corporate products.


More information on the service: https://www.f-secure.com/en/web/business_global/rapid-detection-service


Key responsibilities



  • RDS backend development and operations in the cloud

  • Work in various roles, from feature development to production system maintenance

  • Cooperate with internal customers, the best-in-class cyber security and threat intelligence experts


What we offer



  • Great people to work with! Working in a team of backend software experts, constantly learning, developing yourself and challenging the status quo

  • Opportunity to work on cloud native stack with modern AWS services.

  • As a member of the devops team, take devops responsibility of running your code in production. Opportunity to see what true professional devops means in large scale and highly critical production systems.

  • We are always on the lookout for fresh ideas to improve our systems and practices. You have the possibility to utilize cutting-edge technologies in an exciting security software environment.

  • Relentlessly work together with like-minded, curious professionals who care about each other and act like a friend would

  • Keywords: AWS, ECS + ECR, EC2, Lambda, Serverless, IAM, S3, Kinesis, Docker, InfluxDB, SQS, RabbitMQ, Python, node.js, Java, REST API, monitoring, metrics, highly concurrent event processing, EC2 autoscaling, ELB/ALB, API Gateway, RDS, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, Route53


We value the following - but at the same time, we do not expect you to be master on all of these



  • Development with server side highly concurrent and horizontally scalable systems with use of event driven data processing and messaging systems

  • Programming experience with one or more of the following languages: Python, NodeJS, Java

  • Quality minded approach in all work and understanding of quality practices to enable continuous deployments and delivery

  • Work experience with public clouds and tools for orchestrating automated deployments (e.g. AWS, CloudFormation)

  • We also value experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs, securing production environment and devops practices


As an ideal candidate, you are capable of seeing the big picture and working towards a successful end-to-end solution. We appreciate people with the ability to adapt to any situation, try new things, work independently and communicate well. We do not expect you to be fully ready, we can offer an excellent opportunity to learn together with an excellent team.


As an F-Secure Fellow, you’ll be joining a tight knit network of 1,000 colleagues, spread over 25 offices around the world. At F-Secure, we meet each other as equals, but challenge each other’s ideas – we believe this makes us all better and creates a more secure environment for our customers. At F-Secure you can be who you are – bring your best self to the game and help us outsmart cyber security threats.


Join us and make the connected world a safer place!


Security background check will be conducted for the selected candidate, in accordance with the Finnish Security Clearance Act 726/2014.

item.title: Experienced Backend Engineer at Citrusbyte () (allows remote)
item.description:
Citrusbyte is a software consultancy that believes in using simple tools to solve problems. We build custom systems for both startups and enterprises - You can see our portfolio for more information about our clients.


We have offices in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.



Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience and processes to help them define and create their products.



Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so significant experience in this language is required, but we are looking for polyglot engineers who have a hunger for learning new languages and tools. At Citrusbyte, learning is part of the job, and you should always be able to answer the question: "what have I learned this week?"



We believe that less is more and we vehemently value simplicity. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Ruby on Rails and instead lean towards smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.



We have also done projects in Elixir, Rust, Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

item.title: Full Stack Developer - End User Mexico at EBANX (Mexico City, Mexico)
item.description:
Buscamos un desarrollador Full Stack para ayudarnos en el desarrollo de productos para nuestros más de 20 millones de clientes en Latinoamérica. Si eres muy bueno y quieres trabajar en un ambiente multicultural e innovador con aires de Sillicon Valley, ven a platicar con nosotros.


Además de intentar conquistar el mundo, tus responsabilidades serán:



  • Desarrollar productos con gran calidad, rápidos (queremos siempre una arquitectura de alto rendimiento), intuitivos, funcionales y con excelente UX / UI (queremos que nuestros usuarios usen nuestros productos de forma natural, rápida y sin bugs).

  • Trabajar en un entorno diverso y dinámico que utiliza diferentes herramientas y lenguajes de programación; No tener miedo de aprender nuevos lenguajes y frameworks.

  • Adueñarse de los proyectos y hacer que las cosas sucedan.


¿Qué es indispensable para la vacante?



  • Profundo conocimiento en uno o más lenguajes de programación, tales como Ruby, Java, Python, PHP, NodeJS etc;

  • Pensamiento orientado a la mejora continua de los productos y del negocio: atraer y retener clientes, conversión y tasa de aprobación, UX & UI serán palabras comunes en su día a día.

  • Saber utilizar bien conceptos de GitHub como blanching, pull-requests, etc;

  • Mindset de Continuous Delivery, centrado en entregar valor de negocio;


¿Qué nos gusta ver?



  • Agile en las venas;

  • Git guruness;

  • Buen trato de negociación;

  • Experiencia con TDD;

  • Un verdadero Clean Coder;

  • Experiencia previa en el mercado de pagos;

  • Ya ha desarrollado aplicaciones móviles para iOS / Android;

  • Inglés avanzado (conversación). Es el idioma oficial de EBANX;


Tecnologías de Desarrollo que usamos (calma, no es necesario saberlo todo);



  • Ruby (Ruby on Rails);

  • PHP

  • IOS / Android (Kotlin, Swift, Objective-C, Java);

  • Java (iniciando);

  • Elixir (iniciando);

  • PostgreSQL, MySQL y Amazon Redshift;

  • Redis, Memcached;

  • (MiniTest, RSpec, Codeception);

  • Travis CI;

  • New Relic;

  • JIRA; 


Tecnologías de Operación que usamos (calma, usted no necesita saberlo todo)



  • AWS (OpsWorks, EC2, ELB, SQS, S3, RedShift, RDS, ElastiCache, SES, CloudWatch, etc.);

  • Docker y Vagrant para el entorno de desarrollo;

  • Entre otras cosas. 

  • Tenemos un equipo de Ops dedicado 24x7.

  • Español nativo o fluido

  • Inglés por lo menos avanzado 


Además de eso, ¿qué nos gustaría ver?



  • Que sueñes en grande


¿Qué ofrecemos?



  • Plan de Salud y Dental, con todas las despesas custeadas por EBANX.

  • Vale Despensa de MX$ 1.500,00 mensuales.

  • Clases de Portugués gratuitas

  • Programa EBANX Education (50% de la mensualidad limitado a MX$ 1.500,00 para cursos de Graduación e Especialización).

  • Programa de performance WAVES con target salarial de un sueldo mensual por ano (pago proporcional a cada trimestre).

  • Cuenta EBANX con USD 15.00.

  • EBANX Play (Gympass).

item.title: Developpeur Fullstack Django at ipso sante (Paris, France)
item.description:
votre rôle



  • vous prenez en main la refonte du portail web patients www.ipso.paris pour l’adapter à une utilisation sur plusieurs cabinets

  • vous développez les services patients en ligne : SMS en cas de retard, recueil des motifs de consultation et des antécédents des patients, accès au dossier médical en ligne, messagerie patient-médecin, etc.

environnement de travail

compétences requises

compétences optionnelles (mais utiles)
