item.title: Technical Lead at PassFort (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re seeking a fantastic Technical Lead to help change the face of customer onboarding. 


You will work with the current (awesome) team of 4 engineers that manage and optimise ongoing operations of infrastructure, and delivers new features.


First and foremost, you’ll be a technical expert. You’ll be hands on with code and a contributor in the team, thinking about everything from architecture, security and performance, all the way through to feature UX. We’re looking for someone to bring new ideas, and become an integral part of the process to continuously improve our product.


You’ll work with our CTO to shape and manage priorities and delivery on the product roadmap. As we grow (and we’re growing rapidly), you’ll bring your experience in growing and developing a high functioning team at scale. You’ll understand technical needs, anticipate any issues, and ensure plans are developed, communicated and responsibilities agreed within the team. You’ll have a knack for translating technical ideas into simple and effective plans, and developing a framework for driving their execution in line with business needs.


You’ll help embed engineering best practice and delivery standards, and evolve the technical expertise of the team through coaching. We’re invested in building a collaborative culture that gives back to the community, where we work together to help catalyse innovation and development. You’ll also be integral to supporting the process of recruitment and onboarding new members into the team.


This is an incredible opportunity to take ownership of a new and developing role in a rapidly growing startup.


Our stack includes ES6, React, Redux on the front-end, and Python (with a sprinkling of Rust) on the back-end. We have a service based architecture built on top of Kubernetes and Google’s Cloud Platform.


Skills & Requirements



  • A track record of leading and growing an effective technology team, and establishing best practice and delivery standards

  • Ability to translate technical ideas into simple and effective plans, putting delivery frameworks in place

  • Commercial mindset, able to contribute to the development of tech and product strategies in line with the business goals

  • Ability to support the CTO in prioritising and managing deliveries on the product roadmap

  • Confident communicator

  • Flexibility to adapt with a growing business and culture

  • A deep knowledge of either Python or Javascript, and at least a working knowledge of the other.

  • Experience with React a plus.

  • Experience with Rust would also be great.

  • Experience in DevOps (particularly Kubernetes) a plus.


Benefits



  • A homely environment in our Grade II listed offices in central London,

  • An annual learning & development budget to spend on what you want,

  • A monthly wellness budget (not restricted to gyms – go for a spa day or rock-climbing if you like),

  • ‘Decide your own holiday’ entitlement,

  • Pension contributions (investing in your future is important!),

  • Pick your own equipment and kit, and not to forget,

  • …Equity!

item.title: DevOps Systems Engineer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Excited by the idea of having to manage over 5000 components across more than 20 locations world-wide? Can you make split second decisions that directly influence our P&L and do you keep your cool when everything around you seems to fall apart? Are you the type of engineer who improves their work by automating tasks? Then you will fit right in!


Technology at Optiver


In order to be successful in our trading domain, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best technologists to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. With 12 datacenters and thousands of servers we run ten thousands of trading components executing hundred thousands of trades every day. These systems produce a lot of data that needs to be wrangled to turn it into valuable information for different areas of the business.


What you'll do


As a DevOps Systems Engineer you are the custodian of our production trading environment. You will care for our trading software and systems using your distinct skillset and insights, and adapt the environment as required to achieve our business goals. Activities include setting up, tweaking, optimizing and monitoring the different software and hardware components manually, as well as developing tools to make these activities less labour intensive and more consistent.
You constantly keep an eye on our trading activities, answering questions and troubleshooting issues as they arise. You will be working with highly skilled, smart and engaged colleagues within a team of traders, researchers, software engineers and other system engineers. Together you constantly question the status quo; see whether it makes sense and is the most optimal, and find ways to improve and then make it happen.


Skills & Requirements


What you'll need



  • a Bachelor, Master or PhD degree level in IT related study;

  • extremely well-developed analytical skills, smartness and stress resistance;

  • experience with Unix/Linux as well as Windows systems;

  • scripting skills (i.e. Python, Bash, PowerShell, SQL);

  • facilitating and enabling attitude, with a hands-on mentality;

  • to be a team player with excellent communication skills;

  • experience in data analysis is a plus.


What you’ll get


Optiver is above all a state of mind. We are looking for you when you believe in daily improvement, when you like to be seriously rewarded for your performance and when you easily adapt to change and enjoy some humour and fun. To be concrete, we offer excellent remuneration and great secondary benefits, such as an attractive profit sharing structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, even weekly chair massages and of course Friday afternoon drinks. We are used to guiding expats through their relocation and offer relocation packages and discounts on health insurance.


Interested?


The first step after applying for this job is an online (HackerRank) test assessing your problem solving and programming (in Python) skills. No prior trading knowledge needed.

item.title: Software Engineer at Dutchband B.V. (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Software Engineer
Amsterdam, fulltime

Zet jouw softwarekennis in voor het ontwikkelen van betaal- en toegangsoplossingen voor evenementen en festivals. Solliciteer als software engineer bij Dutchband.

Herinner jij je de consumptiemunten van de Zwarte Cross, Rock am Ring, Lowlands, Eurosonic, Mysteryland of Mañana Mañana? Of draag je het polsbandje nog van een van deze festivals? Dan zijn wij geen onbekende voor jou. Voor ruim 5.000 evenementen in Nederland en (soms ver) daarbuiten, verzorgt Dutchband deze en andere betaal- en toegangsoplossingen. Daar is slimme software voor nodig. Jij deelt als software engineer jouw kennis en goede ideeën met ons. Zo zetten we samen Dutchband verder op de kaart.

In samenwerking met Payfield hebben we de afgelopen vijftien jaar een leidende positie opgebouwd op het gebied van betalen en toegangscontrole op festivals en grote evenementen. Onze kracht? Eigen producten ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de wensen en eisen van onze klanten. En dat blijven we doen.

Maar dat kunnen we niet zonder jou. Dankzij jouw softwarekennis kunnen wij onze producten blijven verbeteren. Als onderdeel van ons R&D-team zorg je met slimme oplossingen er voor dat we de ontwikkeling van onze producten kunnen versnellen én dat deze nog beter functioneren.

Dit ben jij



  • Je hebt ervaring met projectmanagement.

  • Je hebt kennis van Python, softwarearchitectuur, C, C++ en GitLab.

  • Je hebt bij voorkeur kennis van het embedden van systemen zoals Atmel en Raspberries.

  • Je hebt affiniteit met elektronica.

  • Je bent zelfstandig, sociaal en communicatief.



Wat bieden wij



  • Werken aan het Oosterpark in hartje Amsterdam.

  • Flexibiliteit wat betreft werkplek en -tijden.

  • Ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.

  • Samenwerken met ervaren collega’s in een dynamisch team.

  • Dagelijks een goed verzorgde lunch.

  • Met je collega’s bootcampen of een yogales volgen.

  • Een marktconform salaris.


Solliciteren kan via het online sollicitatieformulier.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

item.title: Software-Entwickler (m/w) gesucht at MIOsoft DEUTSCHLAND GMBH (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Wer bist du?


Eine/n Software-Entwickler/in, die/der... 



  • begierig darauf ist, neue Technologien kennenzulernen und die eigenen handwerklichen   Fähigkeiten auszubauen

  • Erfahrung in Java hat und aufgeschlossen für neue Programmiersprachen ist

  • sich gerne mit den unterschiedlichsten Problemstellungen aus verschiedensten Branchen  auseinandersetzt

  • Lust auf echte Big Data hat


Wer sind wir? 



  • Wir sind ein kleines, offenes, motiviertes Team

  • und Big-Data Junkies. Wir sprechen Daten- Analyse /-Verarbeitung/-Qualität / -Migration / Streaming und und und... Hat es mit Daten zu tun, sind wir die Richtigen.

  • Wir bieten abwechslungsreiche Projekte in verschiedensten Branchen: von Telekommunikationskonzernen über Mittelständische Unternehmen bis zu kleinen Verlagen oder Krankenhäuser. 


Wie sind wir noch mal? 


MIOsoft ist ursprünglich in den USA entstanden, bei einem großen Fusionsprojekt zweier Versicherungen. Dabei mussten riesige Datenbestände aus verschiedensten Systemen in neue Systeme migriert werden. So entstand unsere eigens entwickelte Datenplattform MIOvantage. Soweit so langweilig. Aus dieser Geschichte entbrannte eine echte Leidenschaft für Daten, genauer Big Data, die uns bis heute treibt. 


Aus dieser Leidenschaft ist ein engagiertes Team entstanden, welches unkompliziert und pragmatisch an alle Herausforderungen herangeht. Dabei ist Teamwork der Schlüssel. 


Wir haben Spaß am gemeinsamen Ausdenken, Ausprobieren, Umsetzen, Optimieren oder Verwerfen und lernen gerne dazu. Jeder kann sich einbringen, um sich, sein Team und MIOsoft voranzubringen. 


Woran arbeiten wir?


Unsere Projektbandbreite ist sehr vielfältig. Von Streaming, IoT, Datenmigration, Datenqualitätsanalysen, hauseigene Produktentwicklungen bis hin zu gelegentlichen Mobile App Entwicklungen haben wir schon alles gemacht. 


Auch die Branchen der Kunden, für die wir bisher gearbeitet haben, sind sehr vielfältig. Große Telekommunikationsunternehmen, kleine Krankenhäuser, weltweit tätige Großkonzerne, die sich um ihre Corporate Security sorgen, bis hin zu Telefonbuchverlagen. Dadurch bekommen wir Einblicke in verschiedenste Domänen. 


Wie wir arbeiten? 


Bei uns wird eigenverantwortlich in kleinen Teams von zwei bis drei Entwicklern gearbeitet. Grundsätzlich wird in kurzen Iterationen entwickelt, mit möglichst viel Austausch mit dem Kunden,


damit sich beide Seiten an der Projektgestaltung beteiligen. Dabei werden die weiteren Schritte oft von unseren Erkenntnissen aus der Datenanalyse mitbestimmt. So können wir das liefern, was unsere Kunden brauchen, obwohl sie es vielleicht davor selbst nicht geahnt haben. 


Wir legen großen Wert auf Lernen durch Reflexion und Austesten. Wenn sich im Projektverlauf herausstellt, dass eine gewählte Architektur nicht mehr passt, dann wird sie eben verworfen und mit dem gewonnenen Wissen neu gestartet. Das gehört bei uns zur Unternehmenskultur. 


Womit wir arbeiten? 


Wir arbeiten häufig mit unserer Datenplattform MIOvantage. Sie ist in der Lage, verteilt über dutzende Server terabyteweise Daten zu analysieren. Je nach Projekt und Kundenanforderungen können diese Daten durchgehend per Streaming oder einmalig für Datenanalysen verarbeitet werden. 


Neben dieser Skalierbarkeit ermöglicht uns die Plattform viele übliche Datenverarbeitungsschritte direkt per Klick durchzuführen. Das macht uns gleich zu Beginn des Projektes schnell und stark. Wenn man etwas tiefer in die Entwicklung mit MIOvantage gehen will, wird man noch die etwas ältere Programmiersprache Smalltalk anwenden müssen. Eine Schnittstelle für Java ist aber auch gegeben. 


Wir entwickeln jedoch zunehmend mit neuen Open Source Technologien, zum Beispiel Hadoop, Kafka, Spark und Storm, die wir bereits in mehreren Projekten angewendet haben. 


In unseren neueren Stacks kommt hauptsächlich Java zum Einsatz. Was die Front-End Entwicklung angeht, so setzen wir auf den klassischen Ansatz mit HTML/JS/CSS zusammen mit AngularJS. Wobei wir seit einiger Zeit TypeScript und LESS evaluieren. 


Regelmäßig erkunden wir neue Tools und Lösungen. Informatik ist ein breites Feld und wir lernen täglich dazu. Daher brauchen wir auch Verstärkung. Vieles kannst du von uns lernen bzw. bei uns neu entdecken. Gerne lernen wir aber auch von dir. 


Wieso wir dich brauchen? 


Unser kleines Team steht aktuell vor einer großen Herausforderung. Wir wollen unsere neuen Produktentwicklungen vorantreiben uns suchen dafür motivierte Verstärkung. Es kommt dabei nicht auf deine Ausbildung oder deinen Werdegang an. Ob frischer Absolvent, alt eingesessener Senior Entwickler oder Quereinsteiger. Für uns zählt deine Kompetenz und nicht woher du kommst.


Was kannst du einbringen? 


Du solltest eine echte Neugier für Neues mitbringen! Wir sind aber auch gespannt, was wir von dir lernen können. Wir sind immer offen für neue Praktiken und Tools, mit denen wir unsere Herausforderungen eleganter und effizienter lösen können. 


Am liebsten wäre uns eine geübte Unterstützung im Open-Source und Streaming-Bereich (wie oben erwähnt z.B Kafka, Spark, usw.). Gerne nehmen wir Java-Entwickler auf, oder vielleicht Python, oder eben Spezialisten in den verschiedensten Frontend-Skripten. 


Natürlich darf auch die Lust auf Big Data nicht fehlen. 


Wir wünschen uns, dass du gut im Team, aber auch eigenverantwortlich, arbeiten kannst, sowie gut und selbst organisiert bist. Analytisches aber auch kreatives Denken ist in datenzentrierten Projekten sehr wichtig. 


Was bieten wir dir? 


Neben einem spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Job in der objektiv schönsten Stadt Deutschlands bieten wir dir einen top ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz in einem modernen Büro in der Hamburger Hafencity. Neben dem Technischen gibt es natürlich auch gute Verpflegung, Kaffee, kalte Getränke, Tees, Snacks und frisches Obst stehen immer zur Verfügung. 


Regelmäßige Mitarbeitergespräche, sowie persönliche Weiterentwicklung und Fortbildung sind für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit. 


Da wir ein internationales Team sind, tauschen wir uns regelmäßig mit unseren Kollegen in den USA und China aus. Reisen an die Standorte unserer Kollegen kommen auch schon mal vor. 


Gerne unternehmen wir auch gemeinsam etwas, ob ein leckeres Abendessen, Rum-Tasting oder ein Besuch in der Elbphilharmonie - wir finden immer einen Grund zu feiern. 


Darüber hinaus bieten wir ein kostenloses Fitness Abo in einem neuen modernen Studio direkt um die Ecke des Büros. 


Ein HVV-Abo für die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel steht zur Verfügung. 


Auch an die betriebliche Altersvorsorge wird gedacht!  


Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?


Sende uns deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und Angaben zu deiner Verfügbarkeit. Individuelle Fragen beantwortet dir


Frau Junik unter 040/6887461-10 oder per Email unter bewerbungen@miosoft.de.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at AlphaSights (London, UK)
item.description:
You’ll join our Billing and & Payments team which creates our financial infrastructure, aggregates data across all aspects of our business, and allows us to operate. You’ll build tools to issue invoices, execute payments to people in over 100 countries, and record every cent as it moves through our company.


As a Software Engineer at AlphaSights you will:



  • Write high quality and maintainable code primarily in Ruby and JavaScript, with the opportunity to bring in new languages that fit, and using Postgres as the main data store.

  • Build software to meet the needs of our growing business.

  • Work in a project team with two week iterations and be part of iteration planning and retros.

  • Collaborate with and understand all other functions of AlphaSights to make thoughtful and creative software decisions.

  • Influence processes/workflows, product direction, and technology decisions.

  • Pair with teammates, review PRs, help others with technical questions & share your own learnings, and be a part of growing the team.

  • Learn to master a specific part of the stack, e.g., UI/UX, microservices, DevOps, etc. with the opportunity to take on product and/or technical leadership over time.


Skills & Requirements


At AlphaSights, we value diversity and individuality. Drawing on a range of experiences and perspectives better equips us to solve challenging problems. We believe you’ll be successful in this role if you:



  • Have 4+ years of experience developing web applications and/or programming with languages similar to Ruby, Javascript, Python, Java, etc.

  • Are able to understand difficult technical problems and develop end to end solutions.

  • Enjoy collaborating and making teammates better by teaching and mentoring.

  • Have excellent communications skills and are fluent in English.

  • Take responsibility for leaving things in better shape than you found them.


If you don’t meet these exact requirements, but feel like you have qualities and experiences commensurate with with the above, feel free to apply below.

item.title: Software Engineer Data Mining at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

We’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and to match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 1,000,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!



Your responsibilities:



  • Provide the data core to make our slogan, “We know everything about hotels”, come true.

  • Increase quality and quantity of metadata by developing new automated intelligent processes.

  • Write clean, composable, and testable code and extend our current codebase developed in PHP, Java and Python.

  • Participate in architecture decisions and innovative feature development tasks.

  • Use your creativity and problem solving abilities to make a difference.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields according to the motto: “You build it, you run it”.

item.title: Low-Latency Systems Engineer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Within trading, having the best IT solutions is the only way to be successful as a market maker on electronic markets. Which hardware to use, how to use it, the software setup; everything has to be perfect. Our trading infrastructure is a web of distributed systems spanning various locations across the world. Huge amounts of data and low latency systems come together in ways previously unimaginable.


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for engineers who consider this puzzle an interesting challenge. You get to know your systems inside-out, aware of every little detail that matters. You like autonomy in your job; you are the expert, you decide.


The first step in the process of applying for this job is an online (HackerRank) test assessing your engineering mindset and (python) coding skills. No prior trading knowledge needed.

item.title: Theoretischer Informatiker (m/w) at CID GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen Sie als Theoretischer Informatiker (m/w) zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Festanstellung an unseren Standorten in Freigericht und Berlin.


Ihre Aufgaben


Die CID GmbH bietet mit den Produkten Topic Analyst und CORPUS Software-Pakete u.a. für die Bereiche Competitive Intelligence, Knowledge Management, Enterprise Search, Technology Monitoring sowie Patentanalysen an. Hierzu betreiben wir die notwendige Forschung in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Knowledge Management, Content Extraction, Information Presentation und Big Data Analysis.


Ihre Aufgaben beinhalten u.a. die Entwicklung von Algorithmen zur Analyse sowohl von strukturierten als auch unstrukturierten Daten. Insbesondere die Kombination aus klassischen Data-Mining-Methoden und vorhandenen NLP-Algorithmen stellt eine wesentliche Komponente Ihrer Arbeit dar. Sie nehmen die prototypische Umsetzung der entworfenen Algorithmen sowie die Übergabe derselben an das sehr gut qualifizierte Entwicklungsteam vor.

item.title: Lead Developer - Help Fight Cancer with AI at Optellum (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Are you ready to join the fight against cancer and improve the lives of millions?  


Do you want to work with machine learning technologies that will redefine medicine?


Join the Optellum team and help us shape the cancer care of tomorrow!


Lead Software Developer / Senior Software Developer (Full-Stack)


Your Mission: Would you like to



  • Help bring to market AI solutions that will improve cancer care in thousands of hospitals?

  • Build up our software products from the ground up, and have massive impact from Day One?

  • Create infrastructure that will turn thousands of Terabytes of medical data into novel biomarkers?


Required Skills: You must have



  • Proven ability to design software architectures and to develop products from the ground up.

  • Proven ability to establish the dev environment from scratch (choose tools, technologies).

  • Strong ability to code modern algorithms (in Python, C++, or similar), with a focus on code quality.

  • Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and platforms (Amazon AWS, Azure, GCE or similar)

  • Strong communication skills and the flexibility to feel at home in a start-up, as one of the first employees and the first full-time developer working closely with the founders.


Desirable Skills: One or more of these would be a definite plus



  • Experience from a startup or a fast-growing company a plus.

  • Open-source activity and community leadership (presentations at meetups, conferences)

  • Passion for biomedical topics a big plus.

  • Degree in a quantitative discipline a small plus (e.g. CS, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry...).

  • Experience in any of these is a plus: health IT (e.g. HL7, FHIR); computer vision, machine learning, deep learning (e.g. TensorFlow), big data (e.g. Spark) – but you can also learn from us!


What We Offer



  • Fast growth & ownership as one of first employees

  • Freedom to choose technologies and equipment.

  • Professional development: grow your knowledge of AI/ML and other new technologies.

  • Competitive salary and benefits which will grow with the company, including significant equity.

  • Flexible working hours from the outset. Working location may be negotiable in the future.

  • Work permit sponsorship to the most exceptional candidates

  • Beautiful office in Oxford’s historical center with a great quality of life

  • Great transport connectivity: just 5 min walk to train station, 1h to central London.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Deliveroo (London, UK)
item.description:
Hi there!

Before roo-viewing pe-roosing interp-rooting reading this job advert, we want you to know that it's intended for you to see how we work, and decide if we're right for you. Research shows that a significant number of people decide not to apply to jobs based on the requirements listed in the advert; if you see something here that you're not expert level or even relatively skilled at... good! You can learn here. It's also best that you aren't brilliant at everything, as we don't hire ninjas or wizards. Other than those, we're very inclusive. If you think Deliveroo could be a great place for you, apply!


So Why Work For Us?


Training and Development:


We’re all about helping you reach your full potential, and as a business, we never stop learning. We’ll give you a budget for machinery, conferences, books, online courses, and whatever else you need to develop and learn new skills to help keep Deliveroo ahead of the rest.


Diversity:


We’re a global business, so it’s extremely important to us that our team and environment offer a great environment for all types of people. We’re not your average startup bro monoculture.


Working effectively:


We encourage each product team to get involved in suggesting the most effective way to get things done. We utilise best practices to make sure everything we do is a collective effort, and we encourage everyone to take an interest of all areas of the business; not a designer, but you’ve thought of a way to more effectively present a map? The design team are all ears! No code monkeys here, it’s all part of the whole “reach your full potential” stuff we mentioned earlier.


Making you comfortable:


Output, not input. It’s not a problem if you need a little leeway in the way you work, in fact if it helps you out, we’re all for it. We’ve got a cycle to work scheme in place, allow for flexible working hours, and are happy for you to work from home on occasion.


Having fun!


If it’s Monday, chances are somebody has baked something delicious over the weekend and brought it in to share with the team. Some of us like sharing our current favourite reads. Some of us like to work out in the park at lunch, some of us prefer to...you know...eat lunch at lunch. Some of us love posting photos of our kids on Workplace. We’re a sociable bunch, and we love to chill out as a team on Friday afternoon Product Huddles after a solid week’s work.


The Team


At Deliveroo we’re striving to build London’s best engineering organisation.


Our teams are solving unique and difficult problems at scale in an energetic and hyper-growth environment. We’re growing incredibly quickly, and we need experienced Platform Engineers to help our platform engineering team to innovate and scale.


As a Platform Engineer, you will play a key role within our Product team. We have a "customer-first, live service-first" mindset, and we enable our teams to affect change with speed, ease & confidence. The reliability of our Deliveroo service, innovation in our production platform, and "engineer happiness" in our toolchain are our biggest priorities. You will need excellent software development or systems engineering skills, a passion for solving the problems of our fellow engineers, to enjoy working in a constantly evolving start-up, and steering the strategic direction of crucial functions like service reliability and infrastructure management.


Responsibilities:



  • You'll work in our Platform Engineering team, utilising AGILE best practice

  • You'll build platform products and tools and improve existing ones (tech products that is...not meals)

  • You'll take part in decisions related to how we undertake new projects

  • You'll gather requirements and scope out projects with the rest of the team

  • You'll work closely with our fellow engineers, designers, QA and others


Requirements



  • Pride in readable, well-designed, well-tested software OR scripts

  • Experience with TDD environments (RSpec, Minitest, Capybara, Selenium)

  • Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and key-value stores (Memcache, Redis)

  • 2 or more years professional experience writing web-based applications and a willingness to quickly get up to speed on our stack (Ruby/Rails, Python or Scala)


OR



  • 2 or more years professional “DevOps” experience managing toolchains and cloud-based production environments and a willingness to quickly get up to speed on our stack (Ruby/Rails, Python or Scala)


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with containerisation and infrastructure management in a large engineering org

  • Experience with AWS or Azure clouds and the relevant “DevOps” services and tools



  • Experience in designing, analysing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems

  • Experience with front-end web technology, bonus points for React

  • Experience with web architecture at scale (20krpm and above)

  • Experience with PostGIS, or any geography-heavy applications

  • Experience with "NoSQL" data backends (Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch)

  • Experience with Go or Elixir

  • Experience with Ruby and/or Rails

  • Experience solving logistical problems with software


Benefits



  • Working on an amazing product that is loved and used by millions

  • Fantastic exposure to scaling a tech team at an incredible pace

  • Top end machinery

  • Conferences, we're all about professional development

  • Subsidised gym membership at a proper fancy gym down the road

  • Regular off-sites with the team, as well as game nights, and the legendary “Bun-day Monday”

  • Located within easy reach of several incredible restaurants

  • Food. So much food. Nom Nom

item.title: PHP Engineer at 3D Hubs (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to help build THE 3D printing solution that engineers and designers around the world will love to use?


With a network of 3D printers in over 7,000 locations and 160 countries, 3D Hubs provides over 1 billion people with access to a 3D printer within 10 miles of their location.


Why join now? In the coming weeks we'll cross the magical number of 1 million parts printed since the inception of our platform, with close to 1,000,000 parts being printed every month you could help us scale up our teams to achieve the next growth stage.


We are looking for an experienced PHP Developer that has worked on Drupal projects. The challenge for the short term is twofold: assist us in integrating internal (Python/Rust) services in our current Drupal application and migrating parts of our Drupal application to our Python API. So you find it exciting to deep dive into other languages, like Python and Rust.


As an engineer in the 3D Hubs team you work on the core engine behind our platform. You will be responsible for building new features, creating tests and improving performance for the overall platform. You'll work in multidisciplinary teams on projects which directly impact our customers and the company's growth. Within these projects you'll have the freedom to set your own priorities closely together with the project-team.



Projects
Because 3D printing is a rapidly evolving industry, we find ourselves learning and educating at the same time, this means iterations have to be fast-paced. You'll be able to rapidly A/B test different solutions with our customers and suppliers, helping you to find the ones that works best.


You will help craft features that are groundbreaking and accelerating the entire Additive Manufacturing industry. But most of all, you will be building a unique experience for engineers, designers and architects that use 3D printing to prototype their next big idea. Don't be surprised when you get hit by goosebumps when engineers from NASA, Tesla or DARPA give you kudos on your latest features, helping them to be more productive and prototype even faster.


Our challenges are threefold; e-commerce, a market place and 3D printing. These combined allow you to apply your skills in a complex environment and solve meaningful customer problems daily.

Team
You'll join a truly international engineering team with backgrounds ranging from computational geometry to data science. Don’t worry if you don’t have any knowledge of 3D printing yet, because you will join a culture that is centered around learning.
Whether it’s Agile, lean thinking or continuous delivery, we are open to new methodologies of delivering projects, as long as they improve our clock speed.
Together we build scalable solutions and literally change the way manufacturing will work in the future.


Find out more about the company culture and the people behind 3D Hubs here!


At 3D Hubs, we don’t care about the source of your education or your traditional shiny resume, we care about you and your abilities.



Out tech stack



  • PHP (Drupal 7/Composer)

  • Python (Flask/SQLAlchemy)

  • PostgreSQL

  • RabbitMQ

  • ES6 (Angular, Three.js)

  • Sass / Pug

  • Docker

  • AWS: EC2, S3, RDS etc


You



  • Have experience with larger Drupal platforms

  • Get excited by shipping your solutions and getting them validated by users

  • Are eager to teach your colleagues and share knowledge inside and outside the team

  • You value simplicity versus over engineering (KISS)

  • Enjoy a vibrant, creative and ever changing environment


Perks



  • Budget for training and conferences

  • Free 3D printing, anytime, at our office or on our platform

  • Real impact on our technical roadmap

  • Flat structure and no political games

  • Work in a lean, mean, startup environment

  • Be productive in an office space designed for developer happiness.

  • Not to mention it is located in the heart of Amsterdam

  • Join a fast growing, international team of 50+ people and 17+ nationalities

  • Get time to work on your own projects at our Pizza Nights

  • Free lunch, Friday activities and awesome annual trips

item.title: Ingénieur DevOps: automatisation, cloud public/privé, sécurité (H/F) at Antidot (Lambesc, France)
item.description:
Mission :



  • Au sein d’une équipe agile, vous participez au développement et au maintien en condition opérationnelle de l’infrastructure utilisée pour opérer nos solutions logicielles. Elle est constituée de nos propres serveurs (plusieurs centaines de machines physiques) et de machines dans des clouds publics. 

  • Vous voulez gérer des troupeaux de "cattle" et pas maintenir en vie des "pet"

  • Vous aimez utiliser des outils modernes et êtes force de proposition 

  • Vous partagez notre philosophie selon laquelle tout ce qui peut être automatisé doit l’être. Vous utilisez les technologies à l’état de l’art du développement, de la gestion de configuration et du déploiement logiciel. Vous êtes curieux, en veille permanente, et force de proposition.

  • Vous fournissez aux développeurs l’ensemble des informations nécessaires à la compréhension de l’utilisation de l’infrastructure par le logiciel. Vous échangez avec les équipes de développement du produit pour améliorer nos solutions.


Les défis du poste :



  • Faites tout pour ne plus rien avoir à faire ! Si nécessaire, passez-y trois fois plus de temps, mais faites-en sorte de ne pas avoir à y revenir.

  • Automatisez tout, monitorez tout et faites du déploiement « vraiment » continu.

  • Développez le logiciel de l’infrastructure, avec les mêmes outils, les mêmes méthodes, le même niveau de qualité et de validation que nos produits.

  • Remettez en cause vos connaissances, essayez de nouvelles solutions, butinez du côté de l’open source et n’hésitez pas à contribuer.


Skills & Requirements


Les compétences recherchées :



  • Rigueur et Efficacité : le travail sous pression (liée à la production) et dans des délais courts ne vous effraie pas.

  • Flexibilité et Ouverture d’esprit : vous n’avez pas de préjugés, vous cherchez pour chaque problème la « bonne » solution, le bon langage, le bon outil.

  • Passion : vous êtes passionné par votre travail, toujours à l’écoute des nouvelles technologies open source, prêt à aller faire un tour au Fosdem.

  • Collaboration : vous adorez travailler en équipe. Vous aimez apprendre, partager, relire et même challenger le code des autres.

  • Innovation : docker 1.13 est déjà installé sur votre machine (à côté de lxd).

  • Votre Anglais est fluide, à l’écrit comme à l’oral.

item.title: * Backend master to develop robust, scalable cloud backends * at Qvik (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
HEAD IN THE CLOUD(S)?


We’re again looking for a Backend Developer or cloud expert to join our crew! You’re either a medior or a senior level backend master, and you know your way around the essentials such as Node.js, Python and Go. You love building and designing infrastructures, and basically kick ass in anything that runs on the App Engine – Python also being relevant in data analysis and machine learning, of course. Google Cloud Platform is our choice of cloud so as a plus you might already be familiar with it or managed platforms.


 You will be using your heavy tech and problem-solving skills to ensure foolproof backends for our clients' services in the, e.g., fintech, media or travel industries. In addition to coding, you will be mentoring your juniors, consulting our clients and attending the most intriguing events in the field. We’ll provide you with the tools that you need and the opportunity to develop your skills further, as well as the freedom to come up with your own ways to create infra. We’re not fond of sticking to “the good old times”.


We have many interesting projects starting and our clients expect nothing but the best from us. Therefore, we expect you to have experience, opinions and skills to prove your point. In addition to, of course, a hunger to work with the coolest clients in Finland and the Nordics. Also, Finnish skills are seen as a plus, depending on the client, in some cases even mandatory.


INTERESTED?


Our office is located in the heart of Helsinki in Kamppi shopping center office spaces.


We offer our low hierarchy culture; opportunities to try, fail and succeed; as well as a chance for you to concentrate on your actual work. That’s what you would come here for, right?


Our benefits package is also pretty nice with the work equipment of your choice; lunch coupons; commuter, culture and sports benefits; occupational health care with extra insurance; company-paid massage; and many sports and hobby possibilities with other Qvikies.


In addition to many work-related guilds and other development opportunities, we arrange a lot of internal and external get-togethers and events throughout the year, in Finland and abroad.


Send an application - We’ll fill the positions as soon as we find the right match!

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at F-Secure (Helsingfors, Finland)
item.description:
In Security Research and Technologies, we do everything from back end systems architecture to low-level kernel driver development, scan engine development and reverse engineering to artificial intelligence. Although the tasks we work on are varied, there's one thing we all have in common - what we do is meaningful and impactful. And you’ll be working with some of the best technical security people in the world.


Our Software Engineers in Test design, implement, and improve test infrastructure with the aim of guaranteeing optimal releases of our protection technologies. These technologies, which include static scanners and behavioral engines, need to be bulletproofed against threat-actor-crafted objects, and must not increase our customers’ attack surface.


In this position, you’ll work alongside a hardcore group of engineers and researchers at the forefront of cyber security. Their mission is to come up with tech to catch tomorrow’s attacks today.




We’re looking for candidates that demonstrate the following traits:



  • An individual with a quality-driven mindset who takes pride in their work

  • Experience with the design of complex systems

  • Experience with scripting languages, particularly Python

  • Experience with virtualization and cloud computing

  • Knowledge of the Windows operating system is a plus

  • Project management experience is a plus

item.title: Data Engineer / Data Scientist (m/f) at Project A (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• You will help our business intelligence team to build data driven applications for our ventures: data warehouses, recommendation engines and CRM systems (developed in-house, based on open-source technologies). See https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EVMvC9Ov6Vw for an overview of how we do this

  • You will integrate data from various systems into flexible and consistent representations. You will make sure that all people and IT systems in the organisation have an easy access to the data through various front-ends and interfaces

  • You will advance our software architecture and tool set to growing challenges and data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team


Skills & Requirements



  • You have at least a master's degree in computer science or a comparable qualification

  • You have a genuine interest in data and algorithms and you are excited about solving difficult problems. You strive for efficient and robust solutions

  • You master at least these basic tools of computer science: object oriented programming in multiple languages, HTTP and current web technologies, the unix command line and basic server administration, version control systems, a basic understanding of the interplay between software and memory, hard discs and the CPU

  • You have profound knowledge about the inner workings of database systems.

  • You are eager to delve into new technologies and programming languages (our current stack: Mac or Linux, PostgreSQL, Mondrian, MDX, Python, Java, Php, ElasticSearch)

  • You have a basic understanding of mathematics and machine learning

item.title: Mission-Driven Junior Full Stack Developer at Apolitical (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a junior developer to join our engineering team, building the Apolitical platform; a global network for government, helping public servants find the ideas, people and partners they need to solve the hardest challenges facing our societies.


You will report to the Head of Engineering, whilst working closely with all members of the Apolitical team - from the content department to the community and growth staff. You will initially start in a small team of 2-3 developers, however we are expanding rapidly and you should enjoy the prospect of being part of a bigger team within the next year.


Constant learning is an essential part of technology, and as a junior developer you will have the opportunity to learn from our own experienced engineering team, as well as senior technology advisors from high profile companies who can provide mentoring and advice.


You ensure the highest quality code is delivered in line with product cycles, and keep flexibility, security and our unique and influential user base front-of-mind at all times. You are comfortable with agile methodology and thrive working in a team whilst still being comfortable in a distributed company. Challenges excite rather than discourage you, and you are a creative force on the team; proactively suggesting ideas on multiple aspects of the business and the platform. You have a genuine appetite for staying abreast of new technologies and bring this to the table as Apolitical continues to integrate advanced tools such as machine learning into the platform.


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for full stack developers who are committed to writing strong, sustainable, clean code. Our team will obsess over millisecond improvements, and be constantly thinking about the user experience of our features. 


Language experience; one or more of the following:



  • Node

  • React

  • Python

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Go


Other experience:



  • Experience with both backend and frontend development 

  • Minimum 2 to 3 years’ experience

  • Understanding of end to end processes that underpin delivery of a web app, from UX research to Quality Assurance

  • Knowledge of RDBMS database concepts and SQL

  • Experience in agile development

  • Deeply committed to security, the protection of our users and the preservation of their trust in Apolitical 

  • Bachelor's degree (preferred)


Helpful experience:



  • Machine learning

item.title: Research Engineer for Simulation-based Machine Learning for Autonomous Driving at Robert Bosch GmbH (Renningen, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence (BCAI) provides solutions and services in AI technologies to Bosch's business units in mobility, consumer good, industrial technology, and smart buildings. The center works in collaboration with a large team of researchers, engineers, and software providers. We are now hiring Machine Learners for Autonomous Driving, offering a fascinating job in a team of highly motivated top experts in one of the most exciting areas of technology.


See https://www.bosch-ai.com for more information.


Your contribution:


Development, implementation and maintenance of a modular AI-based simulation framework for autonomous driving applications:
- Requirements analysis for both machine learning research as well as business customer requirements
- Derivation of a modular software architecture
- Interfacing with existing solutions
- clean, efficient, and well-documented implementation of the simulation framework
- development and implementation of test scenarios for both the simulation platform as well as machine learning algorithms
- integration of machine learning algorithms into the simulation framework
- code preparation for evaluation, use, and rollout
Support our research scientists in developing new machine learning approaches, in particular reinforcement learning and probabilistic modeling


Your expertise:


- Master in software engineering, computer science, data science, or related subjects; PhD is a plus
- Excellent programming skills, in particular Python, C++
- Proven practical experience in machine learning algorithms and principles, in particular reinforcement learning and deep learning
- Proven experience in industrial production-quality software development and maintenance
- Experience with Windows systems, experience with Linux is a plus
- Strong team player, highly self-motivated, interested in advancing the state of the art in machine learning modeling methods
- Strong English skills, motivation to work in an international team

item.title: Technical Test Engineer at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are interested in talking to people who want to develop bespoke test systems for a wide range of Products. This may include:



  • Developing functional tests for cloud or SaaS applications

  • Developing frameworks and system tests for Satellite devices and ecosystem

  • Developing UI automation for consumer products

  • Developing scalable simulators for load testing

  • Developing automated unit and integration tests for ongoing regression testing


Ideally you will have knowledge and experience of some of the following:



  • Developing test approaches for server side, database driven Software as a Service applications

  • Experience writing tests in NodeJS, Python, Java or .NET (we use NodeJS and Python)

  • Exposure to technologies like REST, AMQP, RabbitMQ, CoAP, PKI, Virtual Machines, Docker, Ansible, Puppet, Chef

  • Database experience of MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, Mongo DB, Cassandra and Redis

  • Networking technologies including IPv6, DNS, HTTP/HTTPS, proxying

  • Mobile or Satellite communication protocols

  • Developing test environments for prototype embedded devices

  • Testing using various techniques including exploratory approaches


Minimum requirements



  • You will have a good degree in a relevant subject such as computer science, software engineering or similar engineering or scientific subject

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English

  • Experience of some of the technologies outlined above


You’ll get to work with multi-disciplinary teams of software engineers, front-end developers, user experience and service designers, mathematicians, test engineers and DevOps engineers.


The team is working with clients from around the globe to deliver novel solutions to the everyday needs of individuals and businesses alike.  You’ll get to work with our clients to understand and realise their requirements and deliver truly exciting new applications.


We are hiring at all levels.

item.title: Junior, Medior & Senior Embedded Software Designers at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction


ASML is leading in the worldwide development, production and sales of high end lithography systems for the semiconductor industry. Worldwide over 10.000 people work at ASML, with important settlings in the United States, Asia and the head office in Veldhoven. The employees of ASML share the passion for technology with a customer focus. At ASML one works ongoing for the further development and implementation of complex and high-quality technological systems. Working at ASML is therefore challenging and extremely dynamic. To remain successful the company has ambitious objectives and high standard requirements.


Within ASML, the sector Development and Engineering is responsible for the specification, design, integration, qualification, and sustaining of all ASML products.


Job Mission


You are happy to make things work and to build great applications which in turn will make things move and will insure extremely precise calibrations.


You will be responsible for writing clean and highly functional code for several stages of our machines such as the lenses and the wafer stages.


You enjoy seeing things move by the code that you generate, regardless if you have to write code in C, C++ or Python – to you, the results count.


Job Description


You will be responsible for creating clear specifications, making the efficient design choices and to 'make it happen' by also implementing the design. Customer satisfaction is the number one driver for ASML and thus for every software engineer.


You will design, analyze, document and test the required software specifications.


You will use C/C++, Python, object oriented design programming and Linux within a highly complex embedded environment.


You will work in a multidisciplinary environment, involving physics, mechatronics, customer support and factory departments.


Education


Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Embedded Systems or equivalent experience.


Experience


We are expanding our embedded software development teams and we are looking for junior, medior and senior embedded software design engineers to join our company.


Software engineer with 0-10 years of experience in large-scale software applications - embedded programming.


Key competencies for this role are Unix/Linux, C, C++, UML, real-time, Python, VxWorks, Matlab.


Solid software engineering knowledge: Agile, Scrum, UML, OOP, design patterns.


Personal skills


You are seeking to work in a precise and challenging department.


You are quality-driven and you are looking for an environment where your technical skills will be enhanced and your ideas will be put to the test.


You are not afraid to debate technical aspects within the team because you know that we will always choose the best solution.


You want to be a part of a dynamic and challenging environment that leaves no room for errors in the live environment.


You are passionate about robotics and you would like be a part of our teams who are building large scale applications for large machines which in their turn, have a global usability.


Other Information


Applications sent by email cannot be processed.

item.title: Data Scientist Analytics Paid Relocation & Visa to Amsterdam at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.


There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialise after work almost every Friday.


B.responsible



  • Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights.  

  • Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.

  • Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.

  • Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.

  • Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.


Skills & Requirements


B.skilled



  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role

  • Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigour

  • Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)

  • Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, and/or R.

  • Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders

item.title: Senior Cloud Architect for Enterprise infrastructure projects m/f at Cloudreach (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.


Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation”. We do this by helping our customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build  one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.


Our office is located in the heart of Berlin, a short stroll away from Friedrichstraße. See what our employees love about Cloudreach: Life at Cloudreach


Which team will you be part of?


As a Cloud Architect you are part of the Cloud Enablement team. Our Cloud Enablement team helps provide consultative, architectural, program and engineering support for our customers' journeys to the cloud. The word 'Enablement' was chosen carefully, to encompass the idea that we support and encourage a collaborative approach to Cloud adoption, sharing best practices, helping change the culture of teams and strategic support to ensure success. Our Cloud Architects play a key role in designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions to our customers.


How will you spend your days ?


We are looking for a Cloud Architect to drive the adoption of Cloudreach services and to inspire customers to innovate using public cloud. We firmly believe that the technical leadership we provide as architects is only as good as our experiences implementing solutions within the industry.


You will be :



  • Focusing on one or more strategic customers to ensure a successful delivery of value.

  • Leading and being deeply involved in the hands-on technical delivery of customer projects

  • Driving solution architecture and best practices by:


    • Contributing to Cloudreach internal tooling

    • Producing white papers and best practices guides

    • Mentoring other fellow Cloud Architects

    • Producing public facing content such as blog posts and presentations

    • Implementing PoC’s making use of innovative technology by evaluating trending technologies


  • Enabling clients to visualise the possibilities of leveraging public cloud and the path to get there.

  • Willing to travel to customer sites when focusing on delivery

  • Constantly investigating and evaluating industry trends


What kind of career progression can you expect?


You can grow into a Cloud Consultant role, step into a managerial position acting as Architect Lead on customer projects or move into the Cloud Enablement Leader role to support internal teams. Lead positions bring to the fold rewarding mentorship opportunities.


There are also relocation opportunities to our other cloudy hubs.


 How to stand out?



  • Experience with architecting, designing, implementing, and supporting greenfield and/or migration projects using public cloud

  • Deep technical experience in one or more of the following competencies:


    • Software design or development (continuous delivery/integration, adoption of DevOps practices)

    • Systems Operations / Management

    • Enterprise Architecture

    • Infrastructure Design

    • IT Security and Governance

    • Automation and System Orchestration


  • You have experience with programming, preferably in Python, but at least, in a modern programming language such as Go, Ruby, Java, C++, Perl or .NET

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Customer facing experience of a consultative nature

  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)

  • Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • Monthly meal vouchers which you can use at local restaurants and supermarkets and a Cloudy Lunch on Fridays. Enjoy, it's on us!

  • Private medical and dental care package in addition to the German statutory health care.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.

item.title: Data Engineer at Infectious Media (London, UK)
item.description:
The Data Engineering team at Infectious Media forms the core of the Platform team, linking all the other departments together and facilitating simple, fast and robust data exchange between each and every system we use. We are looking for someone to develop and enhance the smooth day-to-day running of our data systems and contribute to ongoing best-practice development in the department. 



This position within the team provides someone with a great understanding of data and solid programming skills to manage and process the vastly increasing data volumes we are seeing (we record more than 200 million unique events each day), whilst at the same time looking at ways to streamline and improve our data handling processes and technologies to balance batch and real-time jobs. Infectious Media are leaders in the Real Time Bidding industry and data is the key to the cutting edge technology that we use. This role is essential for ensuring we use data in the best and most innovative ways possible.


Here's what we'd like you to do:

  • Managing the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes of the company to ensure they remain efficient and robust

  • Understanding the data warehousing needs of the company to help identify weaknesses in the current architecture and suggest improvements

  • Identifying and resolving data issues in a timely manner.

  • Maintaining a broad knowledge of all data systems the company utilises

  • Helping to improve the efficiency and reliability of data systems and processes by identifying areas that would benefit from automation, including testing

  • Working with other platform Analysts and Managers to support the introduction of new technologies and data streams

  • Working with the Insights team to support their understanding of the company’s data warehouses


This is what you'll have done already: 

  • Excellent understanding of database and data warehouse technologies, including standard row RDBMS, columnar RDBMS and some form of NoSQL (e.g. key-value, document, graph stores)

  • Excellent understanding of ETL techniques, including the reasons why data needs to be manipulated in this fashion

  • Good understanding of the differences in structure of databases and data warehouses and when to use which technologies for what tasks

  • Good level of understanding of Python with experience in automated testing, high code quality and other engineering best practises

  • Ability to quickly create workable solutions to technical problems.

  • Experience with using Google Cloud, BigQuery and their Data related API’s is a bonus

  • Knowledge of machine learning techniques such as logistic regression or random forests (desirable).

  • Computer Science (or similar such as Maths with Computer Science) degree plus 3+ years industry experience

item.title: Softwareentwickler für Fahrerassistenzsysteme (m/w) M1019 at BFFT Fahrzeugtechnik (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Spannende Aufgaben warten auf Dich


Zur Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung modernster Fahrerassistenzsysteme bist Du zuständig für die Programmierung von Tools und Software für unsere entsprechende Messtechnik. Dafür arbeitest Du mit verschiedenen Entwicklerwerkzeugen, unter Anderem mit Linux, Python, C++ und ADTF. Zum Test unserer neu entwickelten Fahrerassistenzfunktionen nutzen wir Rapid-Prototyping durch den kompletten Entwicklungsprozess.


Dein Know-how ist gefragt



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung

  • Gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung in C/C++

  • Kenntnisse in Python, ADTF und Objekterkennung von Vorteil

  • Erfahrung in der Trajektorienberechnung/Bahnplanung

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at TravelPerk (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Are you a software engineer with extensive programming and technical mentorship experience? Is your code fast, efficient and reliable? Do you particularly enjoy working with amazing people, having fun at work and building something awesome? If so, let’s talk!


TravelPerk is building a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel. Discover our stack here. 


As Principal Software Engineer you will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product, being a subject matter expert for many of the technologies we use.



As Principal Software Engineer, this position involves:



  • System architecture design, implementation and testing in a very hands-on approach.

  • Product development in Python, Django and React of a travel-related web-based product.

  • Integrations between our product to 3rd party APIs.

  • Work in an Agile environment with strong attention to a well-documented code, unit testing and continuous integration.

  • Being able to mentor/coach/train other colleagues as a domain expert.



Required skills and experience:



  • "Product Engineering" mindset.

  • Extensive experience in similar roles building technically complex products, ideally for more than 10 years.

  • Expert level both at server-side and at client-side development.

  • Experience writing highly efficient asynchronous code.

  • Obsession for quality and testing.

  • Eager to learn new technologies and frameworks.

  • Ability to benchmark, analyse and implement new technologies.

  • Strong communication skills (in English).



Bonus points for:



  • Experience in the travel industry.

  • DevOps experience with the AWS suite or similar.

  • Experience working in high-performing, Agile development teams.

  • People who like to build stuff (we really like people who maintain/contribute to open source projects).



What do we offer?



  • Continuous learning is encouraged and you are more than welcome to dedicate time to learn things that interest you, even if they are not directly related to the day to day tasks.

  • A fun, fast-paced experience that will allow you to grow as a professional.

  • 24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.

  • Competitive compensation plan.

  • “Flexible compensation plan” to help you diversify and increase the net salary.

  • Free coffee and beverages, fresh fruit and other breakfast stuff.



The Principal Software Engineer position requires full-time, in-house work in Barcelona, Spain. We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. No prior knowledge of Spanish is required.


TravelPerk is an equal opportunity employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

item.title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Paid Relocation & Visa to Amsterdam at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.


This product development team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.


As a Data Scientist you’ll work side by side with Developers, Designers and Product Owners, and take full ownership of your work – from the initial idea-generation phase to the implementation of the final product on our website. Our ideal candidate is result-focused, innovative and has solid quantitative background and a good business understanding.


B.responsible



  • Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles

  • Research & Development on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data

  • Actively contribute to taking Data Science at Booking.com to the next level

  • Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts


B.skilled



  • Minimum two years of relevant work experience

  • Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)

  • Excellent English communication skills; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders

  • Prior experience with a few of the following models: Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, (Deep) Neural Networks, Hidden Markov Models, Conditional Random Fields, Game Theory, Mechanism Design and/or Latent Dirichlet Allocation


Required



  • Experience with at least one scripting language, e.g. R, Octave, and one programming language, e.g. Python, Perl, C/C++, Java

  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases


Preferred



  • Experience implementing a real-world Recommender or Ranking system

  • Worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem

  • Implemented multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT has regular hackathons, trainings and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

item.title: Full Stack Software Design Engineer (C++) at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction


You are every inch a true developer!


The quality of your work is very important to you and you also want to work in a team with many specialists from various disciplines.


You are looking for a challenging, large-scale project and at the same time you want your work to impact millions of end users worldwide.


If the above describes what you would like to do at work, then we have the job you’ve been looking for!




Job Mission


As part of ASML’s LOT Data group, you will develop and build software solutions that are instrumental to have our lithographic machines operating very productive while maintaining nanometer accuracy and making sure that the system interfaces are consistent and in accordance with the industry high standards.



Since software is an integrating competency, it is an essential added value for ASML. You will be involved at all stages of the software development process; specifying, designing, testing and integrating the advanced software for use in our world-leading products.




Job Description


You will be responsible for creating clear specifications on requirements, making the efficient design choices, to 'make it happen' by also implementing the design and verify the implementation.


Next to this, you will be responsible for providing effort estimates for the work at hand and identify dependencies on others. Together with your team leader you will schedule your activities and agree on when to deliver the required specifications.


The software delivered is documented and qualified by means of automated test cases. 


You will interface with both internal and external clients. Our main core is data transformation and our group is linked to many other groups within the software cluster, therefore your work will be pivotal.




Education


Bachelor or Master level with an education in Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Informatics, Mechatronics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or comparable.




Experience


Demonstrable expertise in C, C++, Qt, object oriented programming, Unix/Linux, Solaris, Python, and software configuration management (ClearCase).


Experienced in working in (agile) team environment is highly desirable.


Experience with Model Driven Engineering is a plus.


At least 3 years of experience in software development, preferably related to large-scale software stacks.




Personal skills


You should first be passionate about technology and you should be excited by the idea that your work will impact millions of end-users worldwide.


We are looking for someone who has a deep technical experience but at the same time likes to communicate with other departments and wants to understand how complex systems work.


You should be analytical, product and quality-oriented.


You should have a keen eye for detail.


You are used to work in a highly complex and procedural environment. To you, proper code documentation is mandatory and you like to keep your work with a high level of structure and clarity.


You like to work in a team with many senior design engineers with whom you can exchange technical ideas and debate upon the best solution for each project.




Context of the position


Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering (D&E) is responsible for the development of ASML products. Within this sector the department Machine Control & Infrastructure (MCI) is responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of the software of the complex lithographic machines. ASML creates high tech machines; software engineers from MCI are facing several aspects of motion control, production control, data management and Interface control. A huge code base is maintained and under strict configuration management to provide maximum commonality between different machine types

item.title: Software engineer Image Processing Engineer at EPFL - Blue Brain Project (Genève, Suisse)
item.description:
The Blue Brain Project (BBP) applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing, and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease.


To strengthen the brain atlasing efforts in the Neuroinformatics team and address challenges in image processing petabyte-scale datasets, we are looking for a



Software engineer – Image Processing Engineer



Specific responsibilities include:




  • Develop and optimize image processing (artifact removal, warping, atlas alignment, etc) modules for large-scale image datasets using parallel computing.

  • Improve and streamline image processing workflows to accelerate the process and enable user interaction.

  • Automate the registration of results of data processing workflows into the Blue Brain data platform.

  • Collaborate with core IT services and HPC team to improve and optimize the computation performance.

  • Collaborate with neuroscientists on ongoing projects and suggest relevant image analysis, statistics and visualization solutions.

  • Implement best-practices for maintainable software development, including but not limited to: continuous integration, build, release, deployment process, managing services in various environments, documentation, adherence to and improvement of coding standards.



Experience and preferred skills:




  • Expertise in C++ and Python.

  • Experience with relevant projects in image processing, visualization, workflow development, etc.

  • Experience with image analysis and workflow tools (e.g. ImageJ/Fiji, 3D Slicer, Amira, etc.).

  • Experience with image processing libraries (e.g.   ITK, VTK, OpenCV, skimage, etc.).

  • Experience with high-performance computing (e.g. MPI, CUDA, Spark, etc.).

  • DevOps technologies (Jenkins, Puppet, Docker, OpenShift, OpenStack).



Experience in any of the following areas would be a plus:




  • Experience with managing and processing large-scale imaging datasets.

  • Knowledge in biological imaging and image format.

  • Relevant work experience in scientific domain, preferably in a setting involving direct interaction with researchers/scientists.

  • Knowledge in REST services and JSON data structure.

  • Experience with Java and Scala.


Profile:



  • Master degree or above in computer science or relevant fields, with focus on image processing.

  • At least 2 years experience of software development.

  • English written and spoken. French would be a plus.



What we offer:




  • An internationally visible and rising project in simulation-based research in neuroscience using supercomputers.

  • A young, dynamic, interdisciplinary, and international working environment.

  • A modern working environment, based at Biotech Campus in Geneva Sécheron.



Start date: as soon as possible; Deadline for application: until the position is filled


Activity rate: 100%; Duration of contract: 1 year, renewable; Ref: Software engineer – Image processing engineer



Applicants should submit a cover letter and a detailed CV in PDF format only, with file name “Surname_position applied to _Cover Letter” and “Surname_position applied to _CV” electronically to jobs.bbp@epfl.ch. Please use the position title and the reference in the “subject” field.
