item.title: Principal Social Policy Analyst at Greater London Authority (London, UK)
item.description:
46,556 per annum


Fixed Term


Ref: PSPA001



Would you like to join an ambitious and forward looking unit of analysts, researchers, data scientists and other experts, working for one of the world’s most diverse cities?



Our Intellience Unit is expanding our social evidence base to address the Mayor of London’s priorities on social integration and social mobility. We have the opportunity for someone to lead this work and apply their analytical knowledge and skills to improve the lives of Londoners.



You will benefit from the opportunity to build a centre of excellence on the measurement of social integration and social mobility. You will lead the creation of the GLA’s social evidence base, which brings together these and the inter-related issues such as of diversity and inclusion, and economic fairness.



You will be customer-focused and have experience in providing specialist analytical advice to policy teams implementing the strategies in these areas. You will have excellent data analysis skills with a track record of undertaking policy-focused analysis projects.



You will identify evidence gaps and develop a programme of research to fill these, using your experience of managing projects from conception to publication. Working alongside a range of GLA teams you will lead the development of a varied set of outputs to form our social evidence base (e.g. indicator frameworks, evidence summaries), ensuring that future policies are based on robust evidence and measurement.



This is a 2 year fixed term contract or secondment opportunity



We are committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We would welcome applications from candidates who are seeking part time work as these roles is open to job share.  We would also consider a reduced hour arrangement, the minium requirement would 30 hours per week (flexibility on days).



In addition to a good salary package, we offer an attractive range of benefits including 30 days’ annual leave, interest free season ticket loan, interest free bicycle loan, childcare voucher scheme and a career average pension scheme.



If you have a question about the role or the recruitment process then please contact a member of the recruitment team via email on glajobs@london.gov.uk quoting reference PSPA001.



To apply, please click on the apply button to visit our website.



Application closing date: Sunday 26 November at 23:59 GMT.


Interview date: Wednesday 6 and Thursday 7 December 2017.



London's diversity is its biggest asset and we strive to ensure our workforce reflects London's diversity at all levels. We welcome applications from everyone regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, faith or disability.

item.title: Developer (Business Intelligence) at RIEMSER Pharma GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Beschreibung


Um unser Business Intelligence Team in Berlin zu unterstützen, suchen wir einen Entwickler mit SQL Erfahrung.


Die Umgebung in der Sie arbeiten werden, besteht aus einem DWH sowie verschiedenen Frontend Tools. Auf DWH Ebene setzen wir für den ETL Apache Airflow und PostgreSQL ein. Die Aufbereitung der Daten geschieht in den Tools IBM Cognos TM1 und Arcplan. Hinzu kommt ein User Interface auf Basis von Django, welches User- und Admininterface für wesentliche Teile des Stacks bereitstellt. Große Teile der Infrastruktur liegen zudem als versionierter Code vor und können containerisiert sowie stateless per Ansible deployed werden. 


Ihre Aufgaben


Als Mitarbeiter im Business Intelligence Team übernehmen Sie die Umsetzung von Anforderungen der Stakeholder (Finance, Controlling, Marketing, Geschäftsführung, etc.) an die Datenverarbeitung. Dabei kann es sich sowohl um die Erstellung und Pflege von Auswertungen als auch um selbstdefinierte Modernisierungs- und Optimierungsaufgaben handeln. 


Ihr Profil



  • Kenntnisse in Python und SQL sind Vorraussetzung. 

  • Erfahrung mit der Verwaltung eines relationalen Datenbanksystems (vzgw. PostgreSQL) und/oder OLAP Tools wie IBM Cognos TM1 sind von Vorteil (vorzugsweise PostgreSQL). 

  • Sie haben ein großes Interesse an neuen Technologien. 

  • Sie bevorzugen Automatisierung und CLI gegenüber GUIs und manueller Arbeit. 

  • Optional: Linux, Ansible, Docker, Gitlab, Django, Pandas, HTML/CSS, JS 

  • Sie kommunizieren sicher in Englisch (min. B2) und Deutsch (min. C1).

item.title: Mid/Senior Ruby Developer at VInspired (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a mid/senior full stack Ruby on Rails specialist, to join our team onsite.  


V•Inspired connects young people with volunteering opportunities in the UK, tracks their progress and helps them understand the skills they gain.


We’re entering an exciting new phase of expansion of our digital service(s) and need help to evolve and scale our existing web platforms. This role is an opportunity to help shape how our in house team grows, operates and continuously improves.


What you’ll be doing 



  • Programming software applications using Ruby on Rails

  • Mentoring and supporting junior developers and helping to grow our in-house team

  • Taking a lead role in architecting and implementing an external API and scalable platform for our applications

  • Continuously improving development processes

  • Owning and iterating the deployment pipeline and processes for the production environments


Skills & Requirements


What we’re looking for:


We’re looking for someone who is passionate about the v•inspired mission, cares about delivering a great user experience to end users and has the following covered:



  • Designing, implementing and releasing scalable web applications and APIs

  • At least 5 years Ruby on Rails experience

  • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, JSON, XML

  • Understanding of platform development and architecture

  • Experience with Automated Testing

  • Experience deploying to cloud based infrastructure, for example AWS and Heroku

  • An understanding of good database design principles and performance optimization

  • An understanding of DevOps practices

  • An appreciation of Responsive Design

  • Working knowledge of agile development practices and experience working in agile/lean environments


We’d really love it if the following capabilities were on your radar too:



  • An understanding of alternative frameworks and approaches to web development, for example Python / Django, .net, Node.js, Angular.js, D3, Bootstrap etc

  • Experience with UX, Interaction or Visual Design

  • Experience with Continuous Deployment, Continuous Integration

  • Knowledge of web page optimisation and scaling approaches

  • Experience of line management and/or mentoring of junior developers

item.title: Full Stack Developer Who Loves DevOps at AViSTO (Vallauris, France)
item.description:
We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real production impact. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of pushing his own ideas.

As a full-stack developer in the AViSTO tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in Java, JavaScript, Node.JS and Angular. You will be creating production grade Java and JavaScript (TypeScript where we can) code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle high levels of traffic. You will need to be process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages.

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €40,000 to €55,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within AViSTO. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills.

Skills & Requirements


- A love of what you do
- Ability to work independently; accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
- Extensive experience programming in Java
- Experience developing for the web with JavaScript, TypeScript and with the most common web framework such as Node.JS and Angular
- Experience using PostgreSQL, Cassandra, InfluxDB, Redis, Lua, Nginx, Elasticsearch is a plus
- Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium and Karma
- Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Git
- Familiarity with DevOps culture and continuous integration tools
- Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Fluent in French is a plus


More Keywords


java, python, javascript, typescript, angular, node.js, postgresql, cassandra, influxdb, redis, elasticsearch, karma

item.title: Developers with an interest for IT security at OUTPOST24 (Karlskrona, Sweden)
item.description:
We are looking for Developers to expand our Development team in our beautiful office in Karlskrona, Sweden. As a developer at Outpost24 you will be part of one of development teams developing high quality components to our product platform. You will be part of finding smart solutions to solve the challenges we are working with. You will also help us integrate new technology there can improve our product or smarter deployment set. Further you will have a huge impact on the product feature set and implementation. If you want to make a difference, have an impact and develop by having highly skilled people around you - this could be the opportunity for you!


General Job tasks


Job Responsibilities:



  • Ensure high quality components are developed that is scalable and secure

  • Be creative to help find solutions to business requirements

  • Constantly seek ways or technologies to improve our quality and performance.

  • Work closely with our development teams to deliver a high-quality product in an agile work environment

  • Be part of developing next generation security products

  • Improve and optimizing existing technology

  • Make a difference for the team


Qualifications


If you have great experience with development in C, python and/or experience with Go language - you might be the person we are looking for. Vast experience in working with databases, webservices and JSON/XML and an agile mind-set is needed as well as good attention to detail that can have an impact on Quality, Security and Scalability will be important in this position. We are looking for someone who is a team player with a team-work mentality, someone who has great knowledge of Linux and/or Windows platforms, networking and cloud environments. Furthermore, you need to be fluent in English as this is the corporate language. You love to help and thrive in inspiring others.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer Paid Relocation & Visa to Amsterdam at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for Full Stack Developers all around the globe!  Join us in our beautiful Amsterdam headquarters and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation website with the industry’s smartest people! Our guiding principle is that by helping users we help our business


B.Responsible


As a Full Stack Developer, you are responsible for developing world-class, complete web applications, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring and addressing performance and security, and for developing customer-focused and scalable user experiences. You will work side-by-side with designers, product owners, copywriters and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for billions of users. You will:



  • Deliver web applications from an idea inception and validation to a scalable solution.

  • Collaborate with colleagues to ideate solutions for users, prioritizing based on business impact, and A/B test them.

  • Develop new user-facing products and optimize existing ones using both client-side as well as server-side languages and technologies


B.Skilled


Understanding the full stack of web development, from transmission of data segments between networks to presenting a well-strategized experience to users is vitally important in this role. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools. We are looking for:



  • Experience working on products that impact a large user base or in an entrepreneurial startup environment.

  • Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.

  • Self-starters with a collaborative, “can-do” attitude.

  • Quick delivery of end-to-end solutions to validate ideas and produce quality products

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Perl, Java, Python, Scala, C++ and Web development with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and HTTP.

  • Experience debugging cross-browser compatibility issues.

  • Experience  working on a command line in a Linux environment.

  • Passionate learners who aren’t afraid of new tools and technologies to build a great end-to-end customer experience.


B.Offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. We have tech talks, trainings, and support you attending and speaking at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We successfully relocate hundreds of IT professionals and their families to Amsterdam every year. Join us!

item.title: Data Scientist On A Real-Time Bidding Platform at Zemanta (Ljubljana, Slovenia)
item.description:
At Zemanta we're handling 100k requests/second where we place bids on advertising inventory on the behalf of our advertisers. Our real time bidding infrastructure needs to decide which ad to show for every impression in real time, and the quality of these decisions directly impacts our bottom line. To achieve this, our prediction models need to be not only very accurate, but also highly optimised.


We are looking for a talented data scientist with solid engineering skills to help us improve our prediction models and implement them in our high-throughput production systems. 


What it's like to be a data scientist at Zemanta?



  • We work with Python, Go, Hadoop, Kafka and AWS.

  • You will join a team of talented engineers and data scientists responsible for improving performance of our real-time bidding infrastructure.

  • At the same time you will become a member of Outbrain's world-class global engineering team and get a chance to work with some of the best data scientists in the business.

  • You'll have the unique opportunity to work with terabytes of data generated daily by our systems, and analysing/processing it with Hadoop.

  • You will design new feature sets, build new predictive models and test them on our experimentation infrastructure with a goal of improving performance of our current predictors.

  • When new models are ready, you will implement them in production (using the Go programming language), ensuring that the implementation is up to standards in terms of performance and code quality.

  • Developing and using A/B testing infrastructure to measure results in production environment is also a key part of the role.

item.title: Quantitative Analyst at Circular Capital (Basel, Switzerland)
item.description:
Key responsibilities



  • Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods.

  • Conduct independent quantitative research and contribute to key decisions.

  • Work with data sets and solve non-routine analytical problems, applying quantitative methods and machine learning as required. Conduct end-to-end analysis including: data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and business recommendations with effective presentations.

  • Review the underlying assumptions, theory, derivation, empirical evidence, implementation and limitations of existing and new models. Identify and quantify associated model risk.

  • Maintain and iteratively extend analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale. Develop an understanding of data structures and goals, advocating for changes where needed.


Qualifications, skills, and experience



  • University degree in a quantitative discipline (Physics, Mathematics, etc.) with strong academic qualifications.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Able to focus on details without losing track of the bigger picture.

  • Ability to analyze trade-offs and to recommend solutions.

  • Can-do attitude and results-orientation, using state-of-the-art technology to generate value to the business.

  • Programming experience, preferably in python or C++.

  • English mandatory; German optional.

  • Ability to communicate logically and precisely, including writing rigorous and clear mathematical model documentation.

  • Deep interest in financial markets.


We offer


A challenging and interesting position, working in an innovative company that meets highest standards and prevails in a very competitive international field. You will work on your own projects and participate in a collaborative environment with extremely talented people. You can expect versatile tasks and flat hierarchies, you will receive generous compensation and benefits, and you will be able to introduce your visions and ideas and utilize your professional skills to the fullest.


We look forward to receiving your online application including your complete documents.

item.title: Backend Software Developer at F-Secure (Oulu, Finland)
item.description:
We are looking for a Backend Software Engineer to join our cyber security related software project.


Key responsibilities



  • Backend development and operations with on-premises server hardware

  • Work in various roles, from feature development to production system setup

  • Cooperate with the best-in-class cyber security and threat intelligence expert




What we offer



  • Working in a team of software experts, constantly learning, developing yourself and challenging the status quo

  • We are always on the lookout for fresh ideas to improve our systems and practices. You have the possibility to utilize cutting-edge technologies in an exciting security software environment.

  • Relentlessly work together with like-minded, curious professionals who care about each other and act like a friend would

  • Keywords: On-premises, Debian, KVM, Python, REST API, monitoring, metrics, highly concurrent event processing, Elastic stack, ELK-stack


We value the following - but at the same time, we do not expect you to be master on all of these



  • Programming experience with Python

  • Quality minded approach in all work, experience of continuous deployments and delivery

  • Experience with on-premises deployments

  • Experience with KVM-virtualization

  • We also value experience in implementing RESTful APIs and devops practices

  • Linux system and network administration skills

  • Test automation

  • Continuous Integration (CI)


As an ideal candidate, you strive for a successful end-to-end solution. We appreciate people with the ability to adapt to any situation, try new things, work independently and communicate well. We do not expect you to be fully ready, we can offer an excellent opportunity to learn together with an excellent team.


As an F-Secure Fellow, you’ll be joining a tight knit network of 1,000 colleagues, spread over 25 offices around the world. At F-Secure, we meet each other as equals, but challenge each other’s ideas – we believe this makes us all better and creates a more secure environment for our customers. At F-Secure you can be who you are – bring your best self to the game and help us outsmart cyber security threats.


Join us and make the connected world a safer place!


Security background check will be conducted for the selected candidate, in accordance with the Finnish Security Clearance Act 726/2014.

item.title: Database Administrator at Marin Software (London, UK)
item.description:
Marin Software is looking to add an outstanding individual, with strong prior MySQL experience to join the Database Operations team. This role will help support our Director of Database Operations here in London.


This position is a deeply technical role, requiring extensive MySQL experience, fluency in SQL, well-rounded knowledge of MySQL internals and a strong unix background. Marin encourages development; currently in the growth phase of our Hadoop cluster, we are looking for someone who is open to learning about data outside of the relational world.


What you will be doing:


It is an exciting opportunity where you will work with billions of rows, hundreds of thousands of transactions per second and upwards of 250 TB of data in MySQL alone. Designing and building- from scratch- MySQL solutions that are both highly available and highly performing.


Perform administration, on-going management and monitoring of all database systems; always looking to streamline and improve the process, as well as troubleshooting database related application performance/availability issues, recommending and implementing solutions to overcome them.


Reviewing, writing and tuning SQL queries, making recommendations on when something should be performed outside of the database instead of via SQL. Proactively develop scripts and tools required to support any or all of the above. Automate where possible to ensure work is repeatable and consistent.


Protecting the safety and integrity of the database platform, through database design changes, backups and securing of database instances.


Essential experience:



  • 5+ years hands-on experience with MySQL

  • 5+ years of writing and tuning SQL queries

  • Detailed understanding of MySQL storage engines, particularly InnoDB and MyISAM

  • Strong Linux administration skills

  • Experience with automation (Ansible, Puppet or Chef)

  • Knowledge of data sharding and partitioning

  • Experience of supporting multi-node production environments with terabytes of data

  • Extremely honed problem-solving and debugging ability

  • Advanced proficiency in BASH scripting and fundamental knowledge of either Perl or Python

  • Familiarity with regular expressions for pattern matching and replacement

  • Understanding of both OLTP and OLAP concepts


(Beneficial but not necessary):



  • Hands-on experience in administering MongoDB from version 3.0 and greater

  • Knowledge of Hadoop and Map/Reduce concepts

  • Understanding of Java and Hibernate

  • Experience with Percona XtraBackup/Toolkit

  • Strong experience in Perl/Python

item.title: Linux System Administrator / System Engineer at InnoGames (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you want to work at scale? As part of our Backend Operations team, you will be responsible for services used by millions of players all around the world. You will work closely with our developers to run in house and open source solutions. We love to know every corner of our systems and most of them are on our own hardware in datacenters in Hamburg and overseas.



Your profile:



  • Some years professional experience administering *nix systems 

  • Comfortable with using various command line tools e.g. (d|net|vm|io)?stat

  • Proficient in at least one scripting language

  • Open and friendly communication style

  • Good English skills



Our technologies:



  • KVM, LVM, Debian, Puppet

  • MySQL (Percona, Galera Cluster), PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, RabbitMQ

  • nginx, Tomcat, Jetty, Django

  • Python, Java, PHP, Go

  • Graphite / Grafana, Nagios, Sentry, ELK stack

  • git, Jenkins, Maven, Docker

  • Slack, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Gitlab



Why join InnoGames?



  • Be part of a great team in an international environment in a healthy and stable growing company.

  • Choose your preferred device (Linux, Mac or even Windows) for your comfortable workplace

  • We will actively support your further development and give you all needed resources to evaluate new technologies, participate in open source communities or improve your soft skills.

  • Our career model is set up equally for an expert in a technical career or a management path.

  • Opportunities to make your code open source and show your achievements at international conferences.

  • Competitive compensation

  • Benefits like relocation support, company gym, smartphone or tablet, company bikes, rooftop terrace with BBQ and much more…

  • Check out some of our code: github.com/innogames


Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Linux System Administrator / System Engineer ? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Katrin Hugo.

item.title: Webbutvecklare at Neodev (Malmö, Sweden)
item.description:
Du är en engagerad webbutvecklare som gillar nya utmaningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer i moderna plattformar och utvecklingsramverk. Som person är du flexibel, positiv, öppen, vågar säga vad du tycker och gillar att arbeta i grupp. Du drivs av att lösa problem och gillar att komma med förbättringsförslag.


Vad du förväntas ha:



  • Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande med minst 2 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet

  • Du ska behärska svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vi tror att du har några av följande erfarenheter:



  • Erfarenhet av objektorienterad mjukvaruutveckling och design

  • Erfarenhet av Java, Javascript, Python eller Ruby

  • Erfarenhet av SQL, MongoDB, CouchDB eller Neo4j

  • Erfarenhet av webbramverk som AngularJS, Node.js eller React.js

  • Erfarenhet av att använda verktyg som Git, Gerrit, Jenkins eller motsvarande


Vi erbjuder:


En anställningsmodell som ger dig stor valfrihet. Du har t.ex. möjlighet att själv bestämma fördelningen mellan lön, pensionssparande, utbildningar, seminarier eller konferenser. Vi ställer inga krav på antalet arbetade timmar utan det är hur bra uppdraget utförs och att kunden är nöjd som är det viktiga för oss.


Hos oss är det viktigt att alla får chansen att påverka, därför träffas vi ofta både formellt och informellt för att ägna oss åt allt från affärsutveckling och studiebesök i Silicon Valley till spelkvällar på kontoret. Man bestämmer själv till vilken grad man vill engagera sig i det interna arbetet, men alla har full insyn i bolaget.


Vi är ett energiskt och glatt team som kännetecknas av öppenhet, hjälpsamhet och hög kompetens.

item.title: Full stack Software Developers wanted to scale a profitable product company at Smartly.io (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
As a Software Developer at Smartly.io you will




    • Build new features, working closely together with other developers, product management, designers and customers.

    • Review other developers’ code right from the start.

    • Help our highly technical support team triage bugs.

    • Work across our stack, most likely with some of Ruby on Rails, Scala, React+Redux+Flow, PHP, MongoDB, Cassandra or PostgreSQL.

    • Push code to production during one of your first days.

    • Demo your first feature at your first Friday demos.

    • Travel to meet our customers and team members in San Francisco, New York, Singapore or Berlin – if you enjoy travelling.

    • Participate in defining our company future at our Futur.io events.



Skills & Requirements


You may be a fit for this role if you




    • Have 4+ years of experience as a software developer.

    • Have experience working with Ruby, JavaScript, Python, Scala, Java, Elixir, Go, Haskell, Rust or similar languages.

    • Write maintainable and testable code, while navigating both functional programming and object-oriented programming patterns.

    • Know how the web works. REST API design, HTTP fundamentals and TCP/IP. Also from the security standpoint.

    • Care about ways of working, and always want to improve.

    • Are pragmatic. We’re working on an existing system, and our customers’ business depends on it.

    • Are continuously teaching yourself and the others.



Bonus points, if you have




    • Experience in component-based frontend architectures with React+Redux.

    • Experience in Ruby on Rails or Scala+Play+Slick.

    • An eye for user interfaces and design.

    • Solid experience in SQL, building complex queries and procedures.

    • Worked with highly scalable distributed systems, consisting of multiple microservices, deployed to hundreds of nodes.

    • Experience building large-scale data processing pipelines.

    • Experience leading a team, or potential to become an Engineering team lead.

item.title: Data Scientist at Inkitt GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a startup with significant funding, we are seeking a dedicated Data Scientist who is ready to shake the publishing industry and work on the next best-seller prediction algorithm.


You are/have:



  • An enthusiastic reader

  • Excited about discovering future bestsellers

  • Strong mathematical background

  • Advanced knowledge in one of the following programming languages: R / Python

  • Not afraid of writing complex SQL queries

  • Some knowledge in Node JS / Ruby would be a plus

  • Startup experience is a clear plus


You will be responsible for:


Developing and testing models for predicting future best-sellers


What we are offering:



  • Your compensation will include meaningful equity ownership.

  • An inspirational startup environment in our office in the heart of Berlin

  • A dedicated team

  • A unique opportunity: take responsibility for and implement your own ideas in a fast-growing, dynamic company


Do you want to build the world's biggest data-driven publishing house with us?

item.title: DevOps Engineer/Architect at Comptel Corporation (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Comptel is looking for DevOps Engineers/Architects (Helsinki office)


Our R&D Services team in Intelligent Data Unit is looking for people who would like to work in a truly international environment, having also great and competent local collegues to work with.


The main DevOps competences needed:


- Good knowledge on working with virtual/cloud enviroments
- Ansible
- Linux, Shell scripting
- Python
- Jenkins
- Terraform, packer or similar tools


As English is our company language, solid communication skills in English is necessary. Knowing Finnish language is not required.


In addition to solid technical skills and passion for quality and smooth processes, we value people who are fun to work with and who do not mind to lend a helping hand for people in need. We develop and maintain the competence and motivation of our experts by providing regular trainings.


As Comptel lately came a part of Nokia Applications and Analytics the global presence and customer base as well as business and job opportunities are now also on different scale.

item.title: 2017 = 100% Cloud + new SaaS products. Join as Senior Backend Developer at Siteimprove A/S (København, Denmark)
item.description:
Are you an experienced and ambitious backend software developer who’s ready to think outside the box and influence our future directions? If the answer is yes, yes and YES then keep reading.

Joining one our several product teams you’ll take ownership of challenges worth accepting. Whether it’s ridding the web from misspellings and malformed HTML,  relieving the visually impaired of browsing frustrations, building bots that protect the online brand of a customer or leading the way in the next generation of web analytics.

This position requires someone who’s happy to roll up their sleeves and migrate large amounts of data without downtime, someone who can battle-test web pages in headless browsers to reveal their weaknesses and build a crawler for the future web.

Joining our diverse and talented group of over 40 developers you’ll have a proven track record of building stable and scalable server software and know what it takes to stream, store and query large amounts of data, SQL or NoSQL. You’ll understand cloud-based solutions and know how to provide software-as-a-service.

Our primary tech stacks include AWS, C# and SQL but we are pragmatic (see below!) and expect you to be the same. We value general skills and experience higher than any specific technology.


Responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain backend application code in one of our product teams.

  • Work together with the product owner, UX designers, operations specialists and fellow developers to shape the best solutions for our customers.

  • Take part in and improve on the way we develop software.

  • Understand what other teams are doing, help them, take action when you see problems on the horizon.

item.title: Senior Back-end developer at JOHAN Sports BV (Noordwijk, Netherlands)
item.description:
Senior Back-end developer
Key role at a growing sport tech startup.



What you tell others about your job at JOHAN Sports
You are a senior developer whose programming skills contribute to getting the best out of every team and athlete. You empower data for every body to help athletes get to the next level and to make this startup an international success.


What you will be doing at JOHAN Sports
You have a key role at the software development team and will be working on the back-end development and the architecture. You will develop, improve and test features, based on the input from our operational, scientific and innovation teams, for our REST API.



  • Our backend consists of a two-tier system, composed of a REST API, written in Python Django, and a series of data processing tasks in Pandas. These tasks will be gradually rewritten to ensure stability and availability. You will evaluate and implement frameworks and architectural changes on the long-term.

  • The frontend consists of an Angular JS Single Page Application (SPA) that communicates with the backend via a REST API, which you will be working on.

  • You will work with Trello to manage the workload, Github to manage the code-related workload end work through pull requests from feature branches. CI and CD is managed through CircleCI and Kubernetes.


Who are you
You are a passionate programmer who likes to make a difference. You are someone who learns quickly and you know how to build a fault-tolerant distributed application. You can reason clearly and think through the implications of your choices when developing. You like to take responsibility and work as a part of a (great!) team. You have an optimistic attitude and clear communication.



Your skills and experience
Experience:








  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in back-end web development 

  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a functional programming language

  • Experience with Elixir/Phoenix is a nice to have!






Skills:



  • Python Django (must!)

  • SQL (must!)

  • C++ (nice to have)

  • Continuous test driven development and professional documentation






What you can expect from working at JOHAN Sports



  • A dynamic and responsible job at a tech startup.

  • You will work as a part of a young and enthusiastic team of approximately 10 people and currently expanding.

  • A great office in the SBIC-building, located at the Space Business Park in Noordwijk (ZH) not too far from Amsterdam.

  • A relaxed, balanced and informal work environment.

  • Full-time employment.

  • Flexible working hours and the possibility to partially work from home.

  • Competitive salary.

  • 26 vacation days per year.

  • Travel allowance.

  • A laptop will be at your disposal.

  • Budget for personal, professional development.

item.title: Machine Learning Developer at Similar.ai (Leiden, Netherlands)
item.description:
Similar.ai is a fast-growing start-up working with state-of-the-art machine learning techniques. We believe that work is fun and that people are at their best when they enjoy themselves. Our headquarters is in Leiden in the Netherlands. We build ecommerce solutions which leverage our Universal Product Ontology, our huge set of labelled fashion and our human-in-the-loop deep learning platform. We are looking for fulltime developers who love clothes, bags, shoes and accessories based in Leiden, The Netherlands


JOB



  • Building & improving existing UIs to enrich unstructured data (we use Django)

  • Working with our ontologists to build out our Universal Product Ontology

  • Building & improving multi-modal classification, entity extraction & generative models (we’re Pytorch fans)

  • Apply recent research to our enormous set of proprietary labelled natural language, image and video data


YOU



  • Love data and dresses? Machine learning and Mary Jane shoes? Cold shoulder sleeves and convolutional neural nets? Combine your passion for data-driven approaches with your love of the things people wear.

  • Bachelors or Masters engineering, maths, computer science or AI degree.


After we look at your CV or LinkedIn profile, we may invite you for an interview and we will ask selected candidates to spend some time working on an interview coding task.


PLS NOTE: Local candidates arebstrongly preferred, visa possible for exceptional candidates.

item.title: Robotics Engineer for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering an interesting opportunity to work as a (Senior) Robotics Engineer (f/m) in the field of autonomous driving. Calling on your sound knowledge of motion planning, decision-making or autonomous systems, you will independently develop new concepts and algorithms, implement and evaluate them in a simulation environment and perform testing with real test vehicles.

Integration of the algorithms in a distributed software architecture means that much of your work will entail collaborating within a large team of experts. Your tasks will also include implementing development tools for simulation and testing so as to ensure that your algorithms are effectively tested and evaluated.

As implementation generally takes place in C++, a sound knowledge of this programming language is essential here. You will ideally also have development experience with Linux and ROS. Our new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the perfect infrastructure for successfully developing innovative software for the cars of the future.



Qualifications:


- A university degree in computer science, robotics, electrical engineering or a related field. A PhD in one of the above fields would be an advantage.
- Practical experience in motion planning, decision-making, reasoning, control theory, optimisation, prediction or reinforcement learning, ideally involving vehicle applications.
- Practical knowledge of agile software development and object-oriented software design principles.
- Besides C++, ideally also in-depth experience of programming with Python.
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Engineer for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering an exciting position as a (Senior) Software Developer (f/m) in the field of reinforcement learning. Calling on your sound knowledge of reinforcement learning, you will independently develop new concepts and algorithms for motion planning and decision-making. You will be responsible for implementation and evaluation in simulations as well as in final testing with real test vehicles.

Integration of the algorithms in a distributed software architecture means that much of your work will entail collaborating within a large team of machine learning-experts. Your tasks will also include implementing development tools so as to ensure an effective learning process as well as to evaluate your algorithms. Furthermore, you will have the opportunity for scientific exchange at international conferences.

As implementation generally takes place in C++, a sound knowledge of this programming language is essential here. You will ideally also have development experience with Linux and ROS. Our new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the perfect infrastructure for successfully developing software for the cars of the future.



Qualifications:


- A university degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering or a related course of study.
- Practical experience in the field of reinforcement learning for robotics applications. A PhD is of advantage in this role.
- Besides C++, ideally also in-depth experience of programming with Python.
- Practical knowledge of agile software development and object-oriented software design principles.
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Remote within Europe) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


Hotjar is looking for a driven and ambitious DevOps Engineer based in a European timezone to support and expand our cloud-based infrastructure used by thousands of sites around the world. The Hotjar infrastructure currently processes more than 16,500 API requests per second, delivers over a billion pieces of static content every week and hosts databases well into terabyte-size ranges, making this an interesting and challenging opportunity.

This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing remote startup in a key position. 

In this position, you will:



  • Be part of the team setting up and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our sites and web applications.

  • Choose, deploy and manage tools and technologies to build and support a robust infrastructure.

  • Be responsible for identifying bottlenecks and improving performance of all our systems.

  • Ensure all necessary monitoring, alerting and backup solutions are in place.

  • Do research and keep up to date on trends in big data processing and large scale analytics.

  • Implement proof of concept solutions in the form of prototype applications.



Compensation Range


The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside. 



Requirements



  • Strong working knowledge of Amazon AWS.

  • 2 or more years of professional experience with systems administration or DevOps.

  • Experience with Python, Nginx and PostgreSQL.

  • Not required but experience in any of the following is considered to be an asset: Kubernetes, Kafka, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, Redis, Memcached, Jenkins, Mercurial, Vagrant, Docker.

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.

item.title: Senior C++ Software Engineer with a multinational Leading Tech/advertising giant at Oath (Dreieich, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a strong C++ engineer to join our ad-serving team. Our ad-server stack consists of low latency and high throughput components handling billions of requests per day.


You will be working on implementing new features and maintaining existing ones as well as enhancing our components to further scale.


As we work with colleagues from around the world, English language skills are mandatory. German language knowledge is a plus. You will be collaborating often with teams across the company.


Qualifications:



  • Extensive experience in C/C++ (at least 3 years)

  • Scripting languages (mostly bash and python)

  • Excellent understanding of RDBMS design concepts

  • Experience with MySQL 

  • Git as main VCS 


Pluses include:



  • Knowledge low-latency, high-throughput distributed systems

  • Knowledge of with key-value stores such as Couchbase and Aerospike 

  • Experience with Docker

  • Understanding of CI/CD concepts and experience with Jenkins

  • Java development

item.title: FULL-STACK WEB-ENTWICKLERIN / WEB-ENTWICKLER BILDBASIERTE MEDIZIN at Fraunhofer-Institut für Bildgestützte Medizin MEVIS (Bremen, Deutschland)
item.description:
FRAUNHOFER-INSTITUT FÜR BILDGESTÜTZTE MEDIZIN MEVIS


INFORMATIK IST IHR THEMA? WIR BEI FRAUNHOFER MEVIS BIETEN IHNEN AB SOFORT EINE SPANNENDE TÄTIGKEIT IN BREMEN ALS


FULL-STACK
WEB-ENTWICKLERIN / WEB-ENTWICKLER
BILDBASIERTE MEDIZIN


Fraunhofer MEVIS ist ein weltweit führendes und international vernetztes Forschungs- und Entwicklungs­zentrum für Computer­unterstützung in der bildbasierten Medizin. Es verfolgt einen patienten­zentrierten und auf die klinischen Abläufe zuge­schnittenen Ansatz zur Lösung klinisch relevanter Frage­stellungen der bild­gestützten Diagnose und Therapie.


Als Teil unseres Software­entwicklungs­teams in Bremen befassen Sie sich mit anspruchs­vollen Aufgaben im Bereich der digitalen Medizin. Die Themen­gebiete Ihrer Arbeit beinhalten die Konzeption, Entwicklung und Bereit­stellung von Web-Applikationen und Micro­services. Neben der Imple­mentierung von Web-Front­ends für unsere Forschungs­prototypen oder Produkte und der Ein­bettung server­seitiger Visualisierungen bildet die Weiter­entwicklung unserer verteilten Applikations­infrastruktur einen weiteren Schwer­punkt Ihrer Aufgaben.


Was Sie mitbringen



  • überdurchschnittlicher Masterabschluss (wissenschaftlicher Hochschulabschluss) der Informatik oder eines verwandten Fachs

  • fundierte Erfahrungen in der Webentwicklung mit modernen Frameworks wie z. B. Angular oder Vue.js

  • Erfahrung im Aufbau von Backend Services

  • hohe Eigenmotivation zur kontinuierlichen Fortbildung in Webtechnologien

  • Fähigkeit zur eigenverantwortlichen Projekt- und Teamarbeit

  • gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse


Weiterhin von Vorteil wären Erfahrungen mit



  • Python (idealerweise im Bereich von Webframeworks)

  • Virtualisierung und Containertechnologien

  • UX/UI-Design

  • DevOps-Themen wie z. B. Cluster-Management, Job-Scheduling, Provisioning

  • Datenbanken


Was Sie erwarten können
Fraunhofer MEVIS ist auf die anwendungsnahe Forschung in der medi­zinischen Bildverarbeitung und Visualisierung spezialisiert. Sie arbeiten in einem klinisch vernetzten Institut mit flachen Hierarchien und viel­fältigen Fort­bildungs­möglich­keiten. Ihre Arbeitszeit können Sie sich im Rahmen unseres Vertrauens­arbeits­zeit­modells frei einteilen und bei Bedarf von zu Hause aus arbeiten.


Unsere Anbindung an den Technologiepark der Universität Bremen ermöglicht Ihnen zudem, die Mensa der Universität zu den Konditionen unserer Mitarbeitenden zu nutzen sowie am Hochschulsport teilzunehmen.


Anstellung, Vergütung und Sozialleistungen basieren auf dem Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst (TVöD). Zusätzlich kann Fraunhofer leistungs- und erfolgsabhängige variable Vergütungsbestandteile gewähren.
Die Stelle ist zunächst auf 2 Jahre befristet.


Die Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft legt Wert auf die berufliche Gleichstellung von Frauen und Männern. Im Bereich der ausgeschriebenen Stelle sind Frauen unterrepräsentiert. Daher freuen wir uns insbesondere über die Bewerbung von Frauen. Familie und Beruf lassen sich bei uns durch flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitangebote, einen Eltern-Kind-Raum und Kinder-Notbetreuung gut vereinbaren.


Die Beschäftigung von schwerbehinderten Menschen ist uns ebenfalls ein wichtiges Anliegen. Bei gleicher Eignung werden Menschen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.


Fraunhofer ist die größte Organisation für anwendungsorientierte Forschung in Europa. Unsere Forschungs­felder richten sich nach den Bedürfnissen der Menschen: Gesundheit, Sicherheit, Kommu­nikation, Mobilität, Energie und Umwelt. Und deswegen hat die Arbeit unserer Forscher und Entwickler großen Einfluss auf das zukünftige Leben der Menschen. Wir sind kreativ, wir gestalten Technik, wir entwerfen Produkte, wir verbessern Verfahren, wir eröffnen neue Wege. Wir erfinden Zukunft.


Bitte bewerben Sie sich online unter: https://recruiting.fraunhofer.de/Vacancies/33814/Description/1?customer=STANDARD


Informationen über das Institut finden Sie im Internet unter:
http://www.mevis.fraunhofer.de

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at OfferUp - buy. sell. simple. (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our Operations Team.  We provide tools and services to all teams in OfferUp for managing an increasingly complex production infrastructure in AWS.  Our success is measured by our ability to allow everyone to stand up and deploy services quickly with no downtime.  In this role, you will be at the forefront of driving and developing the technology that automates everything.  


Responsibilities



  • Work with other SREs to build a comprehensive set of tools to automate and monitor our production infrastructure

  • Work with Engineering to build resilient, operable, self-healing services

  • Participate in reasonable on-call rotations with the rest of Engineering


Experience



  • Managed groups of servers, preferably in AWS, at scale

  • Reasonably deep knowledge of Linux and internet technologies

  • Proficient in modern scripting languages like Python or Ruby

  • Configuration management tools like Ansible or Salt

  • Used advanced metrics to solve hard problems

  • Experience managing Big Data or high-throughput distributed systems like Hadoop and Kafka


Nice to have



  • Experience with continuous integration

  • Contribution to open source projects

  • An active interest in containerization technologies such as Docker and/or Kubernetes


Our team:



  • Acts like a team

  • Avoids doing things twice

  • Solves hard problems for tomorrow, not just for today

  • Prefers fixing problems to complaining about them

  • Investigates, considers and adopts new technology where it makes sense

  • Doesn’t tolerate brilliant jerks

item.title: FRONTEND WEBAPP ENGINEER for AUTOMATED TEXT GENERATION PROJECT (f/m) at Retresco GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are developing a SaaS application to make our natural language generation (NLG) software available to users without linguistic skills. The application is based on the core library for automated text generation developed within our company. To achieve this, we are looking for an experienced engineer to support our dev team.


YOUR TASKS ARE



  • Develope a single-page application with Typescript and Angular.io



  • including e2e-tests, continuous integration utilising Git


Skills & Requirements


Experience with



  • Developing single-page applications

  • Typescript, Angular.io or another componente oriented frontend framework

  • Frontend technology like JS/ES6, DOM, CSS3, HTML5

  • Node.js, npm, Angular CLI, Jenkins, GitLab-Pipelines


Knowledge of Python, Docker and Document-oriented storage systems are a plus.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer Blockchain (m/w) in Stuttgart at daimler AG (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben im Einzelnen:


Als Full-Stack Developer Blockchain (m/w) wird Ihr Schwerpunkt das Requirement Engineering sowie die Anwendungsentwicklung sein. Hierbei übernehmen Sie die Verantwortung für die Aufnahme und Umsetzung von Demands im IT-Umfeld. 


Sie sind verantwortlich für den Lifecycle der Treasury Applikationen und der verwendeten Services.
In Eigenverantwortung arbeiten Sie ein Konzept mit Use Cases im Kontext von Distributed Ledger Technologien, wie Hyperledger und Blockchain aus.
Sie übernehmen das Rapid Prototyping sowie die Entwicklung von Backend Applikationen und User Interfaces nach neustem Stand der Technik.
Zudem verantworten Sie die Neugestaltung eines Application Managements für Distributed Ledger Technologien.


Warum Wir?
Bei Daimler bewegen Sie sich in einem innovativen Umfeld und einer offenen Unternehmenskultur. 
Unser Team zeichnet sich durch einen starken Zusammenhalt aus. Wir meistern den Arbeitsalltag durch innovative sowie kreative Zusammenarbeit und verstehen uns auch über die Arbeitsgrenzen hinaus.
Hier haben Sie die Möglichkeit mit State-of-the-art Equipment neue IT Systeme zu programmieren und aufzubauen.
Bei uns haben Sie die Chance, schnell eigenverantwortlich Aufgaben zu übernehmen und innovativ mit den neusten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Wir bieten Sie neben persönlicher und fachlicher Weiterentwicklung auch die Möglichkeit individuell auf jede Lebenssituation abgestimmt mobil zu arbeiten.


Die Position klingt nach einer spannenden Herausforderung für Sie?
Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!


Qualifikationen


Studium:
Sie haben ein technisches Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen

Erfahrung und spezifische Kenntnisse:
Sie haben Erfahrung als Full-Stack Developer (m/w) in einer oder mehrere der folgenden Sprachen und Frameworks: Python, Java, AngularJS, node.js, HTML5, Bootstrap, Hyperledger, Ethereum
Sie sind in der Lage den Bedarf Ihres Auftraggebers zu erfassen, diesen in Anforderungen zu übersetzen sowie Lösungen und Prozesse unter Berücksichtigung vorhandener Technologien zu entwickeln
Sie verfügen über Erfahrung im Service Management nach ITIL und verstehen es IT-Leistungen als Service aufzubauen sowie zu betreiben
Sie halten Ihr Wissen über Softwareentwicklung, Methoden, Werkzeuge und Technik aktuell

Sprachkenntnisse:
Sie verfügen über verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Persönliche Kompetenzen:
Als Kommunikationstalent ist soziale Kompetenz eine Ihrer Stärken
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und tauschen sich gerne mit Ihren Kollegen über Ihre Ideen und Arbeitsergebnisse aus
Sie bringen ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität und Selbständigkeit mit
Sie leben Change Management, weil Sie der Meinung sind das Stillstand zum Rückschritt führt
Trotz Ihrer Ideen können Sie ein methodisch sauberes Vorgehen definieren und dieses erfolgreich und nachhaltig umsetzen


Zusätzliche Informationen


Die Tätigkeit ist in Vollzeit

Bitte bewerben Sie sich ausschließlich online und fügen der Bewerbung Ihren Lebenslauf, ein Anschreiben im Motivationsfeld des Online-Formulars und Zeugnisse bei (max. Gesamtgröße der Anhänge 6 MB).
WICHTIG! Bitte füllen Sie zusätzlich zu den Dateianhängen, zur Unterstützung des Auswahlprozesses, auch den Online-Bewerbungsbogen mit Ihrem schulischen und beruflichen Werdegang sowie Ihren weiteren Kenntnissen aus.

Wir freuen uns insbesondere über Onlinebewerbungen schwerbehinderter und ihnen gleichgestellter behinderter Menschen direkt auf diese Ausschreibung.
Bei Fragen können Sie sich unter sbv-zentrale@daimler.com zudem an die Schwerbehindertenvertretung des Standorts wenden, die Sie gerne nach Ihrer Bewerbung im weiteren Bewerbungsprozess unterstützt.

Ansprechpartner Personal: HR Services, Tel.: 0711/17-99533.

item.title: Développeur Ruby on Rails ou autre framework MVC at Codeur (La Roche-sur-Foron, France)
item.description:
Codeur.com, société basée en Haute-Savoie, recherche un développeur Ruby on Rails (ou autre framework web MVC) pour compléter l'équipe.


Le job consiste à :



  • Développer et améliorer nos sites développés en Ruby on Rails 5.x

  • Concevoir et développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités

  • Créer de nouvelles applications


Conditions de travail :



  • Nous sommes basés à la Roche sur Foron, en Haute-Savoie, à 20 min d'Annecy

  • Ambiance startup, détendue mais motivante

  • Bureaux neufs avec terrasse de toit

  • Startup web créée 2006 en forte croissance 


Quel profil recherche-t-on ?



  • Expérience en développement web

  • Capable de gérer le code d'un site complexe

  • Idéalement compétence en Ruby on Rails

  • Si vous ne connaissez pas Rails : expérience en Python, .NET ou autre langage / framework MVC

  • Si possible, expérience en JavaScript (Angular ou autre framework JS) mais ce n'est pas essentiel

  • Excellente culture du web


Vos qualités :



  • Vous aimez coder

  • Vous avez envie de participer au développement d'un service destiné aux développeurs partout dans le monde francophone

  • Vous êtes rigoureux et vous livrez du code de qualité


Expérience requise :



  • Nous recherchons quelqu'un d'expérimenté, mais nous étudions toute proposition, même débutant, si la compétence ou le potentiel est là.


Pourquoi travailler chez nous : 


Travailler chez Codeur c'est profiter d'un environnement propice à la créativité et à a la productivité. Entraide entre développeurs, calme, process flexibles et bonne ambiance permettent d'aborder chaque journée avec énergie et bonne humeur.


Chez Codeur vous aurez des responsabilités importantes liées au fonctionnement des plateformes dont vous vous occuperez. Vous aurez beaucoup de libertés techniques et d'opportunités de progresser au contact des autres développeurs de l'équipe. 


Chez nous les développeurs ne font pas de reporting, ne font pas de support client ni l'administration du serveur.


Nous utilisons les outils de communications les plus pratiques (Slack, Trello...), et des services reconnus pour leur qualité (Github, Sentry, New Relic...). 


Nous sommes localisés au coeur des plus belles montagnes des Alpes, à 30 min du Grand Bornand et de la Clusaz et à 45 minutes de Chamonix et Megève, à mi-chemin entre les lacs d'Annecy et du Léman.


Votre rémunération sera en phase avec votre expérience et vous aurez des augmentations de salaire régulières. Vous bénéficierez d'un MacBook Pro de fonction dernière génération.


Possibilité de télétravail partiel (1 ou 2 jours par semaine max).


Rappel : nous recherchons un développeur Ruby on Rails mais si vous avez vous pratiquez un autre langage ou framework MVC nous pourrons vous former sur Ruby on Rails.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer App Marketing at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


You will join a marketing solutions development team responsible for creating internal tools for our marketing team to automate ad creation, ad management, even some creative processes.


We are building data-streaming pipelines and data processing workflows leveraging some very interesting data sources.


We are working closely with our data science team and data engineers from other departments to predict user behaviour and provide those insights to our colleagues.


You Are Skilled


Technologies. 4+ years of experience in coding (Python/Javascript/Java/Perl/C#/...). Experience with Angular or React frontend development


Full-Stack. Full-stack development experience, or a desire to get such experience


Knowledge.  Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, time complexity, etc)


Experience. Experience building complex distributed scalable services and AWS technologies


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coder Dojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, subvention of your occupational pension plan, 40% Zalando shopping discount, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals as well as help with kindergarten and schools, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice, family rooms


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!

item.title: Software Engineer - Distributed Systems at Yelp (London, UK)
item.description:
Yelp’s Infrastructure teams design, implement, and maintain scalable software architectures that are at the heart of our technology. We do everything from building cluster data optimization tools, to designing APIs and developing libraries, and creating speedy and reliable infrastructure that’s easy to use for our relevance/machine learning developers.

Do you dream in service oriented architectures? Do you enjoy profiling and getting the last bits of performance out of complex systems? We do too! You might have used one of our open source projects like mrjob, pyleus, or firefly. Or maybe you’ve read our blog post on how we manage Elasticsearch using Apollo. We help enable hundreds of engineers to safely and quickly deploy their features into production, while serving millions of active Yelp users.

If this sounds like you, join the team that is the glue that connects Yelp’s feature teams to their underlying software infrastructure - in data centers, up in the cloud, or anywhere in between.


Skills & Requirements


What You Will Do:



  • Design, build, and deploy software systems that run 24/7 at increasing scale

  • Develop custom tools and automate processes to find answers to challenging questions and reveal the unknown

  • Write code, document, participate in code reviews, and mentor other engineers

  • Support the software your team works on


What We Are Looking For:



  • Strong knowledge of systems and application design, with an understanding of operational and reliability trade-offs

  • Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis

  • Ability to work closely with information retrieval/machine learning experts on big-data problems

  • A hunger for tracking down root causes—no matter how deep it takes you—and fixing them in systematic ways

  • Strong understanding of operating systems, file systems and networking

  • Fluency in Python, C, C++, Java, or a similar language

  • Ability to work well with and influence many personality types at all levels of the organization


Pluses:



  • Experience building large-scale distributed systems

  • Experience at a large-scale consumer internet site

  • Experience with configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt, CFEngine), monitoring (Nagios, Sensu, Monit), metrics (Graphite, statsd)

  • Experience with cloud computing services like AWS


What We Offer:



  • Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment

  • Competitive salary, equity in the company, and an optional employee stock purchase program

  • Generous paid maternity and paternity leave

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Subsidization of your public transportation card and £50 per month toward any exercise of your choice

  • Central location, a fully stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, and more!

item.title: Embedded Software Developer in Automotive Technologies (m/f) at Technica Engineering GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Technica Engineering, as an innovative technology company, offers products and services for the development and testing of electronic control modules. Our innovative hard and software solutions make it possible to thoroughly and efficiently test components and networks of modern on-board electronics during their development.


We are looking for an Embedded Software Developer in Automotive Technologies (m/f) for our Embedded Development Team.


Our embedded software development team consists of five software engineers. You also work closely with a development team of our subsidiary in Tunisia / Sfax. Your trainer will be your group leader directly and includes the introduction to all the tools we use. Our goal is to build a long-term strategically important research project.


The main tasks are:



  • Responsibility for the whole development process of your part function of your control unit

  • Clarification of technical requirements with the customer regarding efficient and consistent solutions

  • Monitoring and controlling from requirement engineer up to the test on target

  • Using modern development methods and – technologies like continuous integration, agile and test-driven-development

  • Identification of the system dependencies

  • Continuous assurance of observance, stability, performance and safety aspects


We are searching for the following competences:



  • Degree in computer science, related fields or relevant qualifications or similar formation

  • Experience in Software- and System Testing

  • Expertise in associated BUS systems, e.g. CAN or FlexRay

  • Abilities in programing, e.g. Python VB or CAPL

  • Very good knowledge in English, German knowledge would be an advantage

  • ISTQB certificate is an advantage but can also be done within our company


If you are open-minded about innovative automotive technologies, enjoy inspiring others for innovative ways, have a high degree of initiative and a high quality awareness, apply to us.


Please send your cover letter and resume to: personal@technica-engineering.de

item.title: Planning Engineer Simulation and Testing for Automated Driving at Robert Bosch GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.


For years now, the Chassis Systems Control Division has been a pacesetter in innovative technology and quality. Within the business unit ""Automated Driving"" we shape the future of driving. Together with our partner Daimler we are working in the alliance “Urban Mobility Automation” on a system solution of driverless automobile in the urban environment. We are creating the algorithms of highly and fully automated driving in the urban environment. We will launch a system which will revolutionize the urban traffic of the future.


Your contribution to something big



  • Shape the future: You help to bring a fully autonomous self-driving car onto the road.



  • Use your creativity and freedom: You are part of the development of innovative algorithms in the fields of behavior planning in uncertain environments and kinodynamic motion planning under uncertainty.



  • Observe and think ahead: You build the bridge between algorithm development, simulation, system integration and testing. You will integrate the planning software in the automated vehicle and support performing system tests.



  • Reliable implementation: You evaluate the developed algorithms in simulation as well as real-world scenarios in the autonomous development vehicle. Therefore, you design system and software tests and support the Testing Team to identify issues.



  • Create something new: You will code scalable, maintainable and robust software in C++ and Python.



  • Live internationally: You will develop the autonomous system in collaboration with teams from different departments and from different areas of the world.



What distinguishes you



  • Personality: You have excellent communication skills, you like to take on responsibility and drive a topic to its closure.



  • Working method: You work independently but also effectively as part of a big team. You love to tackle challenging problems and are able to solve them.



  • Experience: You are familiar with source code management (git) and unit testing, code reviews and issue tracking systems. You have experience with vehicle testing and vehicle networks.



  • Know-How: You have knowledge of algorithms for planning in autonomous driving.



  • Qualification: You have good programming skills and practical experience in C++ and Python coding. Ideally, you are comfortable with Linux and ROS. Knowledge of software simulation frameworks like VTD is a plus.



  • Languages: You can communicate proficiently in English. German is a plus.



  • Education: You have a Master in the domain of Robotics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or a related field.

item.title: Fullstack Software Engineer at Content Square (Paris, France)
item.description:
Are you willing to participate to the development of a software which revolutionizes e-commerce, thanks to processing large volumes of data, using cutting edge technologies such as Node.js & Angular.js ?


We are precisely looking for a Fullstack Javascript Developer !



Your responsibilities :


Within an agile team of 10 people, your goal will be to enrich our SAAS application, a SPA Angular using APIs based on the framework hapi – Node.js.
We give a high importance to user experience, the quality of the interfaces that we deploy and mainly to the quality of the code.
Your daily work will consist in:
• Taking keys technical decisions and helping to define the global technical vision
• Evangelizing on code’s quality of, design and tests
• Implementing new features of ContentSquare’s product
• Writing client and server’s code to provide successful and ergonomic web applications
• Ensuring the reliability, the scalability and the efficiency of the SAAS application

Stack : NodeJS, Angular, JavaScript, Elasticsearch,...



Do you have excellent technical qualities?


As an enthusiastic follower of good practices of development, you have at least 1 year of experience on a MV*Javascript framework as well as in API development.


Nodejs and Angular have ideally no more secrets for you.


We are open-minded regarding your fullstack path, as long as you are proficient in Javascript and in another backend language such as java or python, and ready to develop/extend your skills on Angular and Nodejs!



Why join ContentSquare’s Application team?


• If you are looking for a variety of cool projects, such as working on Large Single Page Application with intensive visualizations of data
• If you are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing yourself on the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting topics to conferences
• If you are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes
• If you share our “quality focused” vision: code reviews, sprint for the quality of the code, coverage of unit and functional tests.


Then, join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure, with tech teams that are as passionate as you are, who cultivate knowledge sharing and team cohesion. Through Hackathons, Cross teams Innovation Days, we are committed to experiment/create tomorrow’s user experience.


You’ll also find : the possibility to choose your PC/Mac, flexible working hours, remote days, basketball, handball, yoga, and many other sports teams, afterworks with beers provided every Fridays, monthly parties…and a very nice team !

item.title: Software Engineers (C/Linux) at Undo Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are founded and led by programmers for programmers, and we live and breathe engineering. We especially like bright, motivated people who love working in teams, are flexible when priorities shift, and are comfortable working in a non-hierarchical organisation.


If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you.


If you are tired of being a cog in the machine and want to take an active part in developing really exciting technology, this role could be for you.


As an Undo Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to do a variety of tasks, and contribute to projects and customer engagements. You’ll also be supported by the wider Engineering team to brainstorm ideas and help you if you’re stuck.


Undo developers have the freedom to decide their own processes, and individual developers can pick the development environment that works for them. We grow teams that have the freedom to make their own decisions so individual developers are empowered to choose the work they’d like do within the team’s committed goals.


In return, we ask that you do your best to understand our users’ needs, deliver releases or fixes within the time-frames agreed within your team, take ownership of specific tasks, occasionally provide customer training, and be flexible when company priorities change.


Expect to participate in open discussions, to challenge and be challenged with arguments based on reason, and to compromise occasionally in order to achieve team consensus. Trust, honesty and respect for others is essential. Enthusiasm and drive are highly valued.


What makes you an Undo Software Engineer?



  • Excellent skills in the C programming language on Linux

  • Strong experience in developing software within a commercial environment

  • B.Sc. 2.1 or 1st or equivalent in Computer Science or other relevant subject

  • You thrive in a highly collaborative team of engineers

  • You enjoy being part of an empowered development team

  • You are enthusiastic about engaging with customers as necessary to create a great product / service

  • You look to continuously improve your expertise, knowledge or skills


Optional technical skills



  • Python

  • Debugger or compiler internals

  • JITs or other code generators

  • Low-level user-level coding (i.e. good understanding of kernel ABI)

  • x86, ARM or other assembly

  • Kernel development


Applying


If you would like to apply for this role, please send us your CV.


Or, if you have any questions about the role and would like to know more, get in touch with Mark, who’s in charge of recruitment at Undo.
