item.title: DevOps Engineer to support Oath's growth worldwide at Oath (Paris, France)
item.description:
We are looking for a DevOps with significant experience, to support our growth worldwide. Joining the IT team of AlephD, you will manage the core infrastructure of the company, made of around 150 servers/instances deployed all over the world in 10 datacenters, on AWS or baremetal. Those servers host real-time services, developed by the company, and big data frameworks such as Hadoop and Kafka. You will define the DevOps process, together with the devs, working on continuous integration and automated deployment.  You’ll be responsible to deliver:



  • Keep a 24x7 production environment up-and-running using cloud-enabled automation and proactive monitoring, while allowing frequent incremental deployments.

  • Create the standards in the company for any infrastructure process and DevOps, by working with developers to implement it .

  • deploy and maintain the security policy (firewall, access, intrusion detection system), in coordination with Oath ITsec

  • Be part of designing a solid product, with emphasis on rapid development and scalability.

  • Be alert and proactively on analyze production incidents for root causes and solutions.


Technologies you will be working in and around:



  • AWS Ecosystem

  • Configuration management tools (Ansible)

  • Python, Java

  • Analytic Databases (Vertica)

  • CI/CD tools (Git, Jenkins, Nagios, etc.)

  • Hadoop and Kafka Ecosystem (Map/Reduce, Spark, Hive, Flink...)


Qualifications
We’re looking for the following experience:



  • Good Linux system/network admin skills.

  • Configuration Management (Ansible or equivalent).

  • Experience with building CI/CD pipelines using open-source tools (i.e. Jenkins).

  • Infrastructure automation in a scalable cloud environment ( AWS).

  • Fluent at scripting in Python (or other similar languages).

  • Advantage - Extensive experience with AWS networking, load balancing, VPC creation.

  • Advantage - Database administration experience.


Additional information
We’re looking for a solution-oriented candidate, excited by the challenge of a fast growing big data infrastructure, and ready to share its ideas on the future of the IT in the company.
We offer:



  • A competitive package with great benefits and performance related pay

  • International environment with teams from around the world

  • An excellent start-up work environment, flat hierarchies and short decision paths

  • Flexible working time

  • English required, French nice to have

item.title: Senior Ruby Enigneer at Funding Circle (London, UK)
item.description:
Would you describe yourself as an engineer who’s always ready to take on the next challenge? If your answer is yes, you’re going to fit right in with our global team. We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Ruby Engineer who will bring elegance and simplicity to the forefront of our distributed systems. 


Prospectus:


Would you describe yourself as an engineer who’s always ready to take on the next challenge? If your answer is yes, you’re going to fit right in with our global team. We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Ruby Engineer who will bring elegance and simplicity to the forefront of our distributed systems. We are a group of passionate engineers whose bread and butter is learning new technologies and fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment - we’re looking for partners in crime who feel the same.


Our ideal teammate has:



  • at least 1 year of professional experience working with Ruby.

  • 5+ years of overall software engineering experience in any language (Ruby, Python, Java, etc).

  • an interest in Functional Programming languages.

  • comfortable in a Unix/Linux environment.

  • experience using a testing framework in their work process.


Experience with the below is a bonus



  • Github or other open source code we can check out.

  • distributed systems experience.

  • experience with microservices and/or event-driven architecture.

  • operating at scale with low-latency systems.

  • experience working within a highly regulated industry such as finance or insurance.


*The stated experience level is a guide and does not preclude applications from candidates with more or less experience, provided the requisite skills can be demonstrated.


Why Join Us?


Happy employees are productive employees, that’s why we offer a hearty benefits package. From subsidized catered lunches, to a competitive salary, equity, and health benefits, we’ve got you covered! That being said, have you heard about what we're doing?! Our mission is what really motivates us to come to work each day:



  • We're supporting small business, the engine of economic growth.

  • We're helping facilitate higher yields for investors and lower interest rates for borrowers.

  • We can fund loans extremely quickly, all online!

  • We have a clear competitive advantage globally in areas like domain expertise and regulatory processes.


To learn more about our work environment, culture, and perks, visit:

item.title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure at Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Software Engineer, Infrastructure


Do you enjoy building highly reliable systems with the goal of enabling breakthroughs in Artificial Intelligence research? If so, then we have an opportunity for you. AI2 is looking for engineers who are passionate about building common infrastructure to empower researchers and engineers. Currently our team is moving our company's technology into containers deployed in the cloud using Kubernetes. If you joined AI2, you would help make this project to success, as well as contribute to other impactful projects.


At AI2, you’d be working not just with talented software engineers but also with world-class AI researchers. We have projects on understanding and answering real-world questions, learning from pictures and videos, and building the world’s best academic search engine. As an engineer on the infrastructure team, you would have the chance to learn about and collaborate on all of these projects.


We have a beautiful office right on Lake Union; catered lunches three times a week; great pay and benefits; smart, friendly and helpful co-workers; and even a couple of kayaks you can take out on sunny days.


What you’ll do



  • Build robust systems with high reliability that are leveraged across the company.

  • Design and contribute to technical projects that meet the needs of our internal customers.

  • Collaborate with engineers and researchers to identify new opportunities for high impact infrastructure

  • Support key infrastructure offerings.

  • Educate about our offerings, and onboard new users onto our systems.


What we’re looking for



  • Fluency in a mainstream programming language (Java, Python, Go, etc.)

  • Prior software development experience working on infrastructure in an industry setting.

  • Success developing software collaboratively on a team.

item.title: Software Developer C++ at Bright Computing (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We have positions available for enthusiastic and experienced software developers for the development of our Linux-based cluster software environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.

item.title: Systems Performance Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
SYSTEMS PERFORMANCE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


IMC is currently looking for a multi-talented and passionate hands-on System Performance Engineer to play a critical role in analyzing, optimizing, and continuously tune the complete trading stack, in order to improve performance of our low latency trading systems on financial exchanges.


As a performance engineer, you will interact heavily with other teams and be exposed to low latency technologies such as microwave links and FPGAs that are being used by thousands of trading applications daily.


Your primary source of information are full network captures that amount to terabytes of data per day. All these must be reliably captured, stored on an accessible medium, decoded and analyzed in order to find patterns, provide answers, verify theories and assumptions.


You will also be given the opportunity to try in a real environment any innovative state-of-the-art technology, be it in early initial commercialization phases or via collaboration with Universities / Research centers. This is done by implementing quick internal prototypes of early alpha versions that access both their latency improvements and their real-world applicability.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Prototyping: be able to quickly try-out many Ideas, Solutions and Technologies… all at the same time.

  • Automation: be able to fully automate all Measurement, Data collection and Analysis via scripting

  • Measurement: be a latency measurement detective; think Sherlock Holmes and the case of the missing packet sniffer microsecond

  • Communication: be able to share / route the appropriate level of information with both traders and other sister IT teams.


WHO YOU ARE:



  • Strong proven commercial experience in Python 

  • Knowledge: Proficient understanding of computer internals, networking and Linux (at least two out of three). Skilled in reverse engineering techniques.

  • Personality: Inquisitive mind, love solving brain teasers. After internal training, being able to work self-sufficiently with minimal guidance.

  • Experience: typically MSc + proven work experience. Preference to a “T-shaped profile” that mixes both wide + deep skills on a need basis.

item.title: Software Engineer in Rack Scale Design - Come and Code with the Best! at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Poland)
item.description:
Job Description


We are happy to inform that we have a place for you in  Rack Scale Design project, which is all about innovating intelligent resource orchestration of the datacenter based on new hardware architecture.


Intel® Rack Scale Design (Intel® RSD) is a revolutionary, new architecture that disaggregates compute, storage, and network resources, and introduces the ability to more efficiently pool and utilize these resources.


Our Polish Team is responsible for Defining, Designing, Developing and Validating new features and functionalities of RSD. We break things, solve big problems, and lead at the intersection of hardware and software. Sounds interesting?


 Join us and develop your skills and experience by working with some of the brightest minds in scheduling and orchestration, telemetry, networking, storage, and the software that runs a data center.


Our Teams in Gdansk working on all the layers of the Data Centre Solution and we are actively looking for engineers to join:



  • low level FW or

  • middle layer SW or

  • cloud operating system.


What we offer:


We offer competitive benefits and pay, opportunities for professional development and the flexibility you need to achieve balance. Intel fosters a collaborative environment allowing the brightest minds in the world to come together to achieve exceptional results.

Besides regular duties you can:
- Take advantage of various career development activities,
- Participate in various innovation-focused activities (innovation lab, collaboration events, and patent submissions writing),
- Have a chance to participate in Intel Great Place to Work program which gathers people who love running, cycling, squash, tennis, cross fit, photography, and many more,
- Relax during energetic team events (skiing, scuba diving, kayaking, etc.),
- Chill out with unlimited amount of coffee, tea, and soft drinks.

Base salary is accompanied with such additional benefits as bonuses, private medical plan, life insurance, lunch coupons, and more.


Qualifications


Don’t hesitate to apply for this position!  We do have both Junior and Senior Engineers positions so you’ll definitely find the right place for you in one of our Teams.


Just starting your career?


Our Team is a great place to develop your skills and experience in engineering the newest technologies. You can be teamed with experienced engineers who will support you while you’ll be ramping up into your technical journey


Are you already an experienced engineer?


Leverage your experience and bring it to the next level while developing the state of art solutions in Data Center


These are the skills and qualities we value:


- Enthusiasm and passion for new technologies,


- Dedication, pro-activeness, focus on results in the area related to software development,
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
- Knowledge of any modern programming languages (i.e. Java, C++, C#, Python),


- Willingness to learn new technologies and programming techniques,
- Have good communication skills in English.


 Inside this Business Group


The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

item.title: QA Engineer at QuantumBlack (London, UK)
item.description:
About QuantumBlack


We established QuantumBlack to re-imagine how organisations could continuously improve and out learn their rivals. From aerospace to finance to Formula One, we help companies prototype, develop, and deploy bespoke data science and data visualisation solutions to make better decisions. We help companies use data to drive decisions, combining business experience, expertise in large-scale data analysis and visualization, and advanced software engineering know-how to deliver results. 


You will be responsible for testing complex interactive applications. Knowledge of front-end and back-end development processes and environments are essential and respecting the quality of the end-product and taking in pride in the work is a must. You will test across various browsers and devices, and document and communicate the user experience to ensure a seamless result.


Responsibilities:



  • Analyse the requirements and creation of test plan

  • Involved in the creation of Functional, System, Integration and Regression test cases and procedures

  • Execute software tests (Manual/Automated) and document test results

  • Technical trouble-shooting

  • Logging, monitoring and retesting of bugs found

  • Creation and maintenance of test and environment data

  • Day-to-day planning of individual QA assignments.

  • Work closely with developers, business analysts, support and management to understand requirements and product direction. Occasional interaction with clients may be required.

  • Provide regular updates on progress and/or issues relating to test(QA) activities

  • Active in Agile meetings when required for planning, retrospectives


Requirements:



  • End-to-end Automation testing experience

  • A degree in Computer Science or related IT degree

  • ISEB/ISTQB qualified (foundation as a minimum)

  • Experience in Software Testing/QA

  • Good knowledge of QA practices and processes

  • Manual Testing experience (mandatory)

  • Hands-on experience of building test automation frameworks using HP QTP/UFT, Cucumber or Selenium and Continued Integration (mandatory)

  • Experience of working in an Agile environment (mandatory)

  • Knowledge of MS SQL Server / basic SQL (mandatory)

  • Jira, Confluence (mandatory)

  • Experience of working in a Big-Data/Data Analytics project (advantageous)

  • Testing Mobile Applications (preferable)

  • Performance testing for global enterprise websites and applications (advantageous)

  • Experience of scripting using Bash and Python

  • Experience of Docker and containerisation

  • Experience of testing applications built using NodeJS, Scala, Python


Exposure to the following (advantageous):



  • CircleCI9

  • Mesos/Marathon

  • Spark

item.title: BACKEND DEVELOPER (M/W) at grandcentrix GmbH (Köln, Deutschland) (allows remote)
item.description:
BACKEND DEVELOPER (M/W)

Deine Aufgaben bei uns



  • Du realisierst, gemeinsam mit unserem Team, IoT- und Service-Plattformen als Bestandteil digitaler Produkte, die von Millionen Nutzern geliebt werden.

  • Du arbeitest maßgeblich an der Realisierung von hoch skalierenden, sicheren und professionell deployten Lösungen.

  • Hierbei verwendest du keine monolithischen Enterprise-Architekturen sondern nutzt vor allem Elixir, Python und JavaScript.

  • Unter Deiner Mitwirkung entstehen Lösungen, die von unserem Team auf eigener Hardware oder bei Cloud Anbietern betrieben und betreut werden.


Was wir uns von dir wünschen



  • Leidenschaft für die Backend-Entwicklung sowie ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung.

  • Vertiefte Kenntnisse in und Interesse an mehr als einer Programmiersprache oder Plattform. 

  • Kenntnisse im Umgang mit HTTP und im Design von REST APIs.

  • Ausgeprägtes Interesse an Tests, Clean Code und Struktur bei der Software-Entwicklung.

  • Erfahrung mit Domain-Driven Design, Docker und Kubernetes sind von Vorteil.

  • Interesse an der Arbeit in interdisziplinären, agilen Entwicklungsteams sowie offenem Informationsaustausch unter Kollegen.

  • Einen offenen und klaren Kommunikationsstil – in deutscher und englischer Sprache.

item.title: Senior Software Test Automation Engineer at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction


Within ASML the sector Development & Engineering is responsible for the specification and the design of ASML products. 
In this sector, the department SW DE EUV Source Test and Integration specifies, executes and controls the testing and integration of the various software systems into a software release.




Job Mission


Ensure a good efficient testing & qualification of new software, either released as new release version or in service packs




Job Description


• Test Impact determination
In discussions with architects and developers, the impact of a release or service pack must be determined to be able to select existing testcases or create new testcases. The software test engineer will look at these deliverables from a customers point-of-view, and test from that system perspective


• Software qualification 
Define and execute software qualification tests on the new proto type systems and on test benches. Every week a new development software baseline is released and must be tested on the test benches and the proto type systems. As much as possible should be tested on the test benches to relieve the claim on the very expensive proto type systems. Therefore part of the challenge is also to make these test benches as representative as possible. 

• Creating system tests 
Create system level test to qualify the system and the software and to test the reliability of the system and the different modules of the system. These system level tests are typically implemented in the form of Python scripts. 

• Analysis
Do the first analysis of the problem to find the development project that is responsible for fixing the problem. After the problem has been dispatched you should assist the development project in defining and testing the solution and make sure that they deliver an adequate solution in time.


• Reporting
Clear reporting on issues found, both in an issue database, as well as in overviews and in a test analysis report.


• Continuous improvement
New issues coming from the field or factory must be analyzed why they were not caught in our own tests, and preventive actions must be defined to make sure future testcases will capture these issues.




Education


• WO/HBO education level 
• Computer Science, Physics, Electronics, Mechanics, Mathematics or comparable




Experience


• Experience in testing high-tech systems


• Experience deducting test plans from documents and implicit knowledge
  of people


• Experience with programming/scripting/automation (Unix, Python)  




Personal skills


• A strong communicative personality with a pragmatic attitude. 
• Excellent cooperation skills. 
• Flexible and goal oriented, able to realize progress within an uncertain and rapidly changing environment. 
• Good knowledge of English language. 
• Takes ownership and is decisive




Context of the position


For rolling out new software changes, there is a software release project that manages testing and integration of software components into the software release. The Software Test Engineer reports to the project leader of this software integration project and to the manager of SW DE EUV Source Test and Integration.

item.title: Senior UI Engineer at Anthemis (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a talented and curious software engineer to join our Soho, London office and help re-invent financial services for everyone for the 21st century. The information revolution is changing the meaning of financial services and Anthemis wants to help invent an industry for everyone. An industry without zero-sum games and with equal access to information and financial products, for all.


You will work directly with the Director of Technology. Your main focus will be to build things to help answer questions about concepts for new businesses. Additionally, you will be helping to generate new ideas for businesses; experimenting with emerging technology; performing occasional due diligence on investment opportunities; and building a modern technology platform to scale venture investing.


Requirements



We’re looking for an experienced software engineer, with at least five years spent building digital products. We’re open-minded about technology, but are interested in people who keep exploring: you’ll have used more than one of Python, Ruby, JavaScript (including ES6,) Clojure, Go and maybe Rust, Elm and Haskell. We believe high-quality software engineering is how you can be your most effective: you’ll be comfortable with TDD, continuous integration, and continuous deployment. There’s lots more to quality digital products: you’ll also be comfortable with cloud tech (such as AWS and Heroku), and modern architecture (like Serverless and microservices.)


Above all, you’re a creative, curious and thoughtful generalist. You’re happy throughout the tech stack, perhaps with specialties. You use your creativity and curiosity to create ideas for new businesses, to experiment rapidly and to try out new approaches. You’re comfortable with the uncertainty of new businesses and the idea of having no clear product to build.


It’d be great if you’d previously worked on a startup, or helped build and launch a new product of some sort. And it’d be interesting if there was some area of technology that is of personal interest to you.

item.title: OpenStack Cloud System Engineer (m/f) at SysEleven GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Would you be interested in harnessing over 4,000 CPUs, 35 TB RAM and more than 800 TB storage to take an OpenStack cloud to the next level? Then you’ve come to the right place.


As a System Engineer for SysEleven, you will work with committed and passionate people to manage and develop an OpenStack public cloud. We need to tackle the challenges we face in an effective, efficient and highly technical way. What makes our cloud so special is that it complies with the relevant standards: we attract customers with our performance rather than locking them in. To stay constantly up to speed, we undergo regular training in all manner of different areas, including international conferences.


Your tasks:



  • Design, manage and develop our OpenStack cloud platform

  • Automate at all levels, from bare metal through to application management

  • Keep track of everything through good monitoring, alerting and trending

  • Evaluate and commission software and hardware, e.g. SDN, SDS and OpenStack components such as Designate and Kolla

  • Offer new ideas to improve our processes and architecture

  • Join the on-call rotation and help solve emergencies should they arise


Requirements:



  • Several years of experience managing distributed systems with Linux

  • Monitoring and trending experience, e.g. with Prometheus and Grafana

  • Experience of configuration management, e.g. with Ansible

  • Attention to detail

  • Ability to stay calm while solving critical incidents

  • Bonus: Experience with software-defined storage and/or software-defined networking e.g. Open vSwitch or CEPH

  • Bonus: Experience with Kubernetes and/or Docker

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher Deep Learning (m/f) at Avira (Tettnang, Deutschland)
item.description:
Position Summary


With its approx. 100 million customers and about 500 employees, Avira is a globally leading provider of self-developed IT security solutions for private and professional consumers. It has more than 25 years of experience and is one of the pioneers in this industry. In Germany, Avira is located in Tettnang close to Lake Constance and one of the biggest regional employers. In addition, it has offices abroad and also maintains partnerships in Europe, Asia, and America.

For delivering the best possible protection against digital threats to our customers and due to the expansion of our team, we have an exciting career opportunity for a:

Machine Learning Researcher – Deep Learning (m/f)

As a member of the Advanced Research and Technologies Team, you will design, implement and maintain Machine Learning Systems with a focus on Deep Learning technology. You constantly interact with an international team of open-minded computer scientists located in Germany and Romania to find the very best solutions to a diverse set of interesting problems. You closely collaborate with other teams within the Avira Protection Labs in order to react to the newest malware trends when designing new products.

Your challenges



  • Research, Design, implement and maintain innovative Machine Learning systems for security related problems.

  • Collaborate within other teams within the Avira Protection Labs to leverage their security expertise and make sure our products provide the best protection to our customers.

  • Stay up to date with the latest Machine Learning and Deep Learning technology advancements in order to find new possibilities for innovation within the company.


Key to hiring



  • You have an advanced degree (MS./Ph.D) in computer science with a focus on Machine Learning/Deep Learning or related subjects.

  • You have a strong background in Deep Learning including a solid knowledge of different Deep Learning architectures, a profound theoretical understanding of analysis of algorithms, optimization techniques as well as strong awareness of best practices when designing Deep Learning systems.

  • You have demonstrated practical experience in Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Torch, Theano etc.

  • You have versatile programming skills in writing and reliable code in Python and are used to develop in a Linux environment 

  • You never stopped learning and are keen to extend your skills regarding Machine Learning and new technology stacks for any upcoming project.

  • Publications at top-tier international conferences (ICML, NIPS etc.) or significant contributions to open-source projects are considered a strong plus.


Performance objectives



  • Starting from day one you will familiarize yourself with our current Machine Learning environment, which we leverage to protect our customer base. Within one month you understand the software and hardware architecture of the existing Machine Learning systems.

  • In addition, within the first six months, you will collaborate in the design and implementation of a prototype for our next deep learning project. The learning system you design and develop will scale for a very large amount of data and provide high-performance and low maintenance. Your project will process security-related data and help in protecting our users on a global scale.

  • A year into the job you are part of a team that delivers the most up to date security solution to our millions of customers. You take ownership of cross-department projects and collaborate efficiently with other teams. You are keen to improve existing technology and implement new innovative features. You play a big part in securing and supporting the digital lifestyle of our customers and making the internet a more secure place.



If you are enthusiastic about broadening your technical expertise and have a desire to work in an environment that promotes creativity, research, innovation, and fun, we would love to hear from you!


Our offer




  • Freedom to develop innovative ideas and projects as well as implement them

  • Flat hierarchies and open door policies

  • Opportunity to work in an international team using the latest technologies

  • Extensive onboarding


If you are enthusiastic about broadening your technical expertise and have a desire to work in an environment that promotes creativity, research, innovation, and fun, we would love to hear from you!

This position is based in Tettnang, Lake Constance.

Please submit your application including your salary requirements and availability by clicking on the “Apply now” button. Online applications preferred.

item.title: Bioinformatics Software Developer (Genomics) at Illumina Cambridge (Little Chesterford, UK)
item.description:
Bioinformatics Software Developer


Full time / Permanent


Cambridge, UK


Fantastic remuneration package which would include company equity, private medical care, annual bonus scheme, membership to Illumina’s share purchase scheme and more




Illumina is the leading developer, manufacturer, and marketer of life science tools and integrated systems for large-scale analysis of genetic variation, function and disease.



We currently have a fantastic opportunity for a bioinformatics software developer to join the team working on the 100,000 genome project.  This ambitious project is the largest ever study of the underlying genetic causes of cancers and rare diseases and will characterise the genomes of NHS patients and their families to increase understanding of how these diseases occur (read this BBC news article on the 100,000 genome project for more information). Illumina is the company that has been chosen to sequence all of the samples collected and identify the differences in the patients’ genomes that could potentially be the source of their disease.



As a Bioinformatics Software Developer, you will be responsible for building software tools to facilitate the delivery of the genomes. This includes productivity tools to make the analysis and delivery of genomes more efficient; tools for tracking samples and reporting on their status and tools to identify and help resolve issues with individual samples. You will work in a team of software developers, testers and analysts who help gather and refine requirements, develop, test, deploy and maintain software that operates in an ISO accredited environment to deliver genomes that will be used to affect clinical outcomes.



Your responsibilities may include:




  • Developing software (Python, Angular.js, Go) to a high standard and conforming to a well-defined software development process

  • Documenting user needs, design inputs and software requirements in a formal requirements management system (Jama)

  • Work with test engineers to facilitate testing of your code

  • Work with analysts, bioinformaticians and lab users to gather and refine software requirements

  • Helping maintain and extend software developed by others

  • Understanding the environment and infrastructure of the tools, including the build, release and deployment process


Personal Attributes:



We seek demonstrated accomplishment in all of the following essential skills:



  • Confident in a Linux environment

  • Practical experience in at least one modern programming language such as Python, C#, Go

  • Experience both building and consuming REST/HTTP APIs

  • Ability to deliver within fixed deadlines

  • Modern deployment and DevOps practice, such as continuous integration, continuous deployment, containerisation (Docker), use of cloud computing (AWS)

  • Software engineering productivity tools like version control and issue tracking


Any experience in the following areas would be advantageous:




  • Relational databases and database API technologies such as ORM.

  • Working under a Quality Management System

  • Experience of web development technologies, such as Angular.js

  • Have an interest in understanding biology and disease




Qualifications:


Ideally, you should have a university degree in a technical subject (Software Engineering, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Engineering, Biological Sciences, etc.) but equivalent experience will also be considered.



Summary:


You will be an excellent software developer with great communication skills and a desire to join a fast growing Cambridge scientific team.  You will be as comfortable working collaboratively within a team as alone, and will always be looking to improve the quality of products.

item.title: Software Tester / Software QA Test Engineer (m/w) at KoCo Connector GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
CompuGroup Medical ist eines der führenden eHealth-Unternehmen weltweit und erwirtschaftet einen Jahresumsatz von rund 500 Mio. Euro. Software Tester / Software QA Test Engineer (m/w)

unbefristete Festanstellung in Vollzeit

Wir bieten Ihnen

Keywords: IT-Systeme, Software-Systeme, Software Development, Produktentwicklung, Entwicklungsprozesse, Entwicklungsdokumentation, Optimierung, Schwachstellenanalyse, Fehlerbehebung, Quality Assurance, Qualitätssicherung

item.title: Cloud Architect at Cloudreach (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.


Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation”. We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us  build  one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.



Overlooking Munich, our office is located on the 8th floor of a modern and light building, a short stroll away from Hirschgarten. See what it’s like to work in our Cloudy Hub: A day in our Munich office


What does the Cloud Enablement team do?


Our Cloud Enablement team helps provide consultative, architectural, program and engineering support for our customers' journeys to the cloud. The word 'Enablement' was chosen carefully, to encompass the idea that we support and encourage a collaborative approach to Cloud adoption, sharing best practices, helping change the culture of teams and strategic support to ensure success.


How will you spend your days ?


We are looking for a Cloud Architect to drive the adoption of Cloudreach services and to inspire customers to innovate using public cloud.


You will be :



  • Focusing on one or more strategic customers to ensure a successful delivery of value.

  • Driving solution architecture and best practices by:


    • Producing internal and customer documentation

    • Producing internal white papers and best practices guides

    • Contributing to Cloudreach internal tooling

    • Mentoring other fellow Cloud Architects


  • Leading and being deeply involved in the hands-on technical delivery of customer projects

  • Enabling clients to visualise the possibilities of leveraging public cloud.


What kind of career progression can you expect ?


You can grow into a Cloud Consultant role or side step into a managerial position acting as Architect Lead on projects or for specific teams.  


There are also opportunities for relocation in our other cloudy hubs.


How to stand out ?



  • 3+ years of architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of greenfield or migration projects using public cloud

  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject

  • Deep technical experience in one or more of the following competencies:


    • Software design or development (continuous delivery/integration, adoption of DevOps practices)

    • Systems Operations / Management

    • Enterprise Architecture

    • Infrastructure Design

    • IT Security and governance

    • Automation and System Orchestration


  • Good knowledge of programming languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby .NET, C++...

  • You have the AWS Solution Architect Pro Certification

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Fluent in German


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor, personal Google Apps domain and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)

  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • “Cloudy Lunch” where every Friday we take over a local restaurant. Enjoy, it’s on us !

  • Discount on private healthcare scheme and gym membership. Stakeholder pension with shared employee and employer contribution.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.


Salary - Competitive

item.title: Senior KDB/Q Software Engineer - Data & Analytics at JPMorgan Chase & Co. (London, UK)
item.description:
As an experienced Software Engineer, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your deep knowledge of design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming will help your team raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both business and functional requirements. Your expertise in various technology domains will be counted on to set strategic direction and solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally. Your quest to embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. And best of all, you’ll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world.


This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:



•Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines


•Advanced knowledge of architecture, design and business processes


•Keen understanding of financial control and budget management


•Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals


•5+ years of KDB+/Q experience, with relevant experience in financial services


•Proficient in Unix/Linux and OS level tools


•Knowledge of electronic trading across Equities and F&O


•Experience working with time-series databases, including development of scalable real-time data processing systems



As a Senior Software Engineer, you will demonstrate very strong programming skills in KDB+/Q, with 5+ years of experience in a similar role in any business line (fixed income, equities or any type of derivatives) and developed significant technical and business expertise.You have been exposed to some of the following: real-time market data, pre-trade analytics, post-trade analytics, order management, algorithmic trading, enterprise data warehouse, FIX protocol, web services.


Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits.CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.


When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. 



At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. 



©2017 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

item.title: Java Developer (m/w) - Weiterentwicklung der internen Identity Management Lösung at 1&1 (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das sind Ihre Aufgaben:


Die Abteilung "Business IT Development" entwickelt spannende interne Applikationen wie das Intranet oder das Identitätsmanagement der gesamten 1&1. Über 6000 interne und 8000 externe Mitarbeiter werden weltweit miteinander vernetzt. Sie unterstützen uns bei der Weiterentwicklung des zentralen Identity- und Accessmanagements.



  • Sie sind Teil eines agilen und selbstorganisierten Entwicklungsteams.



  • Sie bauen moderne Schnittstellen und anpassungsfähige Prozesse zur Authentifizierung und Autorisation.



  • Sie entwerfen und implementieren flexible Lösungen für den Lebenszyklus von Identitäten in hochautomatisierten Umgebungen.



  • Sie erweitern die Funktionalität unseres zentralen Berechtigungsmanagements auf die aktuellen Bedürfnisse eines modernen Unternehmens.



  • Sie unterstützen bei der Findung von automatisierten und dezentral verwalteten Lösungen.



Das wünschen wir uns:


An der Verwendung verschiedener Technologien und Programmiersprachen haben Sie Freude und aktualisieren selbständig Ihr Wissen. Die Gestaltung, automatisierter und nachvollziehbarer Prozesse und die Implementierung skalierbarer und wartbarer Lösungen mit einem hohen Qualitätsanspruch fällt Ihnen leicht. Sie arbeiten zielorientiert und sind begeistert für Neues. Zudem darf für Sie ein gesundes Maß an Pragmatismus und Spaß bei der Entwicklung nicht fehlen.



  • Sie besitzen fundierte Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit Schwerpunkt Java (Frontend und Backend).



  • Sie verfügen über ein tiefgreifendes Know-how aktueller Java EE APIs.



  • Sie beherrschen den sicheren Umgang mit relationale Datenbanken (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, etc.).



  • Sie haben Erfahrung mit dem produktiven Einsatz von NoSQL Technologien (Neo4j, Redis, etc.).



  • Sie glauben an den Grundsatz "APIs First".



  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Skriptsprachen (Python, Groovy, etc.) runden Ihr Profil ab.

item.title: Software Engineers to help us build a bank in London at Growth Street Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We need Software Development Engineers with experience of delivering impactful results by building first rate software applications. We want to hire people who can see solutions not problems and work collaboratively across all areas of the business.


This is a "level 2" or “mid level” role. It is ideal for somebody who wants to focus on doing great quality work and grow toward having a high degree of influence, potentially at a senior level. Typically, mid level engineers are the people who frequently do design work, but spend the majority of their time writing a lot of high quality code. As your role develops you can expect more responsibility for technical design and coaching.


Your Responsibilities



  • To help design and to build robust systems focused on extensibility, scalability and availability.

  • To apply a test-driven approach to all engineering moving forward, working with the team to this goal, shortening the feedback loop across the SDLC.

  • To contribute to a productive, creative and enjoyable engineering culture where builders can do work they feel proud of.

  • To work with business stakeholders, product owners and business analysts to understand requirements, develop ideas and design solutions.

  • To support production systems operationally and participate in continuous improvement of their quality.


REQUIREMENTS


Our tech stack includes, but is not limited to: Python 3.5; Django; PostgreSQL; Celery running in AWS infrastructure;. And, if you answer “yes” to the following questions, then we could be a great match:



  • Do you practice the principles around ‘12 factor’ app.

  • Do you apply the SOLID approach to everything you do?

  • Do you have proven experience of, or a preference for working in teams delivering complex, highly performing and high quality financial services products?

  • Are you motivated by the opportunity to transform our django-based applications into extensible, scalable and highly performing services.


You will be part of a fantastic and energetic team that constantly demonstrates the Growth Street company values of Being Curious, Being In-sync and Beating Expectations.


Nice to Haves



  • Experience within financial services.

  • Experience with integrations with various SaaS based financial/risk platforms such as Xero,FreeAgent, Moody's RiskCalc, Equifax.

  • Knowledge of Django & Django REST framework.

  • Experience developing against a cloud platform such as AWS, with an eye on serverless applications and beyond.


BENEFITS



  • A competitive salary

  • Employer pension contributions of 5% of your base salary

  • Generous training, equipment and IT budget

  • The tools you require to get the job done

  • A strong and clear company culture, focused on growth

  • Participation in an employee equity scheme

  • 25 days of holiday plus Bank Holidays


The role is based from our London offices. We are located 1 minute from Aldgate Tube station.


About Us


We are on a mission to create a new kind of financial service. Growth Street is building a business banking platform to support the 5 million SMEs that power Britain.


We’re passionate about helping businesses maximise their potential, making applying for credit as quick and easy as possible. We have crafted an efficient marketplace for both borrowers and lenders, so they can get a better deal and a better service than the banks can offer. We are not a bank, and we are far more than an alternative lender. We are something better.


Growth Street engineers are skilled technically, and enjoy working in a team environment and contributing to its success.


We are a rapidly growing team from all kinds of backgrounds. We are deeply ambitious, we work hard and we work together.


We are an equal opportunities employer

item.title: DevOps Engineer - (Hadoop, Linux, Chef) at Sky Betting & Gaming (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
The Challenge…



The Data tribe is looking to expand its team of DevOps Engineer to build, automate, run and support the Data Engineering tools set. The successful applicant will be working with several Hadoop and streaming data technologies to provide the business with both offline and real-time reporting and metrics.


Who are you?



  • Working closely with the other technical teams within Data and infrastructure tribes, you will be part of the team responsible for making step changes to the Data Tribe's live Hadoop cluster, which supports real-time and offline reporting tools.

  • You’ll also be working with our team to manage and enhance our build, repositories, job scheduling and monitoring platforms. Creating tooling to allow development teams to run their own environments. 

  • Availability, stability and performance are key requirements of our systems, you’ll be able to troubleshoot issues at application, cluster and OS level.

  • You’ll have a passion for big data technologies and systems, you keep up to date with the latest open source technology and best practice. Suggest areas where new tools or methods can help the business achieve its goals


Skills & Requirements


What you’ve done…



  • You’ll have worked in an Agile autonomous team, working on both day to day troubleshooting and automation projects.

  • You’ll have strong RHEL administration skills, experience of docker, AWS and CI tools such as Jenkins and Nexus. We expect you to have setup and used application and server performance monitoring using tools such as Graphite and Nagios/Opsview in anger.

  • You’ll have strong scripting skills in Chef, python and worked with a formal SDLC backed by git version control.

  • We’re happy to train you in the administration of Hadoop toolset e.g. HDFS, hive, hbase, sqoop, yarn, spark and data streaming technologies such as kafka . But if you have experience of those tools that’s fantastic.

item.title: Ensembl Web Back-End Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
The Ensembl project and the Genomics Technology Infrastructure team seeks a highly motivated developer committed to the development our web infrastructure at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), which is located on the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

Big data management and dissemination is one of the most important biological information problems in genomics. Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes provides access to over 30,000 genomes served from one of the world's largest computer resources for genomic analysis developing open source software. Thousands of scientists worldwide depend on access to these data to help their research on a daily basis. We are looking for a candidate to drive forward our move to container based deployment of Ensembl’s web infrastructure.


As part of the Ensembl Containerised Deployment project you will report to the Ensembl Web Back-End project leader and work as part of a team of developers with responsibilities including:



  • Developing the new Ensembl deployment platform in conjunction with the Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes teams

  • Continuous evaluation of the current state of container technology

  • Developing prototype container based deployment and then rolling this out to more complex use-cases

  • Providing web support for other EMBL-EBI projects mainly based on Ensembl technology or data

  • Helping to maintain the public services delivered by the two projects both in the UK and on our AWS mirrors

  • Helping to ensure the regular scheduled releases of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes are delivered on-time in conjunction with our front-end development team

  • Collaborate with EMBL-EBI’s technical services cluster to ensure our container solutions are in-line with EMBL-EBI directions


Qualifications and Experience


Applicants should have a masters level qualification or similar practical experience in biology, bioinformatics, computer science or a related subject.


You must have experience in developing and deploying websites into a production environment. You should also have experience of developing software within a collaborative environment and have been exposed to progressive software development techniques (Git, GitHub, software testing, continuous integration).


We are looking for highly motivated candidates with good communication and interpersonal skills. You should also be capable of communicating design ideas effectively. Skill in delivering a high quality product with excellent attention to detail and within fixed deadlines is essential.


You should have experience in two of the following technologies: Perl, Python, JavaScript (server side), MySQL, Apache, mod_perl. Practical experience in container technology (e.g. Docker, rkt) and knowledge of container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm) are essential. Knowledge of Unix/Linux command line, Git is essential. Knowledge of deployment tools such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet would be advantageous.

item.title: Sr. JAVA Developer at Basebone (Málaga, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
Basebone is a specialist in mobile performance marketing, carrier billing and mobile entertainment products. We work with companies all over the world and our consumer base is in key growth markets such as South Africa, India & Mexico. Basebone has enjoyed tremendous growth since inception due to strategic expansion but mainly because of our team of superstars.


Changing the game takes some very special people. Our team is made up of international, driven professionals who love to work in a fast-paced, competitive industry. They are super sharp and switched on. Flexible, friendly, and up for any challenge.


We put great care into keeping a friendly, family atmosphere and all applicants will be judged greatly on their teamwork. Showing respect to yourself and those around you is paramount at Basebone.


So if you join us as a Java developer,  get ready for something special: be a member of the Basebone family. Your past achievements intrigue us but we are also interested to hear what you think you can do to add value to our mission. You can trust us to do the right thing by you. It’s a great place to work and we’re the best team you may ever work with! 


                                                             We're excited to meet you!


Role Responsibilities:


Basebone is looking for full backend JAVA Developers for it's mobile billing, mobile marketing and mobile entertainment systems. We're addicted to mobile, marketing and technology in a fast paced, ever changing industry and you will be joining a highly motivated and capable team.


As a Java developer at Basebone you will:



      Develop and maintain Java and PHP highly optimized, fast code in a rapidly developing, dynamic, messaging connected environment.


Write shell scripts, cron tabs, PHP CLI scripts etc.



      Choosing the proper database solution (MySQL, Cassandra etc) for your code and optimizing the code and queries.


Work in small teams, taking ownership of a business area and managing requirements and goals with company internal stakeholders independently. In other words, be the expert.


Minimum Qualification:



      University studies and/or equivalent experience.



Technical Skills:



      2+ years experience working with JAVA (not only J2EE) and OO PHP (5/7).


Good knowledge of MySql , query and resource optimization and/or professional NoSQL experience.



      Linux / Unix knowledge: you know how to play with command line.


Knowledge and experience with shell scripting (ksh, bourne, bash, csh, PHP, etc).



      Basics in HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap are assumed.



Nice if you have:



      Experience with Cassandra / RabbitMQ / Couchbase / Percona XtraDB.


Knowledge about Eclipse, Intellij, SVN, Git, PhpStorm, Python, PHP 7, HAProxy.



      Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.


Ability to handle diverse situations, multiple projects, rapidly changing priorities and deliver results under pressure.


Soft Skills



      Fluent in English,  both in writing and verbally.


Team work spirit


Company Benefits


We are continually adding and improving our benefits but here are some of the perks we offer:



      Private healthcare


Short day Fridays



      Special hours for new parents


Professional memberships



      Life insurance


Awesome parties and company events



      Complimentary catering, daily fresh Fruit and as much coffee as you can drink!



Basebone is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Architect at Clevertech () (allows remote)

Clevertech is looking for a Full Stack Javascript Architect to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.


In this role you will have significant responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by executing on the deliverables.



REQUIREMENTS


Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.


Technically, you have an excellent background in data structures, design patterns, and modern programming practices with more than 6 years experience.

You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth. Our standard projects use full stack javascript, however we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or C++ .

item.title: Node.js Developer at Accel-Backed Machine Learning CyberSecurity Startup! at CheckRecipient (London, UK)
item.description:
Engineering At CheckRecipient


Dealing with massive datasets at scale requires ingenuity and strong analytical skills. Our agnostic approach to problem solving means we favour hiring engineers who pride themselves on the ability to learn new skills, their comfort with the unknown and their willingness to experiment.


At CheckRecipient you’ll be growing your skill-set on an ongoing basis; regular and continuous development is something we believe in and as an employee we will seek to create opportunities for you to evolve.


We build quickly and follow both agile and continuous delivery paradigms. As a member of the CheckRecipient engineering team, you will have the autonomy to work on your own projects, and be part of our regular round tables to bounce ideas around as a team on how to tackle our biggest challenges. We believe in Deep Work and ensure our Engineers have the option of two 2-hour uninterrupted sessions a day with no external distractions.


We're looking for a backend engineer to work on a scalable platform for live processing of email data to be used with our machine learning technology. Good knowledge of Node.JS and Python is required for developing the platform which is based on Haraka SMTP server, whilst experience of technologies such as Docker, Postgres and AWS is also ideal.


The role will involve strategy planning of the roadmap, architecting the solution, as well as implementation and development of the overall solution. The platform will need to be highly scalable, automated, and capable of live processing large volumes of emails. It will make use of containerization technologies, micro-services and cloud.


You should apply if a lot of the below sounds like you:


Key Languages:



  • Node.JS (backend)

  • Python (desired)


Technologies:



  • Databases (Postgres/MongoDB)

  • Queuing (RabbitMQ)

  • Docker

  • AWS


Other skills:



  • Networking

  • SysAdmin

  • SMTP / Mail Gateways


You should apply if you:



  • are a great problem solver who takes pride in their work

  • have knowledge of Node.js (and ideally some Python)

  • are interested in working on a microservices architecture or have an interest in DevOps

item.title: Full Stack Developer (Reactjs, Node.js & Elixir) at Findmypast (City of London, UK)
item.description:
From our HQ in Shoreditch, we are building a new platform based on Elixir, React and Node! This new platform will handle the 2 million daily page views we have across our sites helping surface billions of records.


We believe engineers should be empowered to create solutions in an environment where the best idea floats to the top, rather than a top down approach!


We can offer the opportunity to:



  • Embrace functional programming, learn and master Elixir, Phoenix, React, Node and others

  • Be part of a TDD culture, employing SOLID principles, focussing on design patterns

  • Work in a lean agile environment with a flat hierarchy and pairing

  • Work on the latest architecture paradigms and technical challenges

  • Join a strong DevOps culture and manage our continuous integration and deployment with Teamcity


Besides Elixir, React and Node, we also use technologies such as Apache Solr, Microsoft SQL Server, Riak, Redis, Neo4j, RabbitMQ, etc. We also have a mix of traditional MVC and SPA applications written in ASP.net, Node, React, Angular, Coffeescript.


You are welcome to check out our tech blog: http://tech.findmypast.com


The successful applicants will have:



  • At least 3+ years commercial coding experience

  • Mastery of at least 1 programming language (e.g. JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Scala, Erlang, Clojure, .NET or other) 

  • Experience working on scalable web applications, services, APIs or high traffic sites is desirable

  • An open mind to being a full stack developer – even if it’s not 50/50 back/front dev!

  • Passion for quality (e.g. TDD / BDD) and hunger to be a lifelong learner


We want to build the best tech team in London!  Please apply now!

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Machine Learning Engineer (Deep Learning) at Othoz GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a top-tier full-stack machine learning engineer to join our team. As part of the early team you work directly with the founders and have the opportunity to significantly shape our codebase and infrastructure (Python, TensorFlow, Docker, continuous deployment to Google Cloud Platform). At the core of your position is designing, implementing, training and evaluating state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms that accurately model financial markets. Your position also includes designing large-scale data pipelines, improving our stock market trading simulation, implementing innovative portfolio optimization concepts and everything else that pops up along the early days of a startup. Like every other team member you enjoy taking full responsibility for transforming ideas into a rock-solid, well-engineered production system. Although a background in finance is not required you are eager to quickly learn essential concepts.

  • Experience in working with modern machine learning frameworks, large-scale data processing systems and cloud infrastructure

  • Demonstrated ability to engineer reliable and maintainable software systems

  • You have written large amounts of quality code

  • Demonstrated persistence when tackling hard engineering and machine learning challenges that are not easily solvable

  • Quick learner, excited to continuously learn new skills and technologies

  • Fluent in spoken and written English, good communication skills


Your strengths: bonus



  • PhD degree in related quantitative field

  • Strong publication track record in machine learning

  • Industry experience with a modern development/research stack based on Python, TensorFlow, Docker and Google Cloud Platform

  • Strong industry background in deep learning

  • Experience in helping an engineering / ML team grow

item.title: AGODA - Quality Assurance Engineer (QA), Relocate to Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
We're Hiring Quality Assurance Engineers!

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Therefore, business value from your contribution can be seen in real-time basis. Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Apply now!

About the Role:

The Quality Assurance Engineer role at Agoda is an integral part of the development process. You will be responsible for the following tasks:
  • Lead and own quality strategy of assigned scrum team to ensure a right level of product quality
  • Own quality practice of assigned scrum team
  • Ensure right level of testing activities perform along with product design/implementation
  • Define necessary test automation, design automation flow, share implementation effort with software engineer
  • Monitor and ensure each change achieves its business KPI on production
  • Drive the velocity of product development together with scrum team


About You:
  • Graduated from IT related field
  • Ability to code in any programming language
  • Experience in Test automation or Selenium is a plus
  • Good command of English (Speaking, Writing, and Reading)
  • Experience in Agile Methodology is a plus
  • Ability to identify and escalate issues in a timely manner
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and commit to the team's schedules and goals
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills


We welcome applications from both international and local based candidates. A relocation package and visa sponsorship will be offered to eligible candidates.

If you bring what it takes and this role sounds like it's for you please send us your CV right now!

item.title: Senior Engineer - Manchester at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description: We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills. As a Senior Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do: Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using languages such as Java, Ruby and/or .NET, Scala, Clojure, Mobile and Python (to name a few) Help the team to champion software quality and engender technical vision and ensuring clients are satisfied Champion agile best practices and Continuous Delivery Be an ambassador of ThoughtWorks and safeguard our reputation Build strong relationships with business people Learn something new everyday Facilitate problem solving and work with a team to make them reality. Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan Help to grow the next generation of developers and have a positive impact on the industry Here’s what you’ll bring: Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code etc, Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, Encapsulation etc   Experience of working in a forward thinking, OSS-centric environment We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so ideally you’ll be flexible about travel.
