item.title: Data Scientist (Beat Product) m/f at mytaxi (Intelligent Apps GmbH) (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About Us


Beat is a platform that transforms the way people move in their cities. Tap on a button on your smartphone and you get a ride in just a few minutes.


In early 2017 Mytaxi, a subsidiary of Daimler A.G, acquired Beat. Beat started its life as Taxibeat, 6 years ago in Europe and 3 years ago expanded its operations to Peru where it serves millions of rides every single month. It is already establishing its position in South America with Chile being the latest new market and Colombia following soon


How are we going to achieve that?


By constantly growing our world-class engineering team and developing projects such as car-pooling, personalized services, real time pricing mechanisms, routing and dispatching algorithms and fraud detection/prevention systems. To this end we are opening a new engineering hub in Berlin that will work in close collaboration with our Data Science and Big Data teams in Athens on building the next generation of intelligent systems, serving both our analytics teams and our product teams.


About the role


Our Data Science teams are at the heart of our efforts and an essential part in Beat’s aggressive growth plan and vision for the future.


As a member of our Data Science team in Berlin, you will take on some of our biggest challenges and your work will impact the entire Beat experience, from making sure drivers are always available for all our customers, to helping our drivers utilize their working hours. Our team moves very fast, so you’ll have the opportunity to make an immediate difference.


What you'll do day in day out:



  • Solve complex logistics problems, so we can make our passengers happy getting from point A to point B the fastest possible.

  • Predict the future, like modelling pickup times and forecasting supply & demand in real time.

  • Personalize the customer’s experience, with the end result of minimizing the number of interactions between user and application.

  • Help utilize our drivers’ working time by being in the right place at the right time.

  • Identify many other interesting problems to solve.

  • Working closely with engineers, designers, product managers and operations teams to iterate on solutions.


What you need to have:



  • Master's degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline. Higher degrees are highly appreciated as is considerable experience with Machine Learning, Statistical Analysis, Big Data Analytics in the industry.

  • 2+ years of experience using statistical insights and software to solve real-world problems.

  • Experience with Python or R. Additional experience and competence in software engineering are preferred. Specifically, candidates with a strong engineering background and competence in Scala or Python are highly valued.

  • Hands-on experience with SQL, NoSQL, and Apache Hadoop, Spark or Tensorflow.

  • A strong sense of ownership in your work.

  • Good numerical and analytical skills with an excellent eye for detail working with qualitative and quantitative data.

  • The desire to build, launch and iterate on products with limited direction.


What's in it for you



  • The chance to bring in your own ideas

  • A strong team spirit

  • Excellent monetary benefits (a pension plan, a monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides, subsidised public transport ticket)

  • Have your birthday off!


As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Beat is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

item.title: (Senior) Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering an exciting position as a Senior Algorithm Developer (f/m) for Autonomous Driving. You will be responsible for developing algorithms and software solutions for sensor signal processing, sensor fusion, state estimation and prediction. You will be a key player during the entire development process, from prototype implementation (e.g. in Python and ROS), through software architecture and implementation in C++ to integration and validation of the software.

You will use your ideas to design and optimise complex algorithms, e.g. for the identification, classification and fusion of objects in the vehicle environment or for situation interpretation while supporting implementation of algorithms in efficient embedded software. You will also carry out testing and validation of the algorithms developed, as well as conduct trials with real test vehicles.

In your daily work, you will find yourself in an international and interdisciplinary environment and collaborate closely with our high-tech partners. . Our new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the perfect infrastructure you will need for successfully developing software for the cars of the future.



Qualifications:


- A University degree in computer science, electrical engineering, robotics or a related field of study.
- In-depth professional experience and expertise in the field of autonomous systems (e.g. sensor data fusion, object tracking, navigation, scene interpretation, prediction).
- Very good knowledge of software engineering and the programming languages C++ and Python.
- Extensive mathematical knowledge of statistics, numerical analysis and/or optimisation.
- Experience in software development processes, e.g. agile methods.
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: Senior Back End Software Engineer at eBay (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Ask any Dutch internet user about their favourite Marktplaats story. Observe their excitement about the great deal they found or the interesting people they met. They have made Marktplaats the most popular site and the most downloaded app made in the Netherlands.

We are an international team (26 countries!) of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us. This is a big responsibility; you will work on high-availability servers, improve customer experience through innovation, impact revenues and advance our team and technologies. In turn, we will work with you to grow your career in Marktplaats and eBay.

Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data; Marktplaats handles over 1 million unique visitors, 350K new advertisements and 155K transactions daily. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.

What you can expect from us:

A collaborative, informal, international and playful work environment with self-organised agile/lean teams

Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person

Work with cool modern technologies such as Scala, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Apache Kafka, Consul, Node.js, React, Swift and Play

Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)

Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eBay Classifieds Group in trending topics like DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others

Continuous Deployment through multiple environments to get rapid feedback about your work

Work on one of the most beloved brands in the Netherlands





The person we are looking for has extensive experience in on-line or related areas, with at least 6+ years of full-time employment. We expect the right person to be an expert in software engineering and have good knowledge of what it means to work with large and/or distributed systems. We also believe that to be a well-rounded developer, one needs experience with more than just one programming language. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, can focus on delivering, and wants to take a leading role in improving how we work.

What we expect from you:

Java and Scala development

Some exposure to mobile application development (iOS/Android/HTML5)

Unix / Linux

Test driven development

Agile methodologies

Affinity for e-Commerce

A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Building great products



Your responsibilities will include:

Be a key team member in development and design of new projects

Coaching of junior and medior developers (guide them through architecture and procedures, be a mentor helping with skills development)

Think with your colleagues about architecture decisions and help work them out

Help to continuously improve development work in all areas (coding, processes, tools, testing, etc.)

Be a technical sparring partner for the organisation to help the business create efficient and effective requirements

Work with international counterparts across the worldwide eBay Classifieds Group



Preferably you have a degree in Computer Sciences or comparable topic.

Background checks are part of the hiring process.

Acquisition is not appreciated.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Strossle (Malmö, Sweden)
item.description:
Strossle is a rapidly growing, venture capital backed, digital media company with global leadership ambitions. We are looking to strengthen our machine learning team with a senior data scientist.

Are you a data scientist with a few years experience of recommendation systems or natural language processing (NLP)? Then we have a challenge for you! Come build article recommendations based on thousands of publishers' articles all over Europe for more than 100,000,000 users. Our data consist of the raw article text, images, tags from publishers, other metadata, click data, user data, and data derived from these sources.

At Strossle we believe that a high degree of flexible work offers employees freedom and more creativity, which will bring us the results were looking for.


Key responsibilities

  • Research and develop machine learning solutions
  • Work with our data engineers to implement these solutions
  • Part take in planning and roadmap development
  • Push the boundaries for how good our recommendations are
  • Create original research, visit and publish at conferences

Requirements

Please make sure these qualifications are clear from your resume

  • M. Sc. or Ph. D. in relevant field
  • At least 5 years experience as a data scientist
  • Good understanding of machine learning in general and at least one of recommender systems and NLP
  • Fluent in Python
  • Good knowledge of Tensorflow and Spark are valued bonuses

Key qualities

Please show us in your cover letter how you exemplify these qualities either at or outside work.

  • Innovative - did you find a completely new way to solve an existing problem at your last work place?
  • Passionate - are you a pro amateur athlete, a guitarist in a folk band, volunteer helping kids with homework, etc.? Show us you are a real and passionate person.
  • Team player - what do you contribute to your team in terms of your personality? Visionary, doer, mentor, spotting problems that everyone else misses, etc.?

About Strossle

Strossle helps publishers and brands to increase page views, attract new visitors and generate more revenue. At the core is a proprietary platform using algorithms and massive data collection to ensure that the right visitors are exposed to the right content and the right ads in the right context. This is often referred to as Content Discovery.

Strossles revenues are primarily generated from Native Advertising, which is the fastest growing ad format today. We have partnered with more than 1,000 publishers in 10 countries. This is only the beginning of a journey that will extend far beyond ad revenues. Our vision is to facilitate a profitable future for all content creators by providing them with the same reach and data as the social platforms have today.

Strossle was founded in 2013 and has 60 employees, of which more than half is in development. The company holds two registered patents.


Benefits


  • Stock option packages are available from time to time
  • Flexible working hours
  • Recurring hack days
  • Great amount of freedom
  • Monthly allowance for health promoting activities
  • Regular bonus competitions where the tech team is competing against a benchmark to win the opportunity for world-wide travel
  • Yearly allowance for conferences and educational material

item.title: Full Stack Developer at SuperAwesome (London, UK)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities



  • Take full ownership of various product components, driving both innovation and performance on the technology front

  • Ensure all products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production)

  • Deliver products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently

Requirements

(Some) Technologies you would work with

Qualities

  • You’re a fire-starter, you can clearly demonstrate your ability to be proactive without direct supervision

  • Flexible and adaptable, to changing situations and responsibilities

item.title: C++ Developer Disrupting TV at Appear TV (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
The rebirth of TV puts software front and center. Appear TV look to industry trends, and work in lean product teams that take on specific projects. We need skilled developers for the next TV revolution, one where the pixelated dimension is every bit as lifelike as our own.


Who are you?



  • You have a flair for C++ programming on Linux

  • You thrive in small teams, and aspire to be the team lead

  • You get a kick out of the latest generation 64-bit ARM platforms

  • You're self sustained and curious about new technologies

  • You're an artist when it comes to efficient software algorithms


What you will do in Appear TV


On the First Day, you'll join a small product team of four to eight engineers that are passionate about their product. The team lead will introduce you to the code base. The product owner will provide you with a rundown of the overall product you'll be working on, its market application and business feasibility, as well as ongoing and upcoming releases. Policy is basically dive-in, headfirst from Day One.. 


During the First Month, you will participate in the first product release. Your contribution will directly affect important features that will be demonstrated to key customers shortly after.


Upon finishing the First Year, you're established as a core team member. Clocking in the first 365, you've made a direct impact on key solutions we provide to some of the largest TV operators in one of the most dominant industries in the world.

item.title: Data Scientist - McKinsey Analytics at McKinsey & Company (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Sie werden Teil unseres sehr engagierten und kollaborativen Advanced-Analytics-Teams und beschäftigen sich mit spannenden Projekten aus allen Branchen. Wir arbeiten eng mit Klienten und Content-Experten zusammen, um Analytics-Lösungen, -Expertise und -Fähigkeiten in die Organisation unserer Klienten einzubetten. Durch die Kombination von strategischen und Business Insights mit den neuesten analytischen Techniken helfen wir unseren Klienten, aus Daten maximalen Nutzen zu ziehen und kritische Probleme datengetrieben zu lösen.


Ihre Aufgabe:


Sie entwickeln als Spezialist mit Hilfe von Advanced-Analytics-Methoden Lösungen für die herausfordernden Problemstellungen unserer Klienten – von der Konzeption über die Modellbildung bis zur Übergabe in die Implementierung.


Dabei verwenden Sie Ihre Kenntnisse in Mathematik, Statistik, Machine Learning oder Optimierung, um für und mit unseren Klienten aus den verschiedensten Branchen wichtige Erkenntnisse abzuleiten. In interdisziplinären Teams, bestehend aus Beratern, Experten und Data Scientists, bringen Sie Ihre Expertise ein. Sie arbeiten vor Ort bei Klienten in Deutschland, Europa und optional weltweit und kommunizieren Ihre Lösungen sowohl im Team als auch gegenüber den Klienten.


Ihr Profil:



  • Masterabschluss oder Promotion im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, Statistik, Machine Learning, Physik, Operations Research, Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet

  • Sichere Kommunikation in deutscher und englischer Sprache

  • Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, insbesondere die Fähigkeit, komplexe analytische Konzepte für Fachfremde und Experten anderer Gebiete nachvollziehbar zu erläutern

  • Erfahrung in einem der folgenden Gebiete: statistische Modellierung, Machine Learning, mathematische Optimierung oder Prozesssimulation

  • Erste praktische Erfahrung bei der Anwendung fortgeschrittener Data-Science-Methoden an Echtdaten im Businesskontext

  • Sichere Beherrschung zweier Programmiersprachen (z.B. R, Python, Julia, SQL, GMPL, GAMS, ILOG OPL oder verwandte Sprachen)

  • Kenntnisse einiger typischer Frameworks, z.B. mlr, caret, NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, Spark ML, Keras, TensorFlow, Theano oder gurobipy

  • Ergänzend Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Gradient Boosting, Support Vector Machines bzw. Neural Networks, Deep Learning oder alternativ im Formulieren und Lösen von Optimierungsproblemen mit Gurobi, CPLEX oder CBC bzw. in der Anwendung von Simulationssoftware wie AnyLogic oder Arena

  • Idealerweise zusätzlich Kenntnisse in Big-Data-Infrastruktur und Cloud-basierten Analyseinstrumenten wie AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Spark, Hadoop, AMLS oder BigQuery


Was wir bieten:



  • Sie erfahren persönlich die vielfältigen, branchenübergreifenden Einsatzmöglichkeiten von McKinsey Analytics.

  • Sie werden Teil unseres internationalen Teams an Standorten weltweit und in unserem McKinsey Analytics Hub in Düsseldorf.

  • Sie nutzen die Vorteile der Kombination aus Einarbeitung und Unterstützung durch erfahrene Kollegen und einem gleichzeitig stark wachsenden jungen Team.

  • Sie profitieren von einem inspirierenden und kollegialen Umfeld, das hoch qualifizierte Mitarbeiter aus den Bereichen Mathematik, Physik, Statistik, Informatik und Ingenieurwesen vereint.

  • Sie bleiben auf der Höhe der neuesten Entwicklungen durch regelmäßigen interna­tionalen Ideenaustausch, Trainings, die Teilnahme an internationalen Konferenzen und starke Verbindungen zur akademischen Welt.


Ihr Kontakt: Meike Höpfner, McKinsey & Company, Kennedydamm 24, 40476 Düsseldorf

item.title: SOFTWAREENTWICKLER/IN FÜR AUTOMATISIERTE ABSICHERUNG at Vision11 GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Aktuell bauen wir auf Basis von neuen und erprobten Technologien für unsere Kunden eine Testautomatisierung der nächsten Generation und suchen Sie als Softwareentwickler für automatisierte Absicherung (m/w) zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Festanstellung an unseren Standorten in München oder Augsburg.


Dank Ihres Abstraktionsvermögens, der Fähigkeit zu konkretisieren, Ihres Prozessverständnisses und analytischen Denkens sind komplexe Herausforderungen genau Ihr Thema. Selbständig und in enger Abstimmung mit dem Team arbeiten Sie im Portal-, Automotive-, oder Mobile Bereich mit  individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum. Sie übernehmen Verantwortung und bringen neue Ideen ein. Lösungsorientierte Konzepte mit den Kunden auszuarbeiten und diese sicher zu präsentieren ist für Sie eine Selbstverständlichkeit.


Wenn Testautomatisierung und Softwareentwicklungsmethoden der „nächsten Generation“ keine Worthülsen für Sie sind, sollten wir uns unbedingt kennen lernen.


Ihre Qualifikation:


• Objektorientierte Programmiersprachen


• Modelorientiertes Arbeiten (UML)


• Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit


• Software Engineering-Toolchain (z.B. Continuous Integration,  Development Pipeline)


• Vorgehensmodelle in der Softwareentwicklung


• Software Design, Frameworks, Architektur


Wünschenswert wären Kenntnisse in: 


• Selenium • Appium • Python • Jira/Zephyr • Java


Wir bieten Ihnen eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten in einem super Team mit direkter Kommunikation, bei attraktiver Vergütung und flexibler Zeiteinteilung. Wenn Sie in einer verantwortungsvollen Position, bei einem Unternehmen mit interessantem Kunden-Portfolio, flachen Hierarchien und schönem Büro in zentraler Lage arbeiten wollen, dann senden Sie Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung an


Magdalena Connell karriere@visioneleven.com

item.title: Innovative IT security company looking for a Software Engineer at VMRay (Bochum, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you want your work to have real impact? Do you wish to directly contribute to the conception and implementation of highly innovative software solutions? Join VMRay!



We are an early stage information security company in Bochum, Germany. We develop innovative
solutions and new technologies based on the latest academic research for automated malware analysis and
threat detection. Our solutions are used by government and enterprise customers around the globe, above all in North America. We regularly present at the top international conferences such as RSA or Blackhat. To support our growth and expand our team we are hiring a Software Engineer- Automation and Testing (Reference: AT-SO 10/17)


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Automate large scale malware analysis system for internal testing and data collection

  • Create and extend comprehensive test plans and test cases

  • Design, implement and operate automated scripts for continuous integration of tests

  • Serve as first point of contact for bug handling requests

  • Supervise release management process


SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS 



  • Proven knowledge of software engineering and software development lifecycle

  • Hands-on experience with automation and/or testing tools (continuous integration, etc.)

  • Experience with Python programming and script automation is a plus

  • Strong communication skills

  • Fluent in verbal and written English


HOW TO APPLY

Please send your application documents (including reference number and salary expectations) as pdf version by email only to jobs@vmray.com!

item.title: Senior Solution Architect/Software Engineer at swissQuant Group AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior solution architect and hands-on software engineer to help create industry leading software components in the Core Modules team such as our Risk Engine and Portfolio Optimizer.
You will be responsible to drive the solution architecture and hands-on contribute to the development and delivery of software components and services using technologies such as Java, Python, REST Microservices, and Docker. In these areas you will also provide technical leadership to our in-house team of Quant Engineers and Developers. Your understanding and ability to link technologies and business requirements is key, and your proficency in communicating complex subjects to both technical and non-technical stakeholders will enable your success in this role.



  • University degree in Computer Science or Engineering

  • At least 5 years of working experience in solution architecture in a quantitative and polyglot environment (Python, Java), including experience in communicating to senior management

  • Knowledge of multiple programming languages is beneficial (Java, Python, Matlab)

  • Knowledge of the web programming stack (HTTP, REST, HTML, Javascript, JSON)

  • Knowledge of datastores (SQL or NoSQL)

  • Knowledge of financial markets and quant finance

  • Knowledge of Continuous Integration/Deployment technologies (AWS, google cloud, Jenkins, Docker, BDD, Cucumber)

  • Passion for applying technology to solve business problems

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to make coherent technical arguments

  • Successful project delivery experience

  • Eligible to live and work in Switzerland

  • Strong communication skills in English and fluency in German

item.title: Software Engineer at Datadog (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Have you built sizeable applications for thousands of users? Do you value simplicity over over-engineered solutions? Do you want to work on an elegant solution to infrastructure monitoring that just works for our enterprise and startup clients? If so, read on.


We’re on a mission to bring sanity to cloud operations and we need you to build the data pipelines to ingest, store, analyze and query hundreds of billions of events a day. 


Join us to build powerful and resilient data systems.


What you will do



  • Build distributed, high-throughput, real-time applications

  • Do it in Go and Python, with bits of C or other languages on the back-end and Reactjs (with flux and redux) and d3.js on the front-end

  • Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components

  • Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way

  • Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company

item.title: ENTWICKLER CLOUD PLATTFORM (m/w) at YOMA Solutions GmbH (Norderstedt, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir bieten ein modernes und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld, große Flexibilität und einen starken Fokus auf gemeinsame Ziele sowie die Übernahme von Verantwortung bei der technischen und fachlichen Gestaltung. Nachhaltige Zusammenarbeit im Team ist uns wichtig. Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und laufende Ausbildung bzw. Weiterbildung gehört zu unserer Philosophie ebenso wie Teamevents. Wir erwarten analytisches Denken, Erfahrung mit modernen Tools und Methoden und den Willen, etwas Neues mit hoher Qualität zu erschaffen. Uns sind Kompetenz und Motivation wichtiger als Hochschulabschlüsse und Zertifizierungen – diese sind aber natürlich auch kein Hindernis.


Das sind deine Aufgaben bei uns:


Du bist Teil in einem erfahrenen Team von Entwicklern mit unterschiedlichen technischen Schwerpunkten und entwickelst gemeinsam eine cloudbasierte, multifunktionale Analytics-Lösung mit agilen Methoden, offenen Standards und innovativen Implementierungsmustern. Deine Softwaremodule schaffen dem Kunden echten geschäftlichen Mehrwert und begeistern durch ein hohes Maß an Qualität, Einfachheit in der Bedienung und kreativen Details. Du kannst eigenständig und auch im Team komplexe Aufgaben bewältigen – Du hast Spaß an der Entwicklung moderner Anwendungen.


Das bringst Du idealerweise mit:



  • Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs oder abgebrochenes Studium und viel Programmiererfahrung

  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Unternehmensanwendungen mit agilen Methoden

  • Erfahrung mit Cloud Plattformen, vorzugsweise AWS

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Software-Entwicklung (Python oder vergleichbar)

  • Kenntnisse rund um Entwicklungskonzepte, Continuous Integration und -Testing

  • Fähigkeit komplexe Sachverhalte zu verstehen und abzubilden

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse, Teamfähigkeit und eine eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise

item.title: (PHP/Go) Backend Developer (m/f) - Change the way people eat forever! at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the job



  • Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team

  • Build and take operational responsibility for the HelloFresh platform

  • Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate microservices that serve millions of users, using DevOps practices and tools

  • Monitor and improve the usage of the services you build

  • Close cooperation with Frontend, Devops and Business Intelligence teams

  • Create a smooth and pleasant end user experience, for both our customers and our internal users


You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our engineering blog.


Skills & Requirements


Who we’re looking for



  • You’ll have solid back-end experience with at least one of the following languages: PHP/Go/Python/JavaScript

  • You have extensive knowledge of OOP, Design Patterns and SOLID Principles

  • Prior experience with unit, integration & functional testing, distributed architectures, applications tuning/profiling, and continuous integration are all highly valued

  • You are used to working with relational and non relational databases

  • Additionally, any experience working with microservices is a plus

item.title: Software Ontwikkelaar (JAVA/.Net) at NCIM Groep (Leidschendam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Software Ontwikkelaar (JAVA/.Net) met een passie voor technologie bij de NCIM Groep!


Wil jij werken aan uitdagende, technische en complexe projecten? Wil jij jezelf blijven ontwikkelen? Meedenken met de klant? En heb jij een passie voor technologie? Als Software Ontwikkelaar bij NCIM Groep werk je mee aan diverse projecten bij uiteenlopende klanten. Zo werk je bijvoorbeeld mee aan de ontwikkeling van een command and control system, ontwikkel je een forensische applicatie die helpt bij het oplossen van misdrijven, of werk je aan een satelliet communicatie systeem!


Je leert veel verschillende bedrijven kennen. We werken aan high-tech projecten, waardoor je aan de slag gaat met de nieuwste technieken! We bieden diverse trainings- en opleidingsfaciliteiten, zodat je jezelf voortduren kunt blijven ontwikkelen.  Daarnaast worden er voor én door collega’s diverse TechTalks en CodingSessions georganiseerd.


Wat ga je doen?



  • Ontwikkelen van complexe en technische applicaties in bijv. Java, .NET, C++, Objective C, C#, Android, iOS, Python;

  • Requirements analyse van uitdagende problemen;

  • Bedenken en ontwerpen van technische oplossingen op basis van de requirements;

  • Implementeren van je oplossing;

  • Het testen van de gemaakte code;

  • Werken met Agile/SCRUM.

item.title: Software Developer in Test at Blis (London, UK)
item.description:
We're seeking an exceptional Software Developer in Test Engineer with holistic system-breaking skills to join our vibrant and enthusiastic engineering team. This is a full-time position based in London with global scope and responsibility.


The ideal candidate must have a strong technical background and prior software development experience. The person will work closely with Development and DevOps Engineers to deliver efficient software testing automation solutions.


We run high-performance, data-intensive backend software for the programmatic advertising sector. We have a SaaS UI, real-time bidding layers, and we generate a vast amount of data stored in a high-performance data warehouse.


We are looking for someone who is self-motivated and who has a proven history of solving complex distributed real-time quality challenges. It is within your remit to find new and interesting ways to test our technology to be more efficient, faster, and smarter.


Responsibilities


You will work hand-in-hand with the software engineers to design, build, and test all components of our platform. Your main responsibility will be to design, implement, and maintain the different components of our testing infrastructure. Some of the challenges you will face are:



  • Develop our software test automation infrastructure.

  • Use existing software testing frameworks to implement functional, regression, and performance tests.

  • Liaise with DevOps to define best practices for software testing and resource management of the different software components of our platform.

  • Liaise with the different software development teams to ensure quality across the board, especially at the functional and system integration testing level.

  • Drive the design and implementation of the Software Quality Assurance Roadmap for our company.


Note that this is primarily a software development position and as such it is expected that you’ll spend most of your time writing test software. However, there are always opportunities for further development of skills within the engineering team.


Required Skills



  • Have a minimum of 2 years Software QA experience in digital media or software companies.

  • Demonstrable software development skills and expertise focused on:

  • Test case definition

  • Functional testing

  • Performance testing

  • Smoke/Regression testing

  • Automated test discovery and execution

  • Demonstrable skills and expertise with industry tools in:

  • Software testing frameworks e.g. Unittest, C-Test

  • Source control e.g. Git, SVN

  • CI/CD tools e.g. Jenkins, Spinnaker

  • Container technology e.g. docker

  • Good Linux shell scripting to establish scriptable tasks.

  • Knowledge of two or more: Python, C++, Java, JavaScript, SQL.

  • Good communication skills and the ability to work closely with others.

  • Ability to work independently


Desired Skills




  • Experience using Python test frameworks and tools e.g. unittest, pytest, mock, moto, etc.

  • Experience using Amazon Web Services ecosystem:

  • EC2, EC2 Container Service, S3, etc.

  • Hands on experience utilizing the Atlassian suite

  • JIRA

  • Confluence

  • Bitbucket

item.title: Data Science Course Instructor (60-80%) at EPFL Extension School (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
The EPFL Extension School is looking for an experienced data science instructor to join our team. The course instructor will be responsible for assisting our learners as they progress through our courses and programs (for curriculum details please see our web site). This will mean supporting learners through 1-1 chat, group chat, support forum, for their course and capstone project work and presentations. The role will also involve creating and grading exercises and projects for learners.


The audience for these courses extends to a large, general public and the knowledge level of the learners will range from novice (no prior experience) to intermediate (strong familiarity, possibly but not necessarily university or post-graduate level knowledge). The course instructor should be able to adapt his/her instruction and support (explaining topics, guiding learners to achieving learning objectives, stepping through exercises, learner support) accordingly.


We expect a solid, demonstrable and practical background in all domains of data science relevant to both a beginner and an intermediate level learner. In particular, we expect you to be well-versed in the most common tools, methods, and applications of the entire data pipeline (i.e. data mining, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualisation), using both Python and R. You will also be able to explain basic concepts in data/data science clearly and effectively.


The ideal candidate also has strong experience with a variety of methods / models / tools relevant to data analytics, statistics and machine learning, as well as applied frameworks (e.g. *SQL, Hadoop, Spark, D3.js, or others).


Additional required qualifications:



  • Previous teaching experience at the beginner and intermediate levels

  • Excellent communications and relationship management / « people » skills

  • Excellent verbal presentation skills

  • Strong organisational skills

  • Good team player

  • Self-starter, capable of autonomous work

  • Demonstrable experience with developer tools: git, the command line, code editors, caching, error management, security etc.

  • Fluent English, both written and spoken

  • Start-up experience desirable


Activity level: part-time (60-80%)

item.title: Software Engineer (Security) at Deliveroo (London, UK)
item.description:
Software Engineer (Security)


Hey there!


Before you per-roos / roo-view / inte-roo-pret / read this job advert, we want to introduce ourselves so that you know a little more about us, and know why you should apply to work at Deliveroo!


Who We Are


We’re Deliveroo!


We’re in the business of delivering awesome meals into everyone's home or office – fast.


We are a superb website, a suite of mobile apps, a complex logistical platform, a fleet of passionate drivers, a global operation, all built to deliver - with unparalleled convenience - great food from the world's best-loved local restaurants directly to our customers.


The only thing faster than our deliveries is our growth. We’re scaling at a blisteringly fast rate: opening in new countries, adopting more restaurants - from major chains to local gems - and keeping it all together and making everything click are what makes working at Deliveroo such a thrilling experience.


If you want to make a difference, and especially if you’re passionate about food, come aboard!


How does it work?


Try us out! Visit our website or open our iOS or Android app - this is the core of the Deliveroo experience. Tell us your location and we provide a curated list of restaurants that can deliver to you. Select from the menu, add personal tastes (lemon and herbs?) and we’ll do the rest.


Your order is pinged to an app at the restaurant, and our dispatch engine - we call it “Frank” - selects a Roo driver, guides them to the food for pickup, and to your location for delivery. Those apps, and that backend logistics management, alongside our real time monitoring tools, all play a critical part in getting that tasty food to you quickly and in great condition.


So why work for us?


Training and Development


We want you to reach your full potential and to never stop learning. We budget for hardware, conferences, books, online courses, and whatever else you need to learn new skills that will help keep Deliveroo ahead of the rest.


Diversity


We’re a global-yet-local business, so it’s extremely important to us that our team and environment offer a great environment for everyone. Deliveroo is not a startup “bro” monoculture.


Working effectively


Each product team suggests the most effective way to get things done. Work is a collective effort, and we encourage everyone to take an interest - and share insight into - all areas of our business.


Perhaps you’re not a designer, but you’ve thought of a way to more effectively present a map? The design team are all ears! Perhaps you’ve worked out how deliveries can be ordered more efficiently? Not merely will you have solved a famous programming problem, but also you will delight our customers with faster delivery! Everything is open for improvement!


Making you comfortable


Output, not input. If you need a little leeway in the way you work - if it helps you out - we’re all for it. We have a “cycle to work” scheme in place, we allow for flexible working hours, and we are happy for you to work from home on occasion.


Fun!


Go-karts! Pubs! Games! And if it’s Monday then chances are somebody‘s baked a cake to share with the team. Roos are a sociable bunch, and we chill out as a team on Friday evenings after a solid week’s work.


Go for it!


We look for reasons to hire people! Even if you don’t fit the job “specification” precisely if you think that you can do it, if you enjoy challenges, if you like to learn, then apply and can you learn at Deliveroo!


Your Responsibilities



  • Guide the architecture & implementation of new products

  • Find and define secure means for all of our product teams to achieve their goals

  • Build tools and libraries to “engineer-away” the complexities of secure software

  • Build tools to monitor, detect and block security shenanigans and other badness.

  • Improve the security of the extant codebase, both directly (by fixing code) and indirectly (by fixing engineers)


Things You Love to Do



  • Pride in creating readable, reasonable, well-designed, well-tested code

  • “Very Full Stack” - full stack is good + Networking, Firewalls or Kernel is great

  • Quickly get up to speed on our stack (Ruby/Rails, Python or Scala)

  • Coding for security: authentication, access control, roles, capabilities, memory-safe languages

  • Basic cryptography: certificates, public/private-key algorithms, hashing & HMAC, OpenSSL, NaCl, Blockchain... 


Things That Earn Bonus Points



  • Front-end Web technology (we use React)

  • Wrangling Web Architectures “at scale” (20krpm and up) for Security & High Availability

  • Programming in Go or Elixir

  • Building libraries and/or APIs for other developers


Benefits



  • Fantastic exposure to scaling a tech team at an incredible pace

  • Conferences, we're all about professional development

  • Subsidised gym membership

  • Regular off-sites with the team, as well as game nights, and the legendary “Bun-day Monday”

  • Ping-pong table, PS4, dartboard and foosball table as standard office furniture

  • Food. So much food. Nom Nom

item.title: Big Data Engineer (Hadoop, Spark, Nifi, Kafka) at Vodafone Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We've reached 420 million customers, all with unique behaviours and experiences and have a tremendous amount of data that is generated every single second in our network. This means that we have a vast body of rich information, which if unlocked, can lead to something very special. With your help.


Our unique capabilities create the best voice and data to our customers and continue our advancement in the Internet of Things (IOT), BIG Data, Cybersecurity, Cloud & Hosting, TV and Video. We’re heading to an exciting future – fancy being part of our Vodafone Gigabit growth?


Role profile:


Within Vodafone Group Big Data operations, we help our customers to gain greater insight into challenging strategic and tactical issues like workforce productivity, footfall and migration patterns, and privacy by converting raw data from the Vodafone network into meaningful insight. We aim to drive more efficient and effective working practices internally, but first and foremost, we aspire to generate additional value for our customers through our business intelligence services and contextual awareness.  Joining as one of our Big Data Engineers now has never been a better time to be part of our success.


As a Big Data Engineer you will be responsible for designing and producing high performing stable end-to-end applications to perform complex processing of batch and real-time data in a multi-tenancy Hadoop environment.


You will also design and implement core platform capabilities, tools, processes, ways of working under agile development to support the integration of local markets data sourcing and use cases implementation.


 Key Accountabilities:



  • Integrate the necessary data from several sources in the Big Data Programme necessary for analysis and for commercial actions;

  • Build applications that make use of large volumes of data and generate outputs that allow commercial actions that generate incremental value

  • Deliver and implement core capabilities (frameworks, platform, development infrastructure, documentation, guidelines and support) to speed up the Local Markets delivery in the Big Data Programme, assuring quality, performance and alignment to the Group technology blueprint of components releases in the platform

  • Support local markets and Group functions in obtaining benefiting business value from the operational data


Your Profile:


You will have expert level experience in designing, building and managing applications to process large amounts of data in a Hadoop ecosystem; performance tuning applications on Hadoop and configuring Hadoop systems; as well as experience building systems to perform real-time data processing using Spark Streaming and Kafka, or similar technologies.


Essential:



  • Expert level experience with Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Hive/Impala, HBase, Yarn)

  • Strong software development experience in Scala and Python programing languages

  • Experience with Unix-based systems, including bash programming

  • Experience with columnar data formats


Desirable:



  • Experience with other distributed technologies such as Cassandra, Solr/ElasticSearch, Flink, Flume

  • Experience in other functional languages

item.title: Systems Engineer who can become a DevOps (both seniors and juniors welcome!) at Box+Dice (Praha 8, Czechia)
item.description:
You’ll be joining a brand new team in Prague which will eventually become Box+Dice’s Global Development Hub.


The successful candidate is a capable of building sustainable infrastructures to facilitate business success in an agile environment while working closely with Dev/QA/Support to provide expertise, handle technical escalations, develop tools and automate processes to improve operational efficiency. 


We are open to both senior and junior level candidates as responsibilities will be adjusted accordingly. Seniors will have a chance to leverage their skills and experience, juniors will get the opportunity to learn and improve their skills. It's all about the right attitude!


The successful candidate is a capable of building sustainable infrastructures to facilitate business success in an agile environment while working closely with Dev/QA/Support to provide expertise, handle technical escalations, develop tools and automate processes to improve operational efficiency. (Juniors welcome!)


  The ideal candidate will be a professional with some of following:



  • 5 years relevant experience in Cloud systems engineering (Junior: 2 years)

  • Holds a graduate technical degree

  • Holds equivalent industry qualifications (LPI Systems Administrator, RHCA/RHCE, AWS SysOps, CCNA/CCNP)


 The position will involve:



  •  Creating and improving a sustainable IT ecosystem

  • Preparing for failures of various degrees

  • Running the stack (Ruby on Rails, PHP @ Debian)

  • Taking care of the Crown Jewels (Databases and message queues)

  • Creating and optimizing self-service tasks

  • Systems monitoring

  • Troubleshooting and preventing unexpected major issues

  • Employing better tools and processes

  • Staying up-to-date

  • Mentoring Juniors in the ways of DevOps


 Essential Skills: 



  • Strong Systems Engineering/Administration skills in a virtualization/cloud environment (AWS/Azure/GCE, Xen/XenServer/KVM).

  • Expert-level Linux Operating Systems administration experience (Debian/Ubuntu, CentOS, Amazon Linux, etc)

  • Strong skills in managing, deploying and scaling web application frameworks (nginx, Ruby/Rails, Django, Symfony, etc).

  • Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting skills in small-to-medium production systems and networks.

  • Proficiency in at least one administration/scripting language (Ruby, Python, Go, Perl)

  • Proficiency in at least one infrastructure automation framework (Ansible, SaltStack, Chef, Puppet)

  • Storage and content delivery infrastructure management (NFS, S3, CloudFront, CloudFlare, Caching)

  • Good network design/engineering skills (TCP/IP, Routing, DNS, Firewalling)

  • Good communication skills, professional working proficiency in the English language

  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging system deployment and usage (Icinga2/Nagios, Zabbix, ELK Stack, TICK Stack, Graylog)

  • Junior should be able to cover all the greatness and excellence after 2 years with our experienced Senior


    Nice to have skills / areas of interest: 



  • Familiarity with MySQL, ElasticSearch, Postgresql, Redis, RabbitMQ

  • Extending infrastructure automation frameworks (developing roles, playbook and scripts)

  • Employing CI/CD best practices and tools (git, git-flow, jenkins)


Interests:



  • Containerization and workflow management (Docker/LXD, Kubernetes, Deis)

  • Hashicorp IaaS Technologies (consul, terraform, nomad, packer, atlas)

  • Code/Infrastructure Security and Hardening (OS permissions/limits, iptables, cloudflare)

  • Structured Reporting/Documentation Skills


 OUR TEAM:


You will be a part of a cool team led by Box+Dice’s Tech Lead Owen Moony (https://www.linkedin.com/in/owen-moony-02a4301/)

item.title: Big Data Architect at Mynewsdesk (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Do you like building great products? That’s what we’re doing here at Mynewsdesk. And we want more people with awesome skills to join our team!


Right now, we are looking for a skilled Big Data Architect to join our Dev Team in Stockholm!


What is it like to work at Mynewsdesk?  


We offer a workplace where the development teams are working in close collaboration with product managers, designers and quite recently also our new data unit. We share our knowledge and interests in cross-team meetings, internal conferences and lunch presentations. We love to learn and that’s why we have daily stand-ups, regular lab days and DevCorners all year round.


What's our stack?


We are currently storing data in different systems such as Google Analytics, Keen.io but are currently migrating to a centralised data platform. Our applications are also using Solr, Apache Spark, Redis, Postgres, Mysql, Elastic Search, Mongodb. Business data are stored in Marketo and Salesforce. We are using plenty of services but welcomes way of simplifying our platform and stack.


What will you do?



  • As our first hired Big Data Architect you will be part of setting up our new data infrastructure and plan system integrations.

  • You will work very closely with Head of Data to understand and design solutions that fits our data needs

  • You will be our database and data pipeline lead to support our development teams with knowledge and database design

  • Create, when needed, database questions that answers complex business questions

  • You will become a valued teammate in a cross functional team of developers, designers and product leads

  • You will continuously deliver value to thousands of users and millions of visitors


That is you!



  • You have experience of working with AWS, Azure or other big data product stacks

  • You have experience of working with data integrations and have a few learnings on what to avoid and what’s important

  • You are a doer that loves to get your hands dirty and getting things done

  • You are used to programming languages and tools such as Ruby/Python, Scala, MapReduce, Hadoop, Apache Spark

  • You are always looking into new technologies and learn beyond your current set of expertise

  • You are fluent in English

  • You have excellence of database and data warehouse knowledge and are used to working with popular technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Amazon Redshift

  • Skills that would be a plus: Salesforce or other business systems and previous working with hierarchical  storage manager(HSM) systems.


What’s in it for you?



  • You will be part of creating a new infrastructure that will have a huge impact of Mynewsdesk success

  • An international work environment with offices and colleagues all over the world

  • Collaboration with and continuous learning from experienced and enthusiastic teams

  • Exciting projects, competitive salary, flexible work arrangements, regular team lunches and health allowances


Interested?


Great, then please send us your application and we’ll take it from there.

item.title: Front End Software Engineer at McLaren Applied Technologies (London, UK)

item.title: Kubernetes GO! at Ticketmaster UK Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you a developer that is operations aware or a Linux system engineer that can write code?  If this is you then we’d love to hear from you.


What are we doing?  Ticketmaster is the #1 ticketing company in the world, selling millions of tickets through its systems which are developed by geographically distributed development teams, each supported by a systems engineering team.


The Platform team is newly formed and in its infancy.  We see ourselves as a team engaged with multiple engineering teams to address common needs and challenges that impact their productivity. 


We are looking for engineers with a good mix of development and operational skills.  You will work closely with engineering, operations, architecture and product to engineer solutions that add business value by promoting and providing self-service tools and services.


You will have the opportunity to work with the latest technology, we’re especially interested in K8s. 


To apply, you will have deep technical knowledge in some of these areas and a keen interest in others.



  • Master in all things Kubernetes!

  • Flexible in container technology – you know the difference between Docker and Rocket

  • You are Zen when you write code.  A black belt in one or more of the following languages – Python, Java or GO. 

  • Scaled a distributed messaging / streaming system – we’d like to use Apache Kafka

  • Familiar with development workflows – Git, GitLab CI, Jenkins

  • You have worked with configuration management and orchestration tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform


It’s the perfect time for you to join the team and be part of the decision-making process which will feed in to the team mission and roadmap.

item.title: AI / Chatbot Developer at BJSS (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you a self-starter and future designer with a sense of curiosity and a finger on new technologies?


Are you interested in joining a team to build virtual assistants that deliver content and services allowing users to reach their goals and objectives?


BJSS has always been forward thinking, innovative and pushing the boundaries of technology and we have been working in the AI space for over two years. We have worked on a portfolio of projects across the spectrum from ML to AI chat bots. Our teams are typically multi-skilled, including software engineers, data scientists, platform engineers, user experience experts, business analysts and conversational designers. Due to continued demand we are looking to expand our technical talent. Specifically, we are looking for an architect-engineer to help expand our Chatbot capabilities.


This role will require you to design and deliver scalable, multi-platform, multi channel chatbot services. Working within multi-disciplined teams you will design, prototype and deliver client solutions.

We are also building our own internal AI tools to help employees and you will be instrumental in that too. This role will showcase that BJSS is at the forefront of delivering cutting edge technology solutions.


About You:
