item.title: Cloud System Developer (Azure, AWS, Google) at Cloudreach (Paris, France)
item.description:
“Cloud Enablement” qu’est ce que c’est ?


L’équipe “Cloud Enablement” est en charge d'implémenter des solutions innovantes pour nos plus gros clients dans leur transition vers des plateformes Cloud, principalement construites autour d’AWS et Azure.


Comment allez vous occuper vos journées ?



  • Développement de systèmes distribués cloud-natifs, de plateformes d’orchestrations de containers, d’architecture Microservices et Serverless, et livraison d’infrastructure immuable.

  • Orchestration et automatisation des processus de build et de déploiement, CI/CD et configuration management.

  • Utilisation d’outils d’automatisation et de configuration management pour assurer la conformité et gérer les opérations d’un grand nombre de serveurs.

  • Migration et transformation d’applications legacy vers des plateformes dynamiques, résiliantes et redimensionnables, aidant nos clients à tirer profit au maximum du Cloud.

  • Travailler avec des clients réputés afin d’identifier leurs besoins et les accompagner de la phase d’architecture jusqu’au build et au delà.


Quelle progression de carrière pouvez-vous imaginer ?



  • Au fur et à mesure de votre progression les postes de Cloud Systems Developer Lead, Cloud Architect ou Cloud Consultant seront à votre portée, d’autres possibilités peuvent être étudiées au cas par cas.

  • Envie de voyager et découvrir d’autre cultures ? Vous aurez la possibilité de vous expatrier dans un de nos autres bureaux (UK, Pays Bas, Allemagne, Suisse, Canada, Etats Unis). 


Comment sortir du lot ?



  • Montrez votre passion et votre enthousiasme pour les nouvelles technologies et leur adoption.

  • Vous possédez un diplôme dans le domaine des Sciences, nouvelles Technologies, ingénierie ou mathématiques

  • Montrez votre expérience en développement logiciel et/ou automatisation en Python, Ruby ou Go - mais venez nous parler si vous aimez hacker dans tout autre langage.

  • Une expérience précédente dans l'écosystème du Cloud (AWS, Azure), de l’analyse des besoins jusqu’au déploiement.

  • Vous automatisez tout, autant que possible. Si vous aviez 10 serveurs vous ne les mettriez pas à jour un par un, n’est ce pas ?

  • Administration système. Vous préférez probablement une ligne de commande à une interface graphique.

  • Brian is in the kitchen but where’s my umbrella ? Montrez nous votre aisance dans la langue de Shakespeare (un niveau d’anglais écrit et oral courant est recommandé).


Quels sont les avantages de nos employé(e)s ?



  • MacBook Pro, grands écrans, votre propre domaine Google Apps et smartphone tout neuf (Vous êtes plutôt Galaxy ou iPhone ?)

  • Notre unique 'cloudy culture” : diversité, passion et accessibilité.

  • Congés illimités et ne pensez même pas venir travailler le jour de votre anniversaire.

  • Cloudy University : notre plateforme de formation continue vous fournira des formation et des opportunités de développement professionnel

  • Notre bureau sur le boulevard Haussmann met a disposition boissons et snacks, Playstation 4, jeux de société et beans bags.

  • Tickets resto, et nos fameux “Cloudy Lunch” où nous envahissons un restaurant local tous les vendredis. Profitez, c’est la maison qui régale !

  • Nous démarrons toutes les nouvelles années fiscales en se retrouvant dans une destination cool en Europe. Cette année, Lisbonne !

item.title: Principal Data Scientist - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Pricing & Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Our tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfill our customers demand. The Pricing and Forecasting engineering team uses cutting edge technology to forecast demand and pricing with focus on business and customer experience. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, business and customer experience teams.


We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to join us to be part of a team of highly accomplished data scientists and research engineers.


YOUR ROLE


As a Principal Data Scientist, you’ll combine both worlds. You know the latest trends from research and innovation and have the experience to bring Machine Learning projects to production.



  • You consult and coordinate several data science projects across our department, such as price optimizations, discount recommendations, and order return predictions.

  • You drive problem definitions. You work closely with Product and Business to understand the requirements, define KPIs, and set expectations. With a team of Engineers and Data Scientists, you structure the research and development process.

  • You develop models. You analyze data and features, explain trade offs of various solutions,  and build sophisticated algorithms and models for pricing-related forecasts and recommender systems, such as demand, returns, cancellations, and discounts.

  • You develop solutions. You apply innovation and technology to fashion e-commerce and develop highly scalable and robust systems that meet business requirements.

  • You network and help our team to find the right contacts inside and outside the company to solve challenges around our product.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • You are a wizard. You are experienced in the latest technologies and processes to transform an insight into a model and to deploy a highly scalable service. You also posses good programming skills (preferably Python), ML frameworks (TensorFlow, R), SQL/NoSQL, AWS.

  • You are a researcher. You are proud of your excellent academic achievements and your proven track record in research and innovation in the field of machine learning and optimization. Ideally you hold a Ph.D.

  • You are a leader. You can act as a role model and a mentor for a highly qualified team of data scientists.

  • You are a storyteller. You are an excellent communicator, who is proactive in solving customer centric problems in collaboration with business. Your strong analytical skills help you easily translate data insights into business opportunities.

  • You are an expert. You hold subject expertise in traditional and statistical models including but not limited to generalized linear modeling, regression, time series, naive Bayesian classifiers, parametric statistical analysis, error calculation. You also hold knowledge of optimization techniques and linear programming.


YOU BENEFIT FROM


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Trading Systems Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
MC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


TRADING SYSTEMS ENGINEERING AT IMC:


IMC is currently looking for a multi-talented and passionate Trading Engineer to play a critical role in maintaining and perfecting our tradinginfrastructure.  As a Trading Engineer you will be part of highly experienced team, facing the daily challenge of managing a critical, high volume data flow in a complex trading environment distributed over a high speed datainfrastructure.  In this role you will be exposed to many technical and trading challenges while ensuring high availability, stability and performance of the end-to-end environment. 


The skills necessary to excel could range from system administration, network administration, database administration, development, release management and performance engineering. This role provides daily challenges as no day is the same as the next.  In other words, this role, unlike any other at IMC, opens up possibilities to make considerable impact as part of a dedicated, dynamic team, both locally and globally.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Provide continuity and stability to the production environment.

  • Provide quick response to production issues to help eliminate down time thereby ensuring high availability and performance of our trading platform.

  • Coordinate, prioritize and plan the changes to our trading software thereby ensuring smooth exchange migrations, quick time to market for new features and software.

  • Contribute towards improving the trading strategy as well as the trading infrastructure.

  • Translate trading requests into concrete technical requirements, work with various focus teams in our organizations towards generating innovative and scalable solutions and finally implement those solutions in order to continuously enhance our systems and processes.

  • Relevant education and relevant working experience

item.title: Deutsche Bank Technology Internship Programme at Deutsche Bank UK (London, UK)
item.description:
About your Internship


Join us and you will be an integral part of our team. Over 9-10 intensive weeks you will experience what it’s like to work for our international bank. You will go through two job rotations and gain a wide range of practical experience. During your internship, you will also benefit from training courses, seminars and a variety of networking events. Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme.


About Technology


Our technology teams are responsible for the bank’s entire information technology infrastructure. They develop and maintain the software required to support the bank’s business. The teams work closely with the businesses and other infrastructure units to modernise the bank’s IT systems to reduce complexity, risk and enable business growth.


Deutsche Bank sees itself as a technology-driven company that can gain market share with new, cutting-edge ideas. Our ambition is to be a leader in the area of digitalisation. We are making investments into digital technology across all businesses to enhance the client experience, harness the power of data, and strengthen efficiency and controls by increasing automation. We are also collaborating with external partners such as start-ups, FinTechs, and technology specialists worldwide to discover and implement innovative solutions for our clients.


Join us here, and you’ll constantly be looking ahead. We’ll look to you to capitalise on new technological trends that can reshape our business and deliver value for our clients, whilst still meeting the demands of customers, regulators and the markets.


The role


Our interns are given the opportunity to learn about our business from different viewpoints, giving you a career advantage. Working on our day-to-day business as well as on special projects, you will contribute to the innovation of new ideas to help our customers achieve their financial goals. You will gain experience in different areas of our business and discover our market-leading solutions first hand. The internship is an ideal way of finding out whether a career in technology meets your needs and aspirations.


Areas in which you could work



  • Analysis: You will be supporting our clients with innovative projects and developing bespoke technological concepts to simplify business processes and make them more effective.

  • Development: As a technical specialist, you should be proficient in at least one programming language. With the help of state-of-the-art software and hardware, you will design and develop applications, look after quality assurance and conduct tests.


Your qualifications


We are looking for bright minds with good academic records and some practical work experience to create a positive impact for our customers.



  • Do you have an academic background in (business) informatics, (business) mathematics, industrial engineering or natural sciences with an IT focus?

  • Are you passionate about bringing together finance and innovative technology?

  • Are you well-versed in working with MS Office and common applications or do you have programming experience?

  • Do you have strong communication skills and are you fluent in English?

  • Can you work well in a team and inspire others with your ideas?

  • Would you describe yourself as a conscientious, dedicated individual with excellent problem-solving skills and rapid comprehension?


Then we look forward to meeting you!

item.title: Data Scientist (w/m) at freenet Group (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
DAS MACHEN SIE MÖGLICH:


Sie analysieren Daten aus den verschiedenen Geschäftsfeldern des Konzerns.


Sie entwickeln in einem dynamischen Team neue
Use Cases in enger Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Fachbereichen.


Sie unterstützen die Kollegen bei der Entwicklung von Marketingstrategien und der Auswertung und Beurteilung von Kampagnen.


Sie bringen Geschäftsprozesse mit Ihren Analysen voran.


DAS BRINGEN SIE MIT:


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium idealerweise der Statistik, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eines verwandten Studiengangs.

Sie besitzen Kenntnisse auf dem Gebiet der multivariaten Statistik und Prognosemodellen.


Sie haben Erfahrungen in der Anwendung von Software zur statistischen Datenanalyse und analytischen Programmiersprachen wie R, Python und SQL.

Sie haben ein Verständnis für betriebswirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge.

Sie sind bereit sich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten wie RStudio shiny, Apache Spark, Hive  und Hadoop.

Sie denken kundenorientiert, strukturiert und analytisch, haben Spaß an einem dynamischen Umfeld und verfügen über ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und Leistungsbereitschaft.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer / C++ Software Developer at Granta Design (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
C++ Software Engineer / C++ Software Developer


What do our developers do?


We develop solutions for our world leading clients such as Airbus, Boeing, Ethicon Surgical Care, General Motors, Jaguar Land Rover, NASA, Philips, Rolls Royce & Universities across the globe! Making a positive impact in the Aerospace, Automotive, Education, Energy, Healthcare, Research & Wind Energy Technology industries, to name but a few.


Most of the GRANTA Gateway code base is written in C++ on Visual Studio, we also have some Python, Java & VB with Angular 2 on the frontend. On your first day you will be set up with an MSDN subscription. We use GitHub for version control, mostly following the GitHub flow model. We’re also passionate about continuous delivery so use Jira to host our Kanban Board and show metrics.


You will be part of a small team working to an Agile methodology with daily stand-ups and regular retrospectives. Our teams also work closely with the product owner, defining features and priorities to ensure our clients’ needs are understood & met.


What will you be working on?


As a Granta C++ Software Engineer you will be responsible for building the gateway for our flagship product, GRANTA MI. Our Gateway links CAD, CAE & PLM systems used by thousands of designers and analysts to GRANTA MI. The leading system for materials information management.


Join Granta and you will be:



  • Developing clean maintainable code, predominantly in C++ and the latest C++ frameworks, to allow clients access to our platform via CAD, CAE & PLM systems.

  • Building on your knowledge and experience of and secondary languages you have (e.g. Python, C#, Java, VB and others)

  • Providing your input and experience to all stages of our development lifecycle. From design and specification through to development and quality.

  • Ensuring the Gateway platform products are developed and maintained to a high standard.

  • Working on cross-platform technologies across Windows and Linux.

  • Using debugging, diagnostic and profiling tools to help us build efficient software that works.

  • Expanding our ever growing SQL Server database, within an application environment.


Why should you choose Granta?



  • You’ll be working in a great team with modern technologies and an Agile environment.

  • We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package.

  • You’ll receive our 12.5% non-contributory pension.

  • We have flexible working, to fit around your family.

  • You’ll be given the choice of private healthcare insurance or gym membership

  • We will tailor your induction and career development plan around you, your motivations and your skills.

  • You’ll be invited to join our Granta share options scheme.

item.title: (Senior) Consultant (w/m) Data Science & Artificial Intelligence at MHP - A Porsche Company (Ludwigsburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen Dich als (Senior) Consultant (w/m) Data Science & Artificial Intelligence


Als Developer für Data Science und Artificial Intelligence bei MHP entwickelst Du Strategien, Lösungen und Produkte basierend auf den neusten Technologien und beeinflusst somit wie zukünftig Menschen forschen, arbeiten, analysieren und miteinander kommunizieren – mit unseren Themen begeistern wir andere! Du erkennst Chancen und wagst es auch mal alternative, neue Wege zu gehen, ohne das Ziel aus den Augen zu verlieren. Du hast keine Angst vor Fehlern und nimmst Herausforderungen gerne an.


Wir suchen Dich als Developer, der frische Ideen mitbringt und sich in Teams mit Data Insight, Distributed Computing, Enterprise Architecture Management, Network, Data Storage, Security, Artificial Intelligence, UI-Design und Mobile beschäftigt – diese Liste geht noch viel weiter und wird Tag für Tag länger.


 Dein Profil als Developer für Data Science und Artificial Intelligence



  • Du bist ein kreativer und analytischer Problem-Löser – du bis voller Leidenschaft für Programmierung und explorative Datenanalyse

  • Du verfügst über hohes Abstraktionsvermögen und kannst daher komplexe Probleme in Teilprobleme zerlegen

  • Du stehst neuen Herausforderungen offen gegenüber und eignest dir selbstständig neue Technologie- und Domänenkenntnisse an

  • Du konzipierst und implementierst anspruchsvolle Data Science Individual-Lösungen

  • Du bist ein dynamischer Teamplayer und wirst zum Trusted Advisor unserer Kunden


Das bringst du mit



  • Einen Abschluss in einem Informatik-Studiengang, bzw. einem Studiengang mit Informatiknähe (Mathematik, Physik, etc.) oder vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der explorativen Statistik und der Sprache Python

  • Erste Erfahrungen mit den folgenden Frameworks: Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Plotlib, SciKit, Tensorflow, Keras, usw.

  • Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich maschinelles Lernen und einen guten Überblick über weitere Themen der künstlichen Intelligenz

  • Ein Gespür für Clean Code

  • Reisebereitschaft


Wir bieten Dir:


Zusammenhalt - ans Ziel kommt man meist besser im Team – ob beim Kickern, Basketball oder Programmieren und das manchmal auch über Ländergrenzen hinweg oder im Homeoffice.


Agilität - Unsere Branche ist schnell und wir sind es auch – Flexibilität und Geschwindigkeit beschreiben unseren Arbeitsstil und unsere Strukturen.


Kollegiale „Du/Do“-Kultur – trotz 2.000 Mitarbeiter in Deutschland sind Hilfsbereitschaft und flache Hierarchien nicht nur leere Worte für uns, sondern ein spürbar gelebtes Element unserer Unternehmenskultur.


Excellence - Mit dieser Philosophie schaffen wir es die Poleposition im Bereich Digitalisierung für die Automotive Branche zu halten und zu stärken.


Jetzt bewerben: Bringe Deine PS mit uns auf die Straße! Lerne uns näher kennen und erlebe wie wir arbeiten! Bewirb dich direkt über den Bewerben-Button.

item.title: Frontend / Backend WebApp Developer - Angular 2 / PHP / Java at PlayFusion (Milton, UK)
item.description:
PlayFusion are looking for talented WebApp developers to join our technology development team. As part of the core team you will have a voice in how our current and future products will be taken forward. We want to hear from highly capable engineers who have a strong passion for games and the software needed to make them a reality. Your job will have you taking ownership of the technical solutions involved, working both independently and as part of a team.


We want to make exciting and useful interactive experiences for users on both the web and on mobile, preferably using the same components for both. You can help us to develop our capabilities in this area, shaping our approach using whatever technologies are appropriate.


We offer a highly competitive above-market benefits package, an on-site gym, and a free lunch every day. The PlayFusion Adventure Academy also offers opportunities for high performing individuals to undertake team challenges and adventures every year. In 2017, 21 members of the team climbed Mount Kilimanjaro!


This year, PlayFusion won two TIGA Games Industry awards, for best technical innovation and for best small independent studio. Maybe you can help us to expand our trophy cabinet in the years to come!


The Role



  • Contribute to the implementation of our platform for deploying and frontend and backend services.

  • Help identify and resolve potential issues in the development pipeline.

  • Implement and iterate on gameplay systems that provide engaging experiences for our players.

  • Create and maintain high quality software documentation.

  • Regularly switch between multiple projects potentially written in different programming languages.


Requirements



  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant engineering/scientific subject.

  • Demonstrable experience with Angular.js, Angular 2, React, Ember.js or a similar JS framework. Experience with TypeScript is preferable.

  • Experience in development for smart phones and other touchscreen devices.

  • Experience writing scripting languages (e.g. Python, Shell Scripting).


Highly Beneficial



  • Experience with version control (e.g. Git).

  • Familiarity with any database technology (e.g. PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Spark, CouchDB).

  • Demonstrable experience in Java, C# or similar

  • Demonstrable experience with WordPress / PHP

  • Familiarity with AWS or other cloud services.


General



  • Please ensure you include a resume and cover letter and a link to your portfolio if applicable.

  • You must be eligible to work in the UK. The position is based in Cambridge, England.

item.title: Data Architect at Fineway GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
As a Data Architect at FINEWAY, you’ll be responsible for designing a scalable & maintainable infrastructure to shape the future of travel. This includes:



  • Drafting, documenting & communicating designs, implementation plans & business models.

  • Working with product owners as well as development teams to assess & define functional & technical requirements.

  • Reviewing your peers’ designs & code to ensure quality.

  • Developing in an event-based micro-services architecture.

  • Learning new technologies independently & evangelizing them.


Requirements



  • Thorough understanding of service-oriented architectures & data processing in high-volume applications.

  • Excellent knowledge & experience in data modelling, data representation, data pipelines, (No)SQL databases & API design.

  • 3+ years professional experience in data oriented ecosystems.

  • Experience with running machine learning services in production.

  • Solid, hands-on AWS experience with focus on their data services.

  • Ability to quickly understand business requirements & transform them into data models.

  • A quick mind, pragmatic & with a strong passion for solving complex data problems.

  • Strong software development skills in Python, Scala, Ruby or Go.

  • Proficiency in German & English, excellent communication skills.


What to expect



  • An exceptionally talented team, led by hard-boiled serialentrepreneurs & investors with decade long track records.

  • A fast-paced, challenging environment.

  • A huge opportunity ahead with a big, common goal in mind.

  • Open doors, flat hierarchies, flexibility & full transparency.

  • 100% responsibility for what you do & lot of room to grow

item.title: Senior Developer, Mac-team at F-Secure (Helsingfors, Finland)
item.description:
At F-Secure, we are committed to helping people and businesses be free in the digital world, without having to worry about cyber security.


Corporate Cyber Security Business R&D develops and delivers the products used by F-Secure's B2B partners and end customers. We are a flat and agile software R&D organization consisting of Software Developers, Test Automation Specialists and Software Architects on multiple sites. We work closely with Product Management, who set high-level directions that we turn into product features and functionalities. We also work very closely with F-Secure Labs, who analyze cyber threats on a daily basis so we can understand how to beat the bad guys. F-Secure is very much a product organization, and without R&D, the majority of our B2B business wouldn’t exist.


We've been working years to acquire and retain highly skilled individuals, do you want to be one of us?


This position pays an integral role in development of Mac end-point products for Corporate customers


Key responsibilities in this role:



  • To develop cyber security products for our B2B customers and utilize the latest and greatest technologies, processes and tools

  • To improve processes, ways of working and common practices, such as continuous integration, test-automation and automated deployment

  • To contribute to product roadmaps and other long-time plans


What we offer



  • A goal-oriented, engineering minded and informal company culture.

  • Full-cycle of software engineering and DevOps: from refining requirements to deploying the product to production and maintenance

  • Work in a product company and build and develop world-class security products that really help our customers and partners to protect against cyber threats

  • Work in an international team of professionals

  • And of course, we offer a competitive salary and benefits including extensive health care, remote working, company supported sports activities, a gym and a sauna at the premises and we even subsidize your commuting by paying you for a bicycle and many more things to keep our best asset – people - happy!




What we expect from you:



  • You have at least 5 years of experience in software development for MacOS and you understand Apple ecosystem in general

  • You understand MacOS internals such as launchd, Mach messaging and IPC

  • You are fluent in Objective-C and Cocoa

  • Experience in the whole software process, from working with requirements to maintaining software

  • Good scripting skills (we use Python, shell, Ruby, JavaScript and others)

  • Excellent problem-solving skills

  • Excellent communication and team-working skills

  • A hunger for constantly learning more

  • Can-do attitude and excellent problem-solving skills


We also value experience in



  • Continuous integration and build systems (we use makefiles, SCons, Jenkins)

  • Test automation

  • Swift

  • Developing for Windows, iOS and/or Linux

  • Darwin kernel extension and I/O Kit development


Both within our existing service offering and new exciting cyber security solutions there is significant potential for further success in the market – if you are the right person to pursue and realize this success – this is a very rewarding position within F-Secure.


Dare to be the best? Apply now with your CV and application with your salary request.


A security background check will be conducted for the selected candidate, in accordance with the Finnish Security Clearance act 726/2014.

item.title: Software Engineer / Senior Software Engineer at STFC (Science and Technology Facilities Council) (Didcot, UK)
item.description:
About The Role


This is a full-stack software engineering role that will involve in all phases of DAFNI construction,
from software requirement gathering, design, implementation, to validation. This project uses agile
software development, testing and deployment methodologies to encourage agile response to change and request. It also uses a data-driven approach to evaluate and validate the entire software
engineering processes, from requirement, design, through to software development, testing and
deployment, to user and community engagement.



The role will reside within the Visual Analytics and Imaging Systems (VAIS) group, Scientific
Computing Department of STFC. It will involve working extensively across several groups involved
in DAFNI and with partnering institutions and organisations.



You will be appointed at either Band D or Band E of STFC’s staffing hierarchy, depending on the
strength of your skills, experience and qualifications.



You will be required to support data/model hosting, migration and co-development activities. For the Band E role you will also be required to lead the development of at least one key section of the
platform, e.g. data or system model integration, data ingest and data/model inventory, real-time
stream/batch processing, platform API, data analytics, visualisation and lead, develop and manage a small technical team.


About You
It is essential that you have an undergraduate degree in Science and Engineering subjects or relevant experience in computing. A Masters or PhD in Computing, Informatics, Geospatial data analysis or
Environmental Science is desirable.



You will have experience in a variety of software engineering processes and experience of modern
programming languages, e.g. Python, Java, C++, C#. To be considered for the Band E role you must also have experience of contributing to a collaborative software development project.


You must also be available for occasional UK and overseas travel.



You will also contribute to project events and conferences as and when required by the project
leadership team.

item.title: Unity3D Developer at Viacom (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description:
Viacom.tech in Warsaw plays a crucial role in Viacom`s global engineering organization. We build highly efficient, advanced systems which are used by millions of users all over the world. Currently, we are seeking a Unity Developerto work on existing and future gaming projects for Nickelodeon Games, part of Nickelodeon, the leading kids network worldwide. We are looking for a talented, self-motivated and innovative individual with a passion for gaming and technology. Deep understanding and knowledge of game development fundamentals and sharp programming skills are required.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement game features and components

  • Research and investigate new technologies and how they can be used for our games

  • Quickly iterate through different proof of concepts and prototypes

  • Participate in game performance optimizations (rendering, loading, memory usage, and file size optimizations, etc.)

  • Troubleshoot and solve critical issues on game projects

  • Effectively communicate project status to extended games team

  • Write tools to automate reoccurring tasks during the project life cycle

  • Write high-quality code and unit tests and conduct regular cross-team code reviews


 If you have:



  • 3+ years of experience with creating production level quality games plus a Master’s degree in Computer Science (or related field) or equivalent professional experience combined with a Bachelor’s degree

  • Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming

  • Experience working with Unity3D.

  • Proven capability in problem-solving and ability to come up with innovative solutions

  • Experience with profiling, along with performance optimization (memory leaks, performance analysis, etc.)

  • Ability to work with a cross-functional team including artists, designers, QA, etc.

  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills (also strong in English)


 and optionally also:



  • Experience developing native applications on iOS and/or Android

  • Familiarity with scripting languages like Python, Bash, etc.

  • Knowledge of network protocols and patterns (HTTP, REST), programming and debugging

  • Experience with additional game engines and frameworks (Unreal, Sprite Kit, libGDX, etc.) 


What makes us special?



  • We are working on projects targeting large international communities, using modern development (Java 8, Scala, Swift, Unity) and deployment (AWS, Docker) technologies

  • We do great stuff for the global brands such as Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon and Paramount

  • We offer great benefits package: private health care, fitness card, in-house compensatory English lessons, lots of team building events, fun zones in the office, parking space, facilities for cyclists, activities within the Social Fund

  • We offer competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience and plenty of opportunities for personal and career development

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Sustaining at Optos (Dunfermline, UK)
item.description:
We are growing our Software Engineering team to enable the delivery of an ambitious and innovative product roadmap. 


The team of nearly 50 developers and verification engineers enjoy an environment where knowledge sharing, open communication and the cultivation of talent from within is encouraged.  Utilising the best software technologies, focused on Agile, our squads deliver innovative products that produce ultra-wide field (UWF™) high resolution images of the retina, providing detailed clinical information and analysis to facilitate the early detection, management and effective treatment of disorders and diseases.


Our Sustaining Engineers work with our global customer base to ensure our technology meets their needs as well as supporting our manufacturing operations. You’ll be exposed to various different products and development platforms and will be working with all parts of our system from embedded software to user interface and data management, releasing new features and defect resolution.


You can expect:



  • A supportive working environment that allows you to contribute to your full potential

  • Support to continue to develop your skills and the trust in you to apply those new skills to building better products

  • To help shape and improve how we build products

  • To help improve the health of millions of people by solving seriously challenging problems


Optos would like you to bring:



  • A track record of significant contribution to the delivery of innovative products in a fast-paced environment



  • The proven ability to collaborate with a cross functional team including Product Managers and Operations, to understand users’ problems and to shape solutions, and then build those solutions using C, C++, Python, Visual Studio and QT

  • Expertise in designing and implementing clean, simple UI solutions for complex problems

  • Expertise in a number of the following technologies: C, C++, Python, Visual Studio, QT and various Operating Systems (Linux or Windows)



  • Expertise in applying SOLID design principles, writing great code and writing great automated tests

  • Experience of Lean / Agile project delivery

  • A demonstrated track record working with colleagues to improve the team’s effectiveness by improving processes and tooling

  • A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related technical field, or equivalent experience

  • Drive and dynamism, bringing energy to everything you do

  • Flexibility to work with various devices and in a range of different environments

  • Experience in any of the following is a bonus:

    • Developing medical devices

    • End-to-end Product Ownership

    • Experience of real time engineering systems development from integration with hardware through to customer-facing applications

    • Experience of supporting a software release through manufacturing processes and delivery to end users

item.title: Hadoop Platform Engineer - AGODA NOW HIRING - Bangkok Based at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build products across our next gen data platform products.
  • Our systems scale across multiple data centres, totalling a few million writes per second and managing petabytes of data. We deal with problems from real-time data-ingestion, replication, enrichment, storage and analytics. We are not just using Big Data technologies; we are pushing them to the edge.
  • In this competitive world of online travel agencies, finding even the slightest advantage in the data can make or break a company. That is why we put data systems in our top priorities.
  • While we are proud of what we built so far, there is still a long way to go to fulfil our vision of data. We are looking for people like you who are as excited about data technology as we are, to join the fight.
    You can be part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) products across all aspects of our core data platform products.


Why Agoda Hadoop Platform Team?

When you join this team, the primary function of the Hadoop Platform is to run multiple Hadoop clusters across multiple data centres, serving teams across all of Agoda, serving large numbers of concurrent jobs at any one-time processing Petabytes of data for any and all purposes ranging from Machine Learning, BI, Cubes on Hadoop, Advertising, etc.

To do this successfully, you will adopt an approach of infrastructure as code, you will be automating everything from deployment to monitoring and remediation, with a huge focus on monitoring, which will provide you the ability to quickly identify and fix issues whether it be infra, data or job related.



Day to Day:
  • You will manage, administer, troubleshoot and grow multiple Hadoop clusters
  • You will build automated tools to solve operational issues
  • You will run effective POC's on new platform products that can grow the list of services we offer


About You:
  • You'll probably hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Engineering / related field
  • You'll be skilled with Bash and at least one other scripting language (Python, Perl, etc.)
  • You'll have a deep understanding of data architecture principles
  • You'll be experienced in solving problems and working with a team to resolve large scale production issues
  • You'll be experienced with configuration management systems (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Saltstack, etc) and version control (eg. git, svn)
  • You'll have experience with Linux HA, clustering and load balancing solutions
  • You'll have great multi-tasking skills
  • You'll have proficient English oral and written communication skills


Nice to Haves:
  • Experience installing, administering and managing Hadoop clusters (Hadoop2 with YARN)
  • Experience with Cloudera Hadoop (CDH)
  • Experience with Hadoop query engine (Hive, SparkSQL, Impala)
  • Experience with modern languages preferably using JVM-based languages (Java, Scala)
  • Solid experience in JVM tuning
  • Experience working with open source products
  • Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies




What else?

With Agoda you can grow rapidly as an engineer.
  • You will work with top Hadoop engineers
  • Have the ability to use and expand your experience
  • Have a big impact on the business.


Some tech you will use:

Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Impala, Scala, Avro, Parquet, Sensu, ElasticSearch, Python, Django, Postgres,



If that's the kind of team you want to join, let's talk!



Agoda is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.



Please note this role open to local and international applications. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

item.title: Ingénieur Data Analyst H/F at VALEO (Bobigny, France)
item.description:
Acteur majeur de la transformation du marché automobile, Valeo est un équipementier, partenaire des constructeurs automobile au niveau international. Grâce à ses 100 900 collaborateurs travaillant dans 32 pays, Valeo conçoit des solutions innovantes de mobilité intelligente pour une conduite autonome, intuitive et écologique.


Le Groupe a réalisé en 2016 un chiffre d’affaires de 16,5 milliards d’euros et a consacré plus de 11 % de son chiffre d’affaires première monte à la recherche et au développement. Valeo est une entreprise du CAC 40.


Travailler chez Valeo, c’est rejoindre un groupe international attractif qui promeut la diversité et le développement de ses talents. Valeo est certifié « Top Employer » au niveau mondial.


L'équipe InnoCoRe (Innovation and Collaborative Research) est une équipe pluridisciplinaire du pôle "Confort et Aide à la Conduite". L'objectif de l'équipe est d'explorer les domaines de la conduite autonome, de l'interaction entre les voitures et les utilisateurs pour les nouvelles technologies et les nouveaux cas d'utilisation.


Notre travail contribue à définir les feuilles de route de Valeo (5-10 ans), en fournissant aux équipes de R & D des projets innovants à poursuivre Ingénieurs, designers UX et gestionnaires de projet situés en France, en Allemagne et en Californie font équipe autour d'une mission commune pour concevoir et expérimenter de nouveaux concepts et services afin de créer une valeur ajoutée pour les technologies Valeo existantes.


Votre mission vous amène à :



  1. Identification, développement et test des applications automobiles liées au Big data



  • Revue des « State of the art »

  • Définition des cas d’utilisation avec l’équipe

  • Développement, test, optimisation et validation des solutions techniques

  • Design et implémentation des collections de données

  • Gestion et analyse des données

  • Fournir la documentation des solutions délivrées (fonctionnel, technique et synthèse)

  • Analyse des nouvelles technologies



  • Evaluation des technologies : électronique grand public, start-ups, fournisseurs de techno, prestataires

  • Intégration des solutions des fournisseurs externes

  • Développement du Métier « Data Science »



  • Support technique pour les autres entités Valeo

  • Responsable du processus de développement de données : acquisition de données, intégration du logiciel, développement du logiciel, validation des applications.


Ce poste est ouvert aux titulaires d’un Diplôme d’Ingénieur ou équivalent ainsi que d’un Doctorat en développement de logiciel justifiant d’une première expérience en Data Science.


Compétences requises :



  • Langages : VisualStudio, C++, SQL, Java, Python, C

  • Environnements : Windows, Linux


Compétences appréciées :



  • Expérience en Machine Learning/Deep Learning : R, Caffe, Tensorflow

  • Connaissances sur le Serveur Cloud et communication

  • Connaissances en Datamining

  • Matlab, HTML

  • Connaissances en technologie réseau (Wifi, BT, BTLE, 3G, Mqtt/CoAP…)

  • Connaissances en Cloud Computing

  • Connaissances en Cloud Security/authentification


La maîtrise de l’anglais est indispensable.


Désireux d'apprendre, curieux, réfléchi et sensible aux nouvelles technologies, Valeo cherche à vous joindre à cette équipe d'innovation. Votre capacité à adapter et maîtriser de nouvelles technologies et de nouveaux sujets enrichira les compétences d'équipe existantes.

item.title: Senior PHP Developer (m/f) at DCMN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About DCMN


Our approach is simple, yet unique: We develop and execute individual growth marketing strategies that combine creativity and media with ROI-optimization technology to help our clients scale fast and internationally. We are the perfect partner for your performance marketing. From strategy to creation and production, to media planning and buying, to ROI-based optimization, all based on our own technology. We work on all media channels – across TV, radio, out-of-home, online, mobile and print.


DCMN has its headquarters in Berlin and offices located in Munich, New York, London, Bangalore, Paris and Cape Town.



We're currently a ~20 person tech team deploying three products across a mix of bare metal and AWS infrastructure. We are looking for a strong PHP Developer to join our Berlin based team.


Requirements



  • Proficient in PHP 7 and the Zend ecosystem

  • Deep understanding of MySQL

  • Fluent in at least one other programming language

  • Experience in building scalable, purely RESTful APIs

  • Write clean, modular and testable code accompanied with proper, meaningful tests

  • Configure CI pipelines for your code

  • Experience with AWS, Linux hosts and docker containers, as well as an eye for DevOps

  • Proven experience on complex systems with many moving components

  • A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or relevant experience

  • Python and Spark knowledge is a big plus



Your responsibilities



  • Work on our tracking and analysis technology for TV campaigns and additional marketing channels

  • Be part of an international team of rockstar passionate engineers

  • Build a variety of client-server API’s from the ground up

  • Collaborate with DevOps to ensure that all applications are scalable and robust

  • Effectively communicate and evangelize technical solutions and strategies

  • Mentor younger engineers



What's in it for you?



  • Work in a dynamic, experienced team of outstanding developers

  • Be a part of an elite international team – we have 30 nationalities!

  • Working with the latest technologies

  • Take full responsibility from day one

  • Home-office and remote work friendly, matched with flexible working hours.

  • We're not cheap, you'll get a nice screen or two

  • Free language courses, pilates classes and massages during and outside work time

  • We live work/life balance (!)

  • A recently remodelled and trendy office in a building with other great digital companies in one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Berlin,

  • A competitive compensation and an incentive plan that rocks when you rock


Interested?


Does this job description sound perfect for you? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Your contact person is Theresa Jasaraj..

item.title: Intern / Working Student for Calibration & Computer Vision (f/m) at NavVis GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
Working student - up to 20 hours per week or Intern up to 40 hours per week during or between the studies. 


Our Mapping & Perception Team at NavVis is developing the technology to map buildings in 3D. We create realistic 3D data of entire buildings, such as airports, based on cutting-edge algorithms in robotics, computer vision, and point cloud processing. If you feel at home in both software engineering and algorithms, and want to build something that finally makes indoors digital, this might be the right place for you.


You will work on:



  • You will work on the calibration of our trolley and its sensors such as cameras, lasers and IMUs

  • You will improve and develop new methods that improve the calibration accuracy

  • You will work on various research experiments to push the data quality to the next level

  • You will do the calibration and perform various experiments to analyze the procedure

  • You will learn a lot about 3D geometry, optimization techniques and frameworks

  • You will make the difference!


Skills & Requirements


You have:



  • You are willing and capable to familiarize yourself with challenging new topics and tasks

  • You are studying Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Mathematics, as examples

  • You will work on all kind of components related to our famous mapping trolley

  • You have some previous experience in software development - Python and C++ knowledge is a plus

  • You are familiar with command line tools - Linux know-how is a plus

  • We are thrilled if you have experience in computer vision or optimization techniques

  • You are fluent in either German or English

item.title: Experienced Semantics Engineer for NLP (Insurance) at Gini GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
EXPERIENCED SEMANTICS ENGINEER FOR NLP


MUNICH, GERMANY - ONSITE - FULL TIME


HOW YOUR NEW TEAM WILL CHANGE THE WORLD 
At the team „Insurance“, we think that processes, reaction times and user experience in today's Insurance industry needs some Gini magic! The insurance world does not only offer enormous potential in optimizing existing processes but also in creating a radical new level of customer experience. How about transforming an insurance claim from painfully bureaucratic to easily relieving? What about boosting transparency and enabling realtime communication whenever, wherever? This is what we strive to achieve.


YOUR PLAYING FIELD AT GINI 



  • Your mission is to enable new excellent product(s) by creating the best possible information extraction quality that ensures the fastest document processing speed

  • You will extract relevant information from documents by training Machine Learning models and hand crafting rules

  • You will gather and employ secondary data to provide additional knowledge, and ensure the best information quality

  • You will be integral part of a brand new, pioneering Insurance product from conception to roll-out and beyond

  • You will work closely with a Backend Developer in your own self-managed, cross-functional team to develop technical product architecture

  • You will actively discuss technical aspects, contribute with your ideas and excellent code to the whole Semantics department


YOUR PROFILE 



  • You have at least 2 to 3 years (more is welcome) of industry experience in NLP, and are fully proficient in regular expressions and statistics

  • You are excellent in at least one of the programming languages: Java, Scala and / or Python

  • You have hands on experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning

  • You are an autonomous, self-driven individual - and others call you a perfectionist

  • You are a risk taker who embraces chances, and love to explore the latest developments in the NLP and Machine Learning communities

  • You have strong interpersonal skills and are able to communicate technical details to non-technical people


Sounds like the right challenge for you? Get in touch with us!

item.title: Senior Backend and/or iOS Engineer for Travel Startup at Polarsteps (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Join us on our adventure!


We're a young startup on a mission to radically change the way travelers plan, track, and remember their adventures. We've built the best travel tracker out there, and we're embarking on our next journey: making your trip planning a breeze. To get a feel of what we're building, you can download the Polarsteps app here (we've been featured in the WWDC 2017 Keynote and multiple times in the App Store).


We’re a fully funded, enthusiastic and multi-faceted team of 7 with a passion for travel, design and code, and you'll be working closely with us building a super awesome travel app that people genuinely love.


The challenge lying ahead of us is huge, but if we push the right buttons we'll forever transform the way people travel. Do you have what it takes?


Our ideal candidate


You’re a seasoned, professional and pragmatic developer with a feel for UI/UX. You love to travel and believe in metrics and stats as a means to understand our users' behaviour as much as you care about their explicit feedback. In addition to this, if you have iOS experience and successfully released one or more apps in the App Store, or if you have experience with large-scale backend platforms, then you’re the rainbow unicorn we’ve been looking for.


Benefits, perks, the cool stuff...


Does this description apply to you? Then check out these additional perks (specially the last one ), and click that Apply button already!


- Stock options!
- Competitive salary
- Work/life balance
- Relocation assistance
- The possibility to be part of a fun, international team
- Awesome office in the center of Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan and beautiful cities in the world
- 30 vacation days (25 ‘regular’ days + 5 Teleporter™ days, see below)


We believe that regardless of stock options and salary, what will really make you richer are your travel experiences. That is why once per year you’ll have the chance to use our Teleporter™: with the push of a button, the Teleporter™ will go through all of the locations logged by our users and select a random one that is at least 1.000km away from Amsterdam. This is where your next adventure will take place! The flight is on us (plus the 5 Teleporter™ days, naturally). Try it out here


P.S. As for our tech stack, we’re constantly aiming for the best possible setup based on our needs as we scale (we take over&under engineering mishaps very seriously!) - we’re hosted in Heroku, use Amazon S3 for media storage, python (Flask) in the backend/API, AngularJS in the frontend, and we have fully native apps in iOS and Android. We have single-command build&deploy tasks for production and staging, and we do automated testing with protractor on the web, XCTest on iOS and UI Automator on Android.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Forecasting tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfil customer demand. We use cutting edge Machine Learning technology to forecast demand and pricing with a focus on business and customer experience.


YOUR ROLE


As a Senior Data Scientist, you are part of a cross-functional agile team.



  • You have end-to-end responsibility. You are accountable for all aspects of your work, from data analysis and research, to KPI definition, testing and deployment. You have +3 years of professional experience and you are passionate to drive and develop a great product as part of an agile team.


  • You support product discovery. You are working with product management and stakeholders to define the scope of data science products. You have great communication skills to translate data science topics to business stakeholders.


  • You pick the right approach for a given problem. You have a deep understanding of standard Machine Learning methods such as Generalized Linear Models, (Recurrent) Neural Networks, State Space Models (SSMs), in particular how to leverage them to handle temporal data. You’re holding a degree (PhD or M.Sc.) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other similar quantitative field.


  • You know how to deal with data. You have the skills to query, analyze, and cluster data and know how to set up monitoring and data quality assurance.


  • You bring machine learning systems to production. You collaborate with engineers to translate forecasting prototypes into production systems. You have experience with Python, ML-related libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, and big data frameworks such as Spark.


WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY



  • You have impact. Your contribution to our business critical forecasting products will have a broad visibility across the company and management levels.


  • You can influence. Zalando’s dynamic structures and processes give you a huge opportunity to drive ideas and influence your working environment.


  • We create career opportunities. Our tech departments are ever growing, offering various career opportunities for your future, whether you want to become a Principal Data Scientist, or step into a new role.


  • We support your networking. You have the opportunity to attend and speak at related conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish your work (open source commitment), we host game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.


  • The Benefits. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


Please make sure your application is written in English. If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Data Software Engineer - Connect fantastic TV to audiences worldwide at Magine (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer with a passion for managing large amount of data to join our team. The mission of the Data team at Magine to provide insights (e.g. reports, models) and build data driven services (e.g. self-service analytics and recommendations) for business partners and for TV loving people. We use the data we collect about the usage of our product to guide our efforts both within the engineering team as well as in the organisation as a whole.


Responsibilities:



  • Continuously design, develop, and deploy services as part of our data infrastructure

  • Work primarily in Scala and python, spanning other languages as needed

  • Leverage a wide array of infrastructure technologies such as Cassandra, Kafka and Spark

  • Collaborative with other software engineers

  • Work as part of cross-functional agile teams 


We think you have the following qualifications: 



  • Excellent understanding of system design, data structures and algorithms

  • Experience in data manipulation: use of structured data tools (e.g. SQL) & and unstructured data tools and platforms (e.g. Spark, NoSQL)

  • You are a fast learner with strong quantitative skills that thrives from working in a fast paced environment together with other team mates

  • You have a high sense of responsibility that takes initiative and has the skills and ambitions to grow with the role

  • Experience working with distributed/scalable systems and high-volume applications

  • Long experience with object-oriented and/or functional programming (e.g. Scala (preferred), Python, Java, Clojure, Haskell, C#, C++)

  • Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g. AWS, EC2, S3)

  • Excellent communication skills


What we offer:



  • A fun and challenging place to work at!

  • Great co-workers.

  • Innovative thinking.

  • Competitive benefit package.

  • The chance to be part of making a difference in your area of expertise (and maybe other areas too!).

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Office located in central Stockholm

item.title: Head of Data Science at OfferUp (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Core to our mission is our use of data. Our marketplace yields millions of transactions every month, and we seek to use this data to improve every aspect of our customer experience.  We are seeking a Head of Data Science to lead our emerging data science effort. In this role you will work closely with the entire executive team, define our long-term R&D roadmap, mentor and manage all other scientists, and partner with with product managers and engineers to deliver data-driven insights and product improvements.


The ideal candidate has a broad understanding of the entire landscape of machine learning and data science, has a solid track record of transferring research results into product, is excellent in all forms of communication, will be a magnet for others to join the team, and will have a strategic mindset that helps to shape the direction of the company.


When successful in this role you will be recognized as a world-class Data Science leader. You will both identify best practices that OfferUp should adopt, and develop best practices that will be adopted by other organizations. This is a role that will require great leadership skills to drive change across the entire organization.


Responsibilities:



  • Define and prioritize the basic research opportunities for the entire company;

  • Identify all infrastructure gaps required to make data science as productive as possible;

  • Serve as a domain expert in many areas of machine learning and data science;

  • Hire, mentor, and manage all other scientists within the company;

  • Act as an internal advisor on all issues related to data;

  • Contribute to the overall company strategy, especially as it pertains to data;

  • Make individual technical contribution where possible;

  • Serve as the company’s public ambassador to the scientific community;

item.title: IT Security Specialist at Docler Holding (Luxembourg City, Luxembourg)
item.description:
Job description


Are you interested in working on a website that has 35 million unique visitors per day? Does the thought of working with Scalable Web Architecture intrigue you? Over 200 developers are working around the world (and clock) always ensuring that our service maintains its highest standard at all times. If you would like to join a diverse international team and work on interesting projects that challenge your knowledge and expertise, you’re the kind of person we want! Come and join us at our headquarters in Luxembourg!


What you will really be doing



  • Ensure that we are always ahead of potential threats

  • Penetration testing of our infrastructure and development of scalable test strategies 

  • Vulnerability research on our systems, including exotic ones 

  • Development of security tools automating complex tasks 

  • Take a hands-on role in building security solutions and improving existing ones 

  • Proactively working with product teams throughout the development cycle integrating security best practices 

  • Share knowledge with peers and mentor less experienced team members


Requirements



  • Degree in security field or equivalent experience (4+ years)

  • Experience in Ethical Hacking of web applications and networked infrastructure 

  • Knowledge of attack vectors, threat tactics and attacker techniques 

  • Familiarity with common toolkits used in penetration testing 

  • Experience in systems engineering with Linux systems (2+ years) 

  • Experience in programming (Python, PHP, JavaScript) (2+ years) 

  • Innovative thinker and problem-solver 

  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal Interpersonal skills sufficient to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organizations 

  • An open mind, willingness to be challenged and strong desire to learn 

  • Experience with OpenStack technologies is a plus 

  • Experience with Agile Secure Development 

  • Lifecycle and Threat Modeling is a plus


What we offer



  • Competitive salary package

  • Relocation package and support

  • Additional benefits: meal vouchers, private health insurance, Sympass card

  • Conferences, certifications, technical workshops, trainings and language courses

  • Possibility to advance in the company (career development, opportunity to work on new projects)

  • Latest hardware, multiple monitors

  • Chill rooms, creative areas, LAN parties and fun events

  • Voted as the second richest country in the world, Luxembourg offers a high quality of life that is hard to match 

  • Multi-cultural environment, 30 different nationalities, English being the official language

    During the recruitment process candidates will be requested to provide with a recent criminal record extract for background screening purpose.

item.title: React JS Skilled Full Stack Developer at Waracle (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Awesome Lead role for React JS Developer based in Glasgow with a top team and cutting edge tech. 


Skills & Requirements


You will have some experience of the following: 


Languages & Frameworks


C# .Net 4.5, ASP MVC 5/Web Api 2, Javascript, Node, Express, T-SQL, HTML 5, CSS 3, Angular, React, Entity Framework 6, Nunit, Moq, Autofac, Selenuim, Kendo UI, jQuery, Knockout, Jasmine, Bootstrap, Blackberry JDK, Python, AWS, Azure.
