item.title: Chapter Lead Data Science at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for a Chapter Lead Data Science


Think Forward! Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network. If you want to work at a place where we believe that you can make the difference by using machine learning to generate data driven products and solve the most pressing business challenges, please read on.

At ING we are incredibly excited about Data Science and the great potential for progress and innovation. ING in The Netherlands reaches over 8 million customers, all with unique profiles, behaviours and experiences. You can imagine that our customer interactions generate a vast volume of data every single day. Unlocking this data can lead to something very special. This is where we come in. The goal of our chapter is to support the business in unlocking its potential; to better serve our customers, improve our operational processes and create new and innovative data driven products that go beyond traditional banking.


Role Profile


As a Chapter Lead you will play a key role in driving the success of Data Science within Domestic Bank, from ideation to the delivery of data driven products and solutions. This role requires a passion for creating cultural change through data – specifically by applying new and innovative methods, data sources and agile development. The ideal Chapter Lead has excellent management and influence skills and (proven) track record in building data driven solutions/products.


You are:



  • Leading a chapter of 6 Data Scientists; coaching them to reach their full potential.

  • Hands on; spending 60% of your time on building reusable data driven products yourself.

  • Always thinking a step ahead and never satisfied with the status quo; seeking to use new data sources and deploy the latest and greatest tools and technologies.

  • Adept at collaborating with a range of stakeholders in order to deliver.

  • A true promoter of the Agile Way of Working.

  • Living the ING Orange code and willing to take the Bankers Oath (see: http://www.ing.jobs/Netherlands/Why-ING/This-is-ING-too/ING-Values.htm ).


Candidate profile


You have:



  • At least 6 years of experience in the Data Science space (methods, technology, data) including statistical modelling and machine learning experience to solve business questions and/or develop (innovative) data driven products.

  • Experience in leading a team to drive results and interact with (senior level) stakeholders.

  • Track record of developing people and knowledge through coaching or mentoring.

  • An entrepreneurial mind set.

  • Excellent communication skills and influence, with the ability to translate business issues into analytical solutions.

  • Successfully managed the end to end delivery of insights and value, including resourcing, budgeting and prioritisation.

  • Knowledge about the latest developments in the Data Science community (methods and tools) combined with the ability to decide which of these are most relevant to ING and translate them in into opportunities.

  • Strong knowledge of existing and emerging Analytics products and Open Source technologies.

  • Experience delivering effectively in a fast paced environment with an ability to adapt quickly.

  • Fluent in written and spoken English. Although Dutch is a pre, it is not necessary.

  • Willingness to learn: open to feedback, develops on the technical and the interpersonal level

  • A PhD or Master’s in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering)


We offer:



  • A leading position in a chapter with a start-up spirit and the mission to become the best Data Science team in the Netherlands

  • A full time position (36 hour work week) in Amsterdam

  • Good salary, 25 vacation days and excellent benefits like a 13th month, NS Business Card, Pension scheme, Personal allowance, laptop, mobile phone, etc.

  • Extensive training and education.

  • Great career possibilities both national and international.

  • Informal working environment with coffee bar, pool table, games and other fun stuff.


In need of further information or ready to apply?
Can you identify with this profile? Then apply and become a Chapter Lead Data Science at ING.  Do you have any questions about this position?


The selection procedure consists out of 3 rounds: two interviews and one hands-on pair programming test. Because we are dealing with a sensitive position we also need to carry out an extended sensitive screening.

item.title: Software Engineer, Tools & Infrastructure at Bending Spoons (Milano, Italy)
item.description:
We’re aiming to become the #1 in the world at developing and publishing mobile apps. How could software engineering not be at the very core of this enormously ambitious mission? Already serving millions of users and adding tens of thousands every day, we rely on our exceptional engineers to build next-generation tools that will make us the most effective and efficient workforce in the industry. With bigger and bigger frontiers to conquer, we’re looking for passionate, bright, and driven software engineers that are eager to bring our tools and infrastructure to the next level.


A few examples of your responsibilities:



  • Take an active role in identifying the tooling and infrastructural needs of the company, and participate in defining the plan to fulfil them.

  • Help define the software architecture of new tools or that of new features for existing tools, and then develop them. The work spans broadly from the most infrastructure- or backend-oriented to the development of complex front-ends.

  • Constantly improve the quality of our tools and infrastructure by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary.

  • Expand our set of libraries as needed to make yourself as well as other engineers more efficient and effective.

  • Stay informed on new, relevant development technologies and test the promising ones to make sure we don’t miss out on game-changing opportunities to boost our productivity and the enjoyment of our work.


What we offer



  • Huge impact. Your tools and infrastructure will be powering our entire organization in its serving millions of users and pursuing market domination. Will that get you out of bed excited in the morning?

  • Talented, knowledgeable colleagues. You’ll get the chance to learn (and teach to!) some of the brightest and most skilled people you’ll ever meet. Your talent is going to blossom here.

  • Cool tech stack. We strive to use the best, most modern tools and technologies, and when they fall short of our expectations we invent our own. It’s a geek’s paradise.

  • Own products. We don’t work for clients, but only develop our own apps. Freed from politics, we can move fast and be daring.

  • Fun, young environment. We have near-zero hierarchy and a very relaxed workplace. Also, we’re 28 years old on average and often hang out together, so you might actually end up making new friends!

  • Top-notch office. Our office is amazing! We designed it ourselves and it goes beyond excellent functionality by offering all sorts of amenities, such as foosball tables and gaming consoles.

  • International reach. Our audience is wildly international. Our company language is English. We’re a global reality.


What we look for



  • Passion for the topic. You have a long-standing, proven passion for writing software. It’s a big plus if you have a demonstrated interest in developing tools, complex front-ends, or infrastructures.

  • Reasoning and depth of learning. You’re structured and creative enough to solve most challenging problems independently, given the necessary knowledge. You learn new concepts and skills rapidly, and look to understand stuff truly in depth.

  • Drive. You’re energetic, hard-working, and persevere through adversity until the job is done, and done well. You get turned on by getting results, and always aim for excellence in what you do.

  • Pragmatism. Far from being too academic or obsessive in your perfectionism, you understand that, when getting things done in a competitive world, speed is often as important as quality.

  • Curiosity and initiative. You love exploring and you’re entrepreneurial in seeking out new opportunities and testing new ideas of your own accord. You don’t just wait to be told what to do all the time.

  • Attention to detail. You care to develop quality user experiences for your colleagues, go the extra mile to learn what they need, and tend to notice the details that make a difference.

  • Diligence, organization. You can blindly be entrusted with big responsibilities as well as small, more menial tasks.

  • Humbleness. You’re down to earth, eager to listen to people’s feedback and constructive criticism, and ready to get your hands dirty with whatever the team needs to succeed.

  • Proficient in English. You read and write proficiently, and speak at a conversational level in English.


Commitment & contract
Full-time, permanent (tempo indeterminato).


Location
Milan, Corso Como 15. It’s fine if you prefer to work remotely sometimes. We offer substantial support for relocation, including finding an apartment in Milan and paying the rent for twelve weeks.


Compensation & benefits
Generous, top of market, and moreover can grow very rapidly and include stock options, depending on your performance. Breakfast, lunch, and snacks are paid-for, when you work from the office. You’ll receive the latest Mac, iPhone, and wireless noise-cancelling Bose headset.

item.title: Deutsche Bank Technology Graduate Programme at Deutsche Bank UK (London, UK)
item.description:
About your programme


Our programme is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to immediately add value and contribute to meeting the needs of our world-class clients. You’ll join your global classmates across all business areas for orientation where you’ll hear from executive board members directly regarding the future of the bank. Following this, best-in-class product trainers will give you an unrivalled introduction to our business and the industry. You’ll build a broad knowledge base and hone your skills through immersive classroom and online modules that are built around you.


About Technology


Our technology teams are responsible for the bank’s entire information technology infrastructure. They develop and maintain the software required to support the bank’s business. The teams work closely with the businesses and other infrastructure units to modernise the bank’s IT systems to reduce complexity, risk and enable business growth.


Deutsche Bank sees itself as a technology-driven company that can gain market share with new, cutting-edge ideas. Our ambition is to be a leader in the area of digitalisation. We are making investments into digital technology across all businesses to enhance the client experience, harness the power of data, and strengthen efficiency and controls by increasing automation. We are also collaborating with external partners such as start-ups, FinTechs, and technology specialists worldwide to discover and implement innovative solutions for our clients.


Join us here, and you’ll constantly be looking ahead. We’ll look to you to capitalise on new technological trends that can reshape our business and deliver value for our clients, whilst still meeting the demands of customers, regulators and the markets.


Your role


Working on our day-to-day business as well as on projects, your ideas will help the team to solve complex challenges and break new ground. An enthusiasm for modern technology, creativity and ability to learn quickly are all vital for this role. You will learn from the best, evolve professionally as well as personally, and build a firm foundation upon which to specialise later.


Areas in which you could work



  • Analysis: You will be supporting our clients with innovative projects and developing bespoke technological concepts to simplify business processes and make them more effective.

  • Development: As a technical specialist, you should be proficient in at least one programming language. With the help of state-of-the-art software and hardware, you will design and develop applications, look after quality assurance and conduct tests.


Your qualifications


We are looking for bright minds with good academic records and some practical work experience to create a positive impact for our customers.



  • Do you have an academic focus on (business) informatics, (business) mathematics, industrial engineering or natural sciences with an IT focus?

  • Are you passionate about finance as well as innovative technology?

  • Have you already completed previous training– an internship or a part-time job in a field related to banking or technology?

  • Are you well-versed in working with common applications and/or do you have some programming experience?

  • Do you have strong communication skills and are you fluent in English?

  • Can you work well in a team and inspire others with your ideas?

  • Would you describe yourself as a conscientious, dedicated individual with excellent analytical skills and rapid comprehension?


Then we look forward to meeting you!

item.title: Big Data Engineer for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering you an interesting and challenging role as a Big Data Engineer (f/m) contributing directly to the development of algorithms in the field of autonomous driving. Data-driven software solutions are at the core of the autonomous driving project, serving agile feature teams that develop sophisticated algorithms for environment perception, situation analysis and driving strategy selection.

As a (Senior) Big Data Engineer (f/m) you will contribute your ideas and knowledge in designing and implementing solutions for ingestion, storage, retrieval and analysis of data from test vehicles that is used to train machine learning models as well as for functional validation. In addition, you will support machine learning scientists to scale their algorithms to big data.

In your daily work, you will find yourself in an international and interdisciplinary environment and collaborate intensively with our high-tech industry partners. Our brand-new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the infrastructure you need to work productively and focus on the software for the automobile of the future.


Qualifications


- A university degree in Computer Science or a comparable qualification.
- Advanced industrial experience on the Hadoop ecosystem (e.g. Yarn, MapReduce, Spark, HBase, Kafka, etc.).
- Expert knowledge in software development in at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, Scala.
- Deep knowledge in distributed processing principles and frameworks.
- Background in data analytics and experience in modelling complex big data architectures is a plus.
- Working experience in automotive data processing is a plus.
- Experience in working according to agile methodologies (e.g. Scrum, LeSS).
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: Software Developer (Windows Platform, C++) - Sophos Home at Sophos (Abingdon, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a software engineer or senior software engineer to join our consumer security product team, building the latest and greatest security products using the industry leading Sophos technologies to provide consumers with advanced and easy to use protection.


The ideal candidate has experience of commercial software development on Windows platforms using C++ and is familiar with Windows low-level details, along with the flexibility to adapt to other platforms and programming languages. Knowledge of internet technologies, Python, Java, JavaScript or Mac development would be an advantage.


Main Duties


Work on all aspects of our Cloud managed consumer security products for Windows platforms as part of an internationally distributed team.


Main Duties



  • Design products or systems in line with asset technical strategy, quality and functionality requirements.

  • Actively contribute to release planning and drive for high-value and high-quality solutions which meet business needs

  • Define and conduct appropriate Unit, System and Integration testing on own code and others across the product or system, fixing errors, highlighting potential implications on other products or systems.

  • Creation of high-quality production level code

  • Demonstrate technical expertise in development, diagnosing/debugging issues and products

  • Influence other Engineers to ensure they are demonstrating best practice and championing the company values

  • Act as a product expert within the team, influencing design and architecture decisions to ensure a reliable and maintainable product which meets customer requirements

  • Other duties and responsibilities as directed


Experience and Skills



  • Design and write high quality code in C++

  • Experience of modern Windows technologies and tools.

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Desire to collaborate with cross-functional team of product managers, software engineers, quality assurance engineers, operational staff, and documentation leads

  • Detail-Oriented: excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills

  • Ability to work independently with general direction; comfortable working with remote team members using telecommunications


NOTICE TO RECRUITERS & PLACEMENT AGENCIES
If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Sophos prior to having a signed agreement from Human Resources. Sophos is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Sophos and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention. Thank you.

item.title: Software Configuration Engineer at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction


Do you want to manage and execute our (software) integration plan in order to meeting the product roadmap and quality standards? In this position you get the opportunity to get in the lead.




Job Mission


The Software Configuration Engineer guards and dictates the SW configuration of several proto and pilot systems, directly influencing systems worth multiple millions of euros each. He defines and delivers the most efficient SW configuration together with the SW Release Project Leader, SW integrator, SW test team, Product architect, integration architects and proto integration team to meet ASML’s product roadmap needs. The plans need continuous adaptation and therefore, the Software Configuration Engineer will have to anticipate and take the appropriate steps.




Job Description



  • It is expected that you can think and work in terms of:

  • Advice on content and planning of the SW configuration which should match the (HW) capabilities of the systems.

  • Optimizations towards development projects, test configurations and proto configurations.

  • Advice not only on SW patch level, but also on SW switches, installed workarounds, installed extras etc in relation with the capabilities of the systems which is dynamic and extremely complex, on SW validity and manage deviations.

  • Proactive manage implementation of the advice on all systems

  • Improve SW configuration tooling

  • Overall improvement of the (functional) coverage

  • Manage and maintain the software configuration to meet ASML’s product roadmap and quality standards.




Education


Bachelor or Master Level – Technical




Experience



  • 5 years of experience in software development and/or configuration

  • Knowledge of scripting/tooling.

  • Knowledge of C/C++

  • Experience with Unix / Solaris




Personal skills



  • Enthusiastic, flexible and assertive

  • Communication skills

  • Able to defend own opinion

  • Proactive attitude

  • Searching own challenges

  • Multi-tasking/dynamic

  • Able to prioritize

  • High degree of autonomy

  • Ready to be employed for at least 2 years

  • Ability / willingness to attend additional courses




Context of the position


Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering (D&E) is responsible for the specification, design and engineering of the ASML products. Within D&E, the Software Cluster is concerned with the design, development, testing and integration of the complete software package which drives a generation of ASML products, within the SW Cluster, the department Software Configuration Engineer (SCE) is responsible for the configuration and releasing of newly developed and existing software.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at immmr GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Responsibilities



  • Write, test and maintain code for our infrastructure automation

  • Design and implement operations support systems

  • Build, update and maintain continuous integration and deployment infrastructure (private and public cloud)

  • Service capacity planning and demand forecasting



Minumum qualifications:



  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science  or equivalent practical experience

  • Experience in writing infrastructure as code, e.g. with configuration management and orchestration languages

  • Experience in one or more programming languages (C++, Java, Python, Go, …)



Preferred qualifications



  • Able to work independently and take over responsibilities in the team

  • Experience with distributed systems/ cluster management

  • Understanding of Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond

  • Understanding of networking stack, especially in public cloud infrastructures

  • Experience with one or more of the following technologies

  • AWS, terraform, Kubernetes, Chef, Ansible, CoreOS, Elasticsearch, Redis, RabbitMQ, Postgresql

item.title: Chaos engineer at SRE - WBS at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is hiring Chaos engineer at SRE - WBS


What we ask:


Complete Chaos, are you ready to implement chaos to create operational zen?


Your working environment: 


Chaos Engineering is the discipline of intentionally injecting failures into systems in order to improve the system's ability to withstand these failures in production. Many of the extended outages in distributed systems occur when each individual service is behaving as intended, but unexpected interactions between services leads to a chaotic outcome. 

The Chaos Engineering team is building a world-class failure-injection tool set which service owners use to run chaos experiments on their systems. Our tool creates real-world failures like network disruption, resource exhaustion or dependency failure in a controlled environment, even chain specific functional payment error scenarios. This allows service owners to determine whether their mitigation strategies for these failures are effective and to continuously improve their system until they are. 

We are a software development team, not a testing team. Since our tool has the ability to disrupt production services, it is critical that it performs predictably, halts experiments automatically when things go wrong, and scales to support the thousands of hosts in cloud, VMware or even HP nonstop and AS400. 


Activities done by Chaos Engineer SRE (e.g.):



  • Setting up and maintaining solid chaos engineering environment which supports Failure as a Service

  • Setting up and maintaining a test framework and a continuous delivery pipeline

  • Setting up and maintaining automatic reporting and feedback loops

  • Solve risk management related challenges

  • Onboarding of teams, teaching the fundamentals, guiding them through the process

  • Researching of cutting edge software

    Your new job!


    You are an enthusiastic Software and or reliability Engineer with a focus on creating amazing code and or frameworks. You will develop consumable, automated end-to-end software solutions for your consumers together with your squad. You are able to move all typical user stories and tasks from “To-Do” to “Done”. You are able to inspire squads to spread the chaos mind set. You are enthusiastic about transferring your knowledge to others within your team, but also with all DevOps teams in Wholesale banking and the rest of ING.


    Capabilities asked



  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

  • Professional experience in software development

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

  • Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis 

    Preferred Qualifications





  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

  • Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems

  • Experience with agile software development practices

  • Experience with software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Experience with building systems with multiple layers of redundancy to withstand failures in software, hardware, network infrastructure.

    You recognize yourself in this profile




  •  Maybe you have some of these Competencies/Skills





  • Mastery in at least one programming language, Java and/or .net are a plus

  • Working knowledge of configuration tools like Puppet, Chef or Ansible

  • Scripting experience in at least one of the following: Ruby, Python, Bash, Powershell

  • Solid foundation in Linux administration and troubleshooting; 


We offer:



  • Great salary and benefits like 13th month, 8% holiday allowance, personal allowances etc.

  • Challenging, professional and fun work environment.


Like it ?


Don’t apply


Love it ?


( hell yes ) apply …..

item.title: Code embedded solutions for the most innovative products! at Altran Netherlands (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Innovations are just ideas waiting to be made!


Do you believe that technology can make a big impact on business and society? Do your ideas come to life in tangible products? Do you like to extract as much power as possible from a small microcontroller, without using a lot of power? Do IoT, signal processing, optics, connectivity, hardware & software interfacing make your heart beat faster? Then you might be the one we’re looking for!


As a Senior Embedded Software Engineer you make a difference in various projects, from smart indicators, medical devices, connected cars, high-tech mechatronics, advanced air traffic control to smart sensors. We have played a role in the development of intelligent and innovative products for customers like ASML, Bosch, Thales, Philips, NXP and TomTom. As soon as you join Altran, we will immediately start working on your future. We do this with both short and long term in mind, supported by the wide range of courses from our Altran Academy. Of course, the projects you’ll work on are chosen with your own preferences and ambition in mind.


What will you do? A few of your frequent tasks:



  • You will translate the customers wishes into technical applications.

  • Besides developing the software, you will also implement it together with your team.

  • You add value to the customer by further developing and optimizing existing methods/processes.

  • You will keep the quality of the code great using automated tests.

  • You will work in a multidisciplinary team in an agile/scrum environment.

a10:author.a10:name: Max Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences

item.title: Django-Entwickler/in at Max Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences (Leipzig, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das Max-Planck-Institut für Kognitions- und Neurowissenschaften (MPI-CBS) in Leipzig erforscht die Funktion des menschlichen Gehirns. Unsere humanwissenschaftlichen Studien ermöglichen dabei führende Erkenntnisse in der Grundlagenforschung. Auch andere Institute (bspw. das Max-Planck-Institut für Bildungsforschung in Berlin) der Max-Planck-Gesellschaft (MPG) führen solche Studien durch, sodass in einem Verbundprojekt der MPG ein Open-Source Management-System zur Organisation und Durchführung entwickelt wird. Im Rahmen dieses Projektes sucht das MPI-CBS zum 01.01.2018 ein/e


Django-Entwickler/in (bis EG 13 TVöD, befristet auf 3 Jahre)


Anforderungen:



  • teamfähige/r, neugierige/r und ideenreiche/r Django-Entwickler/in

  • sehr gute Django- und Python-Kenntnisse (Fullstack von Vorteil)

  • Hochschulabschluss im Bereich der Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder vergleichbare Ausbildung

  • nachweisbare Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung

  • sehr gute Kenntnisse in relationalen und nicht-relationalen Datenbanken

  • sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • agile Softwareentwicklung von Frontend-/Backend-Services und -Systemen

  • konzeptionelle Mitarbeit bei der Entwicklung des Systems

  • Programmierung und Entwicklung von Django-Modulen und -Schnittstellen

  • Begleitung des Deployments und der Datenschutz-Zertifizierungs- und Sicherheitsüber prüfung der Software


Wir bieten Ihnen:



  • teamorientierte und familienfreundliche Arbeitsumgebung in einem internationalen und interdisziplinären Forschungsumfeld

  • einen modernen Technologie-Stack

  • flache Hierarchien

  • flexible Arbeitszeitregelungen

  • Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen Weiterbildung

  • die Stelle ist auf zunächst 3 Jahre befristet


Die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, mehr schwerbehinderte Menschen zu beschäftigen. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht. Ferner will die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft den Anteil an Frauen in den Bereichen erhöhen, in denen sie unterrepräsentiert sind. Frauen werden deshalb ausdrücklich aufgefordert, sich zu bewerben.


Wir freuen uns über Ihre vollständige Online-Bewerbung bis zum 25.10.2017 unter: http://www.cbs.mpg.de/stellenmarkt (Kennziffer „DJE 18/17“).


Bei Rückfragen wenden Sie sich bitte an Herrn Mathias Goldau: goldau@cbs.mpg.de.


Max Planck Institute for Human Cognitive and Brain Sciences Stephanstraße 1A, 04103 Leipzig

item.title: Creative Mobile Developer at Demodern Digital Agency (Cologne, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a friendly, creative native digital to enrich our team in
the area of mobile app development. You‘ll be in charge of frontend development of mobile projects,
technical research and conception, but foremost pushing forward interaction and mobile technologies –
together with a very skilled and passionate team of designers and developers.
You‘ll have the chance to bring in your own ideas and not only develop mobile apps, but interactive
experiences of all sorts and integrate into an international team, who all share the same goal, creating
the best possible experience. Besides mobile apps, you have the chance to work on AR and VR experiences, IoT setups, WebGL configurators and more - if you so wish.
Please contact us by email at jobs@demodern.de and include some work samples testifying to your
abilities and your résumé.



Skills & experience

item.title: Senior Data Scientist working with cutting edge research into online behaviour at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Data Scientist


We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our Research team, to help us develop intelligent products around this data, and conduct cutting-edge research into consumer behaviour on the web.


This is a great opportunity to conduct real R&D around human behaviour. Our data collection tools store more than 1 billion data points every day. Overall, Qubit technology tracks consumer journeys leading to billions of pounds of online spending worldwide every year, for some of the largest names in online retail.


We’re looking for someone smart and motivated, with experience solving real data analysis problems with statistical and machine learning techniques. As part of our research team you’ll help to understand our ever growing dataset, working closely with other parts of the business to ensure our products are ahead of the competition.


Key Responsibilities



  • Joining a team of Data Scientists at a fast growing company with plenty of opportunities to have a big impact

  • Conducting pure research and developing that research into real products used by some of the top names in online retail

  • Building statistical models and applying machine learning/artificial intelligence techniques to understand consumer behaviour online

  • Working with a mixed set of technologies and experimenting with new ones

  • Exploring how state-of-the-art machine learning methods can be applied to real-life problems at Google-scale


Personal Characteristics


We’re open to applicants from any background. Our main requirement is that you’re smart, motivated, and able to do the job. We don’t mind what specific technologies you’ve worked with in the past, although, having some previous experience with production-quality Python will help you add value quicker. We’re looking for someone who adds to our team and complements the skills we already have. That said, in order to meet these requirements, you will probably have:



  • At least one of:


    • A PhD with a large data-analysis and statistics component (e.g. Machine Learning, Computer Vision, High Energy Physics, Genetics etc…)

    • A MSc in Applied Statistics, Machine Learning or similar

    • Commercial data science experience

    • Experience deploying machine learning models in a production environment


  • At least two of:


    • Experience conducting data analysis on big data (e.g. TB+ scale datasets)

    • Experience applying statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to extract insights from real data

    • Strong technical skills, e.g. software development, practical data analysis


  • Ability to clearly communicate complex research findings with non-technical team members and clients

  • An interest in human behaviour


Plenty of perks


As well as the opportunity to work with leading clients and a world-class team, you'll get:



  • Realistic performance-related bonuses

  • Equity options

  • Private health and dental insurance

  • Twice weekly supermarket shop so that you can have healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks

  • Yoga and meditation classes

  • Subsidised gym membership

  • Fortnightly company socials

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development


Location: HQ is in London, other offices New York, San Francisco, LA, Paris and Hamburg


About Qubit.


Qubit is the leader in highly persuasive personalization at scale.


Leading ecommerce companies work with Qubit to transform the way they understand and influence their customers in order to increase revenue, build loyalty and improve marketing efficiency.


By combining rich customer data, deep learning technology and advanced segmentation capabilities, the Qubit Customer Influence Engine can precisely match customers with the widest range of personal, online experiences to influence behavior at scale.


Qubit is trusted to deliver real impact to the bottom line for the biggest brands in eCommerce including Ubisoft, CafePress, Topshop, Shiseido, and Emirates. Across the global Qubit customer base, $600 million worth of online sales are influenced over a typical week.


To date, we have received over $76 million in funding from Goldman Sachs, Accel, Sapphire Ventures, Balderton Capital and Salesforce Ventures.


www.qubit.com


Qubit is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing its employees with a work environment that is both challenging and rewarding. For additional information, please visit our website at www.qubit.com

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Cambridge Consultants creates exciting and novel breakthroughs in technology and products. We help our clients achieve the kind of game-changing leap forward that will transform their whole business.


At the heart of what we do are talented and motivated software teams empowered to create cutting edge technologies and systems to solve difficult problems for our clients.


Examples of our work


The breadth of what we’ve achieved is such that our work has touched most people’s lives in one way or another, from the best-before date printed on the eggs that made your omelette to the Bluetooth chip that lets your phone connect with your car.


Here are just five of the many breakthroughs powered by the software developed at Cambridge Consultants.



  • Robot Communications


Our breakthrough in 4G radio design enabled online retailer Ocado to create the most advanced automated warehouses in the world.



  • Satellite Communications


Our world first with Iridium Communications lets rescue workers in remote locations keep in touch using the latest satellite phone technology.



  • Wireless Pacemaker


We helped develop the world’s first wireless powered pacemaker, transferring energy to a leadless electrode using ultrasonic pulses.



  • Smart Insulin Pen


Our battery-less smart insulin pen and integrated tracker app won an internationally renowned Red Dot Design Award.



  • Aircraft Radio


The last time you flew anywhere, chances are your pilot was relying on the market-leading ground-to-air radio we developed for Northrop Grumman.


You will . . .



  • Design and implement software for custom embedded platforms

  • Participate in system architecture design

  • Lead and participate in design reviews and code reviews

  • Work with clients to define requirements

  • Design and develop world firsts

  • See your amazing ideas come to life

  • Grow your own skills and responsibilities

  • Choose the technologies you work with

  • Proactive mentoring and training

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Undo (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We've grown sufficiently and require Senior DevOps Engineers to help us on the next stage of our journey.


As an Undo Senior DevOps Engineer, you'll take the lead in our infrastructure development and deployment projects, developing and enhancing our software development infrastructure, processes and practices in order to:



  • Reduce build and test cycle time

  • Improve developer productivity

  • Enhance scalability as the team grows

  • Enable quicker resolution of customer issues


Some of your day-to-day tasks will include:



  • Mapping out the development and release processes

  • Making recommendations, deploying and handling change management of new infrastructure tooling

  • Standardising processes

  • Process improvement

  • Tool implementation

  • Provide change management and project leadership

  • Take ownership of software development processes


Undo developers have the freedom to decide their own processes, and individual developers can pick the development environment that works for them. We trust our employees to do their best to do the right thing.  We grow teams that have the freedom to make their own decisions so individual developers are empowered to choose the work they’d like to do within the team’s committed goals.


In return, we ask that you do your best to understand our users’ needs, deliver releases or fixes within the timeframes agreed within your team, take ownership of specific tasks, occasionally provide customer training, and be flexible when company priorities change.


Expect to participate in open discussions, to challenge and be challenged with arguments based on reason, and to compromise occasionally in order to achieve team consensus. Trust, honesty and respect for others is essential. Enthusiasm and drive are highly valued.


What makes you an Undo Senior DevOps Engineer?



  • At least 3 yrs’ commercial experience in an agile team

  • B.Sc. 2.1 or 1st or equivalent in Computer Science or other similar subject

  • You thrive in a highly collaborative team of engineers

  • You enjoy being part of an empowered development team and make decisions independently where appropriate

  • You are enthusiastic about engaging with customers as necessary to create a great product / service

  • You look to continuously improve your expertise, knowledge or skills


Technical Skills:



  • Experience supporting configuration management (e.g. Git)

  • Experience in the setup and maintenance of continuous build and test management tools

  • Knowledge of virtualisation

  • Work with the team to apply best practice to an existing development process

  • Able to develop and articulate a vision

  • Experience of programming in a CI workflow

  • Knowledge of a number of  Automation & Configuration tools including some of Jenkins, TeamCity, InfraBox, Docker, Chef, Puppet.

  • Linux

  • Python

  • Some C/C++


If you would like to apply for this role, please send us your covering letter and CV.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Do you enjoy writing tools for others to use? Is automating processes your thing?  Does the idea of figuring out how to test new infrastructure programmatically excite you?  Do you like evangelizing good practices and spreading knowledge? If so, JW Player's DevOps Engineer role may be exactly what you're looking for. 



As part of the DevOps team, you will:



  • Create and maintain services to provide Developers with infrastructure.

  • Automate configuration and templating of AWS infrastructure created by our services

  • Create services which interact with third-party tools to provide Developers with the tools they need

  • Measure and maintain reliability through instrumentation and monitoring of our systems and the underlying infrastructure

  • Work to improve our processes and systems iteratively.

  • Be part of a production support on-call schedule (Roughly six weeks between rotations)

  • Work as part of an Agile Team, in two-week sprints.



Experience We're Looking for:



  • 3+ years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or Python Developer

  • 2+ years of experience with AWS

  • 2+ years using configuration/provisioning management systems (Salt, Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, etc.)

  • 1+ years of experience with large-scale web systems

  • BS in computer related field or 3+ years comparable job experience



Technology Familiarity We're Looking For:



  • Python Development

  • Docker Configuration

  • Container Orchestration (Kubernetes, Mesos, etc.)

  • Elastic Stack Product Administration

  • Configuration Management (Salt, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform)

  • Database Administration (Postgresql, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)

  • Continuous Delivery/Continuous Deployment pipelines

  • Jenkins Administration

  • Monitoring systems (Datadog, Nagios, Zabbix, etc.)

  • Scripting Experience (Bash, Python, Perl, Ruby, etc.)

  • LDAP Administration

  • ChatOps Development

  • End to End Python Testing

item.title: Software Systems / DevOps Engineer at Sophos (Abingdon, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced software systems (DevOps) engineer to join our Agile development team, which provides build, quality and release tooling across a department of around 100 software engineers and testers; supporting continuous integration builds, virtualised test environments and internal systems.


In this role you will be able to show your passion for enabling others, formulating best practice workflows and building systems to make the software development process easier and more effective. You will be able to show your flexibility to work on a wide range of systems and technologies, interacting with the immediate team and other teams doing both Dev and Ops work.



What we can offer in return




  • A supportive environment within a strong team with training provided as needed

  • Access to the latest systems and software tools

  • A range of different areas to work on

  • The opportunity to contribute to long term planning, technology and tooling choices

  • An open plan office with a friendly company atmosphere

  • Perks such as a subsidised canteen, free tea / coffee / biscuits / pastries / fruit

  • Large company stability and career progression options



Main Duties




  • Write code, create tooling, build and configure systems to deliver against project goals

  • Monitor and maintain existing systems

  • Research new technologies and tools, assist driving plans to gain adoption

  • Contribute to Agile stand-ups, collaborative estimation, planning and retrospective meetings

  • Share knowledge and document as you go

  • Other duties and responsibilities as directed



Experience and Skills



Essential



  • Technical problem solving

  • Good communicator, able to work with different audiences and influence across teams

  • Ability to investigate new technology and contribute to creation of adoption plans

  • Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery processes and tooling

  • Experience with Configuration Management methodologies and tooling

  • Experience with development of back-end systems and infrastructure



Desirable



  • Knowledge of Python, PowerShell or other scripting languages

  • Familiarity with CI tooling such as Bamboo, Jenkins

  • Familiarity with CM tooling such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible

  • Familiarity with VCS such as Git/Stash/Bitbucket, Perforce

  • OO software development in high level language such as C++, Java, C#

  • Knowledge of networks and virtualisation technologies

  • Familiarity with test automation frameworks and testing best practices

  • Database configuration and implementation, SQL, NoSQL

  • Experience of developing using Web technologies, AWS or Azure

  • Administrative knowledge of Windows or Linux, Domain management

  • Experience of code signing

  • Familiarity with Security models and enforcing them





NOTICE TO RECRUITERS & PLACEMENT AGENCIES
If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Sophos prior to having a signed agreement from Human Resources. Sophos is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Sophos and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention. Thank you.

item.title: Big Data Engineer (m/w) at REWE Digital GmbH (Köln, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das gibt es bei uns zu tun:



  • Entwicklung von end- to end Big Data Lösungen entlang der Wertschöpfungskette der REWE Group unter Einsatz einschlägiger Technologien (Hadoop, Spark, etc.)

  • Analyse und Verarbeitung großer Mengen strukturierter und unstrukturierter Daten

  • Entwurf und Implementierung von Datenmodellen, Datenflüssen sowie APIs zur Ermöglichung einer performanten Nutzung großer Datenmengen

  • Kontinuierliche Sicherstellung und Verbesserung der Datenqualität

  • Operationalisierung von Data Science Modellen für den produktiven Einsatz

  • Partizipation bei der Technologie Auswahl

  • Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten in selbstorganisierten, agilen cross- funktionalen Teams mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und enger Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen

  • Intensiver Wissensaustausch und vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten der persönlichen, methodischen und technischen Exzellenz

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP (London, UK)
item.description:
Technology is at the heart of YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP and the driving force behind its success as the world’s leading online luxury retailer. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will work with a number of different teams and stakeholders to understand and deliver to their technical needs.  We’re using DevOps methodologies to deliver enterprise solutions.


The role:


The Infrastructure team within Global eCommerce Operations is recruiting for a Senior DevOps Engineer to help drive the use of DevOps methodologies whilst delivering enterprise solutions. Reporting to the Infrastructure Tech Lead, the successful candidate will be involved in the ongoing delivery of VMWare based IaaS solution to business facing delivery teams, as well as the other teams within eComm Ops. The team is responsible for maintaining existing virtual infrastructure (Openstack, Xen) and related tooling (Puppet, Foreman, Pulp, BIND).


Our environment is highly collaborative and will involve you working with a number of teams across different locations. We like to knowledge share which can involve VCs, global travel or just a really long conversation on Slack.  We also want our people to grow so whether you are a mentor or mentee, you’ll get help and support from our teams as well as formal training.


What you'll do:



  • Design, provision and maintain the virtual infrastructure platform

  • Work closely with DCOps and Network teams to deliver end to end infrastructure solutions

  • Work closely with teams to understand their infrastructure needs

  • Define and implement monitoring, support solutions and automated provisioning solutions for infrastructure and tooling

  • Research new technologies and assess suitability to be incorporated into YNAP systems

  • Provide 3rd line production support for YNAP systems and environments


About you


We work in an agile environment with CI&CD principals so experience working in this is ideal, and additionally the below:



  • Strong experience in Infrastructure and virtualization technologies (VMWare, Openstack, Xen)

  • Excellent understanding of networking infrastructure (Subnets, Firewalls, Routing, Proxies, DNS)

  • Excellent knowledge of modern Configuration Management tools (Puppet, Ansible)

  • Strong experience in infrastructure provisioning tools (Foreman, Terraform, Packer)

  • Strong background in Linux systems, scripting (Bash, Python, Ruby) and version control software (Git)


What we offer:


We have interesting large scale problems that we’re trying to solve and you get to work, and learn, from some of the best in industry. People are at the centre of our technology team so we’re keen to offer support and training as well as a competitive salary and bonus.  We host regular meetups and events to learn from other industry experts and go to, and sometimes speak at, conferences.  There’s the opportunity to travel, although it’s not compulsory, and we work in a really cool space; on top of this, we have all the usual benefits of working with the world’s leading eCommerce company, including a generous staff discount.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Build, deploy and maintain our critical architecture at FanDuel (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for passionate technologists, strong communicators and those with a commitment to continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will have the confidence to propose pragmatic solutions to complex problems and be eager to learn from and educate others. 


What you’ll do



  • Push changes to production within the first week.

  • Build, deploy and maintain the architecture that’s critical to FanDuel’s success.

  • Learn from others, and be a coach and mentor to other engineers, irrespective of experience.

  • Guide continuous deployment as an active member of the development team.

  • Write software that enables our engineering team to push changes to development, performance testing, and production environments dozens of times a day.

  • Explore a multitude of technology to solve complex problems.

  • Work in collaboration with development work-streams to provide operational consultancy on behalf of the infrastructure team.

  • Reflect our values in day-to-day working.


 Characteristics of successful candidates



  • Flexible in learning and working with new technologies.

  • Enjoy solving challenging problems with highly trafficked architecture.

  • Linux systems administration, including python or ruby scripting experience.

  • Configuration management experience, preferably puppet or chef.

  • Technical experience in managing a highly available and highly scalable cloud environment, preferably AWS.

  • Strong communication skills.

  • Strong desire to automate.


Bonus points for



  • CI / CD expertise.

  • Technical experience in managing a highly available cloud environment, preferably AWS

  • Experience with distributed systems

  • Hands on knowledge of container orchestration

  • Experience of building scalable, concurrent, high-availability systems

item.title: Make a change - develop software at PSI at PSI Software AG (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
PSI Metals is continuously looking for talented professionals to strengthen its team: whether experienced in the industry or recent graduates. For its Düsseldorf office, PSI Metals is looking to welcome Software Developers on board its Competence Center Planning team to develop the world leading standard application for production planning and scheduling in the metals industry.


Function


The Software Developer is responsible for the development of the standard application of PSImetals Planning. This application is the world leading production planning and scheduling solution for the metals industry with references all over the world and functions ranging from sales and operation planning, master planning, and detailed scheduling as well as complex cutting and assignment optimization engines. Besides the development of the standard product, the Software Developer will be integrated into project teams to support the achievement of successful projects.


Activities


The Software developer will give support to current activities of PSI Metals according to the actual needs.

In particular:



  • Development of the standard application PSImetals Planning

  • Development of new functionalities to enrich the product

  • Go from project requirements to standard features developments as much as possible

  • Integration of the PSImetals Planning with other applications of PSI Metals

  • Improvement of usability and user experience

  • R&D to develop the next generation of our standard software

  • Support project execution with

  • Understanding the customer’s requirement

  • Developing  required functionalities

  • Creating and performing test cases

  • Supporting system integration if required (pre-processing, post processing)

  • Designing and implementation of optimization models



The activities have to be performed either at PSI Metals office or at PSI Metals customer facilities.


Job Requirements


We are looking for experienced developers as well as recent graduates that are motivated to be part of the development of a standard product pioneer in its field. Typical study disciplines will be civil engineering, machine learning, data science, Information Technology, applied mathematics, mathematics, physics…

In addition to technical skills, qualified candidates will demonstrate strong social skills, proactivity, and independence in their tasks. Knowledge or experience in the metals industry will definitely stand out from the rest.

Our software development is performed primarily in C++, Java, as well as database applications in Oracle using PL/SQL. Python is also commonly used. Experience in these programming languages is an asset.

Knowledge in Operation Research, Optimization techniques and optimization engines are highly appreciated.

The Software Developer will travel on a moderate basis to our customer sites. The communication language is predominantly English while any other languages are an asset.


Best Career Prospective


We offer many development tracks for our employees in the entire product lifecycle of standard software development as well as consulting and project management of large, complex IT projects within the metals industry.

By joining PSI Metals, you are joining a dynamic team working in an international environment. You will be faced with many interesting challenges while working in a stimulating atmosphere.



Candidates with a handicap will be reviewed equally and preferably employed.

Find out more about the company at www.psi.de/en/psi-career/stellenangebote/.

item.title: Senior Performance Analyst wanted in Capacity Management team! at Sabre Polska (Kraków, Poland)

You will have a chance to work with tools like BMC True Sight Capacity Optimization and statistical tools.

item.title: Software Engineer - Backend at Fetchr (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


We are seeking a Software Engineer who will:



  • Participate in all aspects of developing and designing new and innovative applications.

  • Work on cutting edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing.


This is a great opportunity for an engineer, who is excited about coding, search, data analysis and solving complex problems and who enjoys building highly scalable and performant distributed systems leveraging cloud computing platforms.



Responsibilities include:



  • Designing and developing software and algorithms to solve business problems and challenges while ensuring scalability, reliability, performance and security.

  • Work in cross functional feature teams and own modules end to end from inception through test to delivery.

item.title: Secure Server Developer at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Working with C# on Windows or Linux (Mono) you will work on secure systems for UK government. With knowledge of C#, Python and Web technologies you will develop and deploy systems with connectivity to embedded devices and employing analytics algorithms. As part of our ICE division there will also be the opportunity to work with other industries : Industrial (including Robotics), Consumer and Energy.


Main purpose of the job


An opportunity to get involved in server side technologies for our secure systems work. Working with system leads you will take responsibility for defining and implementing significant areas of code and interfaces, working with CI systems to implement tests in Python alongside writing server side code, building, assembling and shipping operational containerised systems, infrastructure configuration, and devops for existing systems.


Type of work undertaken by division/group


You will be a member of the Software Group, which offers application layer software engineering and computer science skills, from real time and embedded software for standalone or connected devices, through to server side analytics frameworks, including system design, algorithm optimisation, and digital security and authentication. The group designs groundbreaking products for clients at the heart of the ‘internet of things’.


We take pride in the commercial success that our clients enjoy as a result of working with us. There will be the opportunity to further your career not just technically, but also in the fields of business development, programme management, and innovation – essential ingredients in delivering commercial value.


Specific responsibilities


In this role you will be responsible for :



  • Design and Implementation of server side components on Windows or Linux systems, writing in C#, and Python

  • Infrastructure design and configuration e.g. networking

  • Working with a test engineer to define CI tests

  • Integrating/Porting algorithms on server side systems

  • Delivering high quality, professional code, compliant with the client’s requirements

  • Executing project tasks to tight deadlines and rigorous quality standards within the timescales and budgets agreed with the project manager

  • Participating in meetings with clients, potentially including travel to US, Europe and/or Asia for meetings or workshops


Minimum requirements



  • An excellent degree or PhD in Computer Science or a related discipline

  • TCP/IP networking/routing knowledge

  • Experience deploying VM / Container technologies

  • Experience of a messaging technology e.g. RabbitMQ/ZeroMQ

  • Experience of production quality software implementation

  • Experience of deploying on cloud systems e.g. AWS, Azure

  • An imaginative and inquisitive mind, eager to learn new skills and develop solutions for complex problems

  • Strong communication skills. Ability to explain and defend design and code, and present complex technical issues clearly to clients and internal teams

  • Experience working with other disciplines (e.g. RF, server, design teams)


This role will be subject to Security Clearance Vetting procedures


Any of the following experience would be advantageous :



  • Designing protocols for communication between server and low power embedded devices, over TCP/IP or custom transport layers

  • Experience implementing algorithms on server systems

  • Data system design and implementation

  • Knowledge of wireless protocols (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, LORA, implementation of custom protocols)

  • Digital Security experience (encryption/authentication schemes)

  • Working to regulatory standards such as MISRA, ISO13485

  • Blockchain implementation experience

item.title: Build Engineer at Jagex Games Studio (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Jagex Games Studio is looking for a Build Engineer to join the tribe. Your primary duties will be to support, maintain and advance the Jagex build and release infrastructure.


You will have full ownership of the Jagex build and release systems. You will work with development teams to implement new build pipelines, and support existing pipelines.


You will advise development teams on best build and release practices.


 You will work closely with the IT Ops team in support of the wider Jagex Development Infrastructure (code/asset repositories, development environments, etc.)


 In return you’ll receive a competitive salary, options for a sponsored gym membership, private health care, flexible working, cycle repair, free parking and fresh fruit delivered to your team every day.
We also have a full bean style coffee machine that provides hot drinks available throughout the day.


 Expect to be invited to team events once a quarter as well as company-wide parties to celebrate our successes.


 The successful applicant will be able to enjoy our newly refurbished office which includes contemporary break out areas, gaming zones, high tech meeting rooms, a huge Atrium with tiered seating and our very own private bar!



Main Duties and Responsibilities:
• To maintain a concise log of all work done, and to aspire to own each piece of work through to completion.
• To only undertake to do work that is within your professional competence.
• To document, formalise and automate work processes, particularly where those processes differ from standard industry practice.
• To aspire at all times to industry best practice, except where deviation is absolutely necessary.
• To version control configuration changes (where possible), configure appropriate backup schedules for business data assets, and automate monitoring routines so that system failures are immediately and clearly visible
• To take responsibility for assigned technical projects – develop appropriate process, and ensure successful delivery
• To keep up to date with industry best practice, and to help steer the Jagex development teams towards best practices


Essential Requirements:


• Experience with Bamboo, TeamCity or similar build systems – at some scale
• Experience with Sonar, FXCop, or similar code coverage tools
• Experience with Sonatype Nexus, or a similar artifact storage system
• Experience with Maven, Gradle, or similar build management tools
• Solid understanding of Linux, OSX and Windows Operating Systems
• Strong understanding of git, and Perforce Helix
• Experience in a range of programming languages (Java, C#, C++)
• Experience in a minimum of one scripting language (Python, Bash, Perl or Ruby)
• Excellent Communication and Team-working Skills 
• Organised, ability to perform under pressure


 Desired Requirements:
• Game industry experience


 Corporate Responsibilities:
•To behave at all times in a professional manner, maintaining a positive and conscientious work ethic whilst also demonstrating initiative and determination to get the job done.
•To work effectively with colleagues both within the immediate team and across the company whenever necessary.
•To demonstrate a willingness to adapt to the evolving environment of the company, teams and work requirements.
•Drive to learn, grown and improve their current skill set and that of the function. Maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies

item.title: DevOps Engineer (m/w) für Publishing Systeme at SWMH Service GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
