item.title: Desktop Applications Developer at Kano Computing (London, UK)
item.description:
The Job


The Core Kit is Kano’s premium software and hardware experience which empowers users to assemble their own computer from scratch and take control of its internals via the software; it is a computer that you make yourself! As a member of the team devoted to delivering on this promise you will help sculpt a complete Linux distribution all the way from the applications which are run on the system to the way we manage the services required for the system to operate effectively.


Your primary focus will be delivering intuitive user-facing applications which aim to make things as simple as possible while still allowing their creativity to shine through but you will have opportunities to work on integrations with our line of cutting-edge IoT devices, optimise our system services and write device drivers for the hardware that we ship with the kit.


Our OS runs on the Raspberry Pi and is based on Raspbian (in turn based on Debian Linux) and on top of this we add a bunch of applications written in a blend of Python, C, C++, Lua and JS using frameworks such as Qt5, Löve2D, Gtk and a plethora of web technologies.


This role offers the opportunity to impact the 100,000+ users who are already using the Core Kit to discover the world of technology and to influence the direction of the product as we move to 1 million users.


Technical Requirements



  • Solid knowledge of at least one application development language (C/C++ and Python preferred)

  • Experience developing user-facing desktop applications

  • Comfortable developing for a Linux environment

  • Good grasp of testing methodologies

  • Understanding of how to optimise applications for speed


Nice To Have



  • Experience with GUI frameworks, particularly Qt5

  • Used a build system like Jenkins

  • Experience developing for the Raspberry Pi

  • Knowledge of agile methodologies, particularly SCRUM

  • Experience developing games

  • Passion for developing fun and educational experiences

  • Experience testing software on hardware devices

  • Solid understanding of SystemD

  • Understanding of Debian packaging system

item.title: Data Applications Engineer - AGODA - Real Time Microservices at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen.

Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build data applications across our business domains.

Why data application in Agoda?

In Agoda we adopt a data-centric approach to solve almost all business problems. We build real-time data applications to answer questions like ranking, recommendation, and how to serve prices most efficiently. Our systems scale across multiple data centres, handling a few hundred thousand requests per second, and respond within a few milliseconds. We also build machine learning jobs to do the heavy crunching.

This is a unique combination of hard-core engineering challenges (scalability, performance, sometimes really low-level tuning) and latest big data technology. This is also the best place to gain exposure to various business domains in the company.



Day to day
  • You'll work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify business opportunities, design and create new data system from scratch, all the way to deploying software
  • Improve scalability, stability, speed of existing applications
  • Debug and fix production problems
  • Collaborate with other team
  • Research new technologies and share across organisations




About you
  • 3+ years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company
  • Experience with at least following languages: Scala, Java, Python, or any functional/OO languages. We code primarily in Scala.
  • Experience building API products (knows protocols/formats/best practices)
  • Experience working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies.




Nice to have
  • Experience building large-scale API products
  • Experience working with big data technologies (eg. Spark, Hadoop)
  • Passionate about functional programming




A few of the technologies we use

Scala, Spark, Akka, Spray, Python, Hadoop, Yarn, MLlib,ElasticSearch, Logstash, Vertica, Grafana.



We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Linux at Sophos (Abingdon, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced software engineer to join our Linux / UNIX team, which develops new features for our cloud and on premise managed security software. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on Linux / UNIX application development including low-level kernel development on Linux and be an instrumental part of developing and delivering a new line of security products. You will work in an agile team that is responsible for both maintaining existing products and developing brand new ones.



Main Duties



  • Participate in the design of products in line with asset technical strategy, quality and functionality requirements 

  • Actively contribute to release planning and drive for high-value and high-quality solutions which meet business needs

  • Write product code along with test automation to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements

  • Effectively contribute during pair programming to deliver tasks as required by the agile team

  • Contribute to daily stand-ups, kick-offs, collaborative estimation and retrospective meetings;

  • Participate in security reviews of new developments to ensure that released products comply with Sophos’ security requirements and industry best practice;

  • Other duties and responsibilities as directed.


Experience and Skills


Essential:



  • Design of complex, high performance software on Linux

  • Strong C++ and good debugging/analysis skills

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communicator with different types of audience

  • Ability to learn new skills quickly and apply them to the role

  • Coaching and mentoring in an agile team

  • Working knowledge of Python and Bash

  • BSc in Computing or other numerate discipline, or equivalent experience.



Desirable:


Knowledge of:



  • Linux kernel development

  • Docker (and related management / orchestration tools), 

  • Django

  • AWS

  • Experience with UNIX (Solaris, HP, AIX)

  • Experience with automated regression testing


Benefits


The remuneration package includes:



  • Annual holiday entitlement of 25 days

  • Group personal pension scheme

  • Private medical insurance

  • Critical illness insurance

  • Death in service policy (life assurance)

  • Permanent health insurance

  • Travel insurance

  • Personal accident cover


Working conditions at Sophos are very good and include:



  • Subsidised staff restaurant

  • Free beverages, fruit and pastries




NOTICE TO RECRUITERS & PLACEMENT AGENCIES
If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Sophos prior to having a signed agreement from Human Resources. Sophos is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Sophos and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention. Thank you.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at EE (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Principal Software Engineer - (AWS Cloud)

London/Leeds



The job:

We're showing the UK how technology can make the everyday better. Our people are keeping our customers happy with great service, and our network, which has been named as the best in the UK, is keeping their digital lives connected. Empowered, challenged, supported and rewarded, our people are the key to our success. And the Sunday Times agrees. They've voted EE one of the Best Big Companies to Work For. This is your chance to join us.

Demanding an entrepreneurial approach to new technology, you will support the evolution of the existing cloud based infrastructure service to better utilise off-the-shelf services and tooling. Your knowledge of cloud based services will provide you with the relevant experience to deliver innovative solutions designs that will drive forward improvements in the automated configuration and deployment of the infrastructure.

As well as supporting the technical evolution and design of the infrastructure, working within an agile development team you will provide hands-on development capabilities to deliver the technical evolution. The opportunity to deliver significant service improvement projects and the selection of new technologies and approaches to cloud infrastructure design and automation will develop your technical knowledge, skills and authority. If you thrive on innovation and technical change within the digital space, this is the role for you.



What you will do:
  • Provide technical expertise and leadership to design and deliver a cloud based infrastructure service
  • Develop in-house tooling based on Linux, scripted primarily in Python and Bash, to work with the Amazon AWS API and state-of-the-art configuration management tooling
  • Provide a reliable and respected voice for the cloud based infrastructure supporting several business critical web applications
  • Engage with solutions architects and application technical leads in the delivery of key systems and projects
  • Build relationships and collaborate effectively with product owners, application development teams, technical architects, support teams and external suppliers
  • Provide consultancy and guidance to Digital colleagues on infrastructure and web related issues


You will definitely:
  • Have good experience of software design
  • Have experience with cloud based infrastructure solutions in Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Experience of working within an Agile team
  • Have experience of system administration, automation of system configuration, and debugging in a complex multi-nodal environment
  • Experience with build servers and build pipelines with tools such as Jenkins
  • Be comfortable with writing Python and Bash
  • A good understanding of Linux
  • Be comfortable with basic networking & network design (particularly in AWS).
  • Have experience with Puppet (significant experience is a bonus)
  • Have used Git version control, preferably in a larger team
  • Have familiarity of monitoring and logging solutions in the cloud
  • Have an appetite for debugging demanding applications
  • Be able to juggle conflicting demands on your time and resources
  • Demonstrate good communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Be able to work as part of a team in either our London or Leeds based office

item.title: Data Scientist (m/f) at relayr GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
Have you dreamed of building the future? relayr has become Europe's leading platform for the Internet of Things, enabling the interaction between diverse systems, and creating new scenarios in which we interact with the world around us. If you would like to work with a great team and technology to build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices...



Then relayr is the right place for you!



We have a cloud interoperability problem supported by a diverse mix of SDKs and APIs for both IoT hardware and Applications that want to access the data. We also have Gateway software which allows us to create a very dispersed (fog) architecture. We have a strong industrial customer base both in Germany and America, and a mission to invent and create new IoT based solutions.
We are looking to recruit a diverse group to be able to best handle the diverse problems in the emerging market of Internet of Things. Currently we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team and be based in our Munich office.


Your tasks: 



  • Help Relayr build the world’s most advanced IoT Cloud Platform

  • Design, prototype and collaborate with the backend team in implementing large scale data processing systems for the cloud and edge

  • Develop and assist in developing internal data exploration tools

  • Design, prototype and refine machine learning algorithms

  • Data mining using state of the art methods

  • Performing ad-hoc data analysis and presenting results

  • Prototype and iterate quickly

  • Engage in architectural discussions 


Your skills:



  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience in the analytics field

  • Significant experience with machine learning techniques (e.g. Supervised / Unsupervised Learning)

  • Significant experience with state of the art algorithms and heuristics (e.g. Deep Learning, Weak Prediction Model Ensembles, Genetic Algorithms)

  • Good experience with Python and Java, C++ and Apache Spark are a bonus

  • Comfortable with database systems and distributed processing


We Offer:



  • Flexible office environment 

  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 10+ languages, of all ages and parental-status

  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe

  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing at our semi-weekly events

  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline

  • Competitive Salary and Stock Options

  • We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!


Sounds like you? Please apply here: https://relayr.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=78

item.title: Software Developer C/C++ (f/m) at Gotthardt Healthgroup AG (Heidelberg, Germany)
item.description:
Your tasks:



  • Conception, design and implementation of solutions for desktop software for physicians in C++ and Qt

  • Development and maintenance of automated unit- and integration-tests

  • Creation of new technologies for the development process




What are your characteristics as our new team member:



  • Competence in C/C++ and ideally in Qt/QML

  • Experience with Python or other scripting languages is advantageous

  • (Long-term) experience in implementing software projects

  • Distinctive ability to work in a team and to communicate

  • Knowledge of agile software development methods e.g. SCRUM

  • Independent, structured and analytical way of working




We offer:



  • An exciting work environment with versatile challenges and diversified projects

  • An open, team-oriented and creative atmosphere in a motivated team

  • Flat organisational structures, a lot of space for new ideas and approaches

  • Various possibilities of development and further education

  • Modern technical facilities as well as flexible work schedules




Interested? We are looking forward to your online-application!
https://jobdb.softgarden.de/jobdb/public/jobdb/JobOutput.html?jp=1297374

item.title: Data Scientist (Paid Relocation) at Vodafone Group (London, UK)
item.description:
The role of Data Scientist will be a key position within the Big Data analytics team.



We are looking for an experience Data Scientist to work closely with the Lead Data Scientist to explore local countries Big Data Analytics opportunities as well as supporting and capitalising on Central Functional Team innovation initiatives.  You will be working with key stakeholders within local country to generate hypotheses and supports the analytics modelling managers to create models that answer impactful business questions.



As Data Scientist your main responsibilities will involve:



  • Translating complex datasets into key strategy insight and powerful capabilities, to the business:

  • Participating in cutting-edge research projects in collaboration with Universities e.g. Deep Learning, Social Network Analysis

  • Support a global community of data scientists across countries and business streams

  • Identify new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across countries

  • Identify new data sources and evaluate emerging technologies for data discovery usage

  • Be recognised as an expert in Big Data Analytics, advising on the suitability of Big Data products and solutions

  • Advise the analytics modelling managers on best practice methodology for Big Data Analytics

  • Delve into data from different systems, at different timescales, and in complex formats to discover hidden relationships and useful information

  • Advise on best practice Big Data Analytics methodology and processes for analytics insight generation, technology and data



As Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:




  • Machine learning Libraries – Spark ML, scikit-learn, xgboost, Tensorflow + Keras, GraphFrames

  • Working knowledge of Big Data statistical analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Scala)

  • Experience in Big Data Analytics landscape and technology trends (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL, SQL)

  • Familiar with leading visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, D3.js)

  • Significant experience in Big Data analytics & deployment of models and algorithms into a commercial/consumer environment in order to analyse extremely large volumes of structured data

  • Ability to test hypotheses from raw data sets and draw meaningful conclusions

  • Deep and broad statistical modelling expertise in various domains

  • Good communication skills, with proven ability to work cross functional teams to translate business issues into potential analytics solutions

  • Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative fields like Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computing and Engineering

item.title: Data Applications Engineer (Big Data/Machine Learning) - AGODA at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen.

Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build data applications across our business domains.

Why data application in Agoda?

In Agoda we adopt a data-centric approach to solve almost all business problems. We build real-time data applications to answer questions like ranking, recommendation, and how to serve prices most efficiently. Our systems scale across multiple data centres, handling a few hundred thousand requests per second, and respond within a few milliseconds. We also build machine learning jobs to do the heavy crunching.

This is a unique combination of hard-core engineering challenges (scalability, performance, sometimes really low-level tuning) and latest big data technology. This is also the best place to gain exposure to various business domains in the company.



Day to day

  • Improve scalability, stability, speed of existing applications

Scala, Spark (Core, SQL, ML), Python, Hadoop, Yarn, Grafana.

item.title: Softwaretester(in) Entwicklung von 2D & 3D Radartechnik für die Industrie 4.0 at indurad GmbH (Aachen, Deutschland)

item.title: Join us as a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer at a Gartner-named industry Leader at Collibra (Brussel, Belgium)
item.description:
How you will impact Collibra:


As our Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you will help developers with all their infrastructure needs and supporting the tools in place to build a great product. You will facilitate running our software in our own cloud environment so customers can make use of our software platform.


A day in the life of a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer at Collibra 



  • Maintain the development infrastructure (AWS), such as build machines (jenkins), atlassian products, and test machines

  • Maintain and monitor the production infrastructure (AWS) where our customers use our product

  • Architect new infrastructure solutions that Collibra needs to move forward, going for open-source solutions first

  • Automate as much as possible

  • Put the security standards in place, making sure no bad guys can get to our beloved data

  • Help with infrastructure/security questions from people

  • Implement new ideas to increase the momentum in the company (slackbot, automation web platform…) The possibilities are endless.

  • You’ll also be working with the following technologies:


    • Amazon Web Services

    • Ansible

    • Apache Http Server

    • CentOS

    • Datadog

    • Docker

    • Elasticsearch

    • Jenkins

    • Jira

    • New Relic

    • PostgreSQL

    • Slack

    • Apache Tomcat

    • Git

    • Kibana

    • Logstash 



Why we need you:



  • You are a fast and agile learner who is able to adapt quickly as our technology stack increases to meet new challenges

  • You’re passionate about cloud engineering and are always on the lookout for new things to learn and apply to your work

  • You know your way around a Linux machine

  • You recognize that the real reason why automation is needed is because we are lazy by nature

  • When things don’t work, your first response is always “have you tried turning it off and on again?” (Just kidding.. or are we?)

  • You have a devops mindset- you embrace the idea that we are the enablers of the company, and it is our duty to trust our people and share our knowledge to our developers and sales people

  • You have a BA in Computer Science or a related field

  • Just graduated or graduating soon? We encourage you to apply!

item.title: Engineering Developer, Intelligence Collections at National Crime Agency (London, UK)
item.description:
Interested in joining our dynamic and diverse workforce?


The NCA is an organisation which leads the UK’s fight to cut serious and organised crime. This includes class A drugs, child exploitation, people smuggling and human trafficking, major gun crime, fraud, cyber crime, money laundering and the corruption that organised criminals use to facilitate these crimes.


We work to imprison serious criminals, and use many other tactics to disrupt crime and keep people safe. In particular, we want to ensure crime doesn’t pay and that it’s harder to commit. We also draw on innovative new approaches to prevent crimes from happening in the first place.We expect our Officers to work to the highest standards of behaviour in everything they do.


Engineering Developer, Intelligence Collections- HP1376601HG
£33,286- £40,298



To manage resources to design and develop applications and tools to a professional standard and to meet user requirements that supports the NCA LI capability. To create and maintain robust systems to process, visualise and analyse intelligence, and maintain and provide 2nd/3rd line support for these applications. Represent NCA to discuss and agree technical standards and collaborate on joint projects. Working with the latest telecommunication technologies and experimenting to exploit intelligence from all sources available.



Successful candidates will be required to travel to other NCA sites on a regular basis and expected to form part of an on-call rota.

item.title: Network Automation Engineer Lead at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone does not cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


NETWORK AUTOMATION ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We are looking for a senior-level Network Engineer with a strong focus on automation. Someone who is passionate about all aspects of networking and gets a thrill out of designing, implementing and supporting high-performance networks, whilst being always on the lookout to further increase quality, efficiency & performance with the help of automation.


You are a highly capable engineer with an appetite for accuracy, and are not afraid to go beyond the standard text-book concepts of networking. You dare to dream of how things could/should be in terms of next-generation networking & automation, and are able to articulate new/fresh ideas to your fellow colleagues. You thrive on working with your peers and cross-functional teams and are able to motivate and encourage people around you. Ability to clearly communicate - both verbally and written - technical concepts and challenges to both technical and non-technical stakeholders is a must.


The Network Engineers in the Trading Infrastructure team at IMC are responsible for designing, implementing and supporting the WAN, LANs and all low-latency connectivity to trading venues. They work closely with our Systems Engineers, FPGA Engineers, other teams and external parties to provide best in class infrastructure solutions supporting our trading business.


Primary responsibilities:



  • Improve our infrastructure in terms of quality & reliability, by automating repetitive workflows, testing complex network scenarios & by daring to challenge the established standards of the networking-industry. Python is our way to go, in a collaborative fashion.

  • Design, implement and support the European networking infrastructure. Key areas include low-latency networking, unicast and multicast routing, BGP, PIM SM, as well as things like QoS, STP, NAT, protocol tuning, etc.

  • Monitor, guard and analyze the proper functioning of our network infrastructure, not necessarily bound by standards like SNMP – Think APIs. Take adaptive, retentive and corrective measures and perform structural maintenance.

  • Accurately create and maintain documentation detailing the implemented network components, as well as relevant procedures and other documentation.

  • Responsibility for our IT security related platforms. Key areas include Palo Alto firewalls, Juniper MAG SSL gateways, VPNs, Security policies, etc.

  • Work flexible hours. We are proud of the uptime of the trading environment, so every now and then you will be working outside of regular business hours to apply critical changes. This could be from your desk, your couch at home or also inside of one of our datacenters abroad.

  • Liaise with external vendors, exchanges and providers to explore new technology & solutions, implement new innovative services or troubleshoot problems.


WHAT MAKES IT FUN?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop.  We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are implemented.

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology.  If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution as quick as we can.

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all three regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where people can have the biggest impact.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets and how exchanges work. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds.  What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.

item.title: Senior Data Science Engineer at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are seeking highly motivated data science engineers to work together with our data scientists to create various data science solutions for the rapidly growing Rakuten group, which provides 50+ services to more than 80 million users in Japan and 300 million users around the world.


Some numbers:



  • 55.9 billion USD of global gross transaction volume on our various platforms

  • 31 million search queries everyday

  • 2 transactions every second on Rakuten Travel

  • 200+ million items sold every year on our e-commerce platforms

  • 2 milions active accounts on Rakuten Securities


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and building a data science platform with selecting various big data processing tools and frameworks

  • Implementing ETL process of huge structured/unstructured data sets in various data platforms

  • Solving business or development problems by proposing and implement solution with the latest data science technologies

  • Developing and maintaining production level data science products with other data science engineers and data scientists

  • Creating insight reports or implementing visualized report system


Skills & Requirements


Minimum Qualifications:



  • 5+ years’ experience in software development, especially using Python as a programming language

  • Experience with common Linux commands and Linux scripting languages

  • Experience with Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS and Big Data querying tools, such as Tez, Hive, and Impala

  • Experience with designing and building tools based on specific requirements

  • Experience with building and maintaining data science platform

  • Experience with SQL and some of the modern relational databases

  • High communication skills


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Be able to work in a team-oriented environment

  • Be able to work autonomously in Agile Scrum processes 

  • Solid knowledge of large volumes data processing

  • Experience with Big Data ML toolkits

  • Experience with NoSQL databases, like Cassandra, MongoDB

  • Experience and knowledge in building or maintaining data science solutions

  • Familiar with data mining concepts and machine learning algorithms

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at Auth0 () (allows remote)
item.description:
Auth0 is looking for Infrastructure Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. An Infrastructure Engineer is a specialist in creating, deploying and running infrastructure and have a great knowledge of networking, the linux kernel and systems scaling.


We are looking for people that have a passion for building robust infrastructure components that others can reuse and have a track record of working with infrastructure at world scale.


Responsibilities



  • Manage our infrastructure and provide alerting for teams to detect common problems

Skills & Requirements

  • Significant scripting expertise (e.g., with Python, Node.js, Shell Script, etc.)

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

  • Working at (or with significant overlap with) Pacific Time

item.title: Engineering Lead - Price Recommendations at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Pricing & Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Our tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfill our customers demand. The Pricing and Forecasting engineering team uses cutting edge technology to forecast demand and pricing with focus on business and customer experience. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, business and customer experience teams.


If you are interested to apply quantitative research, engineering and data analytics to solve dynamic pricing challenges at Zalando, this job is right for you.


YOUR ROLE


As the Engineering Lead for Price Recommendations you are responsible for the delivery and improvement of one of the most important components in Zalando’s pricing process.



  • You lead and mentor a cross functional team of data scientists and developers and deliver in an agile way. You are responsible for the growth of your team members, optimizing the development processes, and foster a culture of engineering excellence

  • You design and implement mathematical optimization techniques for price optimizations, such as stochastic optimization, linear programming, mixed integer programming or dynamic programming.

  • You use research and technology to solve high influence business challenges.

  • You collaborate closely with product and business to provide solutions with high business impact.

  • You craft the technical vision, assess risks, manage expectations, and lead your team to outstanding results.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • You are a scholar. You are proud of your strong academic background in Operations Research, Applied mathematics or other quantitative science field.

  • You are an expert. You hold substantial industry experience in applying optimization models to solve business challenges in real world.

  • You are a coder. You have demonstrable skills in programming (Java, Python) and sound design concepts.

  • You are a Leader. You mentor employees and empower them to grow.

  • You are a people person. You are an excellent communicator, able to successfully interact with various stakeholders, such as product, data scientists, developers and business.


WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY



  • You have impact. Your contribution to our business critical forecasting products will have a broad visibility across the company and management levels.

  • You can influence. Zalando’s dynamic structures and processes give you a huge opportunity to drive ideas and influence your working environment.

  • We create career opportunities. Our tech departments are ever growing, offering various career opportunities for your future, whether you want to go up the ladder or step into a new role.

  • We support your networking. You have the opportunity to attend and speak at related conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish your work (open source commitment), we host game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • The Benefits. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


Please make sure your application is written in English. If you have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, or if you are not sure whether your qualifications and work experience is suffice, please contact your recruiter: almog.greenberg@zalando.de

item.title: Platform Operations Engineer (m/f) @ Carl Zeiss Microscopy GmbH at ZEISS Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
To strengthen our Team in Microscopy, we are seeking a


Platform Operations Engineer (m/f)


Your job


You will play a crucial role in setting up our new revolutionary online platform and actively contribute to the success of this new venture at ZEISS. In this challenging function you will be responsible to provide support for the platform users that include developers. You will ensure that the customer questions are promptly addressed by responding in a timely and accurate manner. You will handle 2nd level support questions and escalate advanced questions to appropriate personnel within the team and also within ZEISS organization. You will communicate with users via email, phone and online forum. You are expected to work with the product owner in setting up a scalable process as the platform grows. 

Take responsibility for building a revolutionary online platform and shape the future of ZEISS Microscopy!


Our requirements



  • A university degree in computer sciences, informatics, or a comparable qualification.

  • Experience with software containerization especially Docker

  • Very broad experience with several modern programming languages (C#, Java, C++, C, Python) and respective programming frameworks

  • Ability to easily grasp software dependencies of customer software and be able to communicate and guide containerization

  • Strong knowledge of software versioning concepts and strategies for software packaging and distribution (git, Gitlab, package managers)

  • Willingness to travel (< 20%)

  • Fluent English and German


What you can expect from us:


• Opportunity to collaborate and engage with customers that include some of the key opinion leaders and Nobel prize winners
• Exposure to projects in a variety of different technology environments: Microscope automation, web, mobile, front- and back-end design, cloud infrastructure, and Platform as a Service 
• A commitment to your professional growth, including subscription to eLearning and professional development resources

If you have a lot of these skills, but not all of them, please still apply. We love to teach those who are willing to learn. Please send us your application using the link at the bottom of this page, indicating your earliest possible entry date.

item.title: Threat Analyst (Rapid Detection Center) at F-Secure (Pozna, Poland)
item.description:
We are now looking for technically skilled individuals to join the Threat Analyst team in the Rapid Detection Center (RDC). The RDC is located in Poznan (Poland) and is one of the company's strategic initiatives. As a member of RDC team you will be responsible for investigations, analysis, and escalating potential incidents for deeper analysis. The job is done is shifts in order to provide 24/7 service to our customers.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Monitoring security events from multiple data sources, results analysis, and escalation for remediation. The events will originate from, various sources including but are not limited to DLP, IDS/IPS, antivirus, firewalls and system security logs.

  • Gathering additional facts necessary for troubleshooting and resolving the issues, creation action plans, implementing them and observing results

  • Developing custom security use cases for the monitoring platforms.

  • Identify systems misconfigurations and work with customers to correct them

  • Monitor external security blogs, articles, reports, as well as other security intelligence sources to aggregate the data and continuously integrate into the SIEMs

  • Building new tools and techniques which automated human-intensive tasks

  • Interacting directly with the customers and other teams within F-Secure, therefore very good English (written and spoken) is expected.



  • Knowledge of networking technology, stacks and protocols (including but not limited to network protocols, routing, switching, typical network design), typical services network flow, operating systems details, vulnerabilities and attacks

  • Basic knowledge about networking devices (routers, switches, appliances such as firewall/IDS/IPS)

  • Basic Windows / Linux operating system internals knowledge (with security focus)

  • Passion for information security

  • Very good English skills (spoken and written)

  • Good team player

  • Attention to details with emphasis on accuracy and quality with structured way of working

  • Ability to communicate technical information, often in the form of verbal and visual operational updates, situation reports and briefings.


Following qualifications are seen as a plus:



  • Penetration tester history sysadmin or netadmin background

  • Basic practical skills in at least one of high level programming language (e.g. C/C++/C#, Java) or scripting language such as Perl, Ruby, PHP, Python, Bash

  • Information security, networking technology or operating system related trainings or certificates


At F-Secure, we work hard to bring efficient solutions and services to our customers –and we work together to do so. As an F-Secure Fellow, you’ll be joining a tight knit network of 1,000 colleagues, spread over 25 offices around the world.


We offer flexibility in the workplace and a vibrant and international company culture with the best expertise and a diverse range of paths towards success and career growth.


Our work culture is goal-oriented and dynamic yet informal. You'll be working with great people who care. And of course, we offer competitive salary and extensive benefits to keep our best asset – people - happy!

item.title: Working Student or Thesis for Deep Learning at Gini GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
WORKING STUDENT OR THESIS FOR DEEP LEARNING 
MUNICH, GERMANY - ON-SITE


HOW YOUR NEW TEAM WILL CHANGE THE WORLD 
At the team ''Leap'', a tech innovation unit at Gini, we research the latest trends in Deep Learning and develop revolutionary AI solutions. You will join the innovators-force to support them with your ideas and high-quality code.


YOUR PLAYING FIELD AT GINI 



  • Your mission is to research ways of combining Computer Vision and NLP approaches for information extraction from document images

  • You will implement Deep Learning solutions for information extraction from document images

  • You will actively contribute to our Semantics and Computer Vision departments with your knowledge of latest discoveries in the field of Deep Learning

  • You will preferably write a Master Thesis based on the results of your research

  • You will be putting your excellent research skills to the best use whilst working on experiments


YOUR PROFILE 



  • You are excellent in at least one of the programming languages: Java, Scala and / or Python

  • You have a brilliant academic record in the field of Machine / Deep Learning

  • You are a risk taker who embraces chances, and love to explore new developments in the Deep Learning communities

  • You are an autonomous, self-driven individual - and others call you a perfectionist

  • You have strong interpersonal skills in German and / or English and are able to communicate technical details to non-technical people


Sounds like the right challenge for you? Get in touch with us!

item.title: Junior to Mid-level Node Developer in top-flight motorsport industry at Bspoke Global Networks (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
We work on the cutting edge of motorsport building tools for teams who expect the best. We work hard to get the job done and have a lot of fun while doing it.


We’re looking for junior to mid-level developers who see a challenge, see something they don’t know, see everything that’s in the way … and think … game on!


Working primarily with Javascript, you’ll get great training and work with a small, expert, friendly team living in the ultimate tech industry.


We value curiosity, creativity and dedication: curiosity to find new routes, creativity to improve our tools, and dedication to deliver the best quality work for our customers every time when the pressure is on.


Developers who’ve buried themselves in code, know they’re on the way, and know their next move is the game changer.


This is that move:



  • Developing and supporting software services in an optimised distributed environment, which includes cloud-based technologies

  • Supporting existing clients and our own internal teams

  • Working in a small but growing, highly skilled and dedicated team of developers, network engineers and other specialists


You’ll get significant technical and personal development opportunities, including mentoring from highly experienced and rather lovely workmates, access to high-end technology and equipment and work with unique customers who you’ve known about for years.


As you can imagine, there are opportunities to travel to and work behind the curtain at some loud international events (and some rather anonymous business parks). You’ll get to hang out in some amazing places and really understand what it means to have a great team around you.


We’d love you to have at least 1 year on-the-job experience and knowledge of Node.js and associated server-side Javascript libraries and architecture patterns



In our dreams, you’d also have on-the-job experience and knowledge of:



  • At least one other server-based programming language, particularly Python or Ruby

  • NoSQL databases

  • Linux system administration, particularly for deployment, log and resource usage analysis, etc.

  • Using Git in an active team environment

  • Team organisation and comms software, particularly Trello, Jira, Slack, etc

  • Building robust software using the Test/Behaviour Driven Development approach / mindset

  • Video/audio streaming protocols and player technologies

  • HTML, CSS and client-side Javascript

  • Deploying and supporting software

  • Documentation using software such as Confluence, Github / Bitbucket Wikis etc.

  • Web and Cloud distribution services

  • Architecture automation using tools like Ansible, Puppet, etc.

  • Java software, including build and deployment


You should be keen to gain experience building and supporting high-end production systems for some of the world’s most advanced customers.


In this kind of environment, the ability to manage your own time and workload is essential.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Scale matters. When it comes to our video platform, scale means ingesting tens of thousands of hours of video a day, and serving thousands of videos every second.


We are looking for a senior level Infrastructure Engineer to join our rapidly growing Media Engineering team at our New York City headquarters. Responsible for our media Transcoding, Delivery and Live Streaming systems, the right candidate will relish the opportunity to build, lead and mentor a continuous delivery organization.  This means designing the processes and building the APIs, infrastructure, pipelines, testing, monitoring, and all other tooling you feel is necessary to ship code frequently of the highest possible caliber.


As a member of the Media Engineering Team, you will:



  • Contribute to the architecture of a production-scale service layer

  • Build features which serve customer-driven product goals

  • Code as part of a highly technical team in a fast paced, agile environment

  • Prototype new ideas and explore new solutions to the growing list of problems the platform solves


You have the skills to be successful in this role if you have:



  • 7+ years of software development and engineering

  • Bachelor's in Science or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field; or experience equivalent

  • Proven track record of ownership of maintainable, stable and scalable software

  • Experience with microservices architecture: designing, creating, deploying, testing and monitoring

  • Experience doing test-driven development (TDD) and/or behavior-driven development (BDD)

  • Strong database design and RDBMS concepts, experience doing domain-driven design

  • Strong understanding of source control management systems

  • Strong Unix/Linux skills


It is a plus if you have:



  • Contributed to existing open-source projects as well as your own

  • Experience building scalable systems with cloud infrastructures like AWS or Google Cloud Platform

  • Experience with event-driven or message-driven architecture

  • Knowledge of video encoding, ad networks, content management platforms, and/or streaming protocols

  • Experience with web video (HTML5 and/or Flash)

  • Experience with Docker and/or Linux Containers

item.title: Senior Engineer, IT Network Services EU at Ticketmaster UK Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
The Senior Network Engineer will join a team of engineers who are responsible for maintaining the design and integrity of the Live Nation Entertainment EMEA Corporate network environment. In this role, you’ll be responsible for all aspects of our Corporate networking infrastructure, including layer 2 and layer 3 switching, routing, internet connectivity, and VPN solutions. You will ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by Monitoring, analysing and reporting on network capacity, utilization and future trending.



The IT Network Services team works closely with all IT departments across EMEA in developing technical roadmaps to continuously deliver, support and enable change to LNE’s businesses across over 17 geographical territories and all businesses within our LNE international portfolio of companies.



It’s a great time to join Live Nation Entertainment: We are shifting from traditional network based infrastructure to software defined infrastructure. As a member of our network engineering team, you will play a part in designing and architecting our next generation network for LNE.





  • Maintain a large number of network devices, each leveraging the latest advancements in networking technology.

  • Automate select network administration tasks through creation and maintenance of scripts and tools

  • Provide highest level of support to all customers both internally and externally.

  • Pro-actively look for ways to improve collaboration and understanding between the Network team and other Technical teams.

  • Provide hands-on application of Network technologies and processes to support proof-of-concept development, review of critical systems and training to other teams within the organization.

  • Ensure close liaison with business groups to ensure that new initiatives are developed with full understanding of relevant architecture / infrastructure

  • Applies strong analysis, research and problem-solving skills across a wide array of systems and situations, including those which may be unfamiliar, in order to address critical issues. 

  • Support and maintain our next generation Corporate network.

  • Deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes.

  • Participate in the rotating "on call" schedule with other members of the team. Provide third-tier support and solve complex networking issues.





WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW (or TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS)




  • Educated to degree standard or equivalent in a technical subject.

  • Obtained significant experience of Cisco solutions and Network architecture and design. Have obtained a CCNP or equivalent experience accreditation with experience of managing/designing networks for medium to large enterprises.

  • Experience with VPN/tunnelling technologies such as DMVPN, VTI, IPsec and SSL client VPN’s

  • Extensive experience with BGP, EIGRP, STP and L4-7 SLB

  • Proven experience in designing, deploying, managing and supporting network services in a large and complex environment

  • Skills in one or more programming languages preferably Python.

  • Knowledge and experience of deployment technologies such as Ansible.

  • Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft Azure cloud computing infrastructure.

  • Knowledge of Linux and experience troubleshooting the life of a packet from client to server and back (and all possible intermediate nodes along the way)

  • Proven experience with design & deployment of monitoring tools both Open Source and off the shelf product suites.

  • You will have a demonstrable ability of working at a senior level within an IT environment and across business functions and sites.

  • Drives thoughtful and pragmatic change by encouraging innovative thinking and continuous improvement.  Models adaptability by responding resourcefully, flexibly, and positively when faced with new challenges and demands.



YOU (BEHAVIOURAL REQUIREMENTS AND LINK TO TICKETMASTER PRINCIPLES) 




  • Able to get one’s message clearly understood by adopting a range of styles, tools and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information conveyed

  • Works well under pressure

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • Ability to keep abreast of new products, technologies and Dev releases.  Produces thorough and useful documentation for working procedures on the team and how to guides that can be issued to client base

  • Encourages team unity through sharing information or expertise, working together to solve problems, and putting team success first

  • Does not make excuses for errors or problems; acknowledges and corrects mistakes.

  • Flexible; responsive to changing situations

  • Ability to multi-task and prioritise deadlines is a must

  • Sees opportunities for creative problem solving while staying within the parameters of good practice. Generates unique but workable and useful solutions to difficult problems

  • Listens to, understands & interprets information/instructions correctly and checks for understanding

  • Obtains and shares information, ideas, and problems. Solicits advice, support, championship, sponsorship, and commitment that result in smooth transitions of change and the development of mutually acceptable solutions

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Real Time Ad Targeting at LoopMe (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Data Scientist


A full time Senior Data Scientist position for an exceptional candidate who has a keen interest in multivariate modelling, machine learning and decision automation. You will be working in the highly exciting area of real-time ad targeting.


This is a rare opportunity to be involved in creating an automated system to optimize hundreds of real-time interactions per second with online customers, and to quantify the benefits created against control groups in a live environment.


The work involves analyzing billions of records of ad-serving opportunities, ad-serves and ad-serve responses to understand what factors explain the variance in expected response value.  That understanding is then to be harnessed as an automated optimization process capable of intelligently finding and servicing the most favorable ad-serving opportunities in a way that leads to higher returns on our clients’ advertising investments.  Guidance is available from a senior analytical party who will support the work.


This is also an opportunity to become part of the UK tech start-up world and get first-hand experience into how tech start-ups operate.


Key Responsibilities:


You will work in a team of the highest calibre developers, machine-learning experts and data scientists to solve tough (but never dull) problems, such as:



  • Analysis of new data streams for inclusion in our real-time ad targeting engine

  • Prototyping real-time machine learning algorithms using cutting edge research

  • Developing applications to visualise and manipulate huge amounts of data

  • Scaling systems to handle many terabytes of data whilst still maintaining millisecond-level response times

  • Working to support the following steps in the analytical process with large (multi-million record) data sets:



  • Basic data cleansing and preparation

  • Variable preprocessing/transformation

  • Univariate analysis

  • Performing statistical tests

  • Covariance analysis

  • Generation of graphical output

  • Multivariate analysis and linear/non-linear regression

  • Preparation of data sets for predictive modelling

  • Robust predictive model building, validation and application

  • Automation of statistical processes


Skills & Requirements



  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a mathematical discipline such as Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics from a respected University

  • 2 plus years’ experience of R or Python

  • At least two years practical experience of univariate and multi-variate statistical analysis in R or Python with large data sets (millions of records and many tens or hundreds of independent variables)

  • Good experience of variable transformation and data preprocessing techniques to extract maximum predictive power such as binning, piecewise linear regression, non-linear function transforms, etc.

  • Excellent practical knowledge of multi-variate techniques such as: Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, Clustering, etc. and a good grasp of the strengths and weaknesses of specific approaches


Bonus Qualifications:



  • Proficient in Java/C++/C# or similar language

  • Experience of agile software development

  • For the senior role, experience of managing small teams


Education:



  • A minimum of a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a mathematical discipline such as Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics from a respected University


About you:



  • Demonstrates a high level of initiative

  • Has an enquiring mind and a disciplined scientific approach to extracting facts and understanding observed behavior

  • Is excited by the potential of analytical intelligence to realize high-value commercial outcomes and change the way that business operates

  • Consistently delivers high quality answers

  • Want to be part of a high growth startup company with global ambitions

item.title: Experienced DevOps Engineer to join one of the smartest teams in Dublin! at Zendesk (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Are you someone that is driven by a great challenge? That has a love for working with  state-of-the-art technologies? Do you have an urge to learn and develop yourself in a culture of  DevOps best practices whilst learning with the most innovative DevOps minds and experts? If you’re nodding your head, trust me, you should continue reading……


In the Dublin office we count on the support of over 200 employees from all over the world, I am Portuguese for example :-) ….. and we all work in a beautiful glass building overlooking the canal, which has some amazing views.


Now, the bad news.. To be in our DevOps family you need to be super smart..  The bar is really high! When Alberto, our courageous EMEA DevOps leader, joined 3 years ago we had a small team of 3 wide-eyed engineers which slowly grew to 12, distributed throughout Europe. Because of major growth plans we’re now looking to double the size of our team in 2017……. We want you to be the next star in Zendesk!


You will be part of a team focused on managing Zendesk's global infrastructure.  You strive to automate everything a system does and want the easiest deployments for all concerned. Want to work in a large environment? Our engineers look after over 5,500 servers with more being added every day! One of our biggest projects we’re working on right now is to migrate a large part of our architecture to AWS -  of which you will play a major part! Finally you will get the opportunity to work closely with some of the smartest developers to fine tune the performance of products such as Voice (have a sneak pick here: https://www.zendesk.com/voice) and improve on ways that we handle traffic.


Skills & Requirements


If you have strong experience with some of the following technologies you’re the person we are looking for;


- AWS


- Ubuntu/CentOS/CoreOS Linux


- Chef, Puppet, Kubernetes, Docker


- Python or Ruby


- Nginx.

item.title: Principal AEM Engineer at EE (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Principal Developer - Adobe AEM
£Competitive + benefits
London/Leeds

The job:
We're showing the UK how technology can make the everyday better. Our people are keeping our customers happy with great service, and our network, which has been named as the best in the UK, is keeping their digital lives connected. Empowered, challenged, supported and rewarded, our people are the key to our success. And the Sunday Times agrees. They've voted EE one of the Best Big Companies to Work For. This is your chance to join us.

Joining us as a Lead Developer, you'll provide our growing Digital Department with expert hands-on capability in Adobe AEM. Leading a team of Software Engineers, you'll help us evolve key systems and project proposal systems - ensuring everything we do is in line with both the Technical strategic architecture model and meets the needs of EE Digital. This will mean keeping a close eye on frameworks and methodology, as well as producing and defining development evolution plans.

What you'll do:

Identify and run design and development opportunities to make sure our customer experience targets are met
Take responsibility for our design and delivery targets
Check on the quality of all work completed - making sure everything delivered is up to our standards
Balance a large number of requests for developments while meeting business expectations
Liaise with Project and Programme Managers to define requirements - making sure any key stakeholders understand the process
Recognise and communicate the benefits of new technologies

You'll definitely:

Have excellent knowledge of solution design and software development
Understand Adobe AEM and a range of different technical languages, like Java, HTML5 and Hybris
Have extensive experience of systems development, preferably within a business-critical role
Know how to analyse and break down problems using structured frameworks and methodologies
Display excellent people skills and be able to manage relationships with internal business customers
Be able to manage changing business and technical requirements

What's in it for you:

Competitive salary
Pension
Private Healthcare
Bonus
Company Car or Cash alternative
Life Assurance
25 days' holiday
Discounted mobile phone package
Discounted products and services, as well as a range of other benefits

item.title: Senior Applications Developer at Oracle UK (Reading, UK)
item.description:
Oracle is seeking experienced Java developers to work on the next generation of cloud-based machine-learning applications. These applications use data from Oracle’s Data Cloud, social media and other sources to produce automated insights using artificial intelligence.  Your role is to help us develop the cutting-edge greenfield machine-learning framework upon which these applications are based.  Our technology stack includes docker, apache spark, jersey, python and Hadoop.


Successful candidates should be able to:
 
develop scalable solutions using big data technologies


develop code for running on distributed systems
understand the cloud delivery model and how that affects application solutions
solve problems in robust and creative ways
work in an environment with a significant number of unknowns
work globally in a geographically dispersed team
 
Successful candidates will typically have a BSc/Msc or higher degree and at least 10 years post-graduate experience as a software engineer/developer, with experience in Java and distributed processing.


This is a great opportunity to work with an international team of talented developers, and with some exciting new technologies and frameworks.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at EE (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
We're showing the UK how technology can make the everyday better. Our people are keeping our customers happy with great service, and our network, which has been named as the best in the UK, is keeping their digital lives connected. Empowered, challenged, supported and rewarded, our people are the key to our success. And the Sunday Times agrees. They've voted EE one of the Best Big Companies to Work For. This is your chance to join us.



Demanding an entrepreneurial approach to new technology and working towards a true DevOps model, you will support the evolution of our cloud based infrastructure service to better utilise off-the-shelf services and best in class tooling. Your knowledge of cloud based services will provide you with the relevant experience to deliver innovative solutions designs that will drive forward improvements in the automated configuration and deployment of the infrastructure and applications.



As well as supporting the technical evolution and design of the infrastructure, working within an agile development team you will provide hands-on development capabilities to deliver the technical evolution. The opportunity to deliver significant service improvement projects and the selection of new technologies and approaches to cloud infrastructure design and automation will develop your technical knowledge, skills and authority. If you thrive on innovation and technical change within the digital space, this is the role for you.



What you will do:

  • Provide technical expertise to design and deliver a cloud based infrastructure service
  • Develop in-house tooling based on Linux, scripted primarily in Python and Bash, to work with the Amazon AWS API and state-of-the-art configuration management tooling
  • Provide a reliable and respected voice for the cloud based infrastructure supporting several business critical web applications
  • Engage with solutions architects and application technical leads in the delivery of key systems and projects
  • Build relationships and collaborate effectively with product owners, application development teams, technical architects, support teams and external suppliers
  • Provide consultancy and guidance to Digital colleagues on infrastructure and web related issues




You will definitely:

  • Have good experience of software design
  • Have experience with cloud based infrastructure solutions in Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Have experience of system administration, automation of system configuration, and debugging in a complex multi-nodal environment
  • Experience with build servers and build pipelines with tools such as Jenkins
  • Be comfortable with writing Python and Bash
  • A good understanding of Linux
  • Be comfortable with basic networking & network design (particularly in AWS).
  • Have experience with Puppet (significant experience is a bonus)
  • Have used Git version control, preferably in a large team
  • Have familiarity of monitoring and logging solutions in the cloud
  • Experience of working within an Agile team
  • Have an appetite for debugging demanding applications
  • Be able to juggle conflicting demands on your time and resources
  • Demonstrate good communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Be able to work as part of a team in our London or Leeds based office




At EE, we're creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed. Diversity makes sense for us, for our customers and for our future. We value different perspectives, skills and experiences, and welcome applications from all sections of the community.

If you're thinking about working for the UK's biggest and fastest network, why not follow our shiny new recruitment channels on Twitter, LinkedIn and Glassdoor. Packed with the latest jobs, company news and career stories it could be a great move.

item.title: Lead C# / .NET Developer at McLaren Applied Technologies (Woking, UK)

  • Lösungen für cyberphysikalische Systeme entwickeln und analysieren, z.B. eingebettete, vernetzte Systeme mit Cloud-Integration

  • eine ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit, Lernbereitschaft und Engagement

Wir bieten



  • Teamwork und starke Kollegen mit unterschiedlichen Hintergründen

  • Mitarbeit an den prägenden Innovations- und Technologiethemen unseres Jahrhunderts, von IoT über AI zu Medtech

  • 170 Jahre Erfolg: Langfristige Orientierung, Nachhaltigkeit und Vorantreiben von Megatrends aus Gesundheit, Forschung und Industrie

  • Echte Mitarbeiterorientierung und –beteiligung – sichergestellt durch das Carl-Zeiss-Stiftungsstatut

  • Attraktive Vergütungspakete zzgl. einer prämierten, arbeitgeber-finanzierten Altersvorsorge

item.title: Static Object Lead Developer at Bonanza.com (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Since the dawn of software development, the ongoing struggle of Lead Developers and CTOs has been to time-efficiently understand what their team is working on, and somehow differentiate between the output of their most productive developers and the rest. It has long been assumed that the problem is just too hard -- coding & commit styles vary tremendously between individual Developers, and attempting to build a tool that can understand what's happening in the code would require teaching an algorithm to "think" like an experienced Developer. 


And yet, that is the tool we've built. Now we need you to join us and take this tool to the next level.


Is this an important enough problem? Here's what a top result from Google (from Dev9) has to say about it:


"If there is a holy grail of the technology industry, especially from a management standpoint, it's the measurement of developer productivity. You can't plan if you can't measure. If you believe [you can solve this problem], you'll be a wealthy rockstar of the programming universe. People will write books about your life and your brilliance." 


Sounds good to us.


Details


This role will be a hybrid individual contributor and leadership position that will initially be tilted toward individual contributions, but grow increasingly toward team leadership over time. 


As an individual contributor, you will help to create a system that can interpret code as you do. This means identifying additions, deletions, updates, find and replace, et. al. Armed with a well-defined concept of how code is changing over time, you'll leverage this data to help build a better diff viewer than Github (not a high bar), a means for grouping similar commits, and a collection of visualizations that make it fast and, dare we say fun, to see how a repository changes over the course of a sprint. 


As the Lead Developer, you'll help define the roadmap for what features can make CTOs, Lead Developers, and individual contributors more productive. You'll use intuition, a sophisticated test suite, and machine learning to map lines of code back to the features and bugs they implement. Since this is a nut that has never been cracked by another company, you'll be given significant latitude to take your creativity and channel it into the implementation of a product that should become essential to developer productivity across organizations.


You will work closely with the CEO, VP of Product, and other departments to coordinate the development of Static Object with our business objectives. You will join us in dogfooding this product daily, to ensure that we're building toward a direction that solves real world needs.


Job Requirements



  • 5+ years experience as a Developer in a high level language like Ruby, Python, or C#

  • 5+ years experience using git

  • Strong background in architecting large-scale systems, taming complexity using DRY principles

  • Work with the CEO to formulate the optimal set of tools to reliably measure+improve quality over time

  • Interface with clients on an as-needed basis to ensure that we are serving their needs

  • Handy with a variety of debugging techniques, never been content to settle for debugging via log statements

  • Demonstrated grit and optimism in the face of great challenge

  • Preferred: Experience with high-level programming concepts, like AI and machine learning

  • Preferred: Consuming passion for software development, including history of contributing to side projects outside one's day job

a10:author.a10:name: SAP HANA Platform & Database and HANA Vora

item.title: Senior Data Scientist / Data Science Expert - Deep Learning Center of Excellence at SAP HANA Platform & Database and HANA Vora (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As you know, SAP’s vision is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives.


As THE cloud company powered by SAP HANA®, SAP is a market leader in enterprise application software, helping companies of all sizes and industries Run Simple.


We empower people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. SAP applications and services enable our customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.


At SAP, we believe in the power of collaboration and empower our employees to perform at their best in an environment that encourages free and open expression of ideas. Here, you work alongside creative thinkers who share your interests, while turning big ideas into reality for our customers. With innovative job training, mentors to help you grow, and the flexibility to balance your work and personal life, you’re able to build your career. It’s no wonder that some of the sharpest minds from around the world are working for a company that is consistently recognized as a global top employer.



As a Senior Data Scientist / Data Science Expert for the SAP Deep Learning Center of Excellence, you will work within a team of data engineers and developers solving real-world problems by building new, cloud based machine learning solutions and services. Our use cases span commerce, finance, procurement, logistics, and travel. You will work against fixed timelines and your success will be measured by the ability to deliver production-grade machine learning models reaching accuracies on par with top notch research prototypes.



EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS


Your tasks include:



  • Push the frontiers of what is possible in the area of Machine Learning working with real data

  • Explore, understand, and implement most recent machine learning algorithms and approaches

  • Comfortably handle very large data sets in scale-up and scale-out cloud environments

  • Fulfill both functional and non-functional (availability, throughput, latency) requirements

  • Understand business processes which create and consume data so as to be able to select best approaches, evaluate their performance, and asses business relevance

  • Create excellence both in terms of results quality and system scalability through continuous evaluation, analysis, and refinement

  • Communicate the relevance of implemented systems and achieved results in a visual and consistent way



EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES


You are a self-starter, goal-oriented, striving for perfection engineer. As an ideal candidate, you will demonstrate a proven track record in development of large-scale machine learning pipelines and combine it with curiosity for exploring of new use cases and applications of machine learning to domains spanning processing of structured and unstructured data.



Required skills & qualifications:



  • Master degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics or related field

  • Track record of developing productive machine learning-based solutions and/or systems

  • Proficiency in working with very large datasets in distributed Linux/Unix environments

  • Experience with Python and Machine Learning software packages such as scikit-learn or TensorFlow 

  • Experience with data and error analysis and ability to present core insights in a clear and compelling way

  • Team spirit and desire to overcome obstacles and make your work benefit SAP's customers

  • Excellent English language skills



WORK EXPERIENCE


At least 5 years of relevant experience in deep learning / machine learning / data science development projects with a focus on innovation.



LOCATION


Berlin area, Germany



EXPECTED TRAVEL


0 - 30%


The position can be filled as part time position.



SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT 



To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

item.title: Wil jij helpen Software bouwen in de nieuwste High Tech ontwikkelingen? at Sogeti (Vianen, Netherlands)
item.description:
Wil jij ook meedelen in het groeiend succes van Sogeti High Tech?


Stel, je hebt een passie voor High Tech. Je bent graag bezig om softwareoplossingen te maken die dicht tegen embedded omgevingen aanzitten, complexe embedded software die onder andere realtime communiceert met hardware. En nu ben je op zoek naar een leuke vacature op het gebied van High Tech Software Engineering. Een baan waarin jij je kennis, kunde en ambities kwijt kan. Je wilt bij een High Tech dienstverlener aan de slag die zijn klanten wil helpen in hun groei en zijn medewerkers in hun ontwikkeling. Dan willen we graag met je praten!


Ons idee van jouw carrière
De toekomst van een organisatie staat in directe relatie tot de kracht van de medewerkers. Als onze medewerkers zich blijven ontwikkelen, dan groeit Sogeti vanzelf mee. Daarom bieden we
High Tech Professionals alle kansen om kennis en ervaring optimaal te verbreden.


Herken jij jezelf?
Jij hebt een relevante technische opleiding op HBO of WO niveau afgerond en minimaal vijf jaar (recente) ervaring als software engineer in een embedded software omgeving binnen het High Tech werkdomein. Je bent bekend met het Windows platform, het .Net framework en C#. Of je hebt ervaring met programmeren in embedded omgevingen. Verder heb je kennis van, of ervaring met verschillende ontwikkelmethoden en –technieken, zoals Real-time, OOAD, UML, RUP of Agile.
Jij hebt een klant- en resultaatgerichte werkhouding. Je kan project- en procesmatig werken met verschillende (standaard) testtooling. Je woont centraal in Nederland en bent bereid om te reizen. Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. En bovendien, je wilt je graag blijven ontwikkelen op het gebied van High Tech.


Sogeti biedt jou 
Wij bieden jou ondersteuning bij jouw ontwikkeling met alle mogelijke middelen zoals opleidingen, technische meetings, events en certificering op je vakgebied. Sogeti is een plezierig bedrijf om voor te werken, waar sfeer en collegialiteit hoog in het vaandel staan. Regelmatig worden informele activiteiten georganiseerd om collega's ook buiten het werken te leren kennen. Wij bieden ruimte voor eigen initiatieven. Initiatieven die bijdragen aan het resultaat worden hoog gewaardeerd en beloond. Verder bieden wij interessante opdrachten en klantomgevingen om je opdrachten uit te voeren.


Selectie


Heb jij de ideale vacature gevonden? Solliciteer dan vandaag nog via de button op deze site! 


Meer informatie over Sogeti High Tech? Ga naar www.sogeti.nl/high-tech.


Skills & Requirements


High Tech Software Engineer
De divisie High Tech is een ambitieus onderdeel van Sogeti dat zich vooral richt op ondernemingen in het High Tech werkgebied en is één van onze snelst groeiende onderdelen. De belangrijkste werkgebieden zijn elektronica ontwikkeling, High Tech testen en High Tech software ontwikkeling. We zijn op zoek naar ervaren collega's voor deze divisie. Slimme mensen met een passie voor techniek!
Als High Tech Software Engineer ben je onder andere verantwoordelijk voor het vertalen van (technische) specificaties naar een softwareontwerp. Je ontwikkelt (realtime) software voor complexe, hightech omgevingen. Daarnaast voer je zelfstandig software testen uit op basis van onder andere unittests, integreer je verschillende software modules en schrijf je bijbehorende documentatie. Je volgt de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van C++, C, C#, .NET, Python en/of Java en bent op de hoogte van de mogelijkheden van (embedded) besturingssysteem, zoals Linux, Windows en VxWorks.
