item.title: Senior Softwareentwickler Frontend - Javascript (m/w) at Paessler AG (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir wollen mit dir zusammen bei Paessler weiter am Ball bleiben, neue Dinge ausprobieren und bewährte Dinge besser machen. Dabei sind es unsere Flexibilität und Beweglichkeit, die es uns ermöglichen, schneller als andere zu agieren. Paessler ist mit PRTG,unserer Netzwerk-Monitoring-Software, seit fast 20 Jahren auf dem Markt und mit aktuell 200 Mitarbeitern ein mittelständisches Softwarehaus. 


Ein typischer Tag könnte so aussehen:



  • Erweitere unser Python CMS und ermögliche es, den internen Nutzern Content in Tabs anzuordnen

  • Erstelle eine SPA, die alle Partner von Paessler auf einer Karte darstellt und sie darunter in Kacheln anordnet

  • Arbeite mit der Grafikabteilung an einer neuen Landingpage

  • Erstelle ein Konzept für Cross Browser Testing zur Sicherstellung der Skript-Qualität

  • Konzeptioniere mit dem Product Owner und den Stakeholdern eine neue Lead-Magnet App

  • Analysiere TrackJS-Fehlermeldungen und leite Lösungsansätze ab, die allen Usern eine gute UX ermöglichen


Dein Profil:



  • Im Schlaf sprichst du immer noch fließend HTML, CSS & Javascript (und jQuery)

  • Mockups setzt du pixelgenau in interaktiven Seiten um

  • Aus Anforderungen an ein neues Projekt kannst du Interfaces ableiten und verlierst dabei die Sicht des Anwenders nicht aus den Augen

  • Die Anbindung neuer Interfaces an bestehende Backends stellt für dich kein Problem dar

  • CI/CD Prozesse verstehen, hinterfragen und neu designen ist für dich kein Hexenwerk, sondern der Weg, ein Projekt rund zu machen

  • Für dich ist Test-Driven-Development ein wichtiges Qualitätssicherungs-Werkzeug

  • Du hast Erfahrungen in verschiedenen Webframeworks, insb. zum Entwickeln von SPAs (Angular, Vue.js o.Ä.)

item.title: Data & Analytics Platform Lead - Connect fantastic TV to audiences worldwide at Magine (Stockholm, Sweden)

We use the data we collect about the usage of our product to guide our efforts both within the engineering team as well as in the organisation as a whole.

We think you have the following qualifications:

item.title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer at Lalamove (Kowloon, Hong Kong)
item.description:
Lalamove is now seeking an Amazing(™) Senior Infrastructure Engineer to join our growing Infrastructure team. The team is central within the Engineering organisation at Lalamove whose focus is on whole-platform performance, optimisation and uptime through automation. We are always seeking the best solution to a problem and thinks it is more important that things are done right, rather than quick. You will possess a high level of technical curiosity and be comfortable with not just solving problems but problems that few other companies have not yet had.

At Lalamove, we value the ideas of all our teammates and it is important that you can contribute right away both with your input and hands on engineering. You will have an opportunity to make an immediate impact that improves the quality of our infrastructure.

What you'll do: 


  • Continuous integration and delivery of the current platform on top of AWS with the aim of improving operations reliability, performance and cost

  • Defining and deploying monitoring and logging systems to help the business and engineering better understand the performance of the live system

  • Encourage best practices and systems operations in an always-up, always-available service

  • Take part in automation process, help and coach developers about getting code they’ve written into production safely and reliably

  • Participate in technical meetings to understand business requirements in order to plan and integrate a system that is viable and scalable and ensures business continuity

  • Exercise a high level of autonomy within the problem space, but also feel confident that you have the support you need to deliver


What you'll have: 



  • At least 3 years of professional experience with Linux or web application programming and excited to learn the other part

  • Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible/Salt/Puppet

  • Experience in automation and testing

  • Understanding of agile and other development processes and methodologies

  • Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services

  • Experience with database performance and operations

  • A working understanding of code and script (PHP, node.js)


Bonus Points! 



  • Application programming experience in PHP/Python/node.js including writing tested code

  • Detailed experience with MySQL and performance profiling of queries

item.title: Junior Blockchain Engineer at Clearmatics (London, UK)
item.description:
Role Information


Clearmatics is an established blockchain R&D company in London, UK. We have good ties to the Open Source / Ethereum community, our Lead Engineer works closely with the Ethereum Foundation, and the company is an Ethereum Enterprise Alliance Member.


We are looking to hire multiple engineers to expand our team. Our stack is Ethereum-like so familiarity and passion with the space is key.


As a Junior Engineer you will be exposed to the latest thinking about Blockchain and Distibuted Ledger Networks. We are working on areas like Privacy, Inter-operability and Consensus. The role would suit a recent graduate with strong fundamentals looking to apply their skills in a structured environment within
the Blockchain space.

Role Description


As a Junior Blockchain Engineer you will be part of a team of Engineers delivering the core Clearmatics technology product. This includes the core Blockchain node and a suite of innovative smart contracts. The Blockchain space is young and evolving so the role would suit a self-starter who is ready to dive into the space with support from Senior Engineers.


You should be familiar with reading documentation and figuring things out yourself but not afraid to ask when you need help. You will have the opportunity to work with and learn from more experienced Blockchain Engineers and assist in creating and maintaining Open Source projects and the core technology platform.


Clearmatics has an ambitious program to create a suite of Blockchain tools and products that will enhance the ecosystem and form the basis for future products and businesses. By joining Clearmatics you will have the opportunity to help create these tools and products in an environment where research and experimentation is valued.



  • Bug fixing on existing codebases

  • Performance testing on existing codebases

  • Producing documentation

  • Completing Agile tickets

  • Enhancing existing tooling

  • Contributing to design discussions


Familiarity with technologies is less important than an aptitude for learning but some of the technologies and tooling we use include Ethereum, Golang, Python, Solidity, Terraform, Gitlab CI, Git, GPG, Agile.


Attributes


The successful candidate must:



  1. Have an understanding of Computer Science fundamentals (data structures,algorithmic complexity, etc)

  2. Have some experience in strongly-typed languages (C/C++, Golang, Scala, Rust)

  3. Have some interest in Ethereum / the cryptocurrency space


The successful candidate should:



  1. Be a self-learner but not afraid to ask for help when they need to.

  2. Be comfortable working in a self-organising team.

  3. Be comfortable communicating in verbal and written format.


It would be nice if the successful candidate:



  1. Has some understanding of cryptography

  2. Attends Blockchain related meetups

  3. Writes Open Source code for personal projects.

item.title: Software Developer at Volvo Car Corporation(Prd) (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
At Research and Development you will be a key contributor to the next generation outstanding luxury cars from Volvo. Together with other engineers around the world, you and your team will create innovative human-centric car technology that makes life less complicated and more enjoyable for people. Are you interested in design and connected car technology? Do you share our passion for people, the environment and our urge to create a superior driving experience? Research and Development is the place for you to prosper.

The section Security and Body Electronics is responsible for design, implementation and verification of system and components within Alarm, Remote, Immobilizer, Exterior Light, Visibility, Sound Signalling and Locking systems. The section is a part of Vehicle Software & Electronics within Volvo Car's Product & Quality (P&Q) division. Currently we are approximately 60 employees, organized in four groups.

The group Body Electronics SW today includes 20 persons. We are responsible for development and integration of application SW for Central Electronic Module (CEM), and Vehicle Computational Module (VCU1). The responsibility also includes Software and Diagnostic requirement specifications for these ECUs.

Central Electronic Module is a master ECU with many bus systems and high level of electrical interfaces, containing vital functionality such as Vehicle Mode Management, Energy Management, Exterior Light, Locking and Visibility.

Vehicle Computational Module is a multi-functional unit that contains AUTOSAR based SW components developed at Volvo Cars and by external supplier.

We are looking for a Software Developer to strengthen our team. You will work with existing and new functionality in current and upcoming car projects and electrical architectures.
The work as Software Developer means that you establish and develop relationships with System Designers for several functional areas, as well as building an understanding of the system design within those areas. In this position, you will therefore build and maintain a wide personal network within Vehicle Software & Electronics and Volvo Car's Product & Quality (P&Q) division.You will work closely to the internal Software Project Leader, SW Integration, SW Testing as well as your team members.

Main Responsibilities:
Develop software components and applications in MATLAB/Simulink
Review software requirements specification
Design and develop unit test specifications and perform unit testing
Responsible for issue and change management on developed models
Secure that models are ready in time, updated and released
Discuss technical solutions with supplier and the internal team
Support investigations and task force activities

Required Qualifications:
B.Sc. grade within Electrical, Computer, Engineering Physics or equivalent level of education
Programming skills in C, C++
Experience of Simulation and Model-Based Design using MATLAB/ Simulink
Experience of developing software algorithms and specifications
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
B driving license

Preferred Qualifications:
M.Sc.in Electrical, Computer or Engineering Physics
Knowledge in AUTOSAR
Programming skills in Python
Knowledge in Automotive Functional Safety Standard ISO26262
Knowledge in Volvo Product Development System (VPDS)
Experience from Body & Security or Power Train area
Experience from software design for automotive
Agile development processes

Personal Qualities:
Strong committed to develop world class products with high precision
Ability to build trust and show courage
Structured with good documentation and communication skills
Self-driven and reliable
Customer oriented
Strong team player with persistence

About Volvo Car Group

The future belongs to those who are empowered by a great idea and have the ability to carry it out. At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand" by simplifying people's lives. We have bold targets when it comes to innovation, sales and customer satisfaction and to make this happen, we need talented people onboard. People with passion, energy, business sense and the drive to innovate. People that want to create the next generation Volvo cars in a global, dynamic and respectful environment. We will support you to reach your full potential. Join us on this exciting journey into the future.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Keepsafe at Keepsafe (Kraków, Poland)

Skills & Requirements:

  • Deep knowledge in Python3

  • Experience with AWS - especially EC2, DynamoDB

  • Experience shipping production code and building well-designed APIs

  • Experience with distributed systems

  • Comfortable with Keepsafe's web stack

  • Passionate about the Keepsafe mission

item.title: 15 PhD Fellowships in Computer Science, Computer Engineering at Technical University of Denmark (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
The PhD fellowships are part of the EU-funded project FORA—Fog Computing for Robotics and Industrial Automation.

FORA is an ambitious Marie Skodowska-Curie European Training Network (ETN) that will train the next generation of researchers in Fog Computing to be used in many application areas, including Industry 4.0. Fog Computing, also sometimes called Edge Computing, brings the Cloud “closer to the ground”, to the edge of the network, where machines and “things” are talking to each other, forming the Internet of Things.

FORA will fund and train 15 PhD candidates in the area of Fog Computing, during the period 2017-2021. The FORA ETN was specifically created to boost your research career; read here about the benefits.

You will be joining a consortium formed of 4 universities and 3 companies from Sweden, Denmark, Austria and Germany, see the partners below. You will be employed at one of these partners and enrolled for your PhD at one of the universities. You are expected to do long-term visits at the other partners in the network, and participate in the training events, summer schools and network meetings across Europe.

Scientific objectives
Industries are digitalized. The machines are talking. This will bring a net value of USD 1.7 trillion by 2020 worldwide. We need to bring Cloud Computing and Data Analytics closer to the machines, we need to develop an open Fog Computing Platform. The research happens at the intersection of several areas: Cloud Computing and Software Engineering, Industrial Automation and Real-Time Systems, and Machine Learning, Security and Safety.


The FORA research objectives focus on: future industrial automation architectures and applications based on Fog Computing, deterministic virtualization and execution, deterministic wired and wireless communication, resource provisioning and resource management, Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA), real-time data analytics and security. The result will be an open architecture built on open source and open standards, e.g., Time-Sensitive Networking (TSN), OPC Unified Architecture (UA) and 5G.


Training program
The FORA training program consists of



  • Network-wide training (individual research projects; visits to other partners; joint training schools that provide knowledge and skills relevant to all PhDs; and conferences). We have 3 training schools, 2 summer schools and a Project Conference.

  • Local training (scientific and skills courses relevant for your individual needs as, at your local host).

  • External training (visits, conferences, tutorials and summer/winter schools outside the network).


Who can apply?



  • We are looking for highly motivated individuals with a background in computer science (algorithms), software engineering (Cloud Computing, service-oriented computing, middleware, distributed systems), computer engineering (hardware design and computer architecture) and industrial automation and control (distributed automation, robotics, control algorithms), as well as data science (machine learning).

  • Applicants must hold a relevant Master´s degree.

  • The candidate must have less than 4 years of research experience and must not have resided or carried out his/her main activity in the country of the host institution for more than 12 months during the last 3 years immediately prior to the recruitment.

  • The applicants should document a high-level knowledge of the English language. Please include documentation in your application (IELTS Academic, TOEFL, etc.) if available.


How to apply?
Details about FORA and the 15 open PhD positions are available at fora-etn.eu. The application deadline is January 5th, 2018.


 To submit your application please click on the "Go to application page" button.


 Places of work:
Companies:


ABB AB
ABB is a global leader in power and automation technologies that enable utility and industry customers to improve their performance while lowering environmental impact. ABB is a multi-national company with offices in most countries of the world. In FORA, ABB will participate with ABB Robotics and ABB Corporate Research. ABB has approximately 6000 persons working with R&D, where ABB Corporate Research has 1000 scientists. ABB Corporate Research in Sweden is the largest lab with approx. 300 scientists with of more that 50% have a PhD degree. ABB Robotics is a leading supplier of industrial robots and robot software, equipment and complete application solutions. ABB is located in Västerås, Stockholm area, Sweden.


 SYSGO
SYSGO specializes in design, implementation, and configuration of device software for the embedded market. Since its foundation in 1991, the company has been focused on real-time operating systems for use in embedded systems. It’s core competencies are: design, implementation, validation, and distribution of microkernel-based operating systems for real-time embedded applications, microkernel-based virtualization, scheduling for multicore processors, scheduling real-time and non-real-time processes in a virtual machine context. The target markets are aerospace/defense, industrial automation, automotive, consumer electronics, and network infrastructure. SYSGO AG was reincorporated as a joint stock company in October 2002. Today, the company has 98 employees in five facilities in Germany and Europe and a global distribution network. SYSGO is located in Mainz, Germany.


 TTTech Computertechnik AG (TTT)
TTTech Computertechnik AG (TTT) is the leading supplier of dependable networking solutions based on time-triggered technology. The company is headquartered in Vienna, Austria, and employs ca. 500 employees. TTT is engaged in the further development of dependable networking technology in the domains space, aerospace, automotive and industrial control systems. (TTT) provides, as the industrial beneficiary partner, longstanding expertise in the field of dependable real-time systems and safety-critical system development.

Founded as a spin-off of Vienna University of Technology, TTTech also has deep insights into the scientific education process and can thus structurally and personally support the education of academics, e.g., by establishing buddy concepts between the ESRs and scientific staff at the company. TTTech is located in Vienna, Austria.

Universities:
Technical University of Denmark (DTU)
DTU Compute, at the Technical University of Denmark, is the largest computer science department in Denmark and represents a unique combination of computer science & engineering. DTU Compute is organized in 11 research sections, and participates in FORA with two sections, the section on Embedded Systems Engineering (ESE) and the section for Cognitive Systems (COGSYS).


DTU is recognized internationally as a leading university in the areas of the technical and the natural sciences, renowned for our business-oriented approach, our focus on sustainability, and our amazing study environment. DTU is located north of Copenhagen, Denmark.


Technische Universität Wien (TUWIEN)
TU Wien is Austria’s largest scientific-technical research and educational institution, and participates in FORA with two Research Groups: The Automation Systems Group (ASG) is part of Faculty of Informatics  and focuses on research in computer engineering. Particular focus is put on distributed automation (factory automation and building automation), industrial communication systems and automation system integration. In addition, knowledge engineering, formal methods for control systems, and networked embedded systems’ safety and security are investigated. The Distributed Systems Group (DSG) is part of the Information Systems Institute and conducts teaching and research in distributed computing with particular emphasis on elastic cloud computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), Fog/Edge Computing, and the Internet of Services (IoS). TU Wien is located in Vienna, Austria.


Mälardalen University (MDH)
Mälardalen University (MDH) is a young and modern university focusing on applied research and education in close cooperation with industry. The School of Innovation, Design and Engineering (IDT) hosts the research profile Embedded Systems (ES). ES is the leading research profile at MDH, and the leading group in Sweden in Embedded Systems related research. Research at ES is organized in 14 mutually supportive and cooperating groups, and focuses on themes such as: Industrial software engineering including technology and processes for complex products; Embedded Systems Software Engineering; Design methodologies for real-time dependable systems; Static analysis of software; Design methods, architectures and communication. MDH is located in the Stockholm area, Sweden.


 Technischen Universität Kaiserslautern (TUKL)
Technische Universität Kaiserslautern, founded 1970, is a technical oriented University comprising nine departments with about 150 professors. Approximately 8000 students are currently registered. The University has a high reputation: 2 Frauenhofer Institutes, the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence, a Max-Planck Institute for Software Systems and several other institutes are embedded in the University. The Chair of Real-Time Systems participating in FORA has expertise in scheduling methods for the integration of time triggered and event triggered activities of mixed criticality demands, such as predictability or flexibility, individually for system activities, instead of system wide paradigms. TUKL is located in Kaiserslautern, Germany.

item.title: QA Engineer at SendCloud (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a QA engineer you will join the development team and work on the SendCloud system. SendCloud integrates various carriers and online stores in a fast and intuitive tool. We release early and often. The development team is responsible for building the SendCloud system and keeping it running.


SendCloud enables online merchants to grow, we do this via automation, creating an efficient processing tool. We focus on offering a simple product, even when the complexity of the internals of our system increases. In your role as QA engineer, you will make sure that our system behaves as expected. You will help our developers understand the complex logic behind the automation and assist them that they implement these right.


You will help us further improve our development stack and train the developers in your team. You do not need to start from scratch, we run thousands of unit-tests and bunch of e2e tests, using Jenkins, Docker and Chrome headless.


This position is open to worldwide candidates. We will assist you with with relocating to ensure a smooth transition.


Benefits


  • A good salary and pension scheme.
  • An ambitious and inspiring working environment.
  • The possibility for your own initiatives in our fast growing organization.
  • Work hard, Play Hard mentality. We celebrate our successes with you!
  • Choose your own device.

Working at SendCloud

SendCloud is here to change shipping for ever! Our goal is to be the largest shipping service provider in the world.

We provide a SaaS solution that easily integrates with the major webshop systems and carriers to offer our customers a big advantage. This way webshops can compete with the big players. We believe that we offer our customers the best experience available in the market.


At SendCloud we love to keep things pragmatic, especially in our day to day job no thick layers of protocols and documentation. We move fast in small self organized teams, creating a place where you can really make a difference. Although our ambitions are huge, we are dedicated to keep our working atmosphere open, pleasant and fun! At the SendCloud office we have a gym, bbq, daily lunches and regularly go out on fun activities.

item.title: Software Engineer for new Search Platform we're building from scratch! at Zendesk (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Zendesk is looking for an experienced software engineer to join a small team working on search on our Guide product in Copenhagen. Search is a critical platform across all Zendesk powering multiple product features and internal tools. Our large-scale search infrastructure handles thousands of requests per second while indexing terabytes of data in different formats. With more than 107,000 customers creating millions of new data points every single day, Search is a real engineering challenge requiring continuous evolution and optimisation.

What you get to do every day:



  • Design and develop high performance and highly available services used by millions of people daily.

  • You will be part of a new team dedicated to improving search performance and experience.

  • You’ll be responsible for enhancing every aspect of the Search experience: from indexing data to servicing the relevant results.

  • Write efficient and scalable code.

  • Create out of the box solutions to help resolve search challenges.

  • Have fun!


What you bring to the role:



  • Experience with ElasticSearch, Lucene or Solr is needed.

  • Strong programming experience in Java or other object-oriented programming languages.

  • Experience with a scripting language like Ruby or Python is a plus

  • Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms and design principles for large-scale data.

  • You believe in frequent releases and in building software that is easy to deploy and pain-free to operate.

  • Good knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases

  • Ability to form creative solutions, often when working with ambiguity.

  • Interest or knowledge of stream processing technologies and message-oriented technologies (Kafka, Google Dataflow, Spark).

  • A strong sense of pride in the software you build and you care about search!

item.title: Junior Full-Stack Developer/Backend at ABOX42 GmbH (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for:


Junior Full-Stack Developer/Backend






Location : Karlsruhe (HQ), Germany






We are looking for People with the same mindset, people who have already proven that sporty goals and challenges are two important things in their lives.


Through daily communication with our product management, the team knows the common product objectives and latest developments in the market that affect our products. Everyone on the team wants to be close to the "pulse of the products" and also uses these products at home.


Because of our own requirements as a team and the requirements that our demanding customers have, our goals are also linked to constant learning in new areas. One of the strengths that characterizes us.


But our flexibility as a team also characterizes our success. We quickly respond to changes in the requirements in a well-balanced manner. A property that is highly appreciated by our customers and is represented by everyone in the team.


Product concepts are set up in a way that the team can act in their own responsibility when implementing these concepts. In addition to concepts, each individual in the team, with their roadmaps, progress tracking and quality assurance, creates a high degree of transparency for the daily progress of the implementation. This leads to a high acceptance of the results of each individual in the team.


And we´ allowed to be happy, because the daily joy and the best care possible, offered in the company, is an important factor for our motivation in the team.


Your Role:



  • You have two hearts beating in your chest: a quality-conscious developer and a responsible administrator

  • Participation in exciting projects: Implementation of the projects from conception to development and roll-out


Your Qualification:



  • 2-3 years of experience as a Full-Stack Developer/Backend

  • Good conceptual and analytical thinking and execution

  • Strong Linux and Linux Environment knowledge

  • Good in scripting (Shell/Python)

  • Safe to use with SSH + bash + vim

  • Experience working with AWS PHP SDK's (EC2/S3) and similar cloud services SDK's

  • Deep understanding of the development of applications based on Restful APIs and Web socket with: PHP, MySQL

  • You bridge the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure of our applications and you take an active role on both sides for different platforms

  • Knowledge in the processes of agile software development like using Scrum

  • Fluent English skills in spoken and written English


Your Responsibilities:



  • High self-responsibility and open communication coupled with a strong team orientation

  • Come every day with the energy & drive to achieve greatness , always drive yourself and others to improve

  • Conception and planning of new ones, as well as the further development of existing services

  • Testing and Roll-out of new / modified software component


Does that sound exciting? Then you could be the new colleague in our ABOX42 team. We are looking forward to receiving your meaningful application with CV and references via email. You are welcome to name references.

item.title: Front end Developer at Iteam Solutions (Östermalm, Sweden)
item.description:
As a system developer at Iteam you help companies digitize their business and streamline its activities with a bunch of talented, diverse and nice colleagues/ customers and new technology.


Your role


You will work in a team together with the customer. As a Front end Developer you will work with other Developers, UX, Designers, and Project Managers (depending on the project) and a Tech Lead that will support you while working and be there to throw around ideas and discuss with. You will work in an agile way and will need to communicate a lot with your fellow team members.

item.title: System Engineer (DevOps) @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
The Senior System Engineer (Dev Ops) is a member of the Products team. Products is a multi-disciplinary team of experienced and highly skilled UX designers, software developers, test engineers, technical writers and support engineers, guided by the Chief Architect and the Products manager. The team is responsible for the entire software development lifecycle of Backbase's portal product suite including out-of-the-box portal solutions. With your experience and skills you will contribute to the quality of our software products, helping to realize successful customer implementations by our Professional Services consultants and partners. You will also benefit from the knowledge and experience of your Products colleagues. We work in Scrum teams in order to deliver new functionality in every release, closely cooperating with Project and Product Managers, as well as with the Professional Services team. The complexity and nature of the product combined with the latest technology trends makes working in Products at Backbase a great and challenging experience.


As Senior System Engineer (Dev Ops) you will be working hands-on with the unit’s experts, Products engineers and other teams within the company, making Operations and IT happen. With your experience and skills you contribute to the ongoing development of our software products, driving your team to deliver great new capabilities. You’ll be working closely with the development teams, architects and other Leads to align on priorities and technical design decisions.


Skills & Requirements



  • Strong desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment where you have a lot of responsibilities and see immediate impact of your efforts;

  • Team player who is passionate about software development and actively shares knowledge;

  • Leader by example who takes pride in delivering high-quality software according to plan;

  • Flexible, balanced, always striving for improvements.


Requirements



  • Bachelor / University degree or equivalent;

  • You have designed and/or built mission critical services (large scale internet or cloud-based services);

  • Shell, scripting and Python programming experience;

  • Expertise with Linux / Unix systems;

  • Experience with any of configuration management tools (such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt);

  • Experience with any of continuous integration server (such as Bamboo, Jenkins, TeamCity, GoCD);

  • You love efficiency and find smart ways to automate tasks for you and your team;

  • Knowledge of cloud computing concepts, experience with AWS, or Azure, or GCE;

  • Solid understanding of systems monitoring, alerting and analytics (Zabbix, NewRelic, Cactai, Graphite, Log Stash, Nagios, Ganglia etc.);

  • Proven experience with production systems and dealing with production issues;

  • Driven, focused self-starter who takes ownership;

  • Extensive knowledge and experience with automation tools;

  • Experience deploying to application servers such as Jetty, Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere in enterprise environments, and working with Relational and NoSQL Databases;

  • Experienced with using Agile development methodologies;

  • Excellent communication skills in English


Very nice to have as well:



  • Software development background is a big plus;

  • Experience programming in Java;

  • Insightful opinions about systems architecture;

  • Experienced in developing custom solutions for systems monitoring, deployments, continuous integration, etc.

item.title: Integration Expert - Cloud Captain at Meshcloud GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben bei uns


Für unser Team im Rhein-Main-Gebiet suchen wir derzeit nach einem/r polyglotten
Allround-Entwickler/in im Integrationsbereich. Als Integration Expert setzen Sie die Integration einer Vielzahl von Open Source Computing Tools in die Plattform und die Kerntechnologie Meshclouds um. 



Ihr Profil


Als optimale(r) Kandidat(in) bringen Sie mit:



  • Mitwirkung bei Open Source Projekten auf GitHub und/oder ähnlichen Plattformen

  • Erfahrung in Skriptsprachen (bspw. Python, Ruby) und kompilierten Sprachen (bspw. Go, Java)

  • Tiefgehendes Verständnis von administrativen Aufgaben in Unix-basierten Systemen

  • Praktische Erfahrung im Einsatz von IaaS

  • Erfahrung im Betrieb, Monitoring und Debugging verteilter Systeme

  • Einen guten Umgang mit Git und/oder Mercurial Versionsverwaltung


Gern gesehen



  • Erfahrung in weiteren Programmiersprachen, Frameworks und Technologien

  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Cloud Foundry, OpenStack und/oder Kubernetes

  • Erfahrung mit Konfigurationsmanagement-Tools wie bspw. Chef oder Puppet

  • Erfahrung mit Orchestrierung-Tools wie bspw. Ansible, Spinnaker oder Terraform

  • Erfahrung mit Betreuung von Datenbanken (z.B. MySQL, MongoDB)

  • Erfahrung mit Federated Identity und Authentifizierungssprotokollen wie bspw. OIDC, LDAP oder SAML



Wir bieten



  • Arbeiten in Startup-Atmosphäre in einem engagierten und talentierten Team

  • Eine Vielfalt von Technologien und Herausforderungen

  • Reichlich Platz für Kreativität und persönliche Weiterentwicklung

  • Jede Menge gratis Snacks im Büro (Wasser, Kaffee, Obst, Süßigkeiten, …)

item.title: Graduate Developer - BI and Big Data at Oracle UK (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
Graduate Software Engineer - BI and Big Data


Bristol


Oracle's Business Analytics engineering teams, based in the centre of Bristol, design and develop Oracle's Data Visualization and Analytic Cloud product suites. With revolutionary innovation in visualization, insights and ease of use, our cloud, desktop and enterprise technology is designed for the reliability, predictability and quality expected by the world’s largest companies, smartest start-ups and individuals!


You could be working in one of our engineering teams to help us innovate and develop our public cloud capabilities at a time when the move towards cloud computing has never been stronger.


In addition to working on interesting projects, you'll be getting a great salary, flexible working arrangements, a fun, state-of-the-art development environment and excellent opportunities for learning and career growth.


On a typical day you will probably be working as part of a small, focused team doing one or more of the following:



  • Programming, testing and operating software at the heart of Oracle's Analytic product. You might be:


    • Writing some code in Java, Groovy, C++, Python or another modern programming language.

    • End-to-end software development (including project lifecycle): build, test, install, configuration, upgrade, security, scaling, routing, process control, eventing, scheduling, backup, restore, etc... on *nix, Windows and Mac platforms.

    • Deploying and operating your software in data-centres across the globe.

    • Working with containerisation and virtualisation technologies such as Docker and OpenStack.


  • Participating in the software engineering community at Oracle and beyond. Maybe you will be:


    • Discussing potential solutions to complex technical problems and building consensus among disparate teams.

    • Learning a new skill or trying a new way of working.

    • Teaching someone else a skill.


  • Developing your ideas by working in collaboration with some of the groundbreaking customers, startups and universities in Bristol (and customers globally).


We are flexible about education and experience but we think this role is suited to someone with a very strong academic record and at least a 1st or 2.1 bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in software engineering/software development, or similar.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Director of Engineering, Core Systems at 2U, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We're Looking For:





Engineering at 2U is fast paced, innovative, and full of people passionate about delivering on the promise of higher education via technology. We’re growing rapidly and are seeking collaborative and results-driven individuals to join us. In return, we can offer you a fun learning environment where your skills, experience and creativity will make a material impact on the company’s success and its overall mission. Your tenure at 2U will be a highlight of your career.


We strive for our teams to be cross-functional, self-organizing and autonomous. You will be working directly with product managers, business analysts, and your peers in a highly collaborative manner.


About The Role


We are looking for a thoughtful, collaborative and results-driven engineering leader with experience running teams of 5 to 10 engineers in an agile environment. You are a maker at heart and have experience in finding a balance between individual technical contribution and achieving results via your team. You are comfortable using and providing guidance in  techniques like test driven development (TDD), pair programming and retrospectives.


Above all, you care about delivering quality software in a sustainable and timely manner. You have experience in, and passion for, building and running effective teams that deliver and thrive.


Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:






You are a competent maker, able to:



  • Make direct technical contributions (writing, debugging, reviewing and deploying code)

  • Provide technical guidance and feedback to your team members. 

  • Lead technical design of applications and participate in larger system design efforts

  • Advocate for end user needs in software you are building


You are a competent manager, able to own and direct your team in:



  • Planning and execution of short and medium term projects 

  • Hiring, engaging and developing for members of your team. Occasionally help with hiring on adjacent ones

  • Assessing, reporting, and improving systems and processes in your charge

  • Collaborating effectively with Product team (product managers, business analysts, and UX designers) to define and refine requirements


You have experience in (or clear potential for understanding) the higher education ecosystem, 2U’s 3 year strategy and major goals, and can align and execute your team’s deliverables accordingly.


This position reports to the Vice President, Engineering and is based in our NYC office.


Other Attributes That Will Help You in This Role:






The Core Systems team builds and maintains products that meet the needs of common patterns that underlie 2U's user-facing platform with the goal of sustainability, reliability, and reducing total cost of ownership. Many of the team's direct customers are other product managers and engineers at 2U, so transparency and balancing needs among many constituencies are of utmost importance.


We are looking for experience with the following:



  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  • Docker container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Mesos

  • Web frameworks like Tornado (Python), Phoenix (Elixir), or Hapi.js (Node.js)

  • Databases and key value stores like MySQL, MongoDB, or Redis

  • Distributed streaming platforms like Kafka or AWS Kinesis

  • Monitoring and alerting tools like Grafana and Sensu


EEO statement:
2U is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans’ status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. 2U’s equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits, pay and dismissal.


Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

item.title: Senior AI Architect (JVM, Machine & Deep Learning) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact

As Zalando transforms from a pure online retailer to a fashion platform, we bring fashion competency and branding expertise to the game by connecting all the players in the industry: consumers, stylists, designers, brands, influencers, and, online and offline stores. By providing a bold mix of global brands, local designers and specialist labels, we create fresh concepts, high-impact campaigns, smart applications and innovative partnerships.

We are now searching for a Senior AI Architect to join our Search & Personalisation department. In this role, you will create an overarching AI strategy and drive our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.



You Are Setting Standards

Vision. You'll define the strategy and roadmap for analytics, deep learning frameworks, and pioneer the vision to the organization.

Implementation. As part of a growing, multi-disciplinary team of Data Scientists and Research Engineers you'll build AI architecture and develop solutions to reinforce the value of data and analytics.

Hands-on. You'll provide hands-on support to complex business and technology piloting projects in order to apply theory to solve real-world problems.

Mission. You'll cultivate and disperse knowledge and best practices on AI architecture and design development within the engineering team.

Ownership.You'll be the owner of Zalando's Global AI architecture documentation and ensure its consistency and alignment with various engineering stakeholders.

Team play. You'll embrace architecture development as a collective effort and share your knowledge through coaching, peer reviews, articles, and tech talks.



You Are

Passionate about Deep Learning. You are a proud PhD degree holder in Computer Science, Computer Architecture, Deep Learning or a related field.

Experienced (on a senior level). You can impress us with 12+ years of professional hands-on experience as a (senior) engineer and architect. Your experience is derived from distributed large scale applications requiring research integrations, such as search and personalization or price forecasting systems.

Polyglot. You bring an expert level programming skills with Java and JVM based languages, like Scala, and ideally Python.

Skilled. You have experience in one or more of the following areas: artificial intelligence, large-scale data mining and machine learning, (including a solid understanding of DL fundamentals).

Enthusiastic about solving hard business problems. You love data and analytics in balance with open source technologies.

Armed with soft skills. Your effective communication skills paired with your strong analytical competence allows you to simplify complex information and problems.



You Will Benefit From

Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.



Want To Join Us?

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact us via email: Magdalena Masluk-Meller.

item.title: DWH/Database Engineer at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
From a technology perspective, we have thousands of sensors with our own firmware installed in our customers’ retail stores around the world. We process terabytes of data via machine learning algorithms and provide a self-service platform for our analytics solutions. We offer a great opportunity for personal and professional growth in a multicultural environment. We work, learn and develop while having lots of fun on the way.

Join our team as a DWH/Database Engineer.

What we do all day:
We create a beautiful self-service platform for our analytics solutions using modern tools and libaries. We process, query and analyze terabytes of sensor and geospatial advertising data. We work in cross-functional teams in order to create a premium experience for our customers. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a good fit.


Skills & Requirements


Required skills:
- You love working with data (RDBMS (Postgres), NoSQL (Cassandra), sorted column-stores (Redshift/Vertica))
- You have strong SQL modeling and optimization knowledge for different analytics workloads and scenarios
- Good experience with at least one (scripting) language, preferably Python
- You find and share best-practices with team members
- You pay attention to details and identify potential performance weak spots

Appreciated skills:
- You are knowledgeable with BI tools such as Tableau

item.title: Java Autonomous Driving at TomTom (ód, Poland)
item.description:
Where do you want to be…in a year, in 5 years?


What if you had the opportunity to achieve more in less time then you could ever imagine?


At TomTom, you can.


Did you know that TomTom had Mobile Mapping technology 5 years before Google? At TomTom we capture petabytes of data with our vans driving across the world. We collect imagery, laser point clouds, inertial data and other sensor output.


Sound good so far?


Here’s a little taste of your challenge:



  • Do you need to quickly view how the street looks like in any part of collected world?

  • Do you want to automatically recognize all road signs placed along the road from Berlin to Paris?

  • Do you want to fully reconstruct 3D model of million kilometers of highways in Europe?

  • You’ve got it! Such kind of problems is what our team deals with regularly.


Where do you want to be?


We are looking for the best and brightest minds in engineering who will design and build scalable data processing systems in highly innovative area of business.



  • If you have ever asked yourself how big IT players build their systems

  • If you are curious how petabytes of data are organized to be useful

  • If you are interested in computer vision or signal processing

  • If you  want to see how cars scan 3D world with laser sensors

  • If you are interested in distributed services or cloud computing

  • Or maybe you love math and algorithms

  • If you want to take part in building new, innovative software

  • If you want to change the world (or just have a good time trying…)


 …then wait no more. Join our team and see it live on the job.


Learn more about Demonstrating Lane Level Localization for Autonomous Driving or


RoadDNA Localisation

item.title: Senior Engineer at EE (City of London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Engineer

Location: London/Leeds

Salary: £Competitive + benefits



The job:

We're EE. And we're the future of digital. As the #1 brand in an innovative, dynamic industry, we're transforming the way our 32 million customers connect with the world around them, and with us. We pride ourselves on being a truly digital-first business - whether we're providing top notch technology or smarter smartphone deals, we recognise that as the UK's biggest, fastest network, we're being trusted to improve digital lives. So we need to make sure the EE experience is the very best it can be. And that means supporting brilliant people in a collaborative culture that puts customers first. Our Digital team is at the very heart of that. This talented bunch are shaping the way we bring the right products to the right people at every stage of the EE journey. It's their impact on the way we do business that's inspired us to invest in a brand new digital infrastructure. And it's why we want to invest in you.

We're looking for a Senior Engineer with the technical expertise and strategic vision to keep us ahead of the competition. You'll manage the continuous evolution of our key systems and champion the appropriate technology and framework choices that will define how we achieve outstanding customer service, satisfaction and commercial return. You'll be designing and developing software solutions acutely aligned to the business' objectives and be responsible for implementing these using both internal and external partners. We need someone fanatical about innovation and new technology who has the passion to get others excited and turn ideas into action.

What you'll do:
  • Develop first class code as part of an Agile development team
  • Work on one of the UK's busiest eCommerce websites in a fast paced and friendly environment
  • Mentor junior developers, manage code reviews and ensure quality code delivery from other members of the team
  • Progress or develop skills in Adobe Experience Manager Java component development
  • Work closely with product owners and business stakeholders to create software that delivers real business value
  • Help create standards for all technical input and assist in ensuring compliance
  • Act as an internal consultant, offering strategic guidance and technical leadership as required
  • Proactively champion existing and emerging technology wherever it can improve outputs.


You'll definitely:
  • Have solid experience in Java development and be able to pickup new technology quickly
  • Personable and able to both fit into the team and work alongside senior business stakeholders
  • Be self starting and enthusiastic about new technology
  • Care about crafting great quality code




You might even:
  • Have an understanding of the telecoms industry
  • Have experience working on business-critical, high availability systems
  • Have past Devops experience




What's in it for you?
  • Competitive salary
  • Pension
  • Healthcare Cash Plan
  • Bonus
  • Life Assurance
  • 25 days' holiday
  • 75% discount on your personal EE mobile phone package
  • 30% Friends and Family discount from day one (conditions apply)
  • Other discounted products and services, as well as a range of other benefits




At EE, we're creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed. Diversity makes sense for us, for our customers and for our future. We value different perspectives, skills and experiences, and welcome applications from all sections of the community.

If you're thinking about working for the UK's biggest and fastest network, why not follow our shiny new recruitment channels on Twitter, LinkedIn and Glassdoor. Packed with the latest jobs, company news and career stories it could be a great move.

a10:author.a10:name: AVANCE Gesellschaft für Marketing und Vertrieb mbH

item.title: Web Developer (Fullstack) (w/m) at AVANCE Gesellschaft für Marketing und Vertrieb mbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du hast einen Background in HTML, Javascript, Java, o.ä. und verbindest auch noch am liebsten beide Welten - Frontend und Backend? Du interessierst Dich für die Entwicklung von Websites, die Implementierung von Content Management Systemen oder individuelle Softwarelösungen mit Hilfe von verschiedenen Web-Frameworks?


Dann lies gleich weiter, denn dann bist du genau richtig bei uns!



Das bringst Du mit.



  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker, vergleichbares Studium oder einschlägige Berufserfahrung

  • Erste praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Softwareentwicklung (Front- und/oder Backend) und Content Management Systemen

  • moderne, strukturierte und gut durchdachte Entwicklung von Software auf Basis von beispielsweise Javascript, Java, Scala, PHP oder gerne auch Python, Ruby o.a.

  • ein grundlegendes Wissen über Datenbanken

  • Verständnis für moderne Entwicklungs-, Testing- und CI-Prozesse

  • Teamfähigkeit, Engagement und Offenheit, Spaß am Programmieren



Wie Arbeiten Wir?


Unser offenes und neugieriges, 14-köpfiges Team besteht aus Frontend- und Backend-Spezialisten/-innen, die


gemeinsam sehr große und auch mal kleine Websites, mobile Apps und individuelle Webanwendungen entwickeln.



Arbeitsweise und Projekte.


Als Agentur entwickeln wir sehr vielseitige Kunden-Projekte, beispielsweise:



  • Corporate Websites großer Kunden mit einem Java-basierten Enterprise-CMS, inklusive Anbindung komplexer SQLDatenbanken und Management der Infrastruktur mit DevOps-Methoden

  • Web Apps auf Basis von HTML5 und einem REST-Backend auf Basis von bspw. Angular, Playframework und MongoDB

  • Microservices, die zum Beispiel als hoch-performante Play-basierte Suchanwendung eine Standard-CMS-Website ergänzen

  • neue Technologien wie personalisierter Cross-Channel-Content mit dem CMS Bloomreach DXP / Hippo CMS



In Sachen Backend sind wir gerne "reactive" und entwickeln leichtgewichtige und hoch-performante Anwendungen mit z.B. Play, Akka und MongoDB. Wir können aber auch Java EE, das als Basis für das Bloomreach Experience / Hippo CMS richtig Spaß machen kann. Genauso spielen auch Typo3 und PHP bei uns eine Rolle, und im Frontend sind wir mit Angular oder Ionic unterwegs, schauen uns aber gerne auch neue Dinge an wie Typescript, React oder vue.js. Aktuell stellen wir unsere Projekte und unsere eigene Infrastruktur auf DevOps-Praktiken um: Docker, Ansible und


Jenkins sind dabei unsere Lieblings-Tools.



Warum AVANCE?


Ein hoch motiviertes Team mit starkem digitalem und technischem Background ist gespannt auf Dich!


Du hast die freie Wahl der Entwicklungswerkzeuge (Mac oder PC, IntelliJ oder Emacs). Einmal im Monat nutzen wir im gesamten Team einen ganzen Tag, um uns mit neuen Technologien zu beschäftigen oder eigene Projekte anzugehen. Darüber hinaus gibt es auf Dich abgestimmte Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten, die Möglichkeit zum Home Office, flexible Arbeitszeiten und betriebliche Altersvorsorge sowie Mitarbeiterevents und ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld in unserer Altbauvilla mit Garten, Terrasse und Grill. Als Agentur bietet sich für jeden die Möglichkeit, auch über den eigenen fachlichen Tellerrand zu blicken und sich mit Kollegen aus Design, Kreation, Konzept und Marketing auszutauschen und zusammen zu arbeiten. AVANCE ist mit über 80 Mitarbeitern von Stuttgart und München aus für Kunden in ganz Deutschland und der Schweiz tätig, u. a. für Allianz, Michelin, Commerzbank, Festool, Schweizerische Post, Daimler, AVIS, Zürich Versicherung, Sunrise, Duravit, Know How AG und Object Carpet.



Das ist unser Kontakt:


Karen Bodamer freut sich auf Deine Bewerbung. Am meisten dann, wenn sie mit Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnissen,


Arbeitsbeispielen sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung komplett ist und per E-Mail an folgende Adresse kommt:


jobs@avance-marketing.de.



Noch Fragen? Gerne anrufen! 0711-123 500-33


Oder besuche uns auf: www.avance-marketing.de.

item.title: DevOps Engineer Cybersecurity at Sophos (Abingdon, UK)
item.description:
As a security company, Sophos takes its own security very importantly and has an internal IT Security team which focuses on protecting Sophos’ own systems and infrastructure.


This role is for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our Cyber Security Engineering Team
This a great opportunity to help secure a world-leading security company. As you’d expect you’ll be joining an organisation that takes security very seriously. You will get the opportunity to work with some world-leading experts from across the company in a fast-paced & exciting environment where security is a priority. 


You will be designing and building our detection solutions for our security operations centre, building the next generation of threat hunting tooling and contributing to the open source community.
Working with leading commercial and open source tools to keep our on premise and cloud infrastructure secure you will be establishing and maintaining strong links to industry experts and world-class specialist consultants.


You’ll need to be highly motivated, have an innovative mind-set and able to clearly articulate complex technical security issues.



Main Duties



  • Continual improvement of our threat hunting capabilities & tooling.

  • Work with our Red Team to develop detection against their activities.

  • Training and knowledge transfer to peers, the Security Operations Centre and the wider IT team.

  • Opensource tools and papers.

  • Act as a security subject matter expert to support development and operations teams and activities.

  • Design and develop automation to ensure platform, services, and machine security.

  • Develop security monitoring and detection systems. Investigate anomalous events across our service infrastructure and coordinate response with DevOps teams

  • Articulate complex technical security issues into business focused terms and communicate to stakeholders.

  • Have and maintain (via conferences, etc) a great knowledge of infosec industry trends and developments and advise on changes to the threat landscape.

  • Identify, propose and initiate improvements to the organisation’s security posture.

  • Investigation & root cause analysis of security events & incidents escalated from our security operation centre.


Special Conditions



  • Occasionally required to be available out-of-hours.

  • Some global travel may be required



Experience and Skills



Essential



  • Development experience, Python, 

  • Experience with secure development

  • Cross-platform knowledge of Enterprise IT infrastructure (Networking, Operating Systems, Databases, etc).

  • Strong interpersonal skills.

  • Experience with cloud security architectures – particularly AWS and the related tooling

  • Deep knowledge of Operating system internals across Linux & Windows.



Desirable



  • Experience with SIEM solutions - Splunk, Kibana, Logstash, Sumo Logic or similar.

  • Deep understanding of SDLC and DevOps.

  • Understanding of TCP-IP and Packet Captures

  • Experience working in a global environment.

  • Contributions to open-source security projects and/or publications.

  • Knowledge of Sophos products.

  • Hands on experience of network, memory and host forensics.

  • Hands on experience investigating & responding to comprises by advanced attackers


Qualifications


Essential



  • Educated to bachelor degree level or relevant experience.



Desirable



  • Security-related professional certification (Crest CRIA/CCNIA/CCMRE/CCHIA, SANS GIAC, GCIH, GPEN, GCFA)






NOTICE TO RECRUITERS & PLACEMENT AGENCIES
If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Sophos prior to having a signed agreement from Human Resources. Sophos is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Sophos and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention. Thank you.

item.title: Senior Developer for Cloud Protection at F-Secure (Helsingfors, Finland)
item.description:
At F-Secure, we are committed to helping people and businesses be free in the digital world, without having to worry about cyber security.


Corporate Cyber Security Business R&D develops and delivers the products used by F-Secures B2B partners and end customers. We are a flat and agile software R&D organization consisting of Software Developers, Test Automation Specialists and Software Architects. We work closely with Product Management, who set high-level directions that we turn into product features and functionalities. We also work very closely with F-Secure Labs, who analyze cyber threats on a daily basis so we can understand how to beat the bad guys. F-Secure is very much a product organization, and without R&D, the majority of our B2B business wouldn’t exist.

We've been working years to acquire and retain highly skilled individuals, do you want to be part of us?


This position plays an integral role in developing F-Secure Cloud Protection offering, with aim to become the most relevant Cyber security vendor in platforms and technologies protecting users, data and apps in the cloud.


Key responsibilities in this role




  • Maintaining existing and developing next versions of Cloud Protection solution




  • Planning, estimating and executing design and development tasks




  • Researching and prototyping new features and technologies




  • Participating in threat modeling and security tests/assesment




  • Maintain and improve CI/CD tools




What we offer




  • Work in the domain of Cyber security




  • Privilege to work with like-minded, curious and ambitious professionals who will teach you and learn from you a lot




  • Competitive salary & benefits package












What we expect you to have:




  • Strong problem solving skills and proven capabilities to get things done




  • Quality minded approach in all work and team player attitude




  • Capabilities to quickly learn new stuff and work in fast changing environment




  • Solid Python programming experience




  • Good level knowledge of modern cloud, web and database technologies/frameworks




  • Knowledge of Agile software development and DevOps




  • Good level of English (written and spoken)




We also value experience of the following:




  • Programming experience with Java, JavaScript, C# and/or Salesforce Apex languages




  • Familiar with development for Salesforce.com, Office 365 and/or other business cloud-based applications




  • Work experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure) and tools for orchestrating automated deployments




  • Experience with CI and VCS tools (Jenkins, Git, etc.)




  • Experience of threat modeling and other SW security practices

item.title: Senior PHP/Node.js/C++ developer - Full Time - 100% Remote EU Time Zone at Cvedia Limited (Madrid, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
About the job


This is a remote, full time, long term position. As a developer in our team you will take full responsibility of your modules in a process intensive system. You will take charge of the development process from gathering requirements and system design through to the UI mockups and front end development. We require a high level of understanding the business logic involved and a critical mind to design and implement it effectively.


Experience with the following is desired



  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Working remotely with a team in multiple timezones.

  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity.

  • The ability to understand what the users and the business need.



  • Must Have: System analysis, data modelling, business process diagrams, data flow diagrams, UML.

  • Full stack development experience designing and building high volume, scalable, modular applications from top to bottom

  • Extensive proficiency with at least two RDBMSes

  • Solid professional experience in OOP using php and preferably python too.

  • Version Control

  • Linux server administration





How should you apply for this job?


Please provide your github repository


Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.


We will not reply to 3rd party software/employees agencies


Please state on the mail subject the job position and the state you reside.


Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.





Application process:


Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.


We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.


1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!





What we offer:


Job location is in Cyberspace.


Communication with the all team members is done through Skype


Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.


Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer


Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)

item.title: Backend Developer (Java) at Dojo Madness GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Backend Developer (Java) to support our team in Berlin office.
As a Backend Developer (Java) at DOJO Madness, you design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions. You will help to shape an architecture that scales and allows for rapid feature development and testing to adjust to our ever-changing demand. Driven by a culture of gaming passion, clear communication, and the urge for improvement you will become part of the DOJO team.


Your Responsibilities:

item.title: Software Engineer Angular at bexio AG (Rapperswil-Jona, Schweiz)
item.description:
Deine Aufgabe: 


Frontend Engineering:



  • Konzeption und Programmierung von Javascript-Applikationen mit Angular und AngularJS oder ähnlichen JS-Frameworks

  • Aufbau von automatisierten Tests

  • Erstellung von wiederverwendbaren Komponenten

  • Mitbestimmung der Frontendarchitektur

  • Erweiterung und Pflege bestehender Module

  • Aufbau eines automatisierten Builds mit gulp, npm, etc


Du passt gut zu uns, wenn du gerne in einem jungen Team arbeitest und das Web und dessen Möglichkeiten liebst und verstehst. Wir bieten dir Freiraum für deine Ideen, moderne Arbeitsplätze und angemessene Entlöhnung bei flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen.


Was du mitbringen solltest:

Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld selbstständig zu arbeiten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen. Wir legen viel Wert auf individuelle Weiterentwicklung.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Kubernetes/AWS) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Zalando is transforming from an e-commerce company into a multi-service platform that provides fashion as a service. We make it our mission to imagine and predict the infinite points of interaction between fashion and people, and develop the technology to make them possible. The 1,600+ members of Zalando Technology across our offices in Germany, Ireland and Finland build most of our 40+ platform products in-house and open source - from Smart Logistics to Brand Solutions to Payments and Warehouse Management.

At the core of our platform effort is the technical infrastructure - we work with a modern, cloud-native technology stack comprised of Kubernetes, Docker, AWS and Go. We offer our infrastructure as a service to more than 200 development teams in Zalando Tech that are running their applications on our clusters. Read our Kubernetes on AWS doc to learn how we run Kubernetes on AWS in production and check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.

YOUR ROLE



  • Working on the line between Software Engineering and Systems Engineering

  • Curious and a step ahead when it comes to software trends

  • A natural leader who takes ownership of the team's deliveries

  • Willing to take responsibility for running an important part of our infrastructure




WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Proficiency in at least one high-level programming language, knowing Go is a plus

  • In-depth understanding of UNIX/Linux system internals and TCP/IP networking

  • Well-versed in scripting (Bash/Python) and infrastructure automation

  • Good knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms and data structures)

  • A track record of running large-scale systems

  • Knowing containers, especially Docker, Kubernetes and AWS is a big plus

  • Cloud native mindset, including microservices, resilience and scale-out




WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Open Source. We work on open source software and actively participate in the Kubernetes community

  • Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 100+ internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events

  • Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice

  • Personal Development. Tour of Mastery (individual growth plan), extensive onboarding program, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences

  • Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours




Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Maria Garcia.

item.title: Front-end Engineer at Dubizzle - an OLX company (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
Our profile


Are you a talented super ninja programmer? Do you know when and how to wrangle state through prototypes and write higher order react components which almost think for themselves? Do you know that with such power comes great responsibility?


Interested in being part of a platform that handles millions of requests per day? Continuous integration, auto-scaled rolling releases, event-driven micro-service architectures are all part of the daily gig.


Do you value openness, transparency and empowerment? dubizzle "Squads" are high performing x-functional teams set with a mission to provide win-win exchanges for our beloved users. We don't believe in monkeys-on-keyboards, we believe engineers are central to the problem discovery process, which is why we let teams own the "what and how" of their respective missions.


Why classifieds you might ask? Sound boring at first? We don't think so! We disrupt consumer exploitation, reinvigorate economies in emerging markets, and keep the world's carbon footprint low through second-hand trade. Don't use your iphone 6 anymore? #itsworthmore than you think! Let a father skype home to his family and kids with your used phone. Let's redistribute the world's unwanted possessions to new owners!


dubizzle is the biggest online classifieds marketplace in the UAE. We believe in fairness, honesty, transparency and ambition. We're humble but confident, irreverent and able to laugh at ourselves, but above all - we badasses. We pick fights with our competitors, move swiftly, nimbly and with agility - at a pace unmatched by others (some might even say 88mph). We are here to build the best platform the Middle East has ever seen and anyone who doesn't have the same goals should look elsewhere!


Coming from abroad? Want a tax free salary, private medical insurance for you and your family, flight tickets home once a year on the house….oh and all the cookies you can eat in the pantry??


Join dubizzle today!


Job Objective


Liaises with the other back end and front end engineers within your product stream, the QA team, the design team and your Tech Team Leads. As a Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for advancing our development stack and ensuring scale as we grow to millions of monthly active users across many countries.


Tasks & Responsibilities



  • Backend Engineers build and maintain robust APIs - from the service that powers them right down to the line of code that perfects them.

  • They ensure all our services are healthy, monitored, automated, and designed to scale.

  • You'll work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues.

  • You will support a wide range of products focusing on automation, availability and performance, and above all reliability as well as supporting mobile engineers and business intelligence leading up to, during and after each sprint.

  • You will live true to our ambitions of building an industry leading platform which is relentlessly focussed on innovation.

  • Develop elegant solutions for complex problems;

  • Write and maintain exemplary code following dubizzle’s programming practices;

  • Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our product and the position of your product stream in it;

  • Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale;

  • Ensure feature comparability across multiple browsers & platforms;

  • Identify & address performance issues;

  • Handle the entire software development life cycle, end to end.


Knowledge & Experience



  • Excellent understanding of HTML, CSS & JavaScript;

  • Experience with Mobile-first & Responsive web design methodologies;

  • Fair knowledge of preprocessors such as Sass (preferably), Stylus or LESS;

  • Fair understanding of BEM, OOCSS or SMACSS methodologies;

  • Essential understanding of JavaScript libraries, patterns & methodologies (jQuery, AJAX, Modernizr, etc...);

  • Experience with testing and developing across multiple browsers while maintaining a consistent experience;

  • Fair understanding of MVC frameworks (Ember, Angular, Backbone or React);

  • Understanding of build tools like Gulp or Webpack;

  • Knowledge of Node.js;

  • Understanding of package management tools like bower & NPM;

  • Fair understanding of AMD, UMD & Common JS patterns;

  • Understanding of client-side performance issues;

  • Good eye for design and UX;

  • Experience with writing modular & reusable code;

  • Understanding of version control systems (git);

  • Understands how to use command line;

  • Good understanding for using graphic applications like Photoshop, Illustrator or Sketch;

  • Experience with Python/Django is a plus;

  • JavaScript testing experience is a plus;

  • Experience with internationalization and working on websites with multiple languages is a plus.


Qualifications & specialist skills



  • 3+ years of experience in a similar role;

  • 3+ years of experience in Javascript;

  • 3+ years of experience in analysis, design, coding and implementation of next generation web applications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent field;


Competencies



  • Problem solving; Analytical thinking; Conceptual thinking; Detail oriented;

  • Excellent communication & interpersonal skills. This is an absolute must. We have heated debates around complicated subjects and you will be expected to defend your points of view.

  • Ability to prioritize tasks and quickly adjust in a rapidly changing environment;


Professional behaviours


If you value autonomy, innovation and our corporate values, send your application – we need you!

item.title: Cloud Engineer- Docker Infrastructure- Leading Open Source Company at Elastic () (allows remote)

Elastic is building out our Elastic Cloud Team focusing on Elastic as a Service. This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at RTB House (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description:
Twoja rola:



  • Projektowanie i tworzenie wewntrznych i zewntrznych narzdzi oraz aplikacji webowych (w technologii Single Page App + REST API)

  • Dbanie o wygod uytkowania tworzonych narzdzi (usability)

  • Kompleksowa opieka nad budowanymi systemami (od poprawnego dziaania kodu po stronie przegldarki, po prawidow integracj z back-endem oraz systemami zewntrznymi)


 
Ty :



  • Bardzo dobrze znasz aktualne wersje JavaScript/ES6, HTML i CSS

  • Swobodnie posugujesz si przynajmniej jedn z popularnych platform back-endowych (Python/Flask, Node/Express, PHP/Laravel)

  • Masz przynajmniej podstawowe dowiadczenie z Linux-em oraz    Bash-em

  • Znasz lub chcesz pozna frameworki React, SemanticUI, KendoUI

  • Swobodnie posugujesz si SQL-em (PostgreSQL, MySQL)

  • Uywasz Gita lub innego systemu wersjonowania kodu

  • Orientujesz si w technologicznym wiecie, ledzisz newsy, blogi

  • Nie boisz si Big Data (Hadoop, Google Cloud Platform)

  • Angaujesz si w powierzone zadania, dbajc o jako tworzonego produktu

  • Jeste gotów szybko zdobywa wiedz oraz umiejtnoci



My:



  • Dziaamy w niewielkich, zwinnych zespoach o duej samodzielnoci i decyzyjnoci

  • Oferujemy dostp do najnowszych technologii w tworzonych projektach

  • Budujemy software dla siebie, a nie na zlecenie

  • Umoliwiamy bardzo elastyczny czas pracy

  • Mamy siedzib w nowoczesnym budynku tu obok stacji metra Wierzbno
