item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer - ReactJS Redux at Chegg (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Senior UI/UX Developer / Senior Front-End Engineer / Senior Web Developer / Senior Web Application Developer


Engineering | San Francisco, CA


SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Organization: Chegg Tutoring Platform Team


Chegg Tutors is an online learning platform that allows students to get help from high-quality tutors on demand and at affordable prices. Every day thousands of live lesson hours happen on our platform. We’re reimagining the online tutoring business, pushing the boundaries of learning on the web.  


As a part of the Chegg Tutors Engineering team, you will help to build a cutting-edge platform that will define the future of online learning. In this role, your strong skills and knowledge in modern web platforms, frameworks, and techniques will be put to the test while you help students save time, save money, and get smarter.


About the Engineering Team:


Chegg's Engineering team is a group of passionate engineers who, in close collaboration with data scientists, product managers, designers, and UX researchers, build the future of the online education industry. We build our products to scale and to last, we don’t take shortcuts (hello tests and documentation), and we take pride in delivering high-quality solutions on time.


What You’ll Do



  • Create and present full-stack architecture for complex technological challenges

  • Implement end-to-end solutions in code, leading junior engineers to help you

  • Be a role model for code quality, accuracy, and perfection of your solutions

  • Communicate and collaborate with product managers, designers, researchers, and data scientists to deliver the best user experience

  • Maintain full visibility of the status of the projects for which you are responsible

  • Continuously look for ways to improve our product and processes, provide feedback

  • Create documentation and teach at regular learning sessions

  • Have fun


Requirements



  • BS (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related discipline

  • 5+ years of experience developing web applications with modern JavaScript programming frameworks, tooling, and libraries like React

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals with competencies in software design, data structures, and problem-solving

  • Expert knowledge of vanilla JavaScript, CSS, HTML

  • Expert knowledge of at least one popular JS framework: React / Angular / Backbone etc.

  • Experience with CSS processors: SASS (preferable), LESS

  • Experience with building tools: WebPack (preferable), Gulp etc.

  • Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive


Bonus Points



  • Knowledge of Java, Python, and/or Django

  • Familiarity with a modularization API such as RequireJS or AMD

  • Familiarity with front-end testing tools such as Mocha, Chai, or Karma

  • Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS

  • Experience with Unix command line, commonly used POSIX commands 


About Chegg:


As the leading student-first connected learning platform, Chegg's Student Hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, CA with offices in San Francisco, New York, Portland, India, Israel, Berlin, and Ukraine. Chegg Student Hub Services Include: Chegg Study, Tutoring, Writing Tools, Math Help, Test Prep, Careers Search, Internship Admissions, and College Admissions. 


Life at Chegg: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo


Chegg Benefits: http://www.chegg.com/jobs/benefits
Chegg for Good: http://blog.chegg.com/category/chegg-for-good/


Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2015: http://bit.ly/GDBPTW 


For more information, visit www.chegg.com


Chegg is an equal opportunity employer


#LI-AH1

item.title: DevOps Engineer (m/f) at relayr GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices. Join relayr and build the future today.


Relayr is bringing things to life. We have three technical pillars: an Internet of Things Platform as a Service, open SDKs and a Hardware development platforms designed to allow developers and enterprises to quickly build Internet of Things solutions.


We have a growing number of internal and client projects and are looking for an enthusiastic DevOps Engineer to join our international team in Berlin.


Your Tasks:



  • Help build out and scale our platform cluster (AWS, Baremetal, different cloud and virtualization platforms)

  • Help development team to clusterize and scale all application components

  • Strive for many 9’s of uptime

  • Develop Continuous Deployment and Monitoring strategies

  • Help develop long term strategies


Your Skills:



  • A minimum of 3 years experience.

  • Experience in scaling applications, working with clusters

  • Experience with modern tools like Mesos, Consul, Swarm, Docker

  • Understanding of administration of Big Data tools like Cassandra, Kafka, etc.

  • Experience working with Cloud Providers (AWS is a significant bonus)

  • Command line and shell scripting are your friends, languages such as Python, Go and Ruby are constant companions.

  • Deep knowledge of Linux operating system (particularly Debian based)

  • Knowledge of TCP networking stack and ability to design firewalls and security rules. (iptables, ipfw, selinux)

  • Bonus: You have experience with Scala and NodeJs and can dive just a little deeper than reading the stack trace when something goes wrong in production


We Offer:



  • Flexible office environment 

  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 20+ languages, of all ages and parental-status

  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe

  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing and an expanding library of books

  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline

  • Competitive Salary and Stock Options

  • Cool office located in Kreuzberg with a relaxation room, standing-desks, 3D printer and free fruit and drinks

  • Free German courses at intermediate and advanced level (Working language is English)

  • We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!


Sounds interesting? Please follow the link to apply for this position: https://relayr.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=5

item.title: Senior Software Developer / Team Lead - Full Stack Engineer at AdeptMind Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Our current engineering efforts focus on vertical expansion: building more tools and services. Current projects ranges from creating internal service to providing command line utilities as well large scale crawling and data processing.


As a senior engineer / team lead, you are expected to be the top performer of your team as well as guiding your team members through the entire life cycle of software development. This is more than a typical engineering, but we know you, the ambitious type, are ready for the challenge. We're asking for a rock star, and you will be treated like such. Please contact us to find out what we have to offer.


--


What you'll do:



  • Manage continuous delivery of Adeptmind’s products

  • Develop high performance / extensible data processing system

  • Lead development of internal tools / services

  • Use and contribute to internal build / deployment system


You should be able to check off most things from this list:



  • Experience with the Linux stack(bash, git, package management etc.)

  • Algorithm, data structure and object oriented programming skills

  • Proficiency in Python, Java and Javascript/Typescript

  • Ability to navigate large scale system for both debugging and development

  • Hands on experience managing AWS to fulfill needs of internal development


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with team software development process: design, testing, coding and peer reviews

  • Management skill for both self management and project management

  • Experience with distributed system development

  • Experience in DevOps

  • Familiarity with data platforms: MongoDB, SQL, Lucence, ElasticSearch, etc.

  • Proficient in MapReduce, Spark, etc.


Perks:



  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience/qualification: 100K-150K with equity

  • Regular learning activities: latest paper, neat techniques, best practices

  • Flat organization structure set up to help people succeed

  • Smart and knowledgeable colleagues

  • And of course, catered meals managed by food expert


--


Of course, life in a young startup can get hectic. But we spend just as much, if not more, effort to grow our engineers as well. We actively hold technical seminars, send our people to conferences and initiate manageable research project. We believe a company cannot grow until the people can.


Let us know if you feel like working here!

item.title: Enterprise Data Scientist (Senior Role) at Philip Morris International (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you ready to crunch any data to generate business value? Do you know when to use ANOVA and when to use Kruskal-Wallis test? Are you fluent in Python and do you know what is necessary to produce high quality code for analytics? Have you been working in a multidisciplinary environment using agile methodology? With this skillset, you are an ideal fit for our Enterprise Analytics and Data Management department and we would like to hear from you!


What do we do?


We invent and implement algorithms, we design and build analytical pipelines – all with leveraging from domains like statistics, machine learning, information and graph theory, data mining, optimization, complex network analysis etc. We work in international teams with huge cultural diversity and we interact not only with other fellow data scientists, but also with data engineers, DevOps, business owners, data architects, security and privacy experts, etc. We mostly write our analytical code in Python, but we're not afraid of R, Java and even Scala. Last but not least, we are strong supporters of Open Source.


Whom are we looking for?


·As an ideal candidate, you:


·have an MSc or a PhD degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Electrical Engineering or related field.


·have a proven track record of putting data science to work in domains such as FMCG, Finance & Banking, Telco, Transportation, etc.


·have a proven track record of hiring, training and retaining data science talents.


·know how to make your research reproducible.


·have solid understanding of data structures and algorithms, specifically advanced statistics and machine learning.


·are experienced with commonly used Big Data technology stack such as Hadoop Data Platform, Spark, Solr, Zeppelin, to name a few.


·know how to create stunning visualizations of data insights and how to deliver thrilling presentations to non-tech savvy audience.


·have experience working in multidisciplinary teams.


·have SCRUM certification.


·know what GitFlow and Pull Requests are and how to use them.


·know what continuous delivery and continuous deployment are and how data scientists can benefit from it.


What awaits you?


Within the Enterprise Analytics and Data Managements global function you can use your talents to tackle enterprise-wide challenges and help in shaping up our smoke-free future. As you move up the career ladder or if you would like to explore new business areas, we support your professional and personal development through continuous trainings, conference participation, mentorship etc. We also provide you with opportunities to put your ideas into practice across all levels of the company.


In return we offer:



  • Truly dynamic worldwide team dedicated to a bold new vision

  • Amazing career opportunities across the globe

  • Working for a certified Global Top Employer and multi-awarded company (https://www.pmi.com/careers/our-awards)

item.title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer at BuzzFeed (London, UK)
item.description:
BuzzFeed is seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to help build and operate the infrastructure that powers our products. This is a huge opportunity to be part of a growing team and help shape the way we develop, deploy, and operate production quality systems.


We’re looking for individuals who have the scars of building and operating large scale and high traffic services and are interested in applying that experience to building tools and systems of automation that respect the human element of operations.


We offer competitive compensation with stock options, full benefits (401k matching), and tasty perks - including catered lunch twice a week, a well stocked kitchen and bagel Fridays. We host team outings and special events like music breaks and summer film series.


We have engineering wide Hack Weeks and we deeply value open source, giving back to the community by speaking, hosting user groups and contributing to projects we benefit from.


About The Job:



  • Build and maintain core infrastructure, including the platform that all other products and services depend on

  • Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation

  • Collaborate with product and engineering in the design and architecture of systems

  • Reports to the Senior Director of Engineering, Infrastructure


About You:



  • You are empathetic, curious, and pragmatic

  • You have emotional intelligence

  • You take initiative

  • You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

  • You care about “the engineering experience”

  • You mentor and facilitate the growth of the people around you

  • You carefully weigh the tradeoffs of any technology, knowing that they are simply tools that help you achieve your goals

  • You think of systems as modular and composable services

  • You take pride in discovering simple and elegant solutions to complex problems

  • You are constantly learning and re-evaluating previous assumptions

  • You value repeatability, resilience, observability, and operational simplicity

  • You follow the “continuous delivery” model


You Are Familiar With:



  • Python / Go

  • AWS

  • Linux (Ubuntu)

  • Source Control (Git)

  • Databases (MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch)

  • Messaging systems (NSQ, Kafka, RabbitMQ)

  • Config Management (Chef, Ansible)

  • Infrastructure Tools (Docker, Consul, Kubernetes)

  • Continuous Integration (Jenkins)

  • Monitoring / Instrumentation (Nagios, Munin, Graphite, Ganglia, StatsD)

  • Team “White and Gold” vs team “Blue and Black”

Optionally:

  • Play framework

  • Jenkins

item.title: Data Scientist - Payments at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make an Impact

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

You Are Setting Standards

Variety. As a team you will research, design and implement machine learning algorithms to improve our payment solutions.
Ownership. You will be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment.
Excellence. Share your knowledge and passion about delivering scalable real-world machine learning solutions to end users, and help your colleagues excel.

You Are Skilled

Technologies. You have already worked with big data frameworks before (we use Apache Spark). You are eager to prototype new machine learning concepts (in R or Python) and are also able to push them all the way to production. You also have experience building production systems at scale (experience in Scala or Java is a plus).
You have experience in applied machine learning and know at least one of the following methods in depth (regression, tree-based methods, ensemble learning). And you have a good understanding of the mathematical concepts that are frequently used in machine learning (linear algebra, probability theory)
Code Quality. You are ready to deploy your code to production (including testing, CI, deployment) and taking ownership.
Education. You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.) and are eager to keep learning and applying new knowledge.

You Are Offered

Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued; positive, inspiring working atmosphere.
Perks. Competitive salary; great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; office in the heart of Berlin; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services; flexible working times; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays and volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings*. (*Depending on location)
Development. Mentoring; personal branding support focused on leadership; diverse career opportunities.
Peers. International, accomplished experts.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!
If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Maria Garcia

item.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer - Data Science / Analytics at JustGiving - London office (London, UK)
item.description:
Who are we looking for?



  • 5+ years of C# .NET or Scala development

  • 1+ years of modern JavaScript development (React, Redux and Node.js)

  • You’ve used best-of-breed techniques and architectures (e.g. DDD/Event Driven Architecture, TDD/BDD, REST, SOA/micro-services, CQRS)

You will be working to help deliver real-time and offline predictive models and systems, most commonly delivered through REST APIs hosted on Microsoft Azure.


You will be joining a small but effective team of developers and data scientists, bringing a willingness to pitch-in and a desire to learn – an enthusiastic generalist and self-starter looking to break into Data Science and Machine Learning.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at EE (London, UK)
item.description:
Principal Software Engineer - (AWS Cloud)

London/Leeds



The job:

We're showing the UK how technology can make the everyday better. Our people are keeping our customers happy with great service, and our network, which has been named as the best in the UK, is keeping their digital lives connected. Empowered, challenged, supported and rewarded, our people are the key to our success. And the Sunday Times agrees. They've voted EE one of the Best Big Companies to Work For. This is your chance to join us.

Demanding an entrepreneurial approach to new technology, you will support the evolution of the existing cloud based infrastructure service to better utilise off-the-shelf services and tooling. Your knowledge of cloud based services will provide you with the relevant experience to deliver innovative solutions designs that will drive forward improvements in the automated configuration and deployment of the infrastructure.

As well as supporting the technical evolution and design of the infrastructure, working within an agile development team you will provide hands-on development capabilities to deliver the technical evolution. The opportunity to deliver significant service improvement projects and the selection of new technologies and approaches to cloud infrastructure design and automation will develop your technical knowledge, skills and authority. If you thrive on innovation and technical change within the digital space, this is the role for you.



What you will do:
  • Provide technical expertise and leadership to design and deliver a cloud based infrastructure service
  • Develop in-house tooling based on Linux, scripted primarily in Python and Bash, to work with the Amazon AWS API and state-of-the-art configuration management tooling
  • Provide a reliable and respected voice for the cloud based infrastructure supporting several business critical web applications
  • Engage with solutions architects and application technical leads in the delivery of key systems and projects
  • Build relationships and collaborate effectively with product owners, application development teams, technical architects, support teams and external suppliers
  • Provide consultancy and guidance to Digital colleagues on infrastructure and web related issues


You will definitely:
  • Have good experience of software design
  • Have experience with cloud based infrastructure solutions in Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Experience of working within an Agile team
  • Have experience of system administration, automation of system configuration, and debugging in a complex multi-nodal environment
  • Experience with build servers and build pipelines with tools such as Jenkins
  • Be comfortable with writing Python and Bash
  • A good understanding of Linux
  • Be comfortable with basic networking & network design (particularly in AWS).
  • Have experience with Puppet (significant experience is a bonus)
  • Have used Git version control, preferably in a larger team
  • Have familiarity of monitoring and logging solutions in the cloud
  • Have an appetite for debugging demanding applications
  • Be able to juggle conflicting demands on your time and resources
  • Demonstrate good communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Be able to work as part of a team in either our London or Leeds based office

item.title: Junior Full-Stack Developer/DevOps at ABOX42 GmbH (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for:






Junior Full-Stack Developer/DevOps






Location : Karlsruhe (HQ), Germany


We are looking for People with the same mindset, people who have already proven that sporty goals and challenges are two important things in their lives.


Through daily communication with our product management, the team knows the common product objectives and latest developments in the market that affect our products. Everyone on the team wants to be close to the "pulse of the products" and also uses these products at home.


Because of our own requirements as a team and the requirements that our demanding customers have, our goals are also linked to constant learning in new areas. One of the strengths that characterizes us.


But our flexibility as a team also characterizes our success. We quickly respond to changes in the requirements in a well-balanced manner. A property that is highly appreciated by our customers and is represented by everyone in the team.


Product concepts are set up in a way that the team can act in their own responsibility when implementing these concepts. In addition to concepts, each individual in the team, with their roadmaps, progress tracking and quality assurance, creates a high degree of transparency for the daily progress of the implementation. This leads to a high acceptance of the results of each individual in the team.


And we are allowed to be happy, because the daily joy and the best care possible, offered in the company, is an important factor for our motivation in the team.


Your Role:



  • You have two hearts beating in your chest: a quality-conscious developer and a responsible administrator

  • Participation in exciting projects: Implementation of the projects from conception to development and roll-out


Your Qualification:



  • 2-3 years of experience as a Full-Stack Developer/DevOps

  • Good conceptual and analytical thinking and execution

  • Strong Linux and Linux Environment knowledge

  • Good in scripting (Shell/Python)

  • Safe to use with SSH + bash + vim

  • Deep understanding of the development of applications based on Restful APIs and Web socket with: PHP, MySQL

  • Experienced programming of engaging user interfaces, responsive websites in HTML5, JavaScript

  • Fluent English skills in spoken and written English


Your Responsibilities:

  • Testing and Roll-out of new / modified software component

item.title: We handle 24,695 logins per minute! SREs ensure were always on at Sky Betting & Gaming (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
What you tell your friend your friends you do?


Work with the best Technologist arround, on our busiest days we can handle 16,785 bets per minute, 24,695 logins per minute, 17,760 page requests per second!


What you'll be doing?  


As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) you will ensure our customers get the best quality of service and uptime we can give them. Identify where we can expect and how we can tolerate IT failures from our systems as well as those we depend upon.  Work closely with our developers and architects to build and run services and systems that respond consistently to failures by gracefully degrading our services.


Be responsible for ensuring the systems and applications we launch remain available, reliable and efficient at accomplishing their duties even as their duties scale and evolve.  To be involved in every part of our site, from conception of products and their development to deployment, troubleshooting and analysis.  


Design, build and automate tools and processes to ensure and improve scalability, availability and performance across areas of technology.  Build, integrate and run tools to inject, predict and identify infrastructure and service failures on an ongoing basis to help optimize our sites.


How will you be doing this? 


You will use primarily using open source technologies and products in a LAMP environment, so you’ll have extensive commercial experience in supporting and developing high volume commercial web sites using object orientated PHP and MySQL.


Data will underpin your decisions and you will take care to ensure qualitative metrics are held in as high regard as quantitative.


What a day in the office looks like?


Start with a brew (Yorkshire Tea of course!) there will be lots to do.  Deal with any incidents or near misses from the night before. Proceed with any open tickets or attend meetings to plan for the new day.


The team:


Web Operations is made up of 6 engineers that have strong operational backgrounds across a number of disciplines and skills from developers to infrastructure specialists.  The team works both as a central operations function for the entire Bet Tribe and are also embedded in development teams providing operational support, training and guidance.  



Skills and Technologies


The role is multi-disciplinary and benefits from having an varying understanding in the following areas:



  • We are a RHEL/CentOS house so a very good understanding of Linux is essential.

  • We have some typical LAMP stacks, though Mongo, Redis, Memcached and RabbitMQ also feature highly.

  • We write our code in PHP and Javascript, making heavy use of Node.js.  There’s the usual mixture of bash, a little Python, and some Ruby.  Our source control is Git.

  • We make heavy use of Chef for our configuration management but experience of this or other CM tools is necessary.

  • We have heavy integration with OpenBet systems underpinning our sportsbook and gaming services.

  • We make use of Graphite, Grafana, New Relic, Splunk and Opsview for monitoring out services.



  • Experience working in a fast-paced agile development environment.


Why not have a look at the Bet tribe: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlxNSLqiko0



We also offer an attractive relocation package for candidates that live outside the Yorkshire region, including those outside the UK.

item.title: (PHP/Go) Senior Backend Engineer - Change the way people eat forever! at HelloFresh (New York, NY)
item.description:
About the job


We’re hiring for a Senior Backend Engineer to join a newly formed dev team at HelloFresh. You will work with a tight knit team to implement new features and functionality, make long term architectural decisions, and supercharge our operations.



  • Be a senior member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team

  • Build and take operational responsibility for the entire platform

  • Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate microservices that serve millions of user

  • Collaborate with Frontend, Design, Product, DevOps, and Business Intelligence teams


You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our engineering blog.


Skills & Requirements


You are:



  • Self motivated: constantly looking to learn and improve yourself, the team, and the architecture

  • Highly responsible: driven to take up and start new projects without fear of failure and with little guidance

  • Critical thinker: thinks in 4D to evaluate and solve complex problems for both the short and long term


As a minimum you have:



  • 3-5 years experience as a Backend Engineer

  • Solid experience with and desire to work in Go (plus for PHP/Python exp)

  • Background working with relational (MySQL, pgsql) and non relational (MongoDB) databases

  • Extensive knowledge of OOP, Design Patterns, and SOLID Principles

  • Prior experience with distributed architectures; continuous integration; applications tuning/profiling; and unit, integration, & functional testing all highly valued

  • Microservice experience a big plus

  • DevOps expertise highly desirable (Unix, Ansible, StatsD/Grafana, etc.)

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or similarly technical/quantitative field


Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive!


It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

item.title: Remote System Administrator (Eastern Europe) at MobyMax () (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us


MobyMax is an Educational Technology company that creates unique, individualized education plans for students in all K-8 subjects. 

Used in over 73% of all K-8 schools in the United States with over 22 million students registered, MobyMax allows students to make tremendous progress while having fun! MobyMax creates global, research-powered curriculums that enable every child to learn twice as fast.


Description


We are looking for talented System Administrator living in Eastern Europe who want to join our engineering team in building the future of education technology.


At Moby we are use a LAMP based tech stack to support over 22 million users (roughly half the schools in America use our software) giving you the opportunity to solve a variety of challenges at scale. 


The position is remote allowing you to work from the comfort of your home, and requires the ability to read, write and speak in English.  Our developers work 9am - 6pm EET.


We use Skype for most communication including voice calls so you must have conversational English skills.


Responsibilities



  • Automate the building of infrastructure

  • Solution Design and implementation

  • Manage monitoring environment using monitoring tools like Nagios, Cacti

  • Resolve operational issues, troubleshoot development problems

  • Automate deployments

  • Assisting IT/Operations with application environment setup

  • Build engineering automation and productivity tools to streamline and scale applications in the

  • production environment

  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to application development, deployment and operations


Desired Experience



  • At least 5 years of experience with Chef, Puppet, or Ansible.

  • At least 5 years of experience working on Unix/Linux operating systems

  • At least 5 years of experience with cloud service providers, AWS, RackSpace

  • At least 5 years of experience scripting: Shell Scripts, Vagrant, Python, Bash, Powershell

  • Very strong scripting and automation skills – you believe you can automate everything

  • Sound database competence and knowledge, MySQL, Percona XtraDB Cluster, Percona

  • tools

  • Background with networking including Routing, IP, Firewalls etc

  • Cyber security experience and PCI DSS

  • Have experience with ElasticSearch, Kibana, LogStash.

  • A passion for open source and web technologies

  • Critical and quick thinker

  • Troubleshooting and problem solving skills


Working setup



  • Work from home

  • A computer that is not older than 3 years

  • High speed internet

  • Clear microphone / headset.


Hours



  • Willing to work 45 hours per week

  • Work 9am to 6pm in the Eastern European Timezone (EET)

item.title: Director of Engineering/Tribe Engineering Lead at SafetyCulture (Surry Hills, Australia)
item.description:
Job description



At SafetyCulture, we build awesome products that help our customers to drive change and create safe and efficient workplaces. SafetyCulture iAuditor is the most used checklist inspection app in the world, with over 1 million inspections performed every month and more than 85,000 DAU's. This means we have some pretty cool scalability challenges across the whole stack.


We understand data is king and we want to provide our customers with insights on how they can increase safety and quality. Are you up to the task of driving initiatives across our Insights teams and our API & Integrations team? You will start by managing Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Software Engineers and QA’s, working with our product team to build out a data-driven strategy and grow a world-class team to build products. We are thinking recommendation engine, IoT, sensors, drones... What else can we do? You will then build out teams across these different areas and focus on 4 key areas - People, Technology, Operations and Delivery. We went from 70 - 140 staff across 5 offices in the last year and we are doubling again this year providing massive opportunities for this role!


Key Responsibilities



  • Build and lead 2-4 high performing engineering teams, developing both leadership and technical capabilities of team members

  • Manage multiple teams of engineers across Development, Data and QA competencies

  • Connect teams to the mission, ensuring that everyone understands the problems we’re trying to solve

  • Partnering with Product Management to translate product vision into deliverable roadmaps

  • Oversee delivery, providing visibility of progress and performance

  • Working with teams and technical leads to champion the use of new technologies that better solve customer problems

  • Measure, maintain and improve operational excellence and quality of our platforms

  • Coach teams to improve their way of working, improving quality and delivery throughput

  • As we continue to grow, ensuring we have a good balance of inter and intra-team collaboration

  • Motivate and energise teams, injecting a sense of fun and focus


Requirements



  • Experience building and leading data teams in a dynamic environment

  • Experience leading delivery using an agile approach

  • Experience working in mobile led teams using a microservices architecture will give you a head start

  • Empathy for the customer with an ability to identify problems and propose the right solution

  • Ability to strike the balance of team health, delivery throughput and platform/operational excellence

  • A passion for technology and how it can enrich lives

  • A Learning mindset with the capacity to grow with our organisation and take on ever-increasing challenges

item.title: DevOps Engineer in Microservices Environment at simplesurance GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the job


What we're looking for



  • Setup, plan and maintain our infrastructure and application automation on AWS and Google Cloud Platform

  • Partner with the development team to manage entire stack from release cycles to data security

  • Build, manage and monitor highly available systems



  • 3 or more years of experience with Ansible or similar configuration management tools

  • Security oriented mindset

  • Expert unix skills

  • Strong working knowledge of AWS and/or GCP

  • Experience with service orchestration and microservice oriented architectures is a plus

  • Experience with CI and CD systems

  • Experience with a wide range of monitoring tools

  • Hands on experience with Hashicorp's Terraform, Consul, Nomad or Vault is a plus

  • Proficiency in at least one scripting language

  • Knowledge of Golang, Python or PHP is a plus

item.title: SaaS Engineering Manager at PeopleDoc (Paris, France)
item.description:
As the R&D team grew up during past years, we have started to think about what should be the management framework at PeopleDoc. Even though we always promoted autonomy and people to be source of proposal, with more and more teams and scopes, we felt that it was the time to hire people that would help the development teams to keep on releasing great quality apps by maintaining PeopleDoc vision and values, finding the process and the organization that enable the team to respect the objectives in terms of delay and quality and ensuring that everyone feels good in the team.


This office-based (Paris) people manager position will report to the Chief Technology Partner.


Competencies required:



  • Technical background in software development

  • Agile project management

  • Strong written and oral communication

  • Emotional intelligence


Education:



  • B.A. and/or Master in Engineering


Experience:



  • Strong experience in software development

  • Significant experience in team and project management in a technology company

  • 3+ years of experience with direct people management

  • SaaS Experience

  • Agile Development experience is a must


What are success looks like for this role?


DRIVE


(what this role has to accomplish -


the WHAT)


CARE


(how it has to be done -


the HOW)



  • Enable the feature teams focused Case Management and Knowledge Base services.

  • Animate the agile rituals

  • Drive and monitor the velocity of the feature teams

  • Drive and monitor the quality of the releases

  • Co-responsible for the R&D program management in partnership with the others delivery managers and the product managers

  • Define the goals and objectives of the team, in accordance with the product deliverables and the technical committees

  • Define the budget of the team, handles the recruitment together with the tribe leads

  • Accountable to lead communication and facilitate the sharing within and across teams

  • Communicate with other teams inside or outside the R&D


People Management Responsibilities:



  • Provide vision on where the team is going.  Ask for their input on the vision and the necessary steps to get there.

  • When hiring, prepare a detailed JD and success measures for the open positions in your team.

  • Prepare an individualized onboarding plan to welcome the new employee into the organization.

  • Mentor employees providing feedback on a regular basis. Address any performance issues straight away to ensure employees are aware of issues and have the chance to improve.

  • Focus on the development of each and every team member individually

  • Ensure the each team member is aware of the fundamentals: company guidelines, job expectations, their goals and any other aspects that are important to you and to their success at PeopleDoc.

  • Review and improve the team execution as needed to ensure that the team is organized in an optimal way to deliver its goals.

  • Be aware of your own and team’s energy level. Adjust as needed to ensure you and the team are motivated and/or investigate the reason for the decrease of motivation in team (or one team member). Proactive address issue until it is solved.

  • Seek feedback on a regular basis on how you are doing as a manager. It helps you improve and provide the chance to employees to provide you with their observations.     



General Management Accountabilities:



  • Team Budget Responsibility

  • Vacation and time off

  • Ensure team coverage

  • Performance and Development Conversations and Plan

  • Onboarding/Offboarding

  • Team Building Activities

  • Providing Ongoing Feedback

item.title: Manager, Data Science at adMarketplace (New York, NY)
item.description:
Data Scientists at adMarketplace bridge the gap between data science and engineering while building our next generation of highly targeted search, bidding and matching platform. You will manage a small but highly talented team that has data scientists and data analysts. Our matching, categorization and user targeting services have only milliseconds to make accurate decisions using both historical and real time data. You will be enhancing and utilizing these services with scalable solutions. The ideal candidate will thrive on solving complex technical challenges involving big data and be motivated by pushing the boundaries of using real time data to make automated decisions. Our team uses cutting edge software, including Akka, Apache SPARK, Kafka, NoSQL and more.


Responsibilities:




  • Mentor and develop members of the Data Science and Data Analytics Teams






  • Apply deep, creative, rigorous thinking to solve broad, platform-wide technical and/or business problems






  • Teach, mentor and collaborate with members of the broader Data Science Data Analytics Teams, both to build out specific projects and to continuously teach and learn new technology and techniques






  • Design, conduct, and analyze real-time A/B tests.






  • Support and guide team in using machine-learning techniques, visualizations, and statistical analysis to gain insight into various data






  • Support and guide team in researching, designing, simulating and/or prototyping new algorithmic product features according to business need






  • Work closely with Ad Operations to deliver products that enhance campaign optimization






  • Represent a data science perspective in cross-functional projects and to the company at large





Requirements:




  • BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field, Masters or PhD is preferred






  • 6+ years of experience with at least 4 years of hands-on technical experience






  • Experience leading multiple teams






  • Experience with applying probabilistic and/or statistical methods to real-world data sets






  • Experience delivering multiple complex, scalable, mission critical products






  • Solid Computer Science fundamentals including complex distributed systems and space-time complexity






  • Experience optimizing machine learning algorithms; Experience with predictive algorithms






  • Experience with stream processing platforms such as Spark or Storm a plus.






  • Knowledge of and/or working exposure to the scikit-learn open source library is a plus






  • Experience with machine learning techniques; expert knowledge is a major plus






  • Strong coding proficiency in SQL and at least one other common scripting or compiled programming language (Python, Java, and/or Scala a plus)






  • Experience working in a Linux environment






  • Good team communication skills, with technical and non-technical colleagues






  • Experience in Digital Advertising is a plus






  • Experience in Ad Technology platforms is a plus.

item.title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer(s) - Chatbots / Web Apps at Flow XO (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
£30,000 to £45,000 + benefits including:



  • 20 Days holiday + Christmas period

  • Flexible and remote working

  • Pension scheme

  • The best equipment to work with (regardless if you’re mac or pc, we’re not biased)

  • Perkbox subscription offering discounts and freebies from some of the UK’s biggest brands Unlimited free coffee

  • Great studio culture


Manchester city centre



At Flow XO we’re creating a web platform for non-technical users to build and manage their own chatbots, deploying to popular messaging systems including Facebook Messenger and SMS. We’re a start-up with two successful development years behind us. We also have an extremely strong financial foundation from our founding company, FLG Business Technology, another software business of 12 years. This unique setup allows us to operate like a startup - energetic, passionate and agile, while having the financial security of a larger experienced organization.


We’re on the lookout for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Software Engineers / Full Stack Developers to join our studio in the heart of Manchester city centre. You’ll become an integral part of our core development team working alongside other like minded developers, designers, and support staff.


We have quite a few ongoing projects and a planned backlog taking us well into 2018. You’ll be involved in most projects, even if it’s just offering your opinion. The way we manage projects means you’ll not only be working on features which best suit your skills, but also working on areas of the product that you enjoy.


We’re primarily building applications in Javascript (our current stack being JavaScript, NodeJS, React, Angular, MongoDB) however we’re flexible when it comes to your background. Our existing code base is solid. We’ve worked hard to reduce technical debt, achieve excellent test coverage, and follow conventions where possible.


So you’ll be joining a business where most of the working day is spent thinking about the future rather than catching up with the past. That’s not to say we are done, we have a long way to go! We’re looking for people who are passionate about our product and vision, collaborating with the rest of the team to help build our truly innovative products. We encourage and support a full-stack and multi-disciplinary approach from our software engineers.



What you’ll do:



  • Learn and use a full stack approach to software development (it doesn’t matter if you’re not initially comfortable across the full stack)

  • Use modern engineering practices like TDD, collaborative and agile development

  • Work within an agile team with the expectation to deliver each sprint

  • Build products, features and services that actually make a difference to our customers



What you’ll bring:



  • Coding skills: You’ll be strong in at least one object oriented programming language (JavaScript, Ruby, Python, C#, Java, etc.)

  • Flexible attitude to technology and a solid understanding in how the web works

  • The ability to adapt and learn new technologies

  • A desire for continuous improvement

  • A commitment to putting UX at the heart of the development process

  • Confidence in your abilities but humble in your approach



Why Flow XO?


Over ten years ago, John Jackson, our CEO, set up FLG Business Technology, a successful CRM software business, here in the North West. Our background is software development and we understand the profession well. Our Manchester studio has been set up with a very ‘flat’ approach to software development - no hierarchy, no bureaucracy, and certainly no ego. Our Head of product has been involved with four technology startups and our positive collaborative studio culture plays a huge part in our success.


We’re doing things slightly differently. We practice what we preach. We don’t get bogged down with too many processes, but we’re also not overly relaxed. We’re a small team of extremely passionate and talented individuals and looking to evolve with the right team members working alongside us.


We can make adjustments to our interview process according to your needs. We also offer a flexible working environment, enabling our colleagues to adjust their internal hours to accommodate personal circumstances.


If you’re a hungry, passionate and talented software engineer working in the North West, then we want to hear from you.


We look forward to chatting! :)

item.title: Software Engineer - Computer Vision - C++ / C# at PlayFusion (Milton, UK)
item.description:
PlayFusion are looking for talented Software Engineers to join our technology development team. You'll be working closely with members of our R&D team to produce industry-leading augmented reality technology. As part of the core team you will have a voice in how our current and future products will be taken forward. We want to hear from highly capable engineers who have a strong passion for computer vision, particularly when applied to augmented reality and virtual worlds. Your job will have you taking ownership of the technical solutions involved.


We offer a highly competitive above-market benefits package, an on-site gym, and a free lunch every day. The PlayFusion Adventure Academy also offers opportunities for high performing individuals to undertake team challenges and adventures every year. In 2017, 21 members of the team climbed Mount Kilimanjaro!


This year, PlayFusion won two TIGA Games Industry awards, for best technical innovation and for best small independent studio. Maybe you can help us to expand our trophy cabinet in the years to come!


The Role



  • Contribute to the research and development of our computer vision systems to provide engaging experiences for our players.

  • Turn high-level ideas and research into SDKs usable by our own teams and partners, on real-world devices.

  • Help identify and resolve potential issues in the development pipeline.

  • Create and maintain high quality software documentation.

  • Support our software teams and partners in integrating and utilising the software we make.


Requirements



  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant engineering/scientific subject.

  • Significant experience in C++ or similar languages, especially involving cross-platform development.

  • Experience writing scripting languages (e.g. Python, Shell Scripting).

  • A demonstrable strong understanding of and interest in computer vision and computer graphics.

  • Experience with computer vision techniques and software libraries.


Highly Beneficial



  • Experience with low-level, resource-constrained development - in particular, mobile ecosystems such as Android and iOS.

  • Experience with the Unity game engine.

  • Experience with version control (e.g. Git).


General



  • Please ensure you include a resume and cover letter and a link to your portfolio if applicable.

  • You must be eligible to work in the UK. The position is based in Cambridge, England.

item.title: Dev Ops / IT Systems Engineer at Adactus Ltd (Thame, UK)
item.description:
We are a .NET C# bespoke software developer - looking for support for our own IT Systems and to support the development team project delivery


Dev Ops / IT Systems Engineer


Role Summary


Providing internal business and project infrastructure support and standardising processes. Working with the Web Operations Manager to ensure project infrastructure requirements are actioned, clearly defined and documented.


Key Responsibilities



  • Ensuring support tasks are dealt with securely and efficiently

  • Provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems infrastructure including; cloud and on-premises network infrastructure

  • Providing support to the development team as part of project delivery

  • Trouble shooting

  • Scripting and automation of system admin tasks

  • Documentation of infrastructure for both internal and external environments.


 Key Tasks



  • Investigate reported problems / support requests and determine the appropriate action

  • Monitor progress of support requests and ensure all parties are kept informed

  • Provide responses to requests for support, suggest solutions and work-a-rounds

  • Monitor solutions via regular creation and scrutiny of reports, identify potential problems and performance trends

  • Create, update and manage assigned JIRA tickets whilst keeping key people up-to-date with results and key milestones

  • Maintain solution documentation

  • To remain up-to-date with client issues and Adactus developed applications.


 Key Skills, Knowledge and Experience



  • Good communication skills with both internal team members and external business stakeholders.

  • A background in Networking - LAN / WAN and Wireless.

  • Shows an understanding of core internet technologies - Routing and Switching, DNS, DHCP, mail transport, OSI Model

  • Desktop and server hardware knowledge

  • Windows, Linux, and virtual machine experience

  • Some scripting experience – i.e. Python/PowerShell

  • Process driven – helping to define and ensure processes are followed

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer in Test at Autodesk (Singapore)
item.description:
The ways we design and build the world are changing rapidly, which is also changing the tools we use and the ways companies and individuals buy and access software. We are embracing this change with a complete transformation of our Try, Buy, and Subscribe platform. Autodesk Subscriber Licensing Platform team is seeking a passionate Test Engineer to join a team of professionals who are responsible for building the licensing service platform that spans the entire Autodesk eco-system, from desktop, web, and mobile device clients to the cloud. 


The Test Engineer works within a highly visible team at Autodesk where the code you develop/test and deploy will have a direct, positive impact to millions of users of our products. Specifically, when any of our customer Try, Buy, or Access any of our software products, they will be touching the licensing services platform you are helping to implement.  This system and experience is a centerpiece in supporting Autodesk’s top-line business transformation objectives.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Develop test strategies and test scope

  • Work with the team to automate testing of new functionalities and services using existing service architecture, delivery pipeline and test framework 

  • Write code/scripts to test services and APIs

  • Contribute to monitoring product development and usage at all levels with an eye toward improving product quality

  • Create test harnesses and infrastructure supporting Windows, Mac & Linux

  • Analyze and decompose a complicated software system and design a strategy to test it

  • Clearly document, manage, and prioritize defects from multiple sources. Collaborate with development, QA analysts and Test Engineers to perform root cause analysis

  • Contribute to customer facing documentation such as readme’s, release-notes, help documents, tutorials, and alpha/beta content, etc.

  • Evaluate (commercial, open-source or proprietary) testing tools and test frameworks which can be leveraged within a project

  • Enforce Engineering Excellence practices and drive quality early in the development cycle; enforcing code standards, unit testing, test driven development and other strategies to improve and ensure code quality


 TECHNOLOGIES WE USE



  • C++, C#, Go, Python, Java & JavaScript

  • Windows, Mac & Linux

  • QT

  • CMake, Nuget

  • Jenkins

  • Git, GitHub, Perforce


REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE



  • 3-5 years of test automation experience

  • Ability to write professional code (clean & good design)

  • Deep knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, mock data/services, creating test cases, debugging & testing

  • Experience working in an agile team, CI/CD with Jenkins and automated deployment

  • Successfully implement performance and/or load testing

  • High attention to detail

  • BS in Computer Science/Engineering or a related field

  • Experience with Python is a plus

item.title: Bouvet leter etter talentfulle konsulenter innenfor Data Science! at Bouvet Norge AS (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
For å møte våre kunders økende etterspørsel innenfor store data, avansert automatisering, maskinlæring og kunstig intelligens har Bouvet etablert en egen satsing innenfor Data Science. 


Vi er derfor ute etter data scientists, statistikere og analytikere som kan hjelpe oss levere data science tjenester til en stor portefølje av kunder. Her får du muligheten til å påvirke og hjelpe med å forme et helt nytt miljø innenfor et av Norges største konsulentmiljøer!


Er du en erfaren data scientist som ser etter å skifte beite, eller kanskje er du nyutdannet og ser etter din først utfordring? Les videre! 


Utdanning


En relevant utdannelse innenfor matematikk, fysikk, maskinlæring eller økonomi ønskes, gjerne på master nivå.


Kvalifikasjoner



  • God innsikt i statistiske metoder og bruk av statistikk

  • Erfaring fra arbeid med «store data og analyser»

  • God innsikt i metoder, konsepter og muligheter innenfor Data Science «kunstig intelligens» og maskinlæring

  • Erfaring fra forskning og undervisning, eller konsulentvirksomhet innenfor Data Science

  • God forståelse for hvordan teknologi kan brukes for å støtte forretningsprosesser

  • God programmeringsferdigheter innen en eller flere relevante språk (for eksempel Python eller R)

  • Kjennskap til skybaserte tjenester (Google, MicroSoft og Amazon) er en fordel


Ønskede personliger egenskaper



  • Gode kommunikasjonsegenskaper på norsk og engelsk, både muntlig og skriftlig

  • Evnen til å jobbe alene eller som en del av et team

  • God til å se helheten og konkretisere problemstillinger

  • Liker ansvar og utfordringer

  • God domenekunnskap av en eller flere bransjer


Vi tilbyr



  • Kompetanseutvikling uten grenser – vær den beste du kan være!

  • Spennende oppgaver innenfor en mangfoldig kundeportefølje

  • En synlig rolle innenfor et av våre sentrale utviklingsområder

  • Store muligheter til å utvikle din kompetanse og karriere

  • Dyktige kolleger med interesse og engasjement for ditt arbeid

  • Et bredt fagmiljø med mange spesialister du kan lære av

  • Godt sosialt miljø

  • Konkurransedyktige betingelser med overtidsbetaling, kollektiv bonus, aksjeprogram og gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer (GO, Java or Scala) at Zalando Lounge (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT


Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 11 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However,  Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell.


Our Tech department builds and drives our own customer facing applications and internal services on top of Zalando’s platform services. We have a strong focus on customer experience and learn and experiment how we can engage them even more. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 50 engineers, UX designers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of Zalando Lounge. As Senior Backend Engineer in our team you will work hands-on in Go to design and develop next generation tooling for all our internal processes, which will support key business units in enhancing their performance through technology.



YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDS


Variety. Together with your team, product managers and UX designers you will drive the development of our internal systems, ensuring efficient and user-friendly tooling. You will also be responsible of shaping a scalable and performant architecture of the internal systems that you will be working on.  


Autonomy. Due to the size and startup-like set up of the tech team you will have the opportunity to decide together with your team on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.


Ownership. You will have end to end responsibility of all of your projects and will focus on building scalable and cloud ready software solutions in our AWS and API-first tech environment.


Excellence. Due to your business mindset you are continually thinking about new ways on how to help Zalando Lounge scale through building a strong technical platform and automated business processes. You build systems for production and implement high-quality solutions, ensuring latency, availability and appropriate monitoring.



YOU ARE SKILLED


Experience: You are experienced in integrating external and internal API services and are excited about building modern tooling operations.  


Technologies. You would like to do hands-on coding in Go and are highly skilled in at least one of the following programming languages: Go, Java or Scala. Previous experience working in cloud environments such as in AWS is a plus. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Business mindset. You have a business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve Zalando Lounge through effective and strategic development of internal systems.


Knowledge Exchange. You will lead and mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.



YOU ARE OFFERED


Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, municipality services, flexible working times, family service and parent & child rooms, additional holidays & volunteering time off, diverse sports and health offerings.


Development. Extensive onboarding, personal branding support focused on leadership, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teams.



WANT TO JOIN US?


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.

item.title: Administrator (m/w) at myRight GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
myRight - Da haben Sie Recht


Mit myRight setzen wir die Rechte von Verbrauchern gegenüber Unternehmen und dem Staat durch. Wo früher das Recht wertlos verfallen ist, kann myRight heute Dank der Verzahnung von IT, Big Data und präziser juristischer Arbeit tausenden Kunden zu Ihrem Recht verhelfen. Einfach per Mausklick und ohne Berührungsängste. Dabei wird myRight die erste übergreifende Plattform für Recht und Gerechtigkeit, die dem Recht des Stärkeren die Stirn bietet. Um unsere Dienstleistung qualitativ hochwertig weiter voranzutreiben suchen wir für unseren Standort in Hamburg zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Teil- oder Vollzeit einen


                                       Senior Administrator (m/w)


Unsere IT-Abteilung steht im Mittelpunkt unserer Firma. Sie ist der Motor, der unser Geschäft antreibt und das Rückgrat für unseren Erfolg. In dieser Position unterstützt Du mit Deiner analytischen Denkweise und Deiner Expertise ein dynamisches start-up bei unserer weiteren Expansion. Es wartet eine hochspannende und herausfordernde Tätigkeit auf Dich - Du bist dabei, wenn wir myRight zum „Legal Companion“ der Verbraucher weiterentwickeln!


Deine Aufgaben sind unter anderem



  • Sicherstellen des Betriebs unserer Ubuntu-basierten Server und MySQL-Datenbankinstanzen

  • Konfigurieren, Verwalten und Dokumentieren unserer AWS-basierten Infrastruktur

  • Einrichtung und Betrieb zentraler Überwachung für Ressourcen und Dienstleistungen

  • Schnelle und effiziente Skalierung von Ressourcen

  • Verwalten von Server-seitigen Benutzer- und Systemkonten

  • Verwalten von Apache- und NGINX-Installationen

  • Sichern von Dateisystemen und Datenbanken

  • Pflege unserer Domain- und DNS-Einstellungen


Was bringst Du mit



  • Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Linux-Server und Datenbank-Administration



  • Sicher im Umgang mit AWS: EC2, RDS, EFS, Route53, u.a.

  • Erfahrung mit der Analyse und Aggregation heterogener Log-Strukturen, z.B. In graylog, logstash, u.a.

  • Idealerweise kennst Du Dich mit PHP oder Python, GIT und Deployment-Strategies aus

  • Du bist das Arbeiten in einem funktionsübergreifenden und agilen Team gewohnt

  • Leidenschaft bei der Arbeit und ein ständiger Verbessrungswille zeichnen Dich aus

  • In der englischen Sprache fühlst Du Dich sicher


Wir bieten Dir



  • Herausfordernde Tätigkeit in einem dynamischen, interdisziplinären Team mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und kurzen Entscheidungswegen

  • Ein Umfeld, das Deine persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung fordert und fördert

  • Schnell wachsende Organisation mit abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben

  • Viel Platz für eigenverantwortliches Handeln



  • Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Perfekt! Wenn Du die formalen Voraussetzungen der Stelle erfüllst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung über jobs@myright.de oder marta.geissler@myright.com


Dort kannst Du auch alle Deine Fragen an Marta Geißler loswerden. Bitte schick uns Deine aussagekräftigen Unterlagen inkl. Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung und Deines frühestmöglichen Starttermins. Danke!

item.title: C++ Developer, Iasi, Romania at ESET (Iai, Romania)
item.description:
We are opening our development center in Iasi. Join us and develop ESET’s core and backend technologies.


What does working as ESET C++ Developer entail?


Our developers work in a development team, which builds our antivirus products and support applications.  As a developer, you will be in charge of ensuring that the detection core can perform all its functions, which means that you will provide it with the necessary data from the system/Kernel mode, specific settings, prepare plugins, and work on the user interface and supplementary applications. The unit of which you will be a part is also involved in developing functionalities that are not directly related to malware detection.


This type of work is ideal for programmers who like to dabble in Kernels, revel in crash dumps, but also all those who just love to analyze, debug and program business logic. This is something that will be right up your alley if you like working with network protocols, enjoy making the GUI user-friendly or look forward to working with JSON, XML and other script languages.


The tools and technologies used on the job:


A developer in this position will almost certainly come into contact with a battery of tools such as Microsoft Visual Studio, WinDbg, VirtualKD, Dependency Walker, ProcMon, Process Explorer, Wireshark and WinMerge. What’s more, some members of the Windows application team use VirtualBox, VMware or write code using Windows API, C++, Perl, Python, Java Scripts or HTML.  We actively use supporting tools such as Git, Jira and Confluence − but it’s up to you: we will be happy to provide you with all the additional tools you may need. 


We are really big on effectiveness in everything we do, we do regular code reviews and check the performance of our applications.


The advantages


You can look forward to working on big projects which benefit tens of millions of users, and do so with a team of experts, from whom you can learn a thing or two about hacking and operating systems, drivers, or system diagnosis.


Are you cut out for thejob?


You will feel right at home if C++ programming is your cup of tea. If you also have experience with real-world projects, can solve hard problems and know your way around OS Internals we would like to welcome you to our team.


Other benefits


Bottomless drinks for all! Enjoy coffee, tea, juice or mineral water and other beverages to your heart’s content.



You will not go hungry. For each working day at ESET you will receive meal vouchers, fully reimbursed by the company. And should hunger strike during the day, you can grab a healthy snack in one of the kitchenettes.

Whether you commute by car, tram, bicycle or by foot, you are entitled to a transportation allowance once on board with ESET.

We support your personal development to help you grow on the job. You can attend a number of training courses, presentations, professional conferences and, best of all, you can improve your language skills, compliments of ESET.

We don’t want you to spend the whole day sitting behind a computer. Head out to the fitness center to lift the body and spirit.

We think family comes first. That’s why for your life’s milestones, such as wedding or birth of your children, in addition to our warmest congratulations, we also give you a financial contribution.

Even though we don’t have the fountain of youth, we can offer the next best thing – we contribute to your retirement savings.

Work hard, play hard. This is what we believe in and that’s why we organize a number of events for our employees throughout the year to relax and enjoy leisure time together.

item.title: Medior/Senior Embedded UI developer (Qt) - Empower people through smart energy. at Quby (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Our employees at Quby are the brains behind Toon®, a leading smart thermostat & energy display in Europe. Toon® is sold by energy utilities to transform their business by engaging and empowering consumers with Smart Energy services.


We are currently looking for an experienced Software Engineer with a passion for embedded systems. As a member of the Software Development Team, you are responsible for the design and implementation of our embedded user interface. You will design and implement a future proof production grade solution.


Your Challenge



  • Turn UI designs into functional features for our customers.

  • Deploy new UI features in a resource-critical environment.

  • Take the lead in technical and functional improvements.

  • Ensure consistent quality across multiple styles and locales.

  • Design, implement, and unit test embedded software.

  • Cooperate across multiple development teams working on the same platform.


Skills & Requirements


Who you are: 



  • You have at least 4+ years of experience in development within an Embedded Software Development environment.

  • You have at least 4+ years of hands-on programming experience with C, within a Linux environment (preferably Embedded).

  • You have at least 4 years of experience with C++, Qt and QML.

  • You understand how to work with Communication Protocols.

  • You have experience with Scrum and Agile.

  • You possess strong presentation and communication skills.


Big plus is experience with:



  • Experience with: Javascript, Python, Squish (Qt/QML UI testing tool), translation management.

item.title: Cloud Architect at Cloudreach (London, UK)
item.description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.


Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation”. We do this by helping our customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build  one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.


A stone’s throw from Leather Lane food market, our HQ is located in London at Chancery Lane. See what it’s like to work in our Cloudy Hub: A day in our London office


Which team will you be part of?


 As a Cloud Architect you are part of the Cloud Enablement team. Our Cloud Enablement team helps provide consultative, architectural, program and engineering support for our customers' journeys to the cloud. The word 'Enablement' was chosen carefully, to encompass the idea that we support and encourage a collaborative approach to Cloud adoption, sharing best practices, helping change the culture of teams and strategic support to ensure success. Our Cloud Architects play a key role in designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions to our customers.


How will you spend your days ?


 We are looking for a Cloud Architect to drive the adoption of Cloudreach services and to inspire customers to innovate using public cloud. We firmly believe that the technical leadership we provide as architects is only as good as our experiences implementing solutions within the industry.


You will be :



  • Focusing on one or more strategic customers to ensure a successful delivery of value.

  • Leading and being deeply involved in the hands-on technical delivery of customer projects

  • Driving solution architecture and best practices by:


    • Contributing to Cloudreach internal tooling

    • Producing white papers and best practices guides

    • Mentoring other fellow Cloud Architects

    • Producing public facing content such as blog posts and presentations

    • Implementing PoC’s making use of innovative technology by evaluating trending technologies


  • Enabling clients to visualise the possibilities of leveraging public cloud and the path to get there.

  • Willing to travel to customer sites when focusing on delivery

  • Constantly investigating and evaluating industry trends


What kind of career progression can you expect?


You can grow into a Cloud Consultant role, step into a managerial position acting as Architect Lead on customer projects or move into the Cloud Enablement Leader role to support internal teams. Lead positions bring to the fold rewarding mentorship opportunities.


There are also relocation opportunities to our other cloudy hubs.


How to stand out?



  • Experience with architecting, designing, implementing, and supporting greenfield and/or migration projects using public cloud

  • Deep technical experience in one or more of the following competencies:


    • Software design or development (continuous delivery/integration, adoption of DevOps practices)

    • Systems Operations / Management

    • Enterprise Architecture

    • Infrastructure Design

    • IT Security and Governance

    • Automation and System Orchestration


  • You have experience with programming, preferably in Python, but at least, in a modern programming language such as Go, Ruby, Java, C++, Perl or .NET



  • Excellent communication skills

  • Customer facing experience of a consultative nature

  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject





What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, and new smartphone (you will have to choose between a Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice!).

  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Our Season Ticket Loan will make your daily commute less expensive.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • Our office in Chancery Lane is filled with free drinks and snacks, Xbox One, pool table, board games, bean bags and sofas.

  • “Cloudy Lunch” where every Friday we take over a local restaurant. Enjoy, it’s on us!

  • Discount on private healthcare scheme and gym membership. Stakeholder pension with shared employee and employer contribution.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool secret location in Europe.

item.title: (Junior) Anwendungsentwickler für Client und Web Applikationen (m/w) at ISKO engineers AG (Ingolstadt, Deutschland)
item.description:
Sie haben bereits erste Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Web oder Client Anwendungen im Unternehmenskontext und möchten Ihr Know-how in einem agilen Unternehmen ausbauen? Zeigen Sie Ihr Können bei der Entwicklung von Java, JavaScript, C++ oder anderen Anwendungen vom Backend bis hin zum webbasierten Frontend. Selbstverständlich arbeiten Sie in einem agilen Team und analysieren sowie konzipieren gemeinsam mit den internen Fachbereichen oder den Kunden die Anforderungen. Und das Beste: Sie sind von der Konzeption über die Implementierung sowie von der Testbetreuung bis zur Produktivschaltung in den gesamten Prozess eingebunden.


Skills & Requirements



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium oder Technikerausbildung im Bereich Informatik o.ä.

  • Erste Erfahrungen in agilen Softwareentwicklungsprojekten

  • Erfahrungen in min. einem der folgenden Werkzeuge: Java, JavaScript, Python, C++, Qt, C#

  • Wünschenswert: Erfahrungen mit Big Data Analytics, Cloud Computing und Virtualisierung Technologien wie Apache Spark, Apache Tinkerpop, TitanDB, Apache Mesos, Kubernetes, Docker und ähnlichem

  • Kommunikativer Teamplayer mit Innovationsgeist

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Ihr Profil ab

  • Motivierten Absolventen geben wir gerne eine Chance zum Einstieg

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer at Visual Concepts (Novato, CA)
item.description:
Visual Concepts is one of the world’s top game development studios with a flat, entrepreneurial, and non-corporate work environment. We have a proven track record having shipped over 100 multi-SKU titles to great critical acclaim.


Most recently, NBA 2K17 for PS4, Xbox One and PC is the highest Metacritic-rated sports game of this generation with critics such as Game Informer stating that “in the world of sports sims, no other game feels like it’s even on the same level as NBA 2K17” with “unrivaled gameplay, presentation and game modes.” Forbes noted that “NBA 2K’s depth continues to set the bar for the genre” and GameSpot raves “it makes me wish that every sport got the same treatment that basketball does in NBA 2K17.” The New York Daily News concludes “the entire package is as robust as a sports game has ever been” and “this year, that experience is even more stunning and addictive.”


As “the uncontested developer of sports videogames” (PlayStation LifeStyle), Visual Concepts is committed to gaming and technical innovation everywhere. 


What are we looking for?


You’re passionate about DevOps and the associated technologies. You’re looking to expand your career by working on a large scale, service infrastructure. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be working with world class engineering and production operations teams to scale up our environment. You’ll develop and maintain tools and practices to support the integration of our backend services. You’ll work closely with various developers in supporting new services as well as being the operations expert and development engineer that launches and maintains our services in a production environment. This is an opportunity to enhance your career in a critical role supporting one of the largest and most successful game franchises.


Requirements:



  • 3+ years of experience as a DevOps Engineer working with large scale, online applications

  • Highly proficient in Python and Shell Script or other scripting languages

  • Experience with Linux systems administration

  • Proficient in one or more of C++, C#, or Java using object oriented best practices
