  • Experience with deployment systems including Puppet

  • Experience with automation/build tools like Team City, Jenkins, Bamboo, and Maven

  • Experience with version control systems (git, Perforce)

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience

  • Able to work flexible hours including weekends or off-hours


Desired Skills:



  • Proficient in database management (Mysql, Redis)

  • Experience with Mongo, Cassandra, Vertica

  • Experience with building tools and APIs (F5, Cisco, AWS)

  • Knowledge of security mechanisms, such as SSL/TLS, IP-Sec, PKI, RSA/AES

  • Knowledge of networking architecture

  • Knowledge of network and application protocols, such as UDP, TCP, ICMP, HTTP, HTTPS

item.title: Senior Back End Engineer - DevOps - AGODA HIRING NOW, Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem in the Back End team. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing work-flow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable swarm of docker containers. A whole vitalised environment of Asia's leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support website growth, growing customers and a growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimise and automate daily work-flow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Java, Python, JavaScript/NodeJS)
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)


Bonuses
  • Experienced in supporting Web application deployment at scale
  • CI: Jenkins , Teamcity
  • UI Tests with Selenium
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Powershell
  • Built a monitoring system for DevOps systems


We are happy to receive CV's from both international & local applicants as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible persons.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

item.title: Software Tester, QA engineer (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you keen to push renewable energies further?


Are you passionate about quality tested software?


Are you a team player and keen getting things to work?


Then this job is for you


As a professional software tester and QA engineer at Younicos you will develop and execute test specifications and most appropriate test strategies and improve our test automation on unit, component and system integration level. You look at technology and business facing tests that support the team and critique the product in all functional and non-functional aspects. Within your focus is also improvement of our configuration management, the build and deployment process as well as application lifecycle management.


To reach the goals in terms of high product quality and customer satisfaction you work together with the developers as part of an agile team (Scrum) and cooperate with our requirements and system engineering. Together with the teams and the customer you will specify user acceptance and factory acceptance test specifications. You will introduce new tools, if required, to perform and monitor tests that will help you and the team to raise the quality of the products. With your knowledge, approach and open feedback you will continually improve the quality policies within the development teams.


With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.


Your profile



  • Significant expertise in software testing in agile teams

  • Profound knowledge of testing tools

  • Experience with BDD/TDD, test automation and CI (Jenkins)

  • Some expertise in Python and knowledge of C++, Java and PHP

  • Excellent analytic and conceptual skills

  • A source of constant ideas for improvement

  • A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Knowledge of SW development tooling infrastructure and system administration

  • Open to new technologies

  • A will to continually improve your skills

  • Exceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy

  • Basic German is a plus


Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Participation on trainings, meetings, conferences, etc.

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

item.title: Software Architect - Machine Learning at Siemens - USA (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
Corporate Technology’s research group Architecture and Verification of Intelligent Systems is currently seeking an Intelligent Systems Software Architect for our Princeton, NJ location. 

Complex software-intensive systems are at the core of Siemens’ business. Siemens trains, power plants, factory automation, building automation, power grid control, medical devices, and others depend on the correct operation of software. Therefore, sustainable software architectures are essential for the success of our businesses. The software architects in our team help Siemens business units world-wide to improve their software architectures, making our products even more reliable, performant, scalable and maintainable. We also help business units translate new business ideas into innovative software solutions and successful products. Our research results influence Siemens products and are reflected in patents and publications in journals and conferences. The Intelligent Systems Software Architect will work at the intersection of software engineering and artificial intelligence and will help Siemens development teams to leverage AI building blocks to develop new products or enhance existing ones. 

What are my responsibilities?

• Design and implement intelligent systems for Siemens business units.
• Extract architecturally-significant requirements for intelligent systems, and ensure feasibility of these requirements.
• Evaluate solution alternatives that involve neural networks, genetic algorithms, SAT/SMT solvers, constraint solvers, planners, logic deduction engines, Bayesian belief networks, and other technologies.
• Define, articulate and apply architectural principles and patterns when building intelligent systems.  Review architectures and work with business units to improve their software architecture.
• Provide technical leadership to the team, collaborators and customers.
• To be aware of state-of-the-art software architecture methods, tools and trends and technologies to build intelligent systems.
• Identify high-impact research topics in intelligent systems architecture.
• Perform research, development and consulting projects collaborating with colleagues, customers and universities.
• Write papers for presentation in journals and conferences. 
• Supervise the work of graduate student interns.
• Acquire and lead Siemens-internal research and development projects.


Skills & Requirements


• Minimum of 6 years of experience in software development and software engineering is required. Recent PhD graduates with appropriate graduate research/internship experience will be considered. 
• Masters in Computer Science or related field required. Ph.D. preferred.
• Strong theoretic background and practical experience in systematic software engineering.
• Experienced in using neural networks especially deep/ machine learning, genetic algorithms, deduction engines, constraint solvers and similar technologies to solve real application problems.
• Experienced in evaluating and improving the performance and scalability of intelligent systems. 
• Ability to generalize key principles and successful methods from one project and apply them to other projects across the company. 
• Ability to quickly learn key concepts of unfamiliar domains.
• Ability to work on a problem from the analysis phase to the implementation of a practical solution. 
• Familiarity with major programming languages (C/C++, C#, Python, Java) and software development for major platforms (Windows, Linux) 
• Strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences required. 
• Strong skills in problem solving, communication, and team work. 
• Willingness to travel 20% of the year domestically and internationally. 
• Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and can-do attitude and the ability to work independently and prioritize work.
• Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

• Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#subcat34

item.title: Data Scientist at autobiz (Suresnes, France)
item.description:
Dans le cadre du développement de ses activités, autobiz recherche un(e) Data Scientist.


Membre de l’équipe Recherche et Développement, vous êtes responsable de la gestion et de l’analyse des données.


Pour ce faire, autobiz recherche des talents ambitieux, motivés à l’idée de rejoindre une société en pleine expansion, dans le secteur du digital et du big data.


Entreprise :


Créée en 2004, autobiz est une start-up innovante, leader sur le marché de la cotation automobile. L’analyse des données « big data » lui a permis de mettre en place une gamme d’outils internationaux pour développer le business VO (véhicule d’occasion) des professionnels de la distribution, de la location et de l’assurance automobile.  Elle se positionne également en pionnier de la reprise automobile via son site autobiz.fr, déclinée en Espagne et Italie.


Aujourd’hui basée à Suresnes (92), autobiz dispose également de bureaux à Berlin, à Valence (Espagne) et Milan. Membre de la communauté BPI Excellence, elle consacre chaque année 15% de son chiffre d’affaires à la R&D. Elle intervient notamment dans l’élaboration de programmes prédictifs dans le domaine de la transaction automobile en collaboration avec le laboratoire SAMM (Université Paris-Sorbonne). 


Début 2017, le groupe PSA a choisi d’entrer au capital d’autobiz avec une participation minoritaire. Cette décision stratégique fait d’autobiz un partenaire clé pour l’ambitieuse feuille de route « Push-to-pass » du groupe PSA, qui prévoit notamment un doublement de ses ventes mondiales de véhicules d’occasion à l’horizon 2020. autobiz et ses équipes sont pleinement associés à la réussite de cet objectif.


Pour plus d'informations : http://corporate.autobiz.com                                                                                                                                           


Poste et missions :


En qualité de Data Scientist, vous êtes responsable de la gestion et de l’analyse des données (big data).


Vos missions principales :



  1. Extraction, uniformisation et structuration des données



  • Collecter, sélectionner et valider les données clients pertinentes pour l’analyse

  • Définir les solutions de stockage et la structuration des données

  • Convertir, coder et cartographier des données de consommation ou d’usage produit dans un format compréhensible par l’ensemble des collaborateurs

  • Améliorer la qualité et enrichir les bases de données clients de l’entreprise

  • Déterminer les outils et méthodes d’acquisition de données depuis un ensemble de bases techniquement hétérogènes

  • Concevoir l’architecture d’un entrepôt de données décisionnelles

  • Maîtriser la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement



  • Analyses prédictives et développement de la connaissance client



    • Mettre en œuvre et garantir la modélisation statistique des données

    • Développer des algorithmes d’apprentissage et scénarios prédictifs des comportements clients

    • Optimiser la segmentation client à l’aide des statistiques et données de consommation.

    • Étudier et mettre en place les meilleures solutions techniques pour gérer les grands volumes de données

    • Concevoir des modèles de détection des insights et des opportunités de marché

    • Accompagner l’entreprise dans le développement de leviers de création de valeur



  • Développement d’outils de support aux clients internes



    • Analyser l’ensemble des données commerciales pour développer des systèmes efficaces d’aide à la décision

    • Participer au développement des indicateurs de performance commerciale de l’entreprise

    • Fournir aux chefs de produit des leviers statistiques décisionnels pour la conduite et l’analyse des campagnes de prospection

    • Réaliser des études statistiques pour les clients internes ou la direction générale

    • Animer les ateliers d’expression des besoins internes et rédiger les cahiers des charges

    • Écrire et rédiger la spécification des besoins à destination des DSI ou de la maîtrise d’ouvrage

    • Déterminer les outils de reporting dynamique et multidimensionnel (OLAP)

    • Présenter les résultats des études réalisées aux clients internes

    • Former les utilisateurs aux outils informatiques et décisionnels



  • Veille technologique sur les outils de datamining



    • Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données

    • Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et d’analyse des données

    • Sélectionner les nouveaux outils et techniques de data management


    Profil :


    De formation universitaire supérieure Bac+5 université (ex : Master en statistiques et marketing, informatique, statistique et informatique décisionnelle, économétrie) et ou Diplôme d’école d’ingénieurs, Doctorat en informatique, en mathématiques, …), vous êtes motivé(e) pour intégrer une structure à taille humaine en fort développement dans laquelle vous investir pleinement.


    Compétences :



    • Maitrise des algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique (Machine Learning)

    • Maitrise des outils de data management (Python, R)

    • Maîtrise des bases de données MariaDB

    • Très grande rigueur

    • Goût pour les données numériques et les chiffres

    • Sens des affaires pour détecter les opportunités et proposer des produits innovants

    • Qualité d’écoute afin de recueillir avec précision les informations et besoins des clients internes et externes.

item.title: Senior Database Developer at Trustly (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Trustly is a tech company at heart. Two of our three founders are developers and eight years later, they are still an integral part of the Tech team. You’ll work alongside them and other talented and motivated developers. The Tech team is one of the fastest growing teams in the company. Currently we are 45+ people, but to support Trustly’s growth, we are hiring developers at all levels.


The entire backend system at Trustly is written using stored procedures in PostgreSQL, mainly PL/pgSQL but also pure SQL and PL/Perl. Our developers contribute to the DB Core and we are active in the PostgreSQL Community. About the Senior Database Developer role: In this position, you will work with new development as well as maintenance of our transaction system. Sound interesting?


Join our world-class PostgreSQL team, where you’ll learn from the best and be able to contribute your ideas and expertise.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop Trustly’s back-end, which is the base of our product and heavily relied upon by all of our other systems to handle complex business logic

  • Collaborate with product owners, team leads and other developers to discuss requirements and implement solutions

  • Manage code reviews

  • Contribute as a team player


Required skills:



  • Excellent SQL skills

  • Minimum of two years experience in database development

  • Strong communication skills

  • Fluency in English


Bonus skills:



  • Experience in PostgreSQL

  • Experience in tuning and optimization of databases and queries

  • Experience creating database designs, database architectures and data-intensive database solutions

  • Experience in Perl, Python or PHP

  • Experience working with git

  • Experience working with Linux systems


Apply now!

item.title: Big Data Architect - Virtual Power Plant at Limejump (London, UK)
item.description:
The Role



As a Big Data Architect at Limejump, you will be at the cutting edge of technology in the energy industry. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the Spark infrastructure that monitors and analyses our virtual power station. The ideal candidate should have a deep interested in the big data ecosystem and significant experience using Python. 


Responsibilities


As our Big Data Architect, you will be responsible for:



  • Improving the efficiency of Spark infrastructure for core products

  • Guiding evolving company data strategy 

  • Supporting analytical functions through data engineering

  • Working collaboratively with Limejump’s Tech and Analytical teams to support business requirements


 Essential Requirements



  • A demonstrated deep interest in the "big data" ecosystem 

  • Necessary commercial expertise to lead the evolution of Limejump's big data architecture

  • Commercial work experience with Spark (preferably pySpark)

  • Significant experience using Python (ideally in a Data Science context using numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.)

  • Preference for experience of processing live streams of data at scale (preferably using Spark Streaming, Flink, Samza or similar)

  • Preference for commercial experience creating and running robust batch jobs/pipelines in a production environment (for example using Luigi or similar frameworks)

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (both verbal and written)

  • Self-motivated and resourceful.

  • Enthusiasm for innovation in the tech industry, including continuous learning and improvement

  • If successful, eligibility to work in the UK without employer sponsorship


 Company Benefits



  • Competitive Salary + Share Options

  • 25 days holiday + Bank Holidays

  • Cycle to Work benefit

  • Employee discount scheme

  • Company social events

  • Excellent work environment and extremely motivated team who enjoy what they do



Limejump is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

item.title: Architecte devops at OXALIDE (Paris, France) (allows remote)
item.description:
L’idée de gérer des clusters de serveurs vous passionne ? Vous prenez plaisir à vous attaquer à des problèmes pointus et inhabituels ? Vous êtes à la recherche de nouveaux challenges ? Les termes « scalabilité », « performance », « uptime » et « industrialisation » vous motivent ? Si oui, lisez la suite.


Au sein de l'une de nos BU (E-commerce, Editeurs SAAS, Finance et Services et Médias Presse) un devops est un spécialiste du Web.


En position de référent de plusieurs clients, un devops conseille ses clients sur l’infrastructure et l’architecture logicielle, et assure le support en escalade.
Vous aurez comme principales missions la réalisation de projets (par exemple : designer et implémenter une nouvelle infrastructure), le conseil et la R&D. Vous travaillerez avec des méthodologies modernes telles que le devops, Agile ou l’Infra as Code.


En tant que devops vous serez donc en charge de faire évoluer les environnements et applicatifs serveurs pour garantir la qualité de service de nos clients. Vous serez le lien entre nos clients et leur infrastructure.


Vous participerez également à :



  • Intégrer des technologies complexes et innovantes, (Varnish, ElasticSearch, AWS…)

  • Développer notre expertise sur des technologies type MySQL, Varnish, Capistrano, AWS, ou toute autre technologie pertinente,

  • Effectuer le support en escalade de la priority line

  • Réaliser une astreinte qualitative, tant sur le plan technique que sur l’aspect communication,

  • Proposer des optimisations/évolutions sur les procédures et technologies,

  • Gérer plusieurs interlocuteurs sur différents projets


Skills & Requirements


Ce qu’il faut avoir :



  • Une curiosité innée pour l’univers technique informatique couplée à une soif d’apprendre,

  • Des notions de programmation et de « bug hunting » dans une application Web,

  • Une bonne connaissance de l’environnement Linux,

  • Une bonne capacité d’analyse et de résolution de problèmes,

  • Une forte sensibilité aux problématiques de sécurité des systèmes et des services,

  • Une bonne connaissance des problématiques d’architectures logicielles et infrastructures,

  • Avoir déjà utilisé des outils de provisionning tels que Chef, Puppet, Ansible…

  • Des connaissances dans le Cloud Public (GCP, Azure, AWS…) seraient un plus.


Ce que nous pouvons vous apporter :



  • Une bonne connaissance du Web et de son environnement technique,

  • Une bonne connaissance des environnements haute-disponibilité et haute performance,

  • Une expertise technique : Infra as Code, AWS, intégration et déploiement continus, etc.


Votre univers technologique :



  • Linux (principalement Debian)

  • Caching HTTP (principalement Varnish),

  • Serveurs Web (Apache, Nginx),

  • NoSQL & Bases de données (MySQL, PgSQL, Memcached, Redis, MongoDB, etc.),

  • Langages (PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby, Shell, etc.),

  • Cloud Public (AWS, Terraform),

  • Industrialisation (Chef, Capistrano).


Vous devez être :



  • Passionné,

  • Ouvert d’esprit,

  • Communiquant,

  • Transparent,

  • Bienveillant,

  • Bac +3 / +5 ou équivalent.

item.title: Mid-level PHP Software Engineer looking to make a difference in Healthcare at Lumeon (London, UK)
item.description:
Lumeon, an up and coming technology company within the healthcare sector, are looking for spirited individuals to join their Engineering team. Lumeon creates a platform used by some of the biggest names in healthcare in the UK and US to simply patient journeys, making the service more efficient for suppliers, hospitals and patients.


You will have the opportunity to work closely with various departments across the business and have the support of a passionate and hands-on CTO. We work in an Agile environment, ensuring customer features and improvements are developed in line with our roadmap. You will be working with API and a tech stack including CentOS, NginX and mySQL, to constantly improve the stability and enhancing the abilities of our product.


You will have the benefit of a close-nit Engineering team, including a DevOps and QA team, regular stand-ups and roadmap meetings to ensure the team are always informed of product changes and developments. Lumeon is a company that believes in transparency and we have monthly all-hands meetings delivered by our Executive Managers, keeping you abreast of happenings across all departments.


We also enjoy our down time, with regular staff events and treats for the staff such as pizza and a regular delivery of fruit for the more health conscious staff. You will also be able to choose from our flexible benefits scheme and all staff have access to our private healthcare plan with BUPA and company Options scheme


Training will be offered, with a combination of access to online training portals where you can learn new skills in your own time, to more formal training courses and seminars. This year all Engineers received SQL training and we will be holding Agile training sessions in the coming 12 months


We are looking for you to have extensive experience within a strong PHP team, working on web based applications. We would like you to have expertise in modern OOP and an understanding of web architecture. You will also need to be fluent in SQL, including data migration tasks, experienced in PHP frameworks and with Bash.


Experience with PCI-DSS and a basic understanding of Python and Ruby would be advantageous but not necessary.


Experience working within the healthcare sector is not necessary but a desire to join us in improving healthcare for all users and patients is a must!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Natural Language Processing at Chegg Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a Senior Engineer on our Writing Tools team, you will join a small, accomplished team building software to help students become better writers.  We are helping students to research & cite sources, while avoiding plagiarizing the works of others.  Our products reach over 30 million students from across the US, and more throughout the world.


You will be helping to architect a system to analyze both internal & external data sources to:



  • detect document similarity (possible plagiarism)

  • advise students on writing style & grammar

  • identify areas of study for students to improve their communication skills


Organization: Writing Tools



The Writing Tools platform is currently composed of four of the largest student citation services in the world - EasyBib.com, CitationMachine.net, Bibme.org, and CiteThisForMe.com. Our products reach over 30 million students from across the US, and more throughout the world. We are building next-generation writing tools to help students with other aspects of their writing process, including grammar and plagiarism checking, and are looking for passionate individuals to help us in our journey.


What You’ll Do:



  • Lead the development of a best in class search engine for internal and external data sources

  • Leverage large distributed data tools such as Solr and/or ElasticSearch

  • Create and present full-stack architecture for complex technological challenges

  • Implement end-to-end solutions in code

  • Be a role model for code quality, accuracy, and perfection of your solutions

  • Communicate and collaborate with product managers, designers, researchers, and data scientists to deliver the best user experience

  • Maintain full visibility of the status of the projects for which you are responsible

  • Continuously look for ways to improve our product and processes, provide feedback

  • Create documentation and teach at regular learning sessions

  • Have fun


Requirements:



  • BS (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related discipline

  • 3+ years of experience developing distributed data platforms

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals with competencies in data structures and problem-solving

  • Strong knowledge of Lucene, either with ElasticSearch or Solr

  • Expert knowledge of Java, Scala and/or python

  • Experience developing API’s for internal and external use


Bonus Points



  • Knowledge of Ruby, Javascript, Elixir and/or PHP

  • Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS

  • Experience advanced search algorithms

item.title: Machine/Deep Learning Engineer at INAIT (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
Major duties and responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the development of Machine/Deep Learning applications using state art machine learning frameworks to advance and verify INAIT’s workflow

  • Technical survey of Machine/Deep learning algorithms and technology


Essential skills and experience required:



  • Professional experience in developing Machine/Deep Learning applications, including CNN/RNN networks

  • Professional experience in the use of Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Caffe, pyTorch, … to build machine learning applications

  • Experience with text, image and sound data sets

  • Professional experience in developing Python code

  • Professional experience in different phases of the software development life-cycle, including unit testing, continuous integration, version control, debugging and documentation

  • Professional experience using UNIX/Linux operating systems

  • Good team player

  • Fluent spoken and written English


Preferred:



  • Professional experience in C/C++ code development

  • Interest in computational neuroscience and biology


Profile:



  • Master’s degree in computer science and/or scientific computing and/or applied mathematics, with at least 2-years of professional experience in machine/deep learning

  • Quality-driven work ethic

  • Successful track record in designing, developing and maintaining software projects

item.title: Senior Software Developer für mailbox.org at Heinlein Support GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
"Mit Kompetenz und Engagement arbeiten wir am sichersten Provider der Welt" lautet die Vision, die sich unser Team von derzeit rund 35 Kollegen an unserem Standort Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg gegeben hat. Teilen Sie unsere Vision? Dann machen Sie mit -- beim Testsieger der Stiftung Warentest.


Für unsere E-Mail-Provider mailbox.org und ox.io und unseren Geschäftsbereich Heinlein Hosting suchen wir Softwareentwickler (m/w) für unsere Webinterfaces und API-Backends, die gerne Verantwortung übernehmen. Besonders für folgende Arbeitsprofile:



  • Softwarearchitektur in PHP und JavaScript

  • Microservices

  • Continous Integration und Deployment

  • Aufbau einer hochskalierenden Plattform für <n> Millionen Nutzer


Ihr Aufgabenfeld


Wir entwickeln Kommunikations- und Sicherheitssoftware für unsere Plattformen und benötigen einen erfahrenen Programmierer für Planung, Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung der passenden Benutzerschnittstellen und zugehörigen Backend-Funktionen. Die Sicherstellung einer hohen Code-Qualität durch Reviews, Unit-Tests und Refactorings gehört genauso zu Ihrem Aufgabenfeld, wie die Analyse und Behebung von Fehlern und Anpassung der Applikation. Sie arbeiten in einem charmanten Team von 5 bis 6 Entwicklern + Teamleitung, unterstützt durch Scrum-Coaching und Projektmanager, sowie durch die Systemadministratoren unserer Plattformen. Ihr Hauptauftraggeber sind unsere Produkt-Teams und Projektmanager aus unserem Haus.


Ihr Profil



  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in PHP und JavaScript (Angular)

  • Arbeitsfähig in Python und bash

  • HTML und CSS (LESS/SASS) gehören für Sie zum Alltagswortschatz

  • Sie beherrschen einen strukturierten Programmierstil und koordinieren sich gut im Team

  • Im Bedarfsfall gehen Sie mit Kunden und Geschäftspartnern sicher und vertrauensvoll um

  • Streben nach steter Steigerung der Code-Qualität durch agile Arbeitsmethoden

  • Interesse an permanenter Fortbildung und Entwicklung

  • Gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse, gute Englisch-Kenntnisse


Zusatzqualifikationen (nicht zwingend erforderlich)



  • Sie können mit Linux umgehen

  • Sie haben Erfahrung mit Microservices


Sinnhaftigkeit, Teamarbeit & Flexibilität


Sinnvolles Arbeiten: Sie sind wesentlich daran beteiligt, mailbox.org zum sichersten E-Mail-Anbieter der Welt auszubauen und so auch in Zukunft eine sichere und freie Kommunikation zwischen unseren Kunden zu ermöglichen. Außerdem unterstützen Sie unseren seit 1989 existierenden ISP JPBerlin.de mit seinen sozial- und politisch engagierten Kunden und Organisationen sowie unsere Geschäftskunden bei Heinlein Hosting. - Wir bieten also einen vielfältigen, interessanten und verantwortungsvollen Arbeitsplatz.


Ein tolles Team: Sie arbeiten in einem kollegialen Team mitten in Berlin. Eigeninitiative und Mitdenken werden bei uns besonders unterstützt -- auf offene Kommunikation und Kollegialität legen wir großen Wert. Mindestens zwei Teamevents im Jahr und eine wöchentliche Mittags-Kochrunde freuen alle Kollegen, die dabei sein wollen.


Lebenslanges Lernen: Unsere hauseigene Heinlein Akademie lockt mit spannenden Fortbildungen Admins aus ganz Europa nach Berlin – und bietet für uns selbst natürlich ebenso zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, Neues zu erlernen und Vorhandenes zu vertiefen.


Sehr gute Rahmenbedingungen: Flexibilität in der Arbeitszeit für die Verbindung von Familie und Beruf sind für uns selbstverständlich. Ein angemessenes Gehalt, Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Freizeitausgleich, wenn es mal hoch her ging, gehören für uns genauso dazu wie eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre, frisches Obst und unser Masseur, der einmal die Woche vorbeikommt.


Ihre Bewerbung


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung). Diese richten Sie bitte ausschließlich per E-Mail mit PDF/JPG-Anhängen (keine MS-Word-Dokumente) an jobs@heinlein-support.de.


Ihr Ansprechpartner bei Fragen ist der Teamleiter der Developer, Yan Minagawa. Sie erreichen ihn telefonisch unter: 030 / 405051-60.

item.title: Inspec finished in 0.37004 seconds,61 examples,1 failure. Are you a Devops Hero? at Sky Betting & Gaming (Sheffield, UK)
item.description:
What does a Platform / DevOps Engineer do at Sky Betting and Gaming?


The delivery of Sky Betting and Gaming's next generation of highly available, high throughput (think thousands of requests per second), low latency services into production. Services that will underpin our rapidly growing customer base's core activities.


So who are the Core Tribe?


Working in the Core Tribe at SBG is one of the most challenging and fun. We manage payments and SSO for all SBG products and when we go down everything goes down. From scaling up systems to thousands of requests per second while still maintaining response times in the milliseconds while simultaneously introducing new first to market products such as Apple Pay.


Key to our ethos is teamwork both the Devs & Ops guys are on call together. Between the teams we ride the wave balancing delivering cool new features and ensuring stability where a mistake can cost millions in minutes


If you join us, you'll:
•    Be on-call sometimes 24x7 for the main sites and applications
•    Support internal development, test environments and help the devs
•    Own the release of internal code and push out config changes
•    Help automate things and bring older systems and processes forward
•    Be a guardian of code quality, helping the devs to make not just good features, but good systems
•    Set up monitoring for everything in sight - if it moves, graph it
•    Be a point of contact into Operations for various teams


Can you fix our problem?


We're looking for a developer with sys-admin war stories, or a sys-admin who can get into the code up to their elbows.  Mainly you need to know your stuff.


Data management - SQL, NoSQL, size, performance - these are mere details; you can make the data dance and the engine hum.


Code - you can branch, code, test, (code, test, code, test…), commit and deploy across a complex estate on just one cup of coffee.


Scaling - you can take a server's temperature, read a load-balancer, you know when to throw tin at it and when to go back to the code.


Automation - you understand the quandary of Chef vs Puppet, and you've had to choose; you know Jenkins' little foibles; your bash skills are strong.


Source - you have a favourite source-control system, a least favourite and the one you love to hate, but mainly you can handle the codebase no matter the size.


Systems - you know your Linux, know your sar from your iostat, you can nurse a sick server back to health in the wee small hours and find out how to make a given application fly…


Experience - whether you've been there and done that or are relatively junior, you've learned from every twist and turn and never tire of new things. 


Systems we use



  • We want you to help manage the LAMP stack but there’s other things too - Couchbase, Redis, kafka, RabbitMQ and Tomcat.  There’s a lot of internally-written systems.

  • We write our code in PHP, Java and Javascript, making heavy use of NodeJS.  There’s the usual mixture of bash, a little Python, some Ruby, the odd bit of perl.  Source control is Git.

  • We use Chef, Graphite, Nagios, NewRelic, Splunk, Hadoop, Riverbed Stingrays.  Where we need raw power and low latency we use our datacentres when we need flexibility and agility we use AWS.

  • We’re a RHEL/CentOS house.


Nosy at the office..


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7x_k7H55cI

item.title: Senior Software Developer - London at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills.


As a Senior Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do: Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using languages such as Java, Ruby and/or .NET, Scala, Clojure, Mobile and Python (to name a few) Help the team to champion software quality and engender technical vision and ensuring clients are satisfied Champion agile best practices and Continuous Delivery Be an ambassador of ThoughtWorks and safeguard our reputation Build strong relationships with business people Learn something new everyday Facilitate problem solving and work with a team to make them reality. Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan Help to grow the next generation of developers and have a positive impact on the industry Here’s what you’ll bring: Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration


Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code etc, Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, Encapsulation etc  


Experience of working in a forward thinking, OSS-centric environment We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so ideally you’ll be flexible about travel.

item.title: Lead Data Scientist, Director Level - Agoda Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
If you don't already know us, Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30°+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Maintaining this growth requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together.

Your role is to:
  • Crack our business problems and come up with deployable machine learning models
  • Interface with business to make sure they are asking the right questions
  • Sift through our data and find us some gems
  • Be a world-class hands-on deploy master


Charm us with:
  • An earned stripes in coding, in data handling, in statistics and in machine learning (5 years of experience is a must; experience of leading projects and/or team will be an advantage)
  • A good balance between theory and practice and a strong desire to learn and keep up with the latest technologies (a master degree in a quantitative field is a must; PhD is even better)
  • Battle-tested team leading skills
  • A good knowledge of what's "Under the hood" of statistical methods
  • Coding, coding, coding (R, Python, C#, Java, C++, Scala, )
  • Some extra points on: SQL, NLP, business acumen, blog writing, good sense of humour


We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (C# 7, .NET, ASP.NET MVC, RabbitMQ, Microsoft Azure) at viagogo (London, UK)
item.description:
The tech team at viagogo is focused on building a platform that will revolutionise the way fans across the globe buy and sell tickets for live events. With buyers and sellers using our website and mobile applications in almost every country and language and with hundreds of delivery and payment options, we're constantly taking on tough, exciting engineering challenges - and we're doing it at scale! We are looking for passionate, skilled Software Engineers who want to make meaningful, measurable improvements that impact millions of users.


How We Work


We work in a start-up like manner and we work in small scrum teams of 4-7. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of their part of the platform but also to contribute ideas, suggestions and code to other areas of the business. We believe that features have no value until they are in production adding value to our customers so teams deploy fast and often. The tech team is building something that has never been built before so we're always trying to think outside the box. We hold monthly hackathons where team members inside and outside of tech bring their most creative ideas for the product; some of which even make it to production the same night!


Here are some examples of cool things we've built recently:



  • We built a notification platform (comprised of RabbitMQ, C# Services, SQL Enterprise) which handles thousands of concurrent changes every minute. This reduced the latency for sale notifications from hours to seconds. We built a scalable delivery pipeline that delivers notifications in real-time to website users (via SignalR) and iOS and Android users (via Microsoft Azure Notification Hub).

  • We built a world class, hypermedia driven, RESTful API with outstanding documentation and several open source SDKs written in .NET, Ruby, Python and PHP


Your Responsibilities


As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the development, performance and scaling of our public website as well as the internal systems that power the viagogo customer experience. This entails using technologies such as C# 7.0, ASP.NET MVC and Web API, JavaScript, AngularJS, RabbitMQ, SignalR, SQL Server, git, Octopus Deploy and Microsoft Azure. We believe that every member of the team should act like they own the company so you will also be responsible for idea generation, speaking your mind and questioning decisions, and helping to build a work culture that we all love.

item.title: Big Data Architect (m/f) at Mynewsdesk (Leipzig, Germany)
item.description:
Do you like building great products? That’s what we’re doing here at Mynewsdesk. And we want more people with awesome skills to join our team! 


Right now, we are looking for a skilled Big Data Architect (m/f) to join our Dev Team in Leipzig!



What is it like to work at Mynewsdesk?  


We offer a workplace where the development teams are working in close collaboration with product managers, designers and quite recently also our new data unit. We share our knowledge and interests in cross-team meetings, internal conferences and lunch presentations. We love to learn and that’s why we have daily stand-ups, regular lab days and DevCorners all year round.


What's our stack? 


We are currently storing data in different systems such as Google Analytics, Keen.io but are currently migrating to a centralised data platform. Our applications are also using Solr, Apache Spark, Redis, Postgres, Mysql, Elastic Search, Mongodb. Business data are stored in Marketo and Salesforce. We are using plenty of services but welcomes way of simplifying our platform and stack.


What will you do?



  • As our first hired Big Data Architect you will be part of setting up our new data infrastructure and plan system integrations.

  • You will work very closely with Head of Data to understand and design solutions that fits our data needs

  • You will be our database and data pipeline lead to support our development teams with knowledge and database design

  • Create, when needed, database questions that answers complex business questions

  • You will become a valued teammate in a cross functional team of developers, designers and product leads

  • You will continuously deliver value to thousands of users and millions of visitor


That is you!




  • You have experience of working with AWS, Azure or other big data product stacks




  • You have experience of working with data integrations and have a few learnings on what to avoid and what’s important




  • You are a doer that loves to get your hands dirty and getting things done




  • You are used to programming languages and tools such as Ruby/Python, Scala, MapReduce, Hadoop, Apache Spark




  • You are always looking into new technologies and learn beyond your current set of expertise




  • You are fluent in English




  • You have excellence of database and data warehouse knowledge and are used to working with popular technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Amazon Redshift




  • Skills that would be a plus: Salesforce or other business systems and previous working with hierarchical  storage manager(HSM) systems.




What’s in it for you?




  • You will be part of creating a new infrastructure that will have a huge impact of Mynewsdesk success




  • An international work environment with offices and colleagues all over the world




  • Collaboration with and continuous learning from experienced and enthusiastic teams




  • Exciting projects, competitive salary, flexible work arrangements, regular team lunches and health allowances





Interested?


Great, then please send us your application and we’ll take it from there

item.title: Data Architect at Datalicious Pty Ltd (Bengaluru, India)
item.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Data Architect to join our team. We are looking for someone who has a strong cloud technology experience to help our big data team to take our products to the next level.


This is a hands-on role - you will be required to architect, design and build our big data pipelines. You are expected to bring with you extensive hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (Kinesis streams, EMR, Redshift), Spark and other Big Data processing frameworks and technologies as well as advanced knowledge of RDBS and Data Warehousing solutions.


Requirements:



  • A degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • 5+ years of experience

  • Extensive experience in AWS, certification will be a bonus.

  • You have in-depth knowledge of data architecture data modelling and database design best practice.

  • In depth knowledge of both OLAP and OLTP systems.

  • Hands on experience in big data migrations and data warehousing.

  • Knowledge of data governance and data quality strategies.

  • Understanding of a range of database technologies, including relational and NoSQL

  • Ability to write code in python.

item.title: Senior Node.js developer (online travel) at FindHotel (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior Node.js Developer at FindHotel, you will help to develop from the ground up a high-performance data platform that powers the website FindHotel, scaling up web traffic from 2M+ visitors to 10M+ by the end of the year.




What you tell your friends you do


"I am a great backend developer who can make code run safely yet fast as lightning!"




What you will really be doing



  • Building a high-performance data platform, dealing with the data for millions of hotels. Retrieving and handling data from multiple sources;

  • Developing our own APIs and deploy them as independent services;

  • Building the right suite of monitoring and alerting system, in order to have both the helicopter view and the magnifying glass at hand whenever needed;

  • Improving the code base, architecture, infrastructure, and overall quality of our product, in order to deliver a great experience to each and every one of our users.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an experienced backend developer in a diverse team of talented experts, and you enjoy working on a product delivering quality code while meeting ambitious deadlines;

  • You choose the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. We're always open to re-evaluating choices that were made in the past: there is always a budget for good ideas;

  • You understand speed is a feature: you love benchmarking and experimenting with different technologies to figure out new ways of improving your code over time.


What we worked on last quarter



  • Created a fast RESTApi, build on AWS Lambda's to serve the results of our machine learning models

  • We built a scalable infrastructure in the cloud, based on AWS, Docker, and Continuous Deployment, that serves on average 11M+ requests per day.


What a day in the office might look like


In the morning, after the daily stand-up, you pair program with a fellow developer to improve the performance of an API call which is not as fast as it could be. After lunch, you provide some feedback on the quality of a couple PRs from your teammates. Then you implement a new feature from the backlog or tackle an annoying technical debt issue that you've been keeping an eye on for a while.



Why join now?



  • We have successfully built the foundation of a great product, which will evolve in time and compete with the big players of the travel industry. By joining the team now, you will have the chance to have a strong impact on how we grow our tech stacks and the way approach work.

  • We are looking to grow traffic from 2M monthly visitors to 10M+ by the end of 2017. This is the perfect time to become part of the team working on the core behind our product, tackling exciting challenges around scalability and performance.

  • We are a company that is growing fast, hiring talent across many different areas of expertise (development, data science, data analysis, marketing, UX). Each team collaborates with the others on a lot of different tasks, making every day the day when you learn something new.

  • You will have fun writing code for existing and new applications, integrating them with internal and external systems, with room to explore new technologies and architectures!



Requirements



What we're looking for



  • 7+ years of professional experience in data heavy backend development

  • Relevant professional experience with Node.js for at least 3 years.

  • Relevant professional experience with other languages, such as Python, Scala, Java, C#, SQL, Go, Elixir

  • A solid understanding of the whole life cycle of (web) applications  including testing, deploying, monitoring

  • Experience with development and integration of SQL databases, ETL, message queues, REST APIs, third party integrations

  • Experience running high-traffic websites and strong focus on performance optimisation, scalability, and reliability

  • Professional Experience in working with AWS (EC2, ECS, RDS)



  • Bonus points if you have professional experience with other AWS services such as Lambda, Data Pipeline, Kinesis, Cloudformation

  • Bonus points if you have professional experience with Docker, Terraform


What we offer



  • The opportunity to work in a diverse international team within a profitable company with a startup mindset

  • An agile environment where communication and initiative is valued and cherished

  • Many chances to develop yourself, including access to courses and conferences

  • No nonsense! We’re proud of our flat hierarchy and short, democratic decision paths

  • A fun work environment at a great office in the city center of Amsterdam



Tip: read some of our blog posts before applying and have a look at our Github profile to find out what we are working on!

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Ageras (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
We’re looking for an awesome senior software developer: dedicated to the craft and able to build high-quality, innovative, and fully performing products for our customers. As Europe's largest platform for professional services, we’re invested in adding transparency to the markets of accounting and legal services. Ageras is a disruptive, fast-paced company where IT is our core product.

The role

As our Senior Software Developer, you’ll have a key role in the development of our client and partner-facing platforms, used by thousands of clients and partners every day. We’re a team of front- and backend developers, product- and project managers, and we work together in an informal, agile environment where the customer is king. We’re passionate experts in everything from HAProxy, PHP/Laravel, Docker over MySQL, Elasticsearch to ES6, React and Redux. Here, we’re responsible for our own systems – if you built it, you run it – and we expect a lot from each other.

Requirements

You are

You have proven experience in designing, developing, and maintaining SaaS products. You want to build new features and have a passion for designing the right architecture; you love to code; and you’re cool to work with.

You’re eager to take on responsibilities and meet deadlines, and you’re the team’s go-to-guy, whether it’s debugging complex production issues, knowledge-share, or by mentoring junior developers. You’re highly adaptable to changes and you’re motivated by working in a vibrant, fast-moving start-up.

Additionally, you:



  • Have solid expertise in software engineering, preferably LAMP (but Python or similar is also cool)

  • Take pride in and are passionate about code quality, TDD and scalable and stable systems

  • Set high standards to inspire the rest of the team

  • Love to tinker with new technologies to move our stack forward

  • Have great ideas that can turn into successful products


Benefits


We think you’ll love it here. At Ageras, we take fun seriously, because motivated Agerians equal happy clients and partners. Driven by our HR team, we offer a social, collaborative, high performing and energetic work environment. We care about where your career will be in 2, 3, or 5+ years – and in getting you there. This is really an opportunity to grow with one of the fastest growing companies in Northern Europe.



  • We serve breakfast and lunch every day – and drink a very decent coffee

  • We have Fun Friday bars on our huge rooftop terrace - which also happens to hold our mini-golf course

  • We offer a competitive compensation package


Interested?


Now that we’ve caught your attention, it’s time for you to catch ours, so please send us your resume or a link to your work (with contact details). All applications are continuously evaluated, but you can expect to hear from us within 4 weeks.


If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Junior Recruiter, Imke Wieboldt at +45 77 34 80 92.

About Ageras


At Ageras, we’re all about making complex things simple, and that is because we believe it to be more fair, transparent, and empowering. We’re building a simple ecosystem connecting clients to lawyers, accountants, and bookkeepers. We’re a high-growth technology startup with 80 employees in Copenhagen, and after 5 years we now have a footprint in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, the Netherlands, Germany – with more countries to come.

item.title: Operations Engineer at Travelport Digital (Dublin 2, Ireland)
item.description:
How would you like to be the newest addition to the Travelport Digital Limited (TDL) Family?



  • This role is part of the expansion of our Operations team, reporting to Operations Manager.

  • You will be responsible for maintaining TravelportDigital's development, pre-production and production environments, and all associated systems and processes.

  • It’s a fast paced role, offering a great blend of technical and continual innovation to drive systems improvements.

  • You will be a part of a team promoting a DevOps culture



What will I be doing?



  • Our infrastructure is delivered with Amazon AWS across multiple regions

  • Working closely with our development teams to manage Travelport Digital’s dynamic environments , using a variety of open source technologies

  • Technically assess and review request for new resources from Travelport Digital’s development team, making independent judgments as to its suitability (e.g. scalability, security, reliability, increased efficiency, fit in with existing systems etc.)

  • Establishing new processes and systems to facilitate transition of code to our production environments (e.g. managing large development projects at varying stages)



Skills & Experience:



  • Minimum 3+ years working in an Operations Team

  • Provide technical and organizational leadership to engineers and technicians for production support, process troubleshooting and process improvement

  • Excellent on Network administration experience

  • Excellent Linux Administration experience

  • Experience with managing large scale distributed systems and task automation.

  • Experience in a highly available and highly secure environment.

  • Proficient in a scripting languages (Python, Bash, etc.)

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At Wayfair, we are looking to grow our Site Reliability Engineering team by bringing on board a talented Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to help manage the large scale physical and virtual server environment that underpins our global e-commerce platform.

Though the focus of this team is Linux, due to the nature of our platforms you will be involved with and exposed to a wide variety of systems. This team owns a large portion of our customer facing systems and services, and as such are heavily involved in the architecture, growth, and improvement of our various platforms.

Ever wondered what it would like to work at ‘internet scale’? At Wayfair we are dealing with internet scale challenges on a daily basis. With our traffic doubling year over year consistently we are faced with some pretty exciting and interesting challenges!


Some projects the team is currently working on in 2017:



  • Create and improve tools to aid in monitoring and control of our systems

  • Enhance our infrastructure to support a variety of different disaster recovery options

  • Expansion of current physical data centers

  • Migrating targeted applications, sites, systems to cloud platforms

  • Improving automation of systems, processes, and services

  • Looking to the future - containers? Mesos?




Responsibilities include:



  • Taking POC Systems and preparing them for production use by applying our standards to them and making them immutable

  • Provide the highest level of technical escalation within the organization of our critical production platforms

  • Improve security and performance of infrastructure

  • Automate, Automate, Automate

  • Provide Architecture & Design feedback for all production platforms, as well as for other teams with in the organization

  • Proactively monitor systems to anticipate business needs before they become critical path

  • Thinking of what is the next big infrastructure thing




Qualifications:



  • 5+ Years experience in a SRE/DevOps type role

  • Experience managing Linux in a large scale environment

  • Experience working with Linux automation tools, such as Puppet, Chef, etc.

  • Knowledge of Web Servers (Apache/Nginx)

  • Familiarity with load balancing tools and techniques (HAProxy, etc)

  • Experience working in virtualized environments

  • Experience working with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)

  • Scripting ability particularly in Bash, PHP, Python or Ruby




Other traits we look for:



  • Good interpersonal and team building skills

  • An easy-going attitude and sense of humor

  • A positive, people-oriented and energetic attitude

  • A strong drive to learn and try new things

  • An analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems

  • An interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and having fun while doing it

item.title: Java Backend Developer at Casumo (Is-Swieqi, Malta)
item.description:
What would be your role?


Casumo is agile so we expect you to take on a broad spectrum of tasks. Together we will work to realize our dreams and visions of how the world’s best gaming site should look and work. We are looking for developers who are driven and won’t say no to a challenge but also they have to care for what they do as we expect taking responsibility for the code written.


Who are you? 



  • Someone who likes to work in a flat organization.

  • Someone who enjoys autonomy.

  • Driven and motivated.

  • A team player.

  • Willing to work out of our offices in Malta, Barcelona, or on remote (within selected EU countries) as part of our distributed workforce.

  • A nice person that can bear conversations about unicorns.


Skills & Requirements


A Backend Java Developer at Casumo 



  • Is native in Java, but speaks and writes Bash, SQL and Python. If you have any experience with Kotlin, Scala or Javascript it’s not impossible that you’ll get to practice that too.

  • Has an interest both in the big picture and for the small details, a key to work in our tightly knit team.

  • Likes freedom with responsibility and would feel comfortable in an environment of developer anarchy.

  • Has a desire to take full ownership of features and code, from inception of ideas to deployment, maintenance and keeping it running.

  • Appreciates the concepts and principles underlying open-source culture and good software development.

  • Is a person who loves to play with code, understands the need of quality and cares about it

  • Gets curious when we say CQRS, Event Sourcing or MicroServices. Feels very comfortable in a Linux environment and working with tools like Git.

  • It’s a plus if you have experience with transaction-heavy, distributed systems, messaging, MicroServices or tools such as MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, Spring, Dropwizard or Jenkins/TeamCity.

  • Would be stoked to build the world’s best gaming experience together with other Casumos from our headquarters in sunny Malta, Barcelona or on remote (within selected EU countries).

item.title: Data Engineer at Condé Nast International (London, UK)
item.description:
Description



Condé Nast International (CNI) publishes Vogue, Wired, Ars Technica, Vanity Fair, Glamour, GQ and many other leading brands. We're in China, Japan, Taiwan, India, Russia, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, the UK and Mexico.



In total we run 64 websites for about 220 million monthly uniques. We’re profitable, privately owned and committed to constantly reinventing ourselves at the tender age of 107.



Historically, we've had different tech stacks in markets all over the world. Now we’re looking at unifying our core platform, including our CMS and data infrastructure.



This is a new international team, with the opportunity to help define what we ship and how we ship it. You'll get a rare look at digital publishing around the world. You’ll be working with experienced folks in product, data and UX who have done this before. And you’ll have a leadership team that gets it, a clear strategy to execute on and the freedom to get on with it your way.



This role is data focused and is embedded within CNI’s Data & Insight team. Your experience in this area will enable you to develop solutions which will expand the team’s capabilities and help them deliver ground breaking actionable insights to benefit editorial, product and commercial teams.



Key Duties and Responsibilities



  • Understand and contribute to shaping and delivery of strategic and operational objectives of Data & Insight team.

  • Own, develop and maintain data architecture and solutions for Data & Insight Team e.g. data warehouse, insight tools, ETL process, cost effective tracking.

  • Act as data champion and technical liaison between Data and Insight team and Product Development teams driving collaboration and education.

  • Design and deploy innovative solutions to streamline manual tasks across Data & Insight team.

  • Work closely with the team to ensure accuracy and timeliness of data collection and processing.

  • Support team with extracting value from data sets with advanced/complex analyses.

  • Own your features from backlog to deployment and beyond.

  • Build well-documented services used by teams worldwide.

  • Follow the best practices of the Engineering teams including TDD, DevOps, pairing and mentoring.



Essential Skills and Requirements



Technologies



  • Experience of key technologies (which may include Java, Pig, SQL, R, Python, Xpath, Regex, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6), React, PHP, AWS, Git, node.js, Ruby, MariaDB, Presto, Big Query, Hadoop, Map Reduce, Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, D3, Highcharts, ETL scripts, Splunk, Elastic Search).

  • Experience of Social Media and Video platform APIs (e.g. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, WeChat, YouTube, Brightcove, Dailymotion etc).

  • Experience of writing software in a TDD approach.

  • Understanding of architectural patterns e.g. CRUD, CQRS.

  • Have the ability to work across the whole web application stack.


Data Skills



  • Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets (including message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores).

  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.


Team



  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Nice to have:



  • Maths/statistical background.

  • Experience in AI and machine learning.

  • Experience of Google Cloud Services.

  • Knowledge of publishing key metrics and business models including advertising and subscription.

item.title: Software Engineer at Greenbyte AB (Göteborg, Sweden)
item.description:
Greenbyte develops Breeze and Bright - the next generation analytics cloud platform for renewable energy. Our customers reside all over the world, and together we manage almost 7 gigawatts of super-clean wind and solar energy! One of Sweden’s fastest growing tech companies, we are a team of young professionals on a mission to convert more renewable resources into electricity, and we need your help!


Join us in building a complex big data SaaS system with a microservice backend, that juggles huge amounts of data per minute, runs it through machine learning, has strict performance requirements, and shows it in a modern frontend. Does this sound exciting and challenging to you? Of course it does!


As a newcomer to the team, you will be gently embraced by a mentor that will help you evolve into a rockstar software engineer, and build a system you will be proud of. Your current experience and knowledge of languages and platforms are much less important than your drive, desire, and ability to produce amazing code.


Our stuff is mostly developed in C#, ASP.NET, and MySQL, with some sprinkles of python, bash and other goodies, and lives in the Amazon Web Services cloud. We are a super-agile team working in scrumban, with the goal of using the best tools possible and constantly improving.


What will you be doing?



  • Develop a cutting-edge big data SaaS system with the best tools, processes, and colleagues in the business!

  • Ship features that help our customers convert more wind and solar into renewable, clean energy for the future.

  • Participate in the technical specification of features in roadmap together with the product owners.

  • Support the continuous improvement of our development process.

  • Participate actively in code reviews, and architecture meetings.

item.title: Quality Engineer - backend at F-Secure (Pozna, Poland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced and ambitious Quality Engineer to join a team of professionals working on the fastest growing product of the company: Rapid Detection Service. It is a tool that helps to prepare organizations for advanced cyber attacks, before and after they happen. More info available at: [https://www.f-secure.com/en/web/business_global/rapid-detection-service]


Key Responsibilities:



  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate quality activities

  • Writing automated test cases for our products

  • Maintaining and enhancing the test automation system in cooperation with the developers

  • Constantly improving our quality processes.


Job Qualifications, most of the following:



  • Hands-on experience in Python and shell scripting

  • Experience at Linux system administration

  • Test Automation and continuous integration experience

  • Experience in writing automated tests

  • Hands-on experience in using git, Jenkins

  • Experience in working on AWS

  • Familiar with the Internet Protocol family (You are no stranger to RFCs and Wireshark.)

  • Excellent team player, self-confident and willing to work in fast changing environments.

  • Good command of English


You will be responsible for developing test automation and bring quality of the product to the next level. In order to make our work efficient, Quality Engineers and developers work in the same team. Teams are small, so communication and team skills inside and outside team are key assets for our international team members. You will work closely with stakeholders and development teams in Poznan and in Helsinki. Test automation is a crucial part of the development and it is enabling us to do regular two-week production release cycle, with some parts of the solution being released multiple times per week and we have an even higher goal.


What? Aren't we known for doing superhuman and mystical Cyber Security stuff at F-Secure? We do advanced Cyber Security and you can expect to work arm in arm with the best experts on this field. Relax though, nothing to fear, no mystical stuff just common sense and industry best practices. As a bonus, you will learn a lot from our hackers.


We offer flexibility in the workplace and a vibrant, friendly, international company culture with a Nordic management style. You will join a friendly, supportive and open community. We live our values instead of printing them on the walls.


This position offers a diverse range of paths towards success and career growth.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer (m/f) at Talend (Bonn, Germany)
item.description:
Talend is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing team in our Bonn Office. In this role, you’ll be responsible for the security, stability, and scalability of our Talend Cloud service. You’ll get to work hands-on with plenty of exciting technology and scale challenges as we grow to support millions of transactions across hundreds of servers in our Talend Cloud environment. We are seeking candidates with expertise on both development and system administration. 

Responsibilities



  • Maintain technical operations for our iPaaS cloud infrastructure; administer Linux systems, including configuration, troubleshooting, and automation, and some limited Windows system administration duties

  • Ensure high reliability and availability for production systems, including upgrade and release processes and incident handling

  • Manage and deploy internal and external monitoring solutions for maintaining high availability for production systems

  • Develop effective tooling, alerts, and response to both identify and address reliability risks

  • Scripting abilities in python, or JVM-based languages

  • Define and evangelize cloud-related optimizations and best practices to improve reliability and performance

  • Responsible for troubleshooting cloud infrastructure, systems, network, and application stacks

  • Work with fellow operations engineers and development teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of action

  • Perform on-call duty as part of a team maintaining the availability and performance of our cloud infrastructure as well as the various internal services and systems that these core services depend on. 


Required Skills



  • 5-7 years of cloud engineering experience

  • Bachelors in Computer Science or a relevant field

  • Strong working knowledge of Linux (Centos) systems and applications including Tomcat, Java, Apache, ElasticSearch, ActiveMQ, Ngnix Proxy;

  • Experience with administering AWS or other IaaS/PaaS Infrastructures;

  • Experience with configuration management / systems automation tools at scale (e.g. Puppet, Chef);

  • Experience with big data systems and/or database administration (e.g. MySQL, Mongo DB, PostGresSQL, NoSQL, and SQL) a plus;

  • Proficiency with scripting languages;

  • Experience with network management systems and network monitoring tools such as Nagios, Icinga, Kibana, LogStash, Cacti;

  • Ability to work independently, strong interpersonal and communications skills.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Vistaprint (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We’re looking for experienced software developers to build Vistaprint’s promotional products shop. This rapidly expanding team is a growing part of Barcelona technology community. 


About us…


We are an agile, customer focused organization working on a high-growth part of our business.  The promotional product market is multi-billion-dollar opportunity for our team to explore.  We will be developing new solutions to help customers find, design, and purchase a wide variety of products (products including clothing, pens, bags, and more).


Our technology community in Barcelona is a growing 25 people focused on building the right solutions, the right way, continuously in cross-functional teams. We speak many languages like C#, Java, Python, as well as English, Spanish, and Japanese.  We’re passionate about our customers, being agile, and building innovative solutions to challenging problems.  We believe strongly in servant leadership, team empowerment, and self-organization.


Happy people + great environment = great products!


What would you be doing?


We are building the next generation of our promotional products shopping experience.  Here are some examples of what this work includes:



  • Providing our customers with an incredible, online design experience so they can make the products we sell their own.

  • Building the next generation of our ecommerce selling experience.

  • Making build-vs-buy choices for our evolving technology platform.

  • Building continuously deployed micro-services that provide back-end flexibility, and rapidly testable front-end experiences that delight our customers.

  • Integrating with other Vistaprint services as well as off-the-shelf and open source capabilities.


What’s in it for you?


In addition to joining an amazingly talented international team we have a great benefits package including…



  • Competitive salary, lunch benefit + healthcare

  • Flexible working hours with paid time off

  • Onsite training, conferences, meetups, library, online training subscription

  • Active sports community (basketball, beach volleyball and ping pong)

  • Free food, drinks, and fresh organic fruit

  • Language courses (Catalan, Spanish, and English)

  • And more!


Who are you?


You’re like us: passionate software craftspeople who are looking to teach and learn from the best in technology. Since everyone’s path is different, below is a sample of what our team collectively can do.



  • Build software both server side (Java, C#, micro-services) and client side (HTML5, JavaScript)

  • Build, deploy, and operate our systems

  • Operate as an autonomous, empowered team solving compelling business problems with innovative technical solutions

  • Seek an environment of group feedback and personal development

  • Experience with 3rd party content and ecommerce systems (e.g. Magnolia, Sitecore, commercetools, Hybris, etc.)


If the above sounds interesting to you don’t hesitate to apply (using a resume in English), we look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Continuous Integration Engineer (m/f) at Safran Vectronix AG (Heerbrugg, Schweiz)
item.description:
We are looking for a Continuous Integration Engineer (m/f) who will be responsible for design, implementation and monitoring the build and delivery infrastructure for our software development team.
