item.title: Senior DevOps Data Engineer - AWS at Zoopla Property Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Devops Data Engineer - AWS


The Big Data Platform is at the heart of ZPG`s transformation into a data driven consumer centric company. It provides access to our data lake, filled with diverse sources of content, usage, profile, transactional, and behavioural data from across all our brands. The platform provides storage, big-data compute, ad-hoc analytical data access, workflow pipeline management, and data access services for both existing applications and new experiments. It provides the facilities used by data science and engineering teams across the organization to apply analytics and deep learning techniques to derive the insights that empower the analytical community.


As a DevOps Engineer, you will build out the big data platform and work with Agile engineering teams to provide production insight into running and operating software at-scale in a globally distributed highly available cloud based system.


You will play a hands-on role helping the team meet ambitious technical, operational, and business requirements. The ideal candidate will be a systems thinker with a passion for creating products that deliver incredible customer experiences and have deep experience with operational automation, data driven metrics collection, and a true desire to automate it rather than do it repeatedly.


Key Responsibilities



  • Build, test, operate and improve the server and service infrastructure on AWS.

  • Implement and maintain industry best-practise for automated configuration, management and security.

  • Implement the benefits of automated testing and continuous integration.

  • Design and maintain monitoring, measuring and alerting systems.

  • Evaluate software performance - optimisation / failover resilience and guide the team in choosing the right profile hardware for the application.

  • Working closely with our software engineers and data scientists to design and implement the infrastructure for large-scale data analysis and data products

  • Research and recommend new technologies and features, keeping the business up to date with the state of the art in system technologies.

  • Works closely with the data science team to ensure the big data architecture enables the machine learning algorithms which power the product

  • Share On-Call rotations with the rest of the software engineering team.




Skills required:


Essential:



  • Experience in cloud computing, ideally with AWS.

  • Experience with Unix/Linux operating system, networking and information security.

  • Understanding of DevOps methodologies and concepts.

  • Continuous Integration experience with Jenkins

  • Experience with source code repositories, especially Git.

  • Understanding and consistent experience with the entire software delivery life cycle and agile methodology

  • Ability to use monitoring and evaluate outcomes

  • A love for solving complex problems and desire to deliver high-quality work

  • Self-confidence and great communication skills

  • Ability to script languages and code in either Bash or Python

  • Experience with cloud formation or equivalent

  • Knowledge of container virtualization and orchestration layers, like Docker and Kubernetes.


Desired:



  • Experience in real-time analytics and streaming platforms (Spark Streaming, Kafka or Kinesis Streams, etc)

  • Experience running machine learning pipelines in production

  • Knowledge of Distributed Systems.

  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases like Redis, Cassandra or DynamoDB.

  • A love for achieving optimal resource utilisation and cost balancing

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (ETL Pipelines, SQL-on-Hadoop, *nix) at Canva (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
At Canva, we work every day to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform!

Since launch in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 10 million users in over 40 languages. We are one of the world’s fastest growing technology companies with software engineering being the core part of who we are. 

We take pride in our focus on software engineering fundamentals and pragmatism.  With engineers from previous companies such as Google, Facebook, Atlassian, Amazon, and Yahoo, the team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand - striking a measured balance between getting things done and long-term maintainability.

This is an opportunity to be one of the foundational members of the Data Engineering function at Canva; taking ownership of our Data Warehouse to derive business value and contribute to the delivery of rich features and functionality to our millions of users around the world. 

Responsibilities



  • Hands-on development and management of our newly developed Data Warehouse platform.

  • Responsibility for the continued development of new features, functionality, and optimisation from raw data ingestion, to the access and modelling layer, through to maintaining the visualization layer.

  • Providing functional and technical subject matter expertise with respect to data management, business intelligence, and reporting to internal stakeholders across the Canva business.

  • Responsibility for managing planning and delivery of Data projects and initiatives across the wider business; in conjunction with Experiments, Product Analytics, and the Machine Learning Team.


Required Skills & Experience


  • Demonstrated experience working with large volumes of data across in-house and third-party data warehousing platforms running in *nix environments

  • Demonstrated understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem and related technologies: HDFS, Yarn, Hive, Presto, Impala, etc

  • Hands-on experience developing ETL Pipelines with open source tools such as Airflow, Luigi, etc

  • Experience developing and designing dashboards and reporting systems.

  • Previous software engineering Experience in OO, functional, or scripting languages - Java, Scala, Python, Bash, etc

  • Experience with cloud-based infrastructure and associated tools on Amazon Web Services (preferably), Google Cloud, or Azure

  • Familiarity with a wide set of Data Warehouse architectures and methodologies, schemas, and performance / optimization principles

  • Excellent written & and verbal communication and collaborative skills


Benefits


  • Competitive salary, plus equity options

  • Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance

  • In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day

  • Fitness membership allowance, plus free Yoga and Boxing Gym membership

  • Generous parental leave policy

  • Pet-friendly offices including a garden, climbing wall, unisex toilets

  • Sponsored social clubs and team events

  • Fun and quirky celebrations

  • Relocation budget provided for interstate or overseas candidates and visa application fees covered





We ensure that the Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so, with breakout areas, little nooks, quiet places to retreat. We have three in-house chefs that whip up amazing breakfasts and lunches for the whole team, check out what's cooking at: https://instagram.com/canvavibe/


For more insight into how we work, check out this article by our CTO and the rest of our engineering blog.


If you're a passionate technologist a truly challenging opportunity, with one of the worlds premier technology companies, all while living in beautiful Sydney, Australia - then apply now to start the discussion with us!

item.title: Principal Software Development Engineer - Compliance and Security at Chef Software (Belfast, UK)
item.description:
Chef is building the best infrastructure automation platform on the planet. We’re writing the rules of the cloud -- rules the world’s top engineers live, breathe and contribute to. Our platform is used to enable hundreds of millions of people around the world to chat, fly, present, bank, game, shop, and learn. Chances are the web applications you use everyday have infrastructure built, deployed, secured and managed with our code.


The partner engineering team is a fast moving and highly technical group responsible for designing and building the right product integrations with our Ecosystem partners. These range from the major hyperscale clouds like AWS, Microsoft and Google to a wide range of enterprise software vendors. Integration with our ecosystem partners is key to the successful adoption of Chef within an enterprise, as such you will play an integral role in the success of the company.


You would be a engineering leader in the team building content to allow enterprises to meet their compliance and audit requirements using InSpec and Chef Automate.  


WHO YOU ARE:



  • You’ve spent the last few years working with a range of Cloud Technologies and DevOps tools to deliver projects and solutions

  • You have experience taking the lead role in designing and implementing complex technical solutions for Cloud based solutions and complex software architectures

  • You have solid software development skills with experience in (one or more of) Ruby, Erlang, Python, Go, C/C++, C# or Java

  • Expertise with Linux and Windows operations and networking is a given

  • You like to dive in, learn new things, and want to build awesome productsYou can demonstrate deep knowledge for languages and technology stacks that you've worked with

  • Previous experience (8+ years) as a software engineer, technical consultant or partner engineerPrevious experience working in a security focused engineering role a plus

  • You’ll enjoy collaborating closely with Chef Customers and Partner teams to understand their complex issues, solve their problems and elicit frequent feedback on the solutions you provide

  • You believe quality is part of the process and not an afterthought

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience, is required


WHAT YOU’LL DO:



  • Become an expert and advocate on our Inspec Compliance Tool to ensure its usage by customers remaining compliant and secure in an ever changing DevOps landscape

  • Lead and mentor other engineers in developing InSpec profiles for common OS hardening and regulatory compliance standards

  • Create tooling and infrastructure to allow Chef to assert the high quality of such profiles that are created

  • Support open source contributors, new and experienced, with supportive and constructive code review, documentation improvements, and workflow changes

  • Advocate and support improvements to our APIs and improvements with core development and integration of our partners

  • Work on issues and improvements in our tools critical to the success of Chef’s customers and the broader Chef community



Work isn’t just about work though. We offer competitive salaries, equity, fantastic benefits, and flexible hours.  You’ll also get to work with some of the most down to earth, driven, intelligent and well read developers in their fields!  


Our Belfast site is growing and we want to ensure we create a team with a diverse worldview.  That are excited to build a high quality DevOps engineering environment that's an exciting, enjoyable and creative place to work.


If this sounds like a team you’d enjoy working with and technology you want to spend time on, for a product you can get behind, get in touch!


At Chef, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products and our community to flourish. Chef is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or Veteran status.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer - R&D at R3PI (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description:
At R3PI, Solera’s R&D Team, we are a group of dedicated and disruptive innovators who are committed to building the future of Solera. We wake up every day hating what we did yesterday, so that we can do it different today and change the world around us. We operate like a greenfield startup environment and build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously (agile, kanban). Our playground consists of connected car, connected home, wearables, IoT, 3D, AR, and things that don’t even exist... yet.


We pride ourselves on being uncommon. We seek individuals who are prepared to push and challenge themselves each day to do it right, better and different. You will want to work in a collaborative team environment where accountability is demanding and rewarding.


We are seeking high-energy, versatile, and uncommon innovators who possess both the development skills and business acumen to operate at a hyper-fast and accurate speed. Our rapid innovation team is responsible for using the latest, cutting edge technologies to combine any and all global data, software, and services to create innovative concepts and solutions that will help our customers gain a competitive edge in the digital world.


How You'd Kick Ass:



  • Automate Everything. In order to build and maintain a resilient, secure, and efficient platform, you will automate anything and everything - including deployment, monitoring, management and incident response. You will build and manage our production systems and tackle challenges associated with building things for the R&D team.

  • Collaborative Team Player in an Agile Environment. You will implement and operate the infrastructure for Solera’s next generation platform in a fully tested agile model. You will engage as part of an agile engineering team to deliver an end-to-end consumer facing proposition. This involves collaborating with BA’s, Product Owners, Designers, and third party development teams in person and remotely to deliver a resilient, scalable infrastructure.

  • Passion for Technology. You’re a champion for innovative, agile, development practices and are inspired by exploring technology, experimenting with the latest innovations, and tinkering with the latest trends to create amazing new solutions. You will support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.


Skills & Requirements



  • AWS expert

  • Proficient in release automation, system administration, automated provisioning, and system debugging

  • Mastering scripting languages and configuration management tools

  • Experience with API gateways

  • Agile/XP experience

  • Experience running databases at scale 

  • Providing tooling for developers

  • Experience working within micro-service delivery team

  • Microservices infrastructure - service discovery, configuration service,  API gateways Experience with CQRS architecture - Kafka/Kinesis

  • Experience working with production PAAS platforms such as Cloudfoundry, Heroku, Openshift, Elastic Beanstalk

  • Experience using containerization technologies such as Docker, rkt, Garden

  • Production & Continuous Delivery/Deployment pipelines using tools such as Concourse, Drone, Jenkins 2.0, Bamboo

  • Programming experience in the likes of NodeJS, Python, Go, Ruby, Java, C++

  • Experience using configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform

  • Application Performance Monitoring and Log aggregation at scale

  • Eligibility to work in Switzerland


Mindset:



  • Passionate: you are proud of what you do and only accept the best from yourself and your team

  • Get it done mentality: Efficient and accurate even under pressure, flexible to adjust

  • Take on responsibility: Pro-active, ready to help out where needed

  • Be accurate and deliver quality, have a roll up sleeves attitude

  • Excellent collaborative team player with communication skills to match

  • Adaptable and flexible meet demands. You are relentless and passionate to get the job done

  • Action-oriented – this is a self-contained collaborative team driven by challenging targets but presented with exciting problems to solve

  • Demonstrated pro-activity in capitalizing on opportunities and resolving issues

  • Intellectually curious - prepared to challenge and be challenged

  • Constantly strive to learn new technologies and look for ways to stay up to date in this rapidly changing industry

  • Flexibility to travel if required


Benefits:



  • Possibility to lead a team

  • Startup-like environment, international team collaborating across Zurich, Dallas, London

  • No MBA or academic egos; this is a meritocracy where you prove your worth by doing cool stuff -daily

  • Work with leading technologists of their fields, opportunities to learn and grow every day

  • Access to the tools and technologies you choose to get the job done

  • Cool office located next to Bellevue at Lake Zurich: a former garage including gym, shower, foosball, free drinks and snacks…

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Criteo Labs (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Description


We are seeking a talented, enthusiastic Software Engineer with a taste for SRE challenges, to join our team in Palo Alto, that will help us migrate part of our infrastructure from AWS to our own datacenters.


What you will be doing:




  • Write high quality, maintainable code as leading member of the platform team

  • Be a part of a team working on a high volume, highly available system, critical to the success of the business

  • Participate in architecture discussions, influence the roadmap, and take ownership and responsibility over new projects

  • Migrate scalable, available, low latency systems designed to serve for high traffic

  • Communicate with a wide range of stakeholder inside and outside R&D



What You Bring to the Role:




  • BS in Software Engineering or related field.

  • 4+ years of programming experience in C#, Java, or C++.

  • You have a rock-solid foundation in Computer Science (data structures, algorithms, software design).

  • You are experienced with architecting, developing and extending large and complex systems.

  • A passion for shipping quality high-performance code.

  • You are a problem solver, a fixer, and a creative technologist. We believe coding is a talent and a passion, not just a skill.

  • You need to be a great team worker and a great communicator



Nice to have:




  • Experience with Big Data and technologies such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Pig, HBase, Hive

  • Experience with API and web services design and maintenance

  • Experience with taking the initiative and acting as a technical lead

  • A passion for shipping quality high-performance code

  • Strong understanding of (one or more of the following): Java, Python, Scala, PowerShell, C#, system design, distributed systems, web services, cloud infrastructure.

  • Working in a very fast-paced and continuously changing environment

  • Good knowledge of advertising technology



We use: CentOS, Windows, Chef, Graphite, Cassandra, Couchbase, ElasticSearch, Memcached, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Jenkins, Consul, Mesos, IIS, HAProxy, Maven, MSBuild, Gerrit, Kerberos, Active Directory, OpenAM, Prometheus…

item.title: Windows Workspace engineer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a System Engineer Workspace, you make sure all of your Coolblue colleagues have a secure, up to date, fast and reliable digital workspace.

What you tell people at parties

"I create Windows of opportunity"

What you really do

  • You design and build the Coolblue digital workspace to keep it highly available and scalable.
  • You continuously expand and improve our digital workspace.
  • You work with different teams to reach your goals.
  • You find the right balance between creating awesome things that have an immediate impact and making sure that they are secure and maintainable in the long run.

How you do it

  • You are a well rounded Windows client-server system engineer with a core skill set in desktop provisioning.
  • You get hands-on, working with your team to design, implement and deliver the Coolblue digital workspace.
  • You initiate change to improve our workspace bit by bit, every day.
  • You present your ideas simple, explainable and understood by all – technical and non-technical alike.
  • You think big and building small. In the end it's about getting things done.

Team

You'll work in a multidisciplinary team of engineers with various areas of expertise. Yes, this means some of your team members work the Linux stack. Passionately. And they will talk about it. A lot. Even to you. And they expect nothing but love in return.
Working in an Agile engineering team at Coolblue also means having big ideas, but being able to chop ‘em up in small deliverables. To help you with this, your team has a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

A day at the office

No two days are the same. Today, you start with a coffee before joining the daily standup with the team. After the standup you create a package which is ready for testing. You ask a your colleagues to look at it to check if it passes our tests. Next, you contact the stakeholders for this piece of software and arrange for it to be tested by them. Everything is good and you send the software out to the department. Happy users - check!

After lunch in the Coolblue canteen, your team gives a presentation on SCCM in our Demo Lab to our colleagues of Tech Services who run the IT Operations. Armed with great feedback and questions you get back to your team room. It’s time for some admin work now in SCCM. You have to make changes to the task sequence used for distributing Windows 10 and check that the computers in one of our new offices are all registering nicely. There are some neat PowerShell scripts you’ve been working on you want to integrate into the SCCM consoles menu and you need to setup roles and permissions for users of SCCM so that they’ll have exactly what they need to do their work.
The day flew by, time to wind down with your colleagues for a Friday afternoon drink!

What we're asking

  • You have several years of experience in building, designing and delivering a digital workspace environment for >2000 users.
  • You are a Windows Ninja - Windows clients and servers have no secrets for you.
  • You are an expert in desktop and application delivery with SCCM.
  • Experience in OSX/iOS deployment is a plus.
  • You are familiar with MDM & MAM.
  • You automate (Powershell, Bash or Python).
  • If you know how to deploy in enterprise secured networks (NAC) - that is a plus.
  • You can name at least 3 NES games.
  • Your opinions are strong, but weakly held. You welcome feedback.
  • You're willing to relocate to Rotterdam or somewhere nearby.

What we're offering

  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

item.title: C# Developer at Zopa (London, UK)
item.description:
Job description


We are building our next-generation loan servicing platform (over 100,000,000 microloans as of July 2017, representing over £1bn outstanding loans) as well as the bank of the future with cutting edge technologies and are looking for Software Developers to collaborate on a major rebuild of our technical stack. 
We are looking for people to help both design and build core parts of these new systems – there are no ivory tower architects here. We want people that care about the big picture and how their code affects the company – not just now, but in the future as well. Interaction with stakeholders and key business users is a way of life here. We're big believers in a lean philosophy and flexibility in implementation, but do not believe in a one-size-fits-all approach. 
 
How we work at Zopa

We work in cross-functional teams that work together to solve customer problems.
We’ve got a great office in London bridge with riverside views, ping pong, fuseball, PlayStation, a meditation room, break-out pods, gym discounts, morning fruit, and private health insurance.


·         We deploy when we need to via CI and a completely automated test suite.

·         We use cutting-edge infrastructure, like moving towards Kubernetes. DevOps is a way of life here. We collect over 12GB of logs every day

·         We work in sprints and constantly make feature releases, with some systems being released to production multiple times per day. 
·         We operate under a tribe-structure; small teams own their own roadmap, stack and products

·         We peer review all code, and value the sharing of knowledge.

·         We use the right tool or language for the job, if you can prove better we’ll use that. (Various teams use mixtures of C#, F#, Go, Java, Python & Ruby)


Requirements


About You



We're looking for experienced engineers that have solved big challenges that come from working at scale.  Ideally:



  • You've worked on large scale distributed software systems that have proven scalability and complex topologies.

  • Experience with Kafka, or some distributed log / message queuing system

  • An advocate of test driven; we are a financial institution and a strong commitment to quality is essential

  • Passion for your work and striving to do things “the right way”

  • You can take ownership of tasks and problem solving and see challenges through to completion.


Several people in the team have escaped The City and come to Zopa from large banks. If you no longer want to be a small cog in a large machine, are keen to be more involved in the product and business we'd love to hear from you!

item.title: Senior System Engineer at Nexmo (London, UK)
item.description:
We are currently looking for a System Engineer - Voice Infrastructure to join our team. Responsibilities include:



  • Working on maintenance and improvement of current infrastructure

  • Design, provision, test and deploy new clusters, POPs or datacentres

  • Monitor, investigate and troubleshoot production issues at worldwide scale

  • Monitor performance and advise any necessary infrastructure changes


Skills and experience:



  • Ideal candidate will have a very strong background in Linux administration

  • Masters / Bachelors degree in Computer Science, or equivalent

  • Deep understanding and experience with networks, high-availability and scaling

  • Good scripting skills (python, bash, ruby)

  • Experience with configuration management (puppet, ansible) and source code management (GIT)

  • Experience with web servers/reverse proxies (nginx/nginx+, haproxy, apache2, tomcat)

  • Knowledge of monitoring and graphing tools (riemann, icinga, graphite, grafana)

  • Solid networking knowledge (OSI network layers, TCP/IP)

  • Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (mysql, couchbase, redis, memcached, redshift,dynamodb, mongodb, …)

  • Experience or knowledge of ELK stack, kafka, consul, zookeeper is a plus

  • Experience with cloud (AWS, Rackspace, Softlayer, GCE) is a plus

  • Experience with SIP and media proxies (kamailio, rtpengine) and telephony platforms (asterisk,freeswitch, voxeo) is a plus

  • Knowledge of voice protocols (SIP, SIPS, RTP, SRTP,SDP) is a plus

  • Experience with VoiceXML and CCXML is a plus



  • Ability and willingness to work in a global, fast-paced environment

  • Flexible with the ability to adapt working style to meet objectives

  • Excellent communication and analytical skills

  • Ability to effectively communicate with team members


Why Nexmo...our values!


We value disruptive innovation, getting things done, and working with passion and integrity are the values that matter at Nexmo. We are on a mission to enable simplified communications between enterprises and their customers by empowering our employees. We strive for passion and integrity, both personally and professionally.


We have achieved significant growth by hiring exceptional people. We have big goals, and we want the people who join us to be self confident, focused on customers and delivery, and who are structured and committed in their approach. We value those who will help us continue this spirit. If this appeals to you then we encourage you to apply.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Sports Thematic Websites) at Visca Web (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
The Visca Web team is behind the popular Futebol.com, Marcadores.com and several other football live scores products which currently attract millions of users over 30 countries worldwide. The product revolves around real-time football results and social interactions (discussions, predictions contest with prizes to win…) between users.


Your Role:


As DevOps engineer in the Visca Web team, you will be a key player in the continuous delivery and continuous deployment of our software. You will collaborate closely with the technical team to find the best solutions to our evolving needs and you will be keen to suggest new solutions to constantly improve our infrastructure and its performance. 


You will also have as objective to bring an AWS professional structure to the company. This will include responsibilities such as:



  • Take part in the process of experimenting different solutions with AWS.

  • Lead a migration from classic servers to AWS (of about ~40 classic servers).

  • Set-up monitoring and alerting processes.

  • Keep teaching the team about AWS solutions, and its automation.


Our projects are made as microservices and the team is eager to learn.


Required skills/experience/mindset:



  • Strong experience managing services in Linux / Unix environments.

  • At least 2 years of experience with Amazon Web Services.

  • Good experience with shell scripting (Python, bash, tcsh).

  • Good knowledge of Docker / Vagrant.

  • Familiar with tools like Ansible, Buildbot, Chef, Salt.

  • Willingness to teach the team and make it comfortable working with AWS.

  • Experience with dynamic language and code architecture (Java, PHP, Node, etc...)

  • (bonus) Experience with technologies such as: RabbitMQ, WebSockets, Varnish.

  • (bonus) Experience with tools such as: Terraform, NewRelic.

  • (bonus) Experience optimising AWS costs.

  • (bonus) Experience/knowledge with Google Cloud.


This position is a full-time one, based in our Barcelona office. Possession of a valid work-permit for Spain is a must.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer at Bluebeam, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Senior DevOps Engineer:



About the role:


Bluebeam is looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team. In this role, youll work collaboratively with software engineering to deploy and operate our systems and help automate and streamline our operations and processes. You will help design and manage cloud based infrastructure that supports an ever-expanding customer base as well as internal applications. Youll build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations and youll troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, QA and production environments. You should have broad technical experience supporting SaaS products and related infrastructure (as well as CI/CD pipelines.)



What you'll be doing:



  • Consult on systems architecture.

  • Develop automation frameworks.

  • Develop and implement systems featuring high-availability, horizontal scalability and self-healing capabilities.

  • Improve our build and deployment processes.

  • Maintain systems related to the CI/CD pipeline.

  • Monitor, analyze and report performance statistics for cloud hosted environments.



What we'd like to see in you:



  • 5+ years of experience with building, deploying, administration and monitoring of SaaS applications and related infrastructure on both Windows (.NET) and Linux platforms.

  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).

  • Understanding of high availability and scaling solutions like caching, CDNs, load balancing, clustering.

  • Demonstrable experience scripting with languages like Python, PowerShell, bash, etc.

  • Knowledge of both RDBMS and NoSQL database solutions like MSSQL, MySQL, Casandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, etc. from an Ops perspective.

  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, PowerShell DSC or others.

  • Experience with build systems such as Jenkins, Bamboo, TFS, etc.

  • Experience with source control systems such as Git, Bitbucket, TFS, etc.

  • Hands on experience with monitoring and APM tools such as Nagios, Icinga, SCOM, SolarWinds, New Relic, AppDynamics, etc.

  • Experience with log aggregation tools such as ELK stack, Splunk, SumoLogic, etc.

  • Experience with system hardening and implementing security controls is a plus.

  • Excellent work ethic and willingness to put in extra time as needed.

  • Positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.



If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send the following:



  • Resume

  • Some sort of personalized introduction for us. This could be a cover letter, a few bullet points about yourself, a comic strip youve drawn - anything that tells us a bit about you AND why you want to work here.


#LI-CT1


Learn more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/

item.title: Cloud Engineer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Cloud Deployment Engineer at Coolblue you help our developers deploy 100 pull requests per day.

What you tell people at parties

"I've got my head in the clouds all day long."

What you really do

  • You maintain and improve our deployment pipelines, so the developers can smoothly and reliably release their applications.
  • You create and maintain the “infrastructure as code“  for our AWS cloud environment.
  • You support developers in deploying their applications.
  • You experiment with new technology to research future use.
  • You automate recurring tasks to make your job (and that of the developers) easier.

How you do it

  • You like to be challenged. You see the obstacles to get to a cloud-based infrastructure as an opportunity to learn.
  • You share knowledge with your Tech Development colleagues to make them self-sufficient. Better teach a man to fish than to give him one, right?
  • You stay cool when things break. You search for the root cause and don’t stop until you find it. Once you do, you make sure this can’t fail again.
  • You don't wait for things to come to you. You go out and get them. You're self motivated, communicative and get things done.
  • You work together, because you like to learn from your colleagues. You coach your team members and provide them with honest feedback.
  • You have your own opinion and you’re able to voice it in a constructive discussion.

Team

You will be part of the “e-commerce deployment” team: a team consisting of smart, experienced and highly motivated engineers who want to take our IT Development department to the the next step in cloud infrastructure. The engineers in this team know everything about the systems of our web platform.  Your team will be supported by a Team Lead, Product Owner and a Scrum Master.

A day at the office

During the stand-up, you agree to work with Jamie (our cloud expert) on moving some domains to Route 53. The configuration is not complex, but you need to call with our current hosting provider. It's a bit of a challenge as it is hard to get the right information about what they are doing and when. However, you work closely with them and together you get it done by lunch.

In the afternoon you talk to the Product Content development team and discuss how we can migrate the queue that they are using for product reviews. It's now an on-premise RabbitMQ, but since we are moving to the cloud, you recommend using SQS. You discuss different options for implementation with the team and agree to join them next sprint for a few days to get the SQS solution into production.
At the end of the day, Frank (senior developer from your team) demonstrates the new solution for the assets of the website. They are now being served from an S3 bucket, with CloudFront caching in front of it. It works great, so we’ll take it into Production next week. After that, it's time to go out and have a nice specialty beer. You do check your beers in Untappd, right?

What we're asking

  • You are smart and have some way to prove it.
  • You are awesome with Linux. You can inspect that package, debug that firewall rule, you know why that file permission is 0600 and where those inodes went. Or you are similarly awesome from a Windows perspective.
  • You are strong with configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef, or Ansible.
  • You believe in configuration management - if it’s not managed, it’s not real.
  • You know scripting and have development experience in Python, Ruby or plain old Bash.
  • You “automate all the things” from bootstrap to backup.
  • You have a DevOps mindset with a strong drive to get things done. You automate. You collaborate. You communicate.
  • You have experience working with CloudFormation. Certification is a plus, otherwise we'll make sure you get it.
  • You have done similar work before, at least for 3 years.
  • You think big and start small. In the end, it's about getting things done.
  • You take pride in what you do, but welcome feedback.
  • You are adaptable and don't mind stepping outside of your comfort zone.
  • You get bonus points if you have experience working with Scrum and if you have experience working with other cloud providers. You also get bonus points for writing a nice cover letter, you would make team lead Roelof Reitsma very happy with that!
  • You are willing to relocate to Rotterdam or somewhere nearby.

What we're offering

  • Money.
  • Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.
  • A 10% discount on all of our products.
  • An awesome workplace. With freshly prepared meals, monthly TGIF drinks, epic Coolblue parties, and an informal, playful office space.
  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back.
  • Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a short stumble away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk.
  • Relocation assistance, from a to z (if you live abroad).
  • Dutch language courses. To help you become a Rotterdammert.
  • An international work environment. With colleagues from places like Belgium, Spain, Australia, Mexico, and Italy.
  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.
  • A job at one of the fastest-growing companies in the Benelux region.
  • Plenty of space for initiatives and original ideas. We welcome them. Whether you've been with us for a week, month, or year.

item.title: System Engineer Workspace at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a System Engineer Workspace, you make sure all of your Coolblue colleagues have a secure, up to date, fast and reliable digital workspace.

What you tell people at parties

"I create Windows of opportunity"

What you really do

  • You design and build the Coolblue digital workspace to keep it highly available and scalable.
  • You continuously expand and improve our digital workspace.
  • You work with different teams to reach your goals.
  • You find the right balance between creating awesome things that have an immediate impact and making sure that they are secure and maintainable in the long run.

How you do it

  • You are a well rounded Windows client-server system engineer with a core skill set in desktop provisioning.
  • You get hands-on, working with your team to design, implement and deliver the Coolblue digital workspace.
  • You initiate change to improve our workspace bit by bit, every day.
  • You present your ideas simple, explainable and understood by all – technical and non-technical alike.
  • You think big and building small. In the end it's about getting things done.

Team

You'll work in a multidisciplinary team of engineers with various areas of expertise. Yes, this means some of your team members work the Linux stack. Passionately. And they will talk about it. A lot. Even to you. And they expect nothing but love in return.
Working in an Agile engineering team at Coolblue also means having big ideas, but being able to chop ‘em up in small deliverables. To help you with this, your team has a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

A day at the office

No two days are the same. Today, you start with a coffee before joining the daily standup with the team. After the standup you create a package which is ready for testing. You ask a your colleagues to look at it to check if it passes our tests. Next, you contact the stakeholders for this piece of software and arrange for it to be tested by them. Everything is good and you send the software out to the department. Happy users - check!

After lunch in the Coolblue canteen, your team gives a presentation on SCCM in our Demo Lab to our colleagues of Tech Services who run the IT Operations. Armed with great feedback and questions you get back to your team room. It’s time for some admin work now in SCCM. You have to make changes to the task sequence used for distributing Windows 10 and check that the computers in one of our new offices are all registering nicely. There are some neat PowerShell scripts you’ve been working on you want to integrate into the SCCM consoles menu and you need to setup roles and permissions for users of SCCM so that they’ll have exactly what they need to do their work.
The day flew by, time to wind down with your colleagues for a Friday afternoon drink!

What we're asking

  • You have several years of experience in building, designing and delivering a digital workspace environment for >2000 users.
  • You are a Windows Ninja - Windows clients and servers have no secrets for you.
  • You are an expert in desktop and application delivery with SCCM.
  • Experience in OSX/iOS deployment is a plus.
  • You are familiar with MDM & MAM.
  • You automate (Powershell, Bash or Python).
  • If you know how to deploy in enterprise secured networks (NAC) - that is a plus.
  • You can name at least 3 NES games.
  • Your opinions are strong, but weakly held. You welcome feedback.
  • You're willing to relocate to Rotterdam or somewhere nearby.

What we're offering

  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer (Beat Product) m/f at mytaxi (Intelligent Apps GmbH) (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
About Us


Beat is a platform that transforms the way people move in their cities. Tap on a button on your smartphone and you get a ride in just a few minutes.


In early 2017 Mytaxi, a subsidiary of Daimler A.G, acquired Beat. Beat started its life as Taxibeat, 6 years ago in Europe and 3 years ago expanded its operations to Peru where it serves millions of rides every single month. It is already establishing its position in South America with Chile being the latest new market and Colombia following soon.


How are we going to achieve that?


By constantly growing our world-class engineering team and developing projects such as car-pooling, personalized services, real time pricing mechanisms, routing and dispatching algorithms and fraud detection/prevention systems. To this end we are opening a new engineering hub in Berlin that will work in close collaboration with our Data Science and Big Data teams in Athens on implementing next-generation ETL, stream processing and machine learning applications, serving both our analytics teams and our product teams.


About the role


Our Big Data team is at the heart of this effort and is an essential ingredient in Beat's aggressive growth plan and vision for the future.


As a senior member of our team, you will tackle some of the hardest problems and your work will impact the entire Beat experience, from making sure drivers are always available for all our customers, to helping our drivers utilize their working hours. Our team moves very fast, so you'll have the opportunity to make an immediate difference.


What you'll do day in day out:



  • Work with the data science and engineering teams in translating complex models and algorithms into production-grade software systems.

  • Develop components that will analyse, process and react to operational feeds in near real-time, optimizing driver allocation, optimizing service pricing and preventing fraudulent use of our services in near real-time.

  • Being agile both within and across teams, bridging software engineering and data science.


What you need to have:



  • At least one Master's degree in Math, Physics, Computer Science or Engineering. Higher degrees are a significant bonus as is considerable experience with Machine Learning, Statistical Analysis, Big Data Analytics in the industry.

  • At least 5 years of experience in developing production-grade software using either Data Warehousing, Big Data or Machine Learning frameworks in order to solve real-world problems.

  • Experience in developing with Scala and/or Python at an idiomatic, expert level is required. Knowledge of advanced Java or C++ is a bonus. We would favour candidates with an exceptionally strong engineering background and deep knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and current frameworks for their application to vast datasets.

  • At least 6 years of experience with SQL.

  • Proven hands-on experience with Apache Hadoop, Spark, Spark Streaming. Familiarity with Tensorflow or CNTK is a bonus.

  • A strong sense of ownership in your work.

  • Excellent numerical and analytical skills with an excellent eye for detail working with qualitative and quantitative data.

  • The desire to build, launch and iterate on quality products on time with minimal technical compromises under a loosely-managed working environment.


What's in it for you



  • The chance to bring in your own ideas

  • A strong team spirit

  • Excellent monetary benefits (a pension plan, a monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides, subsidised public transport ticket)

  • Have your birthday off!


As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Beat is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

item.title: Data Scientist (m/f) | Hamburg at Kreditech (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Join the financial revolution!


Are you passionate about finance and want to make a real change? Join Kreditech and our team of over 300 professionals and become part of a transforming industry. From engineering, to design, to analytics, and collections, we do things differently and we reward great ideas, team work and persistence. We have a lot of work to do – and we want you to join us!


Your Role


You will be joining a dynamic, fast-growing, diverse, multi-functional and multidisciplinary team. You will contribute with your unique background and experience, your fast-learning ability and motivation.


This is the optimal opportunity for you to:



  • Apply data science in areas like credit risk modelling and profitability analysis; acquisition, retention and debt collection optimization; product personalization and conversion optimization

  • Work with state-of-the art stack of data processing and modelling technologies

  • Experience a wide range of problems and proposed solutions - Constantly innovate

  • Develop machine learning expertise beyond basic supervised and unsupervised learning

  • Get responsibility and ownership right from the first day along with the unique chance to spearhead the way big data is used in one of the fastest growing Fintech organizations

  • Prototype and productionize innovative, data-intensive, fully-automated, machine-learning-based decision engines

  • Feel the excitement of extracting value from data and impacting the performance of an entire organization


 Your Strengths


 Essential:



  • Bachelors or Masters with strong academic performance in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Business Informatics).

  • Expertise in Machine Learning.

  • 1 or more years of working experience in a similar role.

  • Ability to process data and build predictive models in R (R Studio).

  • Experience in analyzing complex data and presenting your conclusions in a clear and concise manner to a wide range of audiences.

  • You are familiar with SQL and NoSQL database technologies, and are capable of at least querying them for any data required.

  • You speak English fluently-any other language or German are not required but an additional plus


 Preferred:



  • PhD degree in a quantitative field.

  • 2 or more years of experience as a data scientist.

  • Absolutely fluent in R, you could call yourself an R-hacker.

  • Familiarity with Python.

  • Experience developing data products or writing production-ready code.


How to apply:


We accept applications exclusively through our recruiting platform, found under the ‘Apply Now’ link. There are a few screening questions, and we would like your CV and a short cover letter. That's it! We look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager (Distributed Systems) at Careem (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Careem is a leading ride-hailing platform and newest Tech Unicorn in the MENA region. Operational in 50+ cities and with 30% monthly growth, we are one of the fastest growing companies. Our recipe for success has been a team that thrives on challenges and is passionate about solving problems. 


With our recent Series D funding success ($500m+) , we are positioned on the cusp of significant scale and well on target to deliver our goal of creating one million jobs in the region by 2018. Read more about us here and here.



ABOUT THE ROLE


You will lead a team of amazing engineers to improve the developer experience for engineers at Careem. You will partner with engineering leaders across Careem to ensure alignment about engineering challenges and opportunities.


Key responsibilities include:




  • Lead a team of software engineers in implementing high quality services including design, development, and deployment of new business functionality.




  • Allocate available resources to meet operating objectives. Interacts with direct reports, customers and peers to share information and improve cross-departmental processes.




  • Assist your teams in developing roadmaps for system and product growth, then identify, plan, and execute projects to support that growth




  • Strong ability to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers




  • Experience solving large-scale engineering challenges




  • Encourages and supports others to take on responsibility, authority, and accountability. 




Reqiurements:


The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.


Must have:



  • Current hands on development experience. Your still able to and love coding.

  • Working knowledge of at least one of these Java, C++, Python

  • Track-record of technical leadership

  • Demonstrate ability to run and improve technical development processes

  • Software Development Manager / Head of Engineering in an organization that experienced huge scale.


Salary Package:



  • Competitive salary and equity shares

  • 25 working days annual leave

  • Entrepreneurial working environment

  • Flexible working arrangements

  • Mentorship and career growth

item.title: DevOps Engineer at M800 Limited (Hong Kong)
item.description:
Responsibilities:



  • Manage build/release of all Dev, Test, Production environment

  • Work closely with software developers to deploy and operate our systems

Nice to Have:

Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful. We may also consider their application for other or future vacancies. Personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for a maximum period of 6 months.

item.title: C# Software Developer at Labster (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
At Labster we are dedicated to empowering the next generation of scientists to change the world. Our goal is to develop software that makes learning both engaging and effective, and to make it accessible to as many students as possible.


We govern ourselves by using a flat-hierarchy system that is focused on motivation and results. We believe in flexible work hours and a good work-life balance and while we love to get results, it’s incredibly important for us to have happy co-workers.


We are a team of approx. 20 developers. Some of the projects we are currently working on includes, but are not limited to: VR, building complex game/simulation editing tools and advanced learning analytics dashboard, scaling DevOps server architecture to reach millions of students. To achieve our goals, our stack includes C#, Unity3D, Python, AWS etc. 


We are currently in search of a C# software developer who will join our Content Team in Copenhagen. This team will work on developing simulations for Google Daydream VR platform.



  • You will work closely with our content writers, 3D artists, and SQA to develop our virtual laboratories and learning simulations.

  • You need to learn fast and be organized and focus as we continuously produce new exciting virtual laboratories every month

  • You are motivated to deliver great results as a team where the end goal is not just a finished product but a product that will greatly impact students’ learning and motivation in science.

  • Every month you will create 1-2 new laboratories by putting together all the 3D animations, learning flow, learning content, quiz questions etc. from the rest of the team

  • You will be coding a lot in XML and debugging Unity3D C# code to help the platform team improve the core platform

  • You will be the person connecting all the dots, by bringing the work from all the teams together in the individual virtual laboratory packages


Your profile



  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or similar

  • One year of experience in creating applications using C#

  • Familiar with XML format

  • Experience in working with Unity3D engine is a big plus

  • Familiarity with git version control is regarded as a plus

  • Understanding of agile software development methodology

  • Fluent in written and spoken English

  • Good communication skills

  • Ability to work independently while also able to work efficiently in a team

  • EU passport or EU work permit is a must-have to apply for this position


What do we offer? 



  • A competitive salary based on your qualifications and experience

  • Regular coaching and training with the focus on personal and professional growth

  • Attractive benefits package

  • A fun and challenging opportunity to work in exciting companies with NO DULL CORPORATE LIFESTYLE

  • You will also receive stock options in the company on top of your salary

  • Amazing workspace 


Why Labster?



  • Responsibility and ownership from day one – autonomy for the win

  • Working with and mentoring a young team

  • Getting up in the morning and knowing that you’ll work on something that helps people improve their lives – education

  • Having a flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely

  • Working with an intelligent group of co-workers that will inspire you to achieve more and have fun while doing it

  • Developing your professional profile and learning a lot


Note: This is a 2-year project-based position (with the possibility of extension) that will be located in Copenhagen, Denmark. The preferred start date would be December 2017.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer at eBay (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Your growth will involve our highly-performant and high-traffic systems. During peak hours, our site's per-second throughput is OVER 1000 searches (which makes us the second most-used search engine in NL), 25K images and 4GB of data; Marktplaats handles over 1 million unique visitors, 350K new advertisements and 155K transactions daily. On an average month, we get 140 million visits, which translates into 2.5 billion page views. But our users demand more, so we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love.



What you can expect from us:

A collaborative, informal, international and playful work environment with self-organised agile/lean teams

Managers and teammates who are invested in your growth as a technologist and as a person

Work with cool modern technologies such as Scala, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Apache Kafka, Consul, Node.js, React, Swift and Play

Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, IDEs, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meetups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)

Ability to join and participate in multiple internal interest groups in Marktplaats and across eBay Classifieds Group in trending topics like DevOps, BigData, mobile development, and others

Continuous Deployment through multiple environments to get rapid feedback about your work

Work on one of the most beloved brands in the Netherlands



The person we are looking for has extensive experience in on-line or related areas, with at least 6+ years of full-time employment. We expect the right person to be an expert in software engineering and have good knowledge of what it means to work with large and/or distributed systems. We also believe that to be a well-rounded developer, one needs experience with more than just one programming language. Furthermore, we need someone who lives and breathes Agile development, can focus on delivering, and wants to take a leading role in improving how we work.



What we expect from you:

Java and Scala development

Some exposure to mobile application development (iOS/Android/HTML5)

Unix / Linux

Test driven development

Agile methodologies

Affinity for e-Commerce

A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Building great products



Preferred Qualifications:

Native mobile application development (iOS/Android/Windows)

Knowledge of alternative languages like Python

Processing big data



Preferably you have a degree in Computer Sciences or comparable topic.

Background checks are part of the hiring process.

Acquisition is not appreciated.

item.title: IT Network Expert (m/f) at KPMG Luxembourg (Luxembourg)
item.description:
The role and responsibilities


KPMG’s IT Services are dedicated to the provision of world-class IT and communications platforms and solutions to the firm. The team plays a leading role in ensuring that all business areas receive a service which allows them to make the best use of Information Technology.This role requires a self-motivated individual who is proactive in finding solutions and able to demonstrate drive with a positive and enthusiastic attitude. Your knowledge and communication skills will be required to provide a costumer-focus service.


As a network expert your key responsibilities will include:


•Ensures availability, performance and security of KPMG Luxembourg Network (Wired and Wireless) and external lines.
•Ensures that market best practices are followed, in compliance with audit and standard requirements.
•Lead the Datacenter Network migration project to Cisco Software Define Network solution (Cisco ACI).
•Manage network projects, incidents and act as technical reference for junior team members.
•Maintain and improve the Network services (Load Balancing, Redundancy, QoS, Network Access Security…).
•Review capacity planning and organize asset Life cycle.
•Create Process and Procedures inside his area of expertise.
•Participate to network and datacenter infrastructure design and KPMG application integration.


The perfect candidate


•Has 5-10 years of work experience in IT Network administration.
•Has expertise in Network datacenter (Nexus) and campus Wired (Catalyst) and Wireless (Cisco) infrastructure administration. A Cisco certification will be an advantage. (CCNA / CCNP)
•Has the wiliness to develop and implement Software Define Network technology (Cisco ACI) using innovative technologies.
•Has expertise with the Network Access Security Solution (Cisco ISE) and good knowledge with network authentication protocols (Radius/TACACS).
•Proven experience in Windows W2k8/W2K12 environments and virtualized environments (VMware).
•Has experience in VoIP, Monitoring Solution, Scripting (Python / PowerShell) and Cisco UCS.
•Is an effective team player and able to demonstrate initiative, autonomy and flexibility in his work. Is dynamic, rigorous, focused on user’s needs and able to work under pressure.
•Brings new ideas and inputs regarding KPMG infrastructure services.
•Is fluent in English. Any other European language is considered as an asset.


Interested?


If your profile fits the above description, send us your CV and cover letter.

item.title: Team Leader - IoT Edge Connectivity at Leica Geosystems AG (Heerbrugg, Schweiz)
item.description:
When building the tallest buildings, the longest bridges and the biggest airplanes, people put their trust in the market-leading measurement and surveying solutions from Leica Geosystems. Our employees develop, produce and distribute what our customers count on, day after day: innovation, precision, reliability and efficiency.



Team Leader - IoT Edge Connectivity

Your main tasks include:

  • Manage the roadmap of product deliverables in accordance with feature requirements

  • Maintain a high level of proactive communication with different stakeholders across the whole organization
